Give this a go if you're an arena shooter junkie like me.

review: Really low class to take the game I paid for and give me a free version and say I need to buy it again. Eff you scammers. I already brought this game back in 2010-2013ish and I havent played it for 10 years but I did buy it and now you want me to buy it again? NO STEAM SUPPORT? Your own website for support 404 error. You are losers and I hope you left this industry because your cancerous criminals.
developer_response:
Hi there, √≠f you have a license and the game disappeared from your library, then it's an issue related to Steam, i.e. your Steam account.

We, as developers, can't do anything about it, as the entire license and key handling is solely done by Steam. Please get in touch with their support. I'm sure they can help you out.

If there's anything we can help with, you can get in touch with us easily through our homepage. There's a contact form on reakktor.com.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401705462', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 38, 'playtime_at_review': 4900, 'last_played': 1711575173}
review: Good AFPS with a pace that is in between the Call of Duty kind of games which are a different genre all together and yet a bit slower than the Quake series if that is off-putting for some players. The player can thrust forward with the Shift button, do a small double jump and turn invisible for a short time with the Q button. Other than that its a solid fast paced AFPS game, shame that it is not more active. Recommend

review:
Good game, but all the reviews are kinda not true. Everyone who has played this game has enjoyed it, but hasn't put many hours into the game. It plays well, but due to lack of updates/new content it died pretty quickly. Last I checked there were 59 active players. It's sadly a dead game with a non-existent player base. I had fun with it, but the limited maps and low player count makes it not worth it.

Good game, no community or active player base.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960561809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 75504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75348, 'last_played': 1708061836}
review:
This one is always in rotation. Frag Fest Fridays!

It's simple, runs on potato while still looking awesome. It's open to modding & custom self hosted servers. The bots are great to train against, and even scarier human opponents technically above SC12.

While the community needs more players, you're more than likely to find players in the discord. (chat.toxikk.com)

Free is Free, check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047463015', 'num_games_owned': 1244, 'num_reviews': 397, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1697928367}
review:
I would prefer Unreal Tournament any day.
"Frog like it's 1999"? Obviously, no. It's not close to UT99 or Quake 1-3. But mostly Unreal Tournament 3. So frag like it's 2007.

Online is almost non-existent. But it's still possible to get people in the game through the Discord server. Bots and dedicated server included, in case you wondered.

I liked it, the gameplay is dynamic and fun, weapons are enjoyable to use. The feelings you'll never get from modern multiplayer crap, so in this sense it's old-school after all.

It might be just me, but I really miss the UT's link gun's beam. There's nothing similar in this game for this quite distinctive weapon from every UT and Quake (Lightning gun) games.
And just why can't I pick a second enforcer?

review: Good game, but it's too much of a by the book/tried and true AFPS for me, especially when you can actually play Unreal Tournament 99/2k4/4 (which Toxikk drawed on for inspiration) online for free these days (even tho Epic Games killed the franchise) (just be Jack Sparrow *wink wink* & download the fan patches), and there are not enough players to justify buying the game. So i won't say that i'm agaisnt the game, i have nothing but respect for the devs, but i can't really say that i recommend you to buy it. Just try the free version yourself, and if you like it, support the devs.

review:
I played TOXIKK again for one hour today and I love it now! TOXIKK game feels so refreshing and exciting to me; (the game mechanics movement and weapons feel better, improved now since I last played it years ago). All the weapons feel awesome to use now, especially flame thrower! AND the bodies explode into little bits bouncing around giving more realism to the game, especially if you use the rocket launcher!! Its got amazing graphics with beautiful polished maps that all appeal to me so much more now! The level up system also looks fun with the unlocking of new armour etc.

I played TOXIKK years ago for several hours (no vehicles and no robot mechs back then) but TOXIKK felt a bit weird to play to be honest (it couldn't hold my attention and keep me coming back for more) probably maybe because I was comparing TOXIKK too much to my favourite Arena FPS game I loved. But now a lot has changed in the gaming industry and my personal tastes for games has also changed it seems. I love TOXIKK a lot now!

TOXIKK really does have the future of Arena FPS gaming in their hands right now! I just hope some marketing wizards conjure up some breath taking ways to spread the word that TOXIKK is still here waiting for new players to join the game!

This game still runs smoothly on an old computer using Windows 7, so you don't need Windows 10 to play it! (BUT Steam will stop running on Windows 7 around end of 2023 I have read!) And I played on servers maps with high pings and I had no lag, no problems, it ran smoothly!

Wishing for better days to come for TOXIKK Arena FPS !!!
developer_response: Thanks for your wishes and your nice review. The team appreciates it!

review: Apparently, someone had the idea to take the assets of the former Unreal Tournament games and create a wannabe-UT-game out of them. Bad thing is, they missed  all the important stuff, like the flak cannon (!), the shock rifle, the bio rifle, announcements, a decent bot behaviour, cool music, an indicator of vehicle armor/HP when you repair them,... just to name a few. Instead, they put in a completely ridiculous sniper rifle, which unscopes after every shot - thanks for that. What is most annoying about this pitiful clone of a game is the map design: on most maps, you'll run endlessly around without finding a single weapon.

author: {'steamid': '76561199065641201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1681611203}
review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

6 tablespoons unsalted butter

1/2 cup white sugar

1/2 cup brown sugar

1/4 cup water

1/4 teaspoon cinnamon

1 pinch salt

5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced

1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.

Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.

Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.

Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.

Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: very fun game, if you find yourself nostalgic for unreal tournament like gameplay, and having a hard time getting games on with your friends by alternative means due to them shuttin down the servers for the classics, i highly recommend giving this game a try as an alternative, the bots are pretty well made, they got custom maps added to their matchmaking, like aerowalk (enlarged but still very fun) and campgrounds, the movement is pretty easy to figure out, and its still pretty fast,

review: It's Unreal Tournament (pretty much literally, Deck is in the game ffs), but the weapons resemble Quake 3 a bit more than any UT game. To be honest it's so close to being a literal UT4 that this is probably my favourite recent modern arena shooter, but as usual for this entire genre nobody is playing it. Thankfully the AI is pretty much identical to Unreal Tournament's so that doesn't really matter much. The game's pretty much free, so you may as well try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006268674', 'num_games_owned': 5624, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1681552955}
review:
This is a fantastic game with a dead community. There is literally nobody playing this online; However, the AI is actually pretty impressive in single player bot contracts mode. Sometimes it feels like you're playing against actual people, almost. It's very reminiscent of quake and unreal tournament with the same great gameplay feel that makes a great multiplayer shooter.

Too bad nobody plays anymore, otherwise it's an outstanding game. It's free to try anyways, not sure I recommend the paid version even if the bot AI is impressive.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198093108826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1679412914}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
[list]
[*]A modern arena shooter 100% inspired by Unreal Tournament.
[*]Game modes: DM, TDM, 1 life TDM, CTF, Domination.
[*]Free version: No singleplayer, hosting, or skins. Play and level up to unlock maps (starts with 3).
[*]Free version has no in-game server browser, but you can simply use Steam's own server browser (View ‚Üí Servers ‚Üí Filter game to show Toxikk)
[*]Paid version has skins but you will need to level up to unlock each of them.
[/list]

[h1]Art & Graphics ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ[/h1]
[list]
[*]Hands down the best-looking Unreal Engine 3 game with regard to sci-fi style. 
[*]Its "white facility" maps (Dekk/Deck17 and Facing Worlds sci-fi version) look as good as Overwatch's Horizon Lunar Colony, which is just mind-blowing considering that this is UE3, a game engine released in 2006. Toxikk pushes the limits of the game engine to greater heights never reached before.
[*]I'm personally not a fan of the outdoor nature maps but the amount of details put into making the maps are just as meticulous. Anyone can tell just by the maps alone, that this indie game is a true work of passion.
[/list]

[h1]Music & Sounds ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ[/h1]
[list]
[*]Toxikk follows the footsteps of UT and queues up a playlist of its own techno music. 
[*]The soundtrack plays in-game too which is very much energizing.
[*]A techno soundtrack is well-fitting for a game with a high tech sci-fi theme.
[/list]

[h1]Gameplay ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ[/h1]
[list]
[*]Unreal Tournament was likely the first shooter that employed parkour-esque mechanics in its movement system. By that I mean moves like wall jumps and quick successive lateral hops. There are also anti-physics shenanigans like double jumps and weapon jumps. Combine these together and you will witness unbelievable feats of motion. Toxikk models itself closely after UT2004's movement system which favors high air control and has dodge double-jump that is missing in other iterations of UT.
[*]Bring physics-defying parkour into combat and the result is an erratic movement pattern heavy on dodging enemy attacks and flick aiming shots back at them. There is a lot of double tapping of movement keys and the spacebar with tight coordination and precise mouse angles.
[*]It is pretty clear that Toxikk is a complex game with a high skill ceiling.

[*]What set Unreal Tournament apart from its archrival Quake are dual fire weapons and the vehicular combat in large maps. 
[*]Having secondary fire modes for each weapon means that at every moment in combat, there is an extra way to kill and an additional way to die. This amps up the intensity and decision-making process. Secondary fire is a lot quicker than swapping to another weapon (which you may not have). Picking up 1 weapon in UT is actually picking up 2. Toxikk adopts this formula as well.
[*]Vehicles are just insanely fun and unlock another dimension to the combat. Toxikk gifts its players another cool toy ‚Äî a freaking MECH. Nuff said.

[h3]List of weapons and vehicles in Toxikk and comparison with UT:[/h3]
[*][b]Ravager (melee):[/b] Near equivalent of UT99 & UT3's Impact Hammer. Instead of deflecting projectiles, its secondary function repairs damaged vehicles.
[*][b]Raven (pistol):[/b] Identical to UT99 & UT3's Enforcer. But has no dual wield.
[*][b]Bullcraft (shotgun):[/b] Unique, no equivalent in UT.
[*][b]Violator (LMG):[/b] Identical to UT2004's Assault Rifle.
[*][b]Falcon (sniper):[/b] Identical to all UT Sniper Rifles.
[*][b]Stingray (plasma):[/b] A combination of UT99's Pulse Gun and Shock Rifle. Primary fires balls of plasma, while secondary fires an instant beam.
[*][b]Dragoneer (flamethrower):[/b] Unique, no equivalent in UT.
[*][b]Cerberus (rocket):[/b] Near equivalent to UT99's Rocket Launcher with guiding laser for secondary fire.
[*][b]Hellraiser (mini nuke):[/b] Identical to all UT Redeemer.
[*][b]Notable omissions:[/b] UT's Flak Cannon, Bio Rifle, Ripper, Lightning Gun, Shield Gun.

[*][b]Streamer (bike):[/b] Equivalent to UT3's Hoverboard. Can be spawned on-demand and allows carrying of enemy's flag.
[*][b]Rhinoceros (car):[/b] Identical to UT3's Scorpion.
[*][b]Banshee (aircraft):[/b] Near equivalent to UT2004 & UT3's Manta. Uses a minigun instead of plasma, and has a secondary fire which shoots rockets.
[*][b]Phantom (aircraft):[/b] Just a bigger and slower Banshee.
[*][b]Demon (mech):[/b] Unique, no equivalent in UT. Although UT3 has an alien "mech" called Darkwalker, the Demon mech is the real deal. Has dual Gatling guns, shoots rocket barrages and can fly.
[*][b]Notable omissions:[/b] All UT tanks in general, such as the Goliath, Leviathan and Paladin.
[/list]

[h1]Plot & Characters ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ[/h1]
[list]
[*]A futuristic new Cold War, between puppet governments run by powerful western and eastern paramilitary corporations, emerged from the discovery of a new scientific element that has become a prized material in the ongoing global energy crisis. Be deployed in missions as a hired gun for both factions and battle in various advanced facilities and derelict sites around the world.
[*]The premise is quite a sane one for an arena shooter, and it's a good thing. No nonsensical blood sports, no bizarre journey through hell or some other dimensions, but just your everyday mercenary jobs in a grounded reality that harnesses more exciting tech than what we have now.
[*]This fictional world is fine, but playing as a faceless merc means that there is no story. Just two megacorps' fight for supremacy unraveling mission after mission. And you don't get to pick sides; you fight for both. There's nothing to feel invested about in this game's plot or characters.
[/list]

[h1]Controls & Interface ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ[/h1]
[list]
[*]Standard WASD controls configurable in the settings. Shift + W/A/S/D as an alternate way to dodge instead of double tapping the movement keys, which may be preferred by some players. *There is no option to disable double tapping*
[*]Weapon priority can be reordered, which will influence the behavior of auto weapon switch on pickup.
[*]The crosshair is highly customizable. There are 43 crosshairs to choose from with options to change the color, size, rotation, offset. You can combine 2 crosshairs to make a fancy one, meaning there are technically 43*43=1849 crosshairs in this game! Each weapon can have a different crosshair assigned.
[*]The weapon switching overlay can be toggled to always show or fade away, and each weapon can have its own custom color.
[*]And lastly, you can choose to be right-handed, left-handed or center-aligned weapon model.
[/list]

[h1]Verdict [/h1]
[quote]Toxikk is undeniably what Unreal Tournament 3 should have been. UT3 was a disappointing Gears of War wannabe with an aesthetic that departed from its roots. Toxikk stays true to its inspiration and showcases shocking UE3 graphics made possible only by the impeccable craftsmanship skills from Reakktor Studios. Grab this F2P spiritual successor of UT2004 and play it with your friends![/quote]

[b][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198314895445', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1692484470}
review: This game reminds me a lot of a more futuristic version of Uberstrike or Super 3d Paintball or whatever from the Facebook games web browser thing from 2006-2015 that used the Unity 3d game engine, but the music is upgraded, the game is less pay to win, and has an amazing hit registration and networking functionality. This game is very fun but I wish it had a few more Uberstrike like maps with more hidden secrets and things like that. This has to be one of the greatest fps games I have played in the last 5-7 years. The game runs very smooth most of the time too. I never felt like I missed possible kills because of low game performance. The art style is very good as well. I really love the music in this game too... It has to be one of my favorite soundtracks in an fps game. I could not find almost any people in the multiplayer matches but I am using the free to play edition as well so it only selects to closest, lowest ping server for me automatically with quick play instead of finding the server with the most players like Shatterline.

review:
A UT-inspired (I say inspired, it has UT2004 dodge jumps) arena fps that succeeds in distinguishing itself visually and mechanically from its predecessor.
It feels good to play and has solid mechanical potential, it seems like the people behind this game wanted something specific and succeeded in making that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976811250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1651295689}
review:
An excellent tribute to 90s/early 00s arena shooters, especially Unreal Tournament. Given what it's going for, the gameplay is basically flawless. The graphics are pretty good, and the guns - while they aren't as cool as UT's arsenal - are still cool and fun to use. You are mobile, fast, and powerful in this game, it feels great.

Sadly, I can't recommend it if you don't have friends to play with, as the servers are basically dead - but if you have even a couple of friends to play with from time to time, this game is a total blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166931214', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1682640889}
review:
Lo que pudo ser el √∫ltimo Unreal Tournament y lo que tuvo que haber sido el Quake Champions. Muy divertido, con bots competentes, algunas armas nuevas e innovadoras, y algunas clasicas, lo cual nunca viene mal. Las mec√°nicas de movimiento son del Unreal Tournament y hay algunas armas similares al Quake y al ut. La verdad el juego no enga√±a, es como jugar un ut1999 pero con armas distintas y algunas mejoras en movilidad (y obviamente los graficos). 

Adem√°s hay una mec√°nica nueva similar a las del Halo o Crysis, habilidades activas del traje. Solo hay 2. Vienen al spawnear, por lo que no tendr√°s que buscarlas por ah√≠, solo elegir cual quieres. En todos los modos, est√° el camuflaje activo. Se activa con la Q y te hace semi-invisible mientras te quede energ√≠a en el traje. La energ√≠a se llena despu√©s de un tiempo sin usar habilidades del traje. Y la segunda solo esta en los mapas donde hay vehiculos, y te permite spawnear una hoverboard.

En definitiva, un muy buen juego, Debes probarlo, ya que es gratis, y si te gusta comprarlo para poder jugar contra bots, usar cosmeticos, crear servers y unirte manualmente a ellos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999228805', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1644337005}
review:
Jeez, I put off trying this one for ages, I'm not sure where to start but the general user experience playing as a free player so far has been pretty bad. 

Launched into main menu, dealt with the usual changing audio settings and changing my resolution three times for it to save and stick. I then started the tutorial, first impressions of actual gameplay. 

For an arena game, there is immediately no sense in momentum, your character has like air brakes and is incapable of building any kind of momentum. In terms of movement feel, it's much closer to Halo than it is to Quake. There is a second jump, but you can only use it when at the apex of your first jump. This feels bad and I just ended up mashing it to get through the tutorial. Rocket Jumping is weak as you can't carry your momentum after you land, you just kinda stop. There is no bunnyhopping and there is only a tiny feeling of strafing for maybe half a second after a dash, most movement tricks you might be used to in other arena shooters are absent here. Wall-jumping also doesn't seem to add much here due to the limitations of speed, amount of jumps and even the map designs not really encouraging it in the slightest. 

As a free player, your options are to play the tutorial or select a quick match. There is a server browser but you can't see it, so whilst apparently there are 100 people playing this game according to Steam Charts, you can't see them or play with them. On my multiple attempts to find a game using our only 'quick match' option (with skill-level matchmaking turned off mind you) I was only able to find games with bots. There might as well be 0 people playing from my perspective. Why the hell would I spend money for a game that might not even have one populated server? 

Aesthetics are fine and the weapons seem ok, not that I can get much experience with them, otherwise it just kinda looks like Halo, what with everybody looking pretty much the same, either red or blue in a generic armoured space suit thing. 

Just go play Unreal Tournament or Warfork, or any other Arena shooter, you have loads of free ones to pick from that actually have servers with players that you can join. Whilst I appreciate another attempt at making an accessible modern arena shooter, this is far from what we need to make the genre popular again.

Also, making maps unlocks seems like a completely backwards way of getting people to play your game. Could you imagine if you had to play Halo 2 for 50 hours before you got to play on Blood Gulch? Who the hell came up with that idea for a game that was already going to struggle building an audience and player base?

author: {'steamid': '76561198998262497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1635542014}
review:
TOXIKK

Frag like the 90s.. obviously with movement in 1080 HD graphics exceeding 60 frames!

Feels similar to many great arena style deathmatch FPS games, Halo, quake live and unreal tournament come to mind.

Game is very fluid and has a decent lineup of powerful guns with Alt fire options, sound and music is great as well, you have a cloaking ability similar to crysis which is pretty cool!

I just wish the single player had more to offer, this great Gems online community is pretty slim most of the time, pick it up for sure and try help revive the player base some.

Check this one out and toss some money in for the full release as this would help the developers.
7/10 - needs more players

author: {'steamid': '76561198170671818', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1697967312}
review:
Mutators: 
-135% Speed
-Instagib

Level: Citadel

*MUAH* Chef's Boner

UPDATE: I played some 99 and actually this game feels pretty good. Turns out I was playing on hardcore all those years lol

<s>Also, the default guns are way too nerfed. I feel like I'm fighting with a piece of cotton on a string. Best tactic seems to be to run and just grab health pickups and then frag scavenge. I haven't been so underwhelmed by a shotgun since Doom 3. Rocket Launcher splash damage? Nonexistant. Then players gather up enough health to storm the Bastille because they never die and so your 100 damage bullseye rocket launcher hits become a tickle. The movement system is excellent but plying an arena of agile, low-damage tank is no fun, at least for me. Gimme that UT99 rocket launcher charged barrage or the Quake 3 one-shot railgun. The movement/dodge system is good enough to support it. </s>

review: It combines and adds on top of Quake and Unreal, having all the cool things I want from an arena shooter - no weapon reload, you can see (and hear!) damage dealt, it shows weapons' spawn time, objectives' locations. Movement freedom with dodge, double jump, wall jump. Sounds good, has cool weapons with more than one way to fire, vehicles. Some sceneries are BEAUTIFUL.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114646370', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1695591929}
review: I was super skeptical of the the movement at first, so I dropped the game for a long time. Then, I decided to really truck through the movement tutorial, and after a bit of frustration, really came to love the movement mechanics. I'm disappointed that this game doesn't have more players, because otherwise I'd pay for it in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993568299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1645850699}
review:
Its amazing, and its dead. Mostly it own fault. Everyone wants to go home to Quake, but Quake Live has never gone away.  It does suffer form "doing it up" too much as the temptation for ornament is too much with so much processing surplus with modern hardware. For that reason like all modern games, or Bayformers, rather than cramming as much shit to look at as possible, good design is supremely about cleanliness, which is this game's only fault. Quake could grow up a bit...maybe....this is your best try at that. 

Ohh and it's free. So review it yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866942343', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1593137791}
review:
I grew up on Catacomb 3D, Wolfenstein 3D, Doom series, Duke Nukem 3D, and similar games.  Quake 2 came along and blew me away graphically and gameplay-wise. Fast-paced, balanced weapons, and lots of content by the community. Quake Ii was the first online community I felt like I was a part of and to this day I still talk to one clan member.

TOXIKK is a modern take on that formula without the community or as much quality. Guns feel great and are very responsive. Controls are all around responsive. Interesting maps. Unfortunately, matches are heavily populated by bots. These bots make very questionable decisions often.

Great arena shooter in a great setting that's missing the community feel of other games I played in the past.

Die Entwickler haben bei dem Spiel zu viel versprochen. Die Schnelligkeit und Dynamic eines Unreal Tournament wird hier √ºberhaupt nicht geboten.
Dank fehlender Spieler k√§mpft man zudem gegen strunz doofe Bots. Auch das konnte UT im Jahre 1999 besser. Die Waffen sind ebenfalls nur Standardkost. 
Ich m√∂chte behaupten, dass dieses Game auch im Jahr 1999 nicht f√ºr Begeisterung gesorgt h√§tte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968255315', 'num_games_owned': 1717, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 9288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8868, 'last_played': 1663436051}
review:
A modern successor to Unreal Tournament 2004 / UT3. TOXIKK delivers that adrenaline pumping arena shooter gameplay you remember with beautiful graphics, familiar weapon and level design, and butter smooth performance.

I‚Äôve played Quake Champions and I think the character abilities change the core mechanics too much, so it didn‚Äôt scratch the Arena itch I needed. TOXIKK on the other hand feels just like an Unreal Tournament game.

Unfortunately there aren‚Äôt many people playing this game, and unless you‚Äôre on during peak hours, you‚Äôll be playing a lot of autofilled matches with bots. Personally I didn‚Äôt mind this, because I‚Äôm nostalgic for bot matches in UT and Quake 3, but mostly I don‚Äôt mind it because I suck and the bots make me feel like I‚Äôm way better at the game than I actually am.

The UI and graphics are beautiful and it feels like a big budget title. My only graphic complaint is with the character designs. I wish they were unique ala Quake and UT. Instead they‚Äôre kind of generic Spartan guys. You gain multiplayer XP and unlock different armor, helmets, camo patterns, etc like Halo, though I‚Äôm not a fan of most of the helmets. There aren‚Äôt any weapon cosmetics, which would‚Äôve been nice to see. 

Workshop content is fairly sparse. There are a few high quality community maps worth checking out. Give those a download. Only a couple player models, though unfortunately. Arena shooters are always better when you‚Äôre fragging Kermit the Frog or Homer Simpson.

All of the maps are fun. Most are re-created from other arena shooters, and since most of the map layouts were designed by other game devs, the TOXIKK devs put extra care into making each re-imagining as gorgeous as possible, and it definitely shows. They all look fantastic and visually distinct from one another.

If only this game had a more active playerbase. There is a weekly Friday Fragfest event which I assume has a big turnout but I‚Äôve never participated.

If you like Unreal Tournament and want to play against bots, buy it. You‚Äôll gain access to the ‚Äúcontract‚Äù challenges which were fun to complete. Or, if you have a group of friends to play with already, get everyone to check out the F2P version and pretend you‚Äôre having a lan party with your buddies in 2004.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070705087', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1711891154}
review:
[h1]Frag like it's 2007[/h1]

Now, if you don't know anything about Unreal Tournament, i strongly suggest you take a look at those games before considering this one.
Toxikk is a loveletter to the AFPS genre which unfortunately like all other attempts, have failed. The game is dead, so you are stuck with playing against bots.

At it's core this really is Unreal Tournament 3. The game runs in Unreal Engine 3, has very similar movement and physics to Unreal Tournament 3 and even has it's gritty but with ridiculous bloom artstyle.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
With that said, it's not blatant copy of course. Toxikk has different weapons (some are quite unique) and abilities like jetpack and cloak (thankfully, you can disable them). The dashing can be bound to a seperate key, making it more spammable. You can double jump AND dodge jump, something that was available in UT 2004 but not in UT 3. For everything else, it will play really similar to UT 3. Tho one thing to note is that for some reason i just cannot hit targets as consistently as i can in UT 3. I am really not sure why, maybe the slight speed changes or pretty crappy animations, but take it as you will.

[b]Music[/b]
Each map has 3 tracks assigned to it which are then shuffled as you play. Some of them are pretty mediocre but some others are truly [b][i]GODLIKE[/i][/b]. Unfortunately the devs did not provide the soundtrack nor any information on where to find it. And the files themselves seem to be encrypted. If anyone know how to get some tracks from this game, let me know.

[b]Graphics and performance[/b]
Graphics are actually on point. Don't expect to see anything close to Arkham Knight here, but for an indie studio being stuck in an ancient engine, this really looks way better than it should.. Like said before, the artstyle is very close to UT3, but with some extra fancy stuff like volumetric lighting and general better quality of the assets. The post processing is way more intense here however. This applies to the bloom and distortion. Some of that stuff can be tweaked in the settings or the config file, but if you do not like overly extreme graphical effects, you won't like what you get here.

[b]Verdict[/b]
Game is good, get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198960431474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1667372628}
review:
This game is good, but there's definitely some issues and alterations that would make the game better. I'll get the good stuff out of the way first. The game looks fantastic, everything looks fantastic, the weapons feel great, and the maps are all designed very well. The weapons with the best design in my not so humble opinion are,(from best to worst) stingray(plasma gun), violator(machine gun), falcon(sniper rifle), dragoneer(flamethrower), Cerberus(rocket launcher), Raven(pistol), Bullcraft(shotgun), and Ravager(melee thing). Even the ones at the bottom of the list aren't too bad.

Now on to the things that should be altered. I think there needs to be more pellets fired with the bullcraft(shotgun) and the spread thinned down a little, because I can hardly use it for anything that isn't directly in front of me. 
Sometimes, when I'm running around, my face occasionally glitches into the wall and I can't see anything for a split second. This is really annoying and has resulted in me dying or getting really disoriented, and it's super frequent.
The hitboxes of the pickups are also too small. I can't just brush past them and pick them up like in other arena shooters, which is a big issue when you're flying around the map at high speeds.
The mouse speed in the menu is way too slow. And combined with the weird distortion thing when you move the mouse around, this is really painful for my eyes.

If these things can be fixed, This game will be perfect and be a good contender for the big games like Quake Champions and UT4.

review:
If you've cherished the ego-shooters of the mid- and late 90s, then TOXIKK is your get-go.

Fast-paced, thrilling action, brilliant HD Graphics,...  Even the legendary map "DmDeck16" (recreated as DEKK) is included!

So, before you die of boredom, play and frag like back in the 90s!

author: {'steamid': '76561198318633473', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1609649238}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 25.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline broken. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that. 

also I never played this game before I just pirated other games and this was the steam api
developer_response: What a great read. All the best to you and your family!

review:
A part of me has moved on from this genre of my youth, tournament shooters. But in a time when arena shooters are both either polished yet bloated, or "fundamentalist" yet unpolished, TOXIKK stands out as being both a well-made game and amazing tournament shooter.

Every fan of the genre should try this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364397779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1682412811}
review:
Here is my review for Toxikk - This is Unreal Tournament 2004, I like Unreal Tournament 2004 and it feels, looks, and plays like Unreal Tournament 2004. Lets start off by saying the weapons in this game are more satisfyingly fun to use because of the fact every weapon has more of that viscous feel and look and there is nothing unbalanced here - they are like UT 2004's weapons but much better, in terms of cleaner animations and they are more meaner looking and brutal when fired and they actually look nice and they do what they are supposed to do (and a flamethrower thrown into the mix very awesome!) And yes they all have the same similarities when it came down to each of the firing modes on each weapon - left click normal fire, right click special fire. The weapons do feel more powerful and they even give you the feeling you are actually doing damage - so I really like the weapons in this game more compared to UT 2004's weapons in the long run. 

The maps in this game also remind me of UT 2004 style maps, the architecture of each map is very similar also and infact there is one map I played on that resembled Deck 16 from Unreal Tournament, as it had the exact same layout. The maps here are like UT 2004 in these venues - a couple of outside valley maps with ruins and caves surrounding the forest, a couple of city area street maps, a couple of indoor maps with platforms to jump around on and a couple of maps that are mixed with indoors and outdoors. These maps this game has to offer are really nice looking for eye candy and inspiring from the Unreal Tournament series.

The characters you play as can be customized, but mostly everyone including the bots look the same and I think that is the only downfall of this in general, UT 2004 had more distinctive characters and players to choose to play as or against.

The gameplay of this game plays exact to UT 2004's gameplay, fast paced and everyone for themselves and none of those extra things attached like building forts or getting people to down cover you and no reloading weapons either or any of that bulls**t it is all about running around and fragging people and getting to a certain amount of frags to win a match and or capturing cells/flags to win a match. Very simple straight to the point gameplay here with no other nonsense or technically a player has to worry about while playing a deathmatch - very old school feel just like the good old days when FPS shooters were simple and not complex at all. (We need to bring more games like this back again)

The graphics in this game are beautiful, clean, crisp, very nice to look at. The menu and gui layouts are not confusing and very user friendly as well as the hud layouts. Gameplay is fast and smooth easy to understand and its very easy for any user to master within seconds, especially if you have played UT 2004 then you will know what you are doing immediately.

I recommend this game for everyone to give a try, especially if you liked UT 2004 you will like this as well. Even if you are into old school FPS games then this one is for you, its worth the going rate that it sells for the full version or if the free version is enough then that is still good too. There is next to nobody playing this anymore so that means most likely you will be stuck going against bots at random difficulty's with the free version, only when you upgrade to the full version then you have access to set your matches however you like them with the bots on how hard you want them to be. This is a 4 year old game - 2016 it came out I think? So really I just discovered it and Im writing this review in 2020. Being that old it really does not bother me that I have to play against bots, Im just enjoying the game itself and you will also if you give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336883940', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1702017599}
review:
[h1]"Toxikk: A Modern Classic in the Arena Shooter Genre!"[/h1]


Toxikk has completely revitalized my love for fast-paced, adrenaline-pumping arena shooters, and it's an absolute gem in the gaming world. From the moment I stepped into its virtual battlegrounds, I was hooked on the intense action, crisp graphics, and the pure essence of old-school first-person shooter goodness.

The gameplay in Toxikk is a breath of fresh air, combining the best elements of classic arena shooters with modern design. The fluid movement, responsive controls, and skill-based combat make every match a thrilling experience. It's a game where individual skill truly shines, and mastering the art of precise aiming and strategic movement is incredibly rewarding.

Visually, Toxikk is a stunner. The maps are beautifully crafted, and the attention to detail is remarkable. The futuristic setting is brought to life with vibrant colors and dynamic environments that keep every match feeling dynamic and engaging. The optimization is spot-on, ensuring a smooth and immersive experience even during the most heated battles.

One aspect that truly sets Toxikk apart is its commitment to simplicity. No overcomplicated mechanics or unnecessary gimmicks ‚Äì just pure, unadulterated FPS action. The weapon arsenal is diverse and well-balanced, catering to different playstyles without overwhelming players with choices. This straightforward approach creates a level playing field where skill and strategy prevail.

The community surrounding Toxikk is fantastic. I've encountered friendly players, and the matchmaking system ensures that every match is competitive and enjoyable. The developers are actively engaged, listening to player feedback, and regularly updating the game to keep it fresh and exciting.

Toxikk is not just a game; it's a love letter to the golden era of arena shooters. It manages to capture the essence of classics while infusing it with the best elements of modern gaming. If you're a fan of fast-paced, skill-driven shooters, Toxikk deserves a spot in your library. It's a testament to the fact that great gameplay and solid design are timeless. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077342338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1477190775}
review:
Nobody plays this game. Nobody will ever play this game. But its the best game in its genre imo.

Edit: After 4 years since release, still nobody plays. I tried convincing friends to play but with no online community or player base I cannot recommend it.
developer_response: Hi there and thx for your review. However, given the Steam algo, ...do you think a 'thumbs-down' will give the game more visibility (aka more players)?

author: {'steamid': '76561198154953801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 15257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3694, 'last_played': 1707515669}
review: Toxikk is basically the modern 'Unreal Tournament'. Unfortunately the UT franchise is dead and got worse with each edition but Toxikk on the other hand brings back all the good stuff from the classic arena games. This is proper old school FPS combined with modern graphics and mechanics. I love the UT control style and movements, and certainly being able to play against bots giving you total control over your matches. You play what you want to play and when you want to rather than having to fit your gaming sessions around other people online. But the lack of an online multiplayer community may not satisfy certain gamers. There are some moments of video stutter on certain maps due the game running on the older Unreal 3 engine which is surprising having been released in 2016. There isn't a huge amount of content but more maps are available to download for free from the games work shop. Reakktor Studios could have designed some better weapons as Epic Games did with the Unreal Tournament games but the default maps are incredibly well designed and over all this is a fantastic game for less than ¬£11. Any one who likes the old school FPS arena games will love this game. It's a massive thumbs up from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114377492', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1596301065}
review:
Played it back in 2016 for about 2 hours and totally forgot about it, mostly due to not being so much into the genre as I currently am. Saw it in a video recently and decided to install since its free, and what do I see - dead game. All I found in about 20 minutes were 3 people and around 10 servers running, 9 of which empty. It's a really fun game (tbh that was some really well spent 20 minutes of my time), but without playerbase it's nothing.

If you've got a friend or two who like this arena deathmatch genre, I highly recommend trying it out, but otherwise, don't bother installing, unless you decide to pay 15 euros for the single-player campaign or the ability to play with bots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017599592', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1597174963}
review:
Ein wirklich starkes Spiel
Tolles & schnelles Gameplay mit einer immer noch sehr ansehnlichen Grafik
Auch die Musik ist spitze. Spielerisch ist es echt top! 

Habe es jetzt noch nicht lange bisher gespielt wei√ü aber bereits das ich noch einige Zeit an diesem Spiel h√§ngen werde da es viel Spa√ü macht wenn auch leider mehr mit Bots als mit anderen Spielern

Das der Knackpunkt an Toxikk 
Es spielt fast  keiner mehr.

Server-Browser bisher immer leer gewesen bis auf 1-2 Ausnahmen wo aber auch nur 1-2 Spieler am zocken waren.
Was wirklich schade ist grad weil es ja sogar Free2Play spielbar ist und dazu nicht mal einen Itemshop besitzt

Allzu viele Maps bietet Toxikk auch nicht aber das ist jetzt nicht so wild. Und die die da sind machen auch viel Spa√ü.
Gibt neben den offiziellen auch noch nen paar Maps aus dem Steam Workshop und wer Lust und Laune hat kann sich auch eigene im Editor erschaffen (Kaufversion hierf√ºr aber n√∂tig) 

Insgesamt  zu empfehlen und kann ja seine Freunde auch einfach dazuholen 
ist ja immerhin kostenlos spielbar. Und mit den Bots ist sonst auch okay und diese funktonieren auch bei den Workshop Maps was ja auch nicht selbstverst√§ndlich ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008153781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1595689472}
review:
Like nearly all online games nowadays, it is full of annoying psychos, in particular, if one starts up the game for the first time there are still always one or two which are clearly not beginners but trying to harass beginners for their ego and pure "toxicity" (I'm a pretty decent shooter player with general experience in arena shooters, but those people act with determination which is not just an accidental pairing with good players). The game also looked ridiculous, the map I got had only a single colour (white), it was hard to distinguish anything, moreoever the mouse was way too sensitive (I have already turned down my mouse's own sensitivity), which one can adjust of course, but is just another aspect of pointless, weird design.
And one aspect of old arena shooters, the strafe jump, is something I could do without entirely, the chance to hit it accidentally is way higher than that one can make effective use of it.
The game lacks any feeling of polish and feels like a "cheap" knock-off of the old games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276573191', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1710469527}
review: I'm going to preface this review by saying that this is a great game, of course it has flaws, but none (that I've noticed) have been game-breaking. I haven't come across any hackers (unlikely that there are many) and this game even runs great on my older gaming rig, where most modern FPS games lag quite a bit, I find myself with  constant (at least) 40 FPS with reasonable loading times. The biggest issue is the low player-count. The only reason why I'm hesitant to buy the upgrade is because I've seen many rumors of very low server-pop. Moving on-- the game handles very nicely, and while the controls can be a bit hard to get used to at first, they're very memorable, and very nice to use.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979631438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1587548378}
review: You know all of those games that claim to be reviving arena shooters, but with some flashy new gimmick that never catches on?  This is like that except without the gimmicks.  Just an arena and a bunch of guns, no character classes, no Ultimates, just nice punchy guns, solid movement and classic gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121456414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1669103094}
review:
Not gonna lie, the game can be played two ways.

1) Super Simple; run and gun like there's no tomorrow and ignore your health.
2) Super Nimble; Jackie Chan and Jet Li trained you in the Art O'Asian and you are now The Monkey King.

I'm loving the cheese and every weapon has it's benefits and it's drawbacks (honestly feels pretty balanced), even the special one shot weapon that's basically a fun launcher (nuke cannon) takes so long to respawn in a room you can shoot in with a somewhat hidden door that...yeah, it's surprisingly well thought out.

The multiplayer allows you to host games pretty easily and it's got a pretty user-friendly way of going about everything, even my half-witted self could find what I needed in an instant.

I definitely recommend this game, in it's entirety (although all you need is the free version, which seems to have been the original point of this game) even with the single-player that feels like hard-mode turned up to twelve (out of ten, but that might just be me).

author: {'steamid': '76561197990680744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1604075304}
review: A modern hommage to the sci-fi-like gorey shooters we grew up with. The feel of the weapons is satisfying and familiar. I feel the audiovisual cues this game gives are vastly superior to the old arena shooters. Map structure and pick-up placement is solid, understandable and balanced; it's a matter of minutes to understand a map and frag along. Oodles of fun both in small and big matches. Sound design overall is rock solid. Color, contrast and lighting is exceedingly well-done. This game fills a void in my heart I didn't even know I had. I played a couple of matches in the free version and in ecstasy I bought the four pack. Goshdarn, great job guys, I wish I heard about this game sooner.

review: Âñ∑È¶ôÊ∏ØÂú∞ÂõæÁöÑÁúãÂÆåÊàëËøôÁØáËØÑÊµãË∞¢Ë∞¢ÔºåÊàëÊòØÂ∏¶ËäÇÂ•èÂºÄÂßãÂñ∑ÁöÑÔºåËß£ÈìÉËøòÈ°ªÁ≥ªÈìÉ‰∫∫ÔºåÊàëÂ∑≤ÁªèÂêëÂà∂‰ΩúÁªÑÂèçÊò†Ôºå‰ªñ‰ª¨‰πüÈÅìÊ≠âËØ¥ÊòéÈÇ£ÂπÖÂú∞ÂõæÊ≤°ÊúâÊÅ∂ÊÑèÔºåÂú®ÊÅ∂ËØÑ‰πãÂâçÂêÑ‰ΩçÈúÄË¶Å‰∫ÜËß£Ëøô‰ª∂‰∫ãÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàËøáÁ®ã„ÄÇ

author: {'steamid': '76561198011969439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1610741421}
review:
If you loved UT2004/UT3 but played them to death, this is the next best thing. The Free version limits HOW you can play, but not what's IN the game - it's a great place to check out if you dig the tempo and action style this game offers. Buying the full version allows you to set up private online matches and gives you access to bots (both in a single player "campaign" called Contracts and to use online). From my limited time with the game so far, the bots seem about as good as I remember them being in the older UT titles - for a relatively casual player of these game like myself, they're a perfect fit. The things that seem more limited or different in a bad way are few and far between, and I don't think they should discourage anyone from checking TOXIKK out in the Free version at least.

Also, I absolutely LOVE the fact that several years since it launched, the devs still keep servers up and running, even if the game doesn't seem all that popular - I'm definitely taking advantage of this with my friends (game is 70% off at the time of writing, what a time to be alive!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198041727294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1586802061}
review:
Hui! Also so schlecht wie ich den early access crap in Erinnerung hatte, kommt mir das hier ja direkt wie ein ganz anderes Game vor.
Nach nur 4 Stunden hier schonmal meine pro und cons:
- - - Pro - - -
- Men√ºstruktur ist ziemlich gut
- Spielereien wie Fadenkreuz anpassen vorhanden ( und mein GOTT, l√§sst sich das Haar genau anpassen.... )
- Grafik erste Sahne ( nicht das das f√ºr einen Quake3 und UT99 Liebhaber wichtig w√§re, aber es gibt ja 12 j√§hrige, f√ºr die sowas bei einem Arena Shooter wichtig ist... )
- Gameplay extrem fl√ºssig
- Fast pace, wenn man die dodge bzw double-tap Techniken beherrscht
- Singleplayer missionen

- - - Contra - - -
- Effekte im Spiel sehr nervig. Hoffe man kann Rauch und Explosionen abschalten. ( noch nicht getestet ).
- Bot AI scheint nicht die hellste zu sein. Auf einigen Maps pimmeln die bots in vereinzelten R√§umen rum. Mit der falschen Mod und nach dem eigenem Ableben, muss man dann drauf hoffen, das die Gegner Bots schlauer sind und dann die Gegnerkollegen aufsuchen, sonst muss man bis zum Round Timelimit warten. Mein Test fand aber nur mit den Bots der normalen Stufe statt, also ka, vielleicht gehts mit einer h√§rteren AI ja besser.
- MP ist tot.
- Da der MP quasi tot ist, muss man sich quasi immer mit Bots herum schlagen, was nat√ºrlich auf Dauer nervt.
- Zu wenig Maps. Auch custom Maps sind ja leider nur eine handvoll da. :(


FAZIT: Auch mit noch 30 weiteren PRO's, an Quake 3 Arena und Unreal Tournament 99 kommt NIE ein Game ran. Also hop hop, f√ºllt mal wieder die alten Server und lasst den modernen Kram links liegen!
Aber mal davon abgesehen, ist man ein Fan von Arenashootern, dann kann man bedenkenlos mal bei TOXIKK reinschauen.

review: Looks like it could be a lot of fun, since I like Arena Shooters, but it's completely dead online. So, RIP.
developer_response:
Thanks for your review and great to hear that you "think it could be a lot of fun" and how you like Arena shooters.

Sorry for not finding enough players in your 0.4 hrs of game time. You should generally be able to find active matches (or you can play vs bots, if you don't). FYI: "Thumbs down" reviews influence our visibility on Steam, leading to fewer players as a direct consequence.

You can use SteamCharts to find the more active play-hours in your time zone: https://steamcharts.com/app/324810

author: {'steamid': '76561198114963066', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1533134610}
review:
This game is an utter joy to play and is a throwback to the days when Unreal Tournament/Quake 3 were the pinnacle of gaming. Closer in feel to UT than Quake, this shooter had it all. It is incredibly sad that the playerbase just didnt materialize for this game. 

I still feel if some big time streamer had picked it up, this might have served the niche that enjoys these almost rhythmic, kinetic shooters. Maybe pick it up with a couple of friends for some fast paced fun matches every once in a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333758846', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1583279059}
review:
Ingredients: 
5 tbsp coconut oil, melted
200g vegan dark chocolate
170g self-raising flour
180g golden caster sugar
3 heaped teaspoons cocoa powder
1 vanilla pod
230ml unsweetened soya milk
200g pecan nuts
Large pinch of sea salt


Method: 
Preheat the oven to 180¬∫C/350¬∫F/Gas Mark 4.
Grease a square baking tray (20cm) with a little coconut oil and line with grease proof paper.
Melt ¬æ of the dark chocolate in a microwave or in a dish over a pot of boiling water.
Sieve the flour and cocoa powder into a bowl.
Add the caster sugar, sea salt and cocoa powder.
Halve the vanilla pod and scrape out the seeds.
Add the soya milk, coconut oil and melted chocolate and stir until you reach an even consistency.
Chop the pecan nuts and rest of the dark chocolate and add to the mixture.
Spread the mixture evenly onto your baking tray.
Cook in the oven for 25 minutes.
Allow to cool for a few minutes
Serve with vegan vanilla ice cream and berries.

review:
If you've ever played Unreal Tournament, you want to play this game.

If you've never played Unreal Tournament, you should probably do that. Then you should play this game.

Reakktor got it right, finally. If they had only gotten it right with Neocron, the gaming world woule be different today. We can't change that, but we can accept that they've perfected the arena shooter, and you will have a great time playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080553225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1681078497}
review:
I really like the way the Demo play is set up! I can play with my friends and they buy it for the bonus maps if they like it, no pay2win.

BUT: Workshop maps are not well supported. They load very slowly if the players have not already downloaded them through the steam page and it is not possible to select the next map after a game to be a workshop map.
Please make it easier to customize server settings, like number of bots or the map played on, without having to exit the server and reopen it.

Also, is there a way to have the bots wait until all players connected?

author: {'steamid': '76561198010054622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4499, 'last_played': 1576975774}
review:
Despite problems with finding people within my skill range to play with, this game was highly enjoyable and somewhat breathed new life / life back into 90's arena shooting in a "pure" way, while improving on the concept with a better arsenal of weapons.

The biggest problem this game suffers from is poor/almost nonexistent-seeming matchmaking. 

I could have easily invested another 500 hours in an arena shooter if the community could prosper and develop (hell, even just interact without the free edition cutting the community in half) organically.

review:

The gameplay is not as smooth as UT which I think is caused by limitation of the old UDK engine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291827599', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1575976476}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004471512', 'num_games_owned': 1296, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1549, 'last_played': 1695434921}
review:
A true homage to the classics; Doom Deathmatch, Unreal Tournament, Halo, Quake 3, I see elements of each within this game. 
Only gripe I have about this game is that it never really took off. There are only a few stock maps per game mode and the workshop content is very lacking.
I still log in frequently for a quick match and am never disappointed,
I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys arena shooters, especially the ones from back in the day. 
Hopefully it will get the recognition it deserves one day and the workshop content will flourish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098563486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1600014542}
review:
This a very nice arena shooter 

Pros
It's a fun arena shooter with good maps and guns to play around with
It has bots for when you want to practice or can't get a match going

Cons
The Machine gun and laser gun seem to do the same amount of damage which is weird considering that the laser gun is projectile based you'd think it'd do a bit more damage per hit

Not a whole lot to say what you see is what you get another lovely arena shooter

author: {'steamid': '76561197997383674', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1570749129}
review:
It's such a shame this isn't played more, I followed this game when the first trailer came out say it wouldn't be Free to Play and i loved that, at that time being F2P was the new thing and this game clearly didn't want to be that. 

But it never got much traction and then was made  F2P peaking at 2k players for a while which was fun for a while but I believe it was at the same time of Quake Champions, so it had a competitor with a bigger name and publisher so people move to that I think.

And then QC turned out to be what it is.. But people never got back to this and moved on to other games.

It's seriously enjoyable but bots get old fast, perfect game if you have a couple of friends that are looking for a new game and don't want to deal with a lot of randoms in lobbies and just want to have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137325951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1685266638}
review:
So this is a great game, but you need friends to really get more than some passing time out of it because the population is so low. It's like a modern Quake or Halo CE, great timeless fun playing in the high school computer lab with a big party during lunch, but empty matches otherwise.

It's for the population and price that I give this a 'Not Recommended' because this was originally supposed to be a paid title. They made it free-ish to get more players but the way they went about that was not so great, like popup ads in a mobile app. When you exit the game it opens a browser tab to the game website to encourage you to buy the game. This is why I stopped playing, instead of pricing the game better they made most of it free but opened chrome every time I closed the game.

If you have friends to play with and all enjoy LAN party type games, Toxikk is a great game if a little overpriced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835812319', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1571232000}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996397431', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1569693911}
review:
I'm being very honest and fair here, it's a really good game with absolutely fantastic game mechanics and graphics, it takes me back to 1999 as advertised. However no one is really playing it on steam which makes it very frustrating, the bots are simply too easy to kill. Nevertheless i'm dumbing this game up because i feel it doesn't get the attention and recognition this game deserves. I really don't know what we are doing with our lives in 2019, most games just suck or being developed by sellout developers. Where are the golden times when u could buy a full game without lootboxes, season passes, cosmetics, unlocking by progession and all that kind of stuff. The makers from TOXIKK really do know what they are doing and understand the type of gaming we once fell in love with. It's a shame all these kiddo's are playing fornite and buying games from greedy developers which aren't really worth it.

This is the game what Quake Champions has should have been... Sadly, bethesda turned the franchise into trash like many other developers/games!

Conclusion: If you wanna turn away from the daily madness and just frag some bots and have a good time doing it, this game is for you. Just don't expect many people are playing it so you will be alone in servers all the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199313534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1566969334}
review:
Well, I appreciate a free sample of a game especially. But I am someone who likes to kill time by playing arena shooters offline. I like Unreal Tournament 3 and there are some out there who may crucify me for that. Therefore, I like the art style this game goes for. I don't like how everything is way too colorful and inspired by crap like Fortnite nowadays. I also like fast-paced action in video games. So it pains me to say that after playing UT3 and coming back to this, this isn't as good as I remember. One, the free edition doesn't let me play solo, only in the tutorial it allows solo play; which the tutorial has only two missions. Then there is quick play which connects me to a server in Europe and allows me to play online. However, when I tried this, it was laggy as hell and I was only playing with one other stranger. I can't even customize my own character in this free version with a single set of armor.

As for gameplay, it replicates the Unreal Tournament formula. Weapons are straight out of a military shooter and they replace the cool ones Unreal had. Except for a flamethrower the game has of it's own. It's like UT3 with UT2004 gameplay and I can see the effort was put into this. However, I just didn't enjoy it as much. 

Aside from the UT3 style graphics, the game (at least the free version) doesn't offer up much for me to review. I don't like writing ill about this game because I remember enjoying this before I got my hands on the Unreal games months after. I also checked the game files and some of the stuff from UT3 is in them, but I am aware that may be just part of the Unreal Development Kit that was used to make this game. I'm mentioning Unreal a lot in this review, aren't I? Well, it's obvious what this game wanted to be Unreal in an era where arena shooters are long since dead. If you're curious about this game, it's only $15 max. If it's ever on sale, it may be a steal. As for me, I think I'm gonna go back to Unreal Tournament 3. 

REVIEWER'S NOTE: To the developer from Reakktor Studios that replied to my review before I changed it, I formally apologize for having wrongly remembered about solo play for this game. I checkit out again and I remember the tutorial had the bots I was talking about. Maybe I will give this game another chance if it ever goes on sale because I do think TOXIKK has potential. I wish Reakktor Studios good luck in their future endeavors.
developer_response: Thanks for your review. Just a quick correction of false information: Nothing was changed in the game regarding the free version. You can, as a free player, simply jump in any game and play against real players and/or bots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016995995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1627611229}
review:
Nice FPS with a feel from the 90s FPSs era (e.g. Unreal Tournament (UT), CS).

Pros:
- Very high frame/s. 
- Highly responsive. 
- Quick to load, quick to play.
- Good price point. 
- Devs keep maintaining the game and quick to fix issues that come up (e.g. recent Win10 patch issue).
 
Cons:
- Major Con: Too much "track shooting" - weapons aren't as powerful as they were in say UT. Even the missile launcher takes a number of hits. This really makes sharp aiming feel unnecessary...
- The bot AI is a bit weird. They shoot at you half way across the map when you can barely see them, but don't shoot at you when you're right beside them? Not a major issue since the game is meant to be played with humans.
- I haven't tried all maps, but the maps seem to be a bit small like the ones in old Counterstrike's. I would've preferred more UT alike levels (e.g. larger horizontally and vertically). It feels weird using the sniper rifle from just a few steps above the ground.
- Might be a bit too twichy for me; you can easily turn 380 degrees with a slight mouse move.I might need to adjust some settings. 
- You can get stuck behind geometry or other players which breaks the immersion. On a further note, not stuck as in a bug, but stuck as in you can't move anywhere while obstacles are in your way.

Verdict: Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990124470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1614635183}
review:
I loved Unreal Tournament Games and you can tell this was built to be just like it. Even Featuring the Infamous Deck 17 level. lol which was a welcome level option.

The game is soooooo good if you into this sort of play.

However...
- The servers are almost always empty nowadays
- With the community this dead the devs should just reduce the price of the full game or even make it just entirely free
- I seem to have an issue myself the game runs smoothly to begin with but as time goes on and the longer I play the performance gets worse... it gets laggy and jolty more and more as time passes. if i play long enough it becomes unbearable and even stops my mic from working on discord and starts causing other application issues "for some unknown reason"

It has so much potential but I don't think we will see a rise of players unless the devs do something drastic.

I recommend this game highly as i am an original 1999 fragger from the early days of Quake and Unreal Tournament, and this has the perfect feeling of those styles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977283056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1483848212}
review:
Excellent example of the genre. As much as I love these games and many other do too, unfortunately the genre of arena shooters is basically dead. Other trends simply left it behind. It is what it is. Maybe it will come back someday. If you can buy-in to this for LAN parties, do it. It's pure joy to play. If you don't have friends the servers are pretty barren and those that are active are mostly bots. 

It's a shame but this really did bring me back to the old Unreal Tournament days in my formative gaming years. These games were about skill not abilities. Everyone on equal playing ground without need for endless nerfs, buffs and rebalancing. Everyone was on equal footing where the faster trigger finger won. It's sad games aren't like that anymore. No one wants quick fun anymore they want skill trees, abilities and leveling systems. 

This game unlocks 100% of itself from the get go. You get to see it all and do it all and has great character customization, sadly you will be doing this mostly alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930738334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1670796308}
review:
[h1]Little review for TOXIKK[/h1]

[h1]1.[/h1] [b]Graphics?[/b]
They are REALLY nice!

[h1]2.[/h1] [b]Is it hard?[/b]
Nope.

[h1]3.[/h1] [b]How long is the game?[/b]
I just played multiplayer, I don't know how long it is.

[h1]4.[/h1] [b]Do you need a powerful computer?[/b]
Not a master race, but you'll need a nice PC.

[h1]5.[/h1] [b]Does it have multiplayer? Is it nice?[/b]
It has multiplayer, and it's the best.

[h1]6.[/h1] [b]Does it have story? Is it nice?[/b]
If it has, I haven't played it

[h1]7.[/h1] [b]How many bugs does it have?[/b]
I didn't find any bugs

[h1]8.[/h1] [b]Is the price really worth?[/b]
it's FREE!

[h1]9.[/h1] [b]If there's multiplayer, who will you find?[/b]
I just played with bots

[h1]10.[/h1] [b]Are the controls for everyone?[/b]
Yea, but it's quite hard to play... like in super fast speed

[h1]11.[/h1] [b]Is it fun?[/b]
It is!

[h1]12.[/h1] [b]Conclusion?[/b]
This game is quite nice, I just love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039190932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1593859097}
review:
I am recommending this game because I love playing it and I hope that it will encourage more people to play.
I think it's kinda funny how you can faint in the game. lol
Great maps! Cool weapons! Cool armor!
It kind of gives me HALO and URT nostalgia. (^^)

My PC specs:
Intel Core i7; GeForce GTX 750 ti; 12GB RAM; 2TB SSHD

Graphics: Awesome! Beautiful textures! Great FPS! No screen tearing.

Performance: Runs great! Fast loading times!

Controls: Traditional and/or easy to learn! Customizable.

Cons/suggestions: Dead servers. More people need to play. I wish it had voice chat (Push to talk) in addition to the text chat. Maybe the developers should come out with a game of the year edition to get people back into it.

Overall score: 7/10 [I'd give it an 8 if it had voice chat (Push to talk)]

author: {'steamid': '76561198050044632', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1554060988}
review: There are a lot of things to like here. The graphics hold up, the music is solid and the gunplay is decent, but that doesn't change the fact that the servers are totally dead. Playing with a couple of bots just isn't all that fun. I almost want to buy the full game just to see how chaotic it will be to play with full teams in single player, but why do that when I can just boot up UT 3 and get a more polished experience? Overall, it feels like a clunkier version of UT, which is disappointing. This game had potential, but something clearly went wrong with the marketing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048390739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1435215111}
review: This game is the best example how important PR is for a game, especially for an arena shooter. The game ifself feels great, like the good old school UT, but the player base is close to non-existent. Reason? PR. It's not the game's fault. The reason lies in the lack of commercials for this game. This is really sad, but it is what it is. This game has the potential to be an all-time great shooter. But as long as there is no PR whatsoever it will never be a success as a game, just because many players, who don't know this game will never get in touch with this game.

review:
This feels like Unreal in all the right ways, only down side is the player base. I wish we had more Dev's that care about making an old school arena shooter, Reakktor Studios is one of them and they did a great job here. 

A friend's review put it best: 

"They should have named it catch-22.
Fun game but no one plays it because no one plays it."

author: {'steamid': '76561197961634234', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1671857140}
review:
ok at first i tried this game and it seemed really bland, the default map it comes with isn't really a good example of the game

at first glance it seems like an arena shooter wanna be in the likes of quake 3 clones like reflex arena

tried it recently and it makes more sense now, its a mix of quake 3, unreal tournament, and perhaps nudoom

the damage system and no ammo clips are like quake 3, the machine gun and rocket launcher are here

it has the dodge system from unreal tournament as well as sort of a shockrifle gun

and it has the double jump from doom though not the climbing mechanic

probably best played in a group, one on one could get boring though

haven't tried the vehicles

update 3/13/2019: bought full version for the vehicles and bot match

game is decent, kind of like a halo-lite with the vehicles,  no shield regeneration and the weapons are more hitscan like quake 3 but still worth picking up if you like the gameplay

could use more guns,
