author: {'steamid': '76561198081379609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1546606423}
review:
[h1]''Frag like it's 1999''...[/h1]
Well there are 2 90s-style things in this game...fast paced gameplay and graphics.
Assuming you don't mind the graphics part keep reading...
There is only 2v2 where you play with bots (don't expect to find other players often) and the gameplay is far inferior to all other similar shooters from the 90s (quake, unreal etc) even from some newer ones.
There are many f2p similar shooters atm much better than this one with more content.
You really want money for this?

author: {'steamid': '76561198067374650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1545587853}
review:
I was really excited when first time I saw this game on Steam, added to wishlist to play when I have some time. Well, played for 25 minutes and I won't play it again, so I guess it's enough to write a review.

1- Servers are mostly empty. They have bots to reduce that loneliness a bit, but still, you want to play with other players and interact with them.
2- Maps are big. Way too big for a 2v2 game. There's a pretty high chance of not finding the way back. That's a big negative.
3- Map designs are bad, lighting doesn't help you, even a tiny bit. I guess the gaps between platforms have made just to make it exciting and harder to get from a point to a point, but it's just annoying. It's already 2v2 and maps are already big and complicated enough, there are no logical explanation of doing this. 

Is everything negative? No. If this texture team were working on Quake Champions, I would play it every single day. At this point I'll only play Quake Champions for fun and... TOXIKK? Never, sorry.

ITA: Uno sparatutto arena in stile unreal. Una vera chicca nel mondo free2play. Per√≤ viviamo nell'epoca in cui la gente non capisce una cippa di videogiochi e quindi √® semideserto. Peccato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074597411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1590349771}
review:
First things first - I am a Full Edition owner.
As for the game - it's not that bad... for an indie game shooter. BUT! The title says "Frag like it's 1999" so I treat it the way it deserve.
At first it's a pretty fun game(you have to change some controls though - mouse sensivity, etc) but later you get a feeling, that something wrong. And that is:
-Small maps and scarce amount of them
It's about ten maps for all game and - Really, you can't even play DM and TDM on maps for CTF and DOM, wtf?!
Yes, maps looks good but that's not enough! You didn't write the game engine(as a matter of fact, you didn't use the game engine - you have worked with scripted UDK! It's nice tool, but still, you didn't created all from source code) - all you have to do is make content and for all this years of development it is only ~10 maps?! 
Also, there are not many maps in workshop either AND(!) as far as I understood maps-remakes from UT and other games are being constantly banned here.
-Weird accuracy & weird hitboxes
I played UT99, UT2k3, UT2k4(and UTIII) and I can't remember that ALL weapons have to be that precise. Link/pulse gun don't have to be that precise! Really, I can describe all weapons in TOXIKK as: pistol, semi-auto pistol, sniper rifle, sniper rifle with pulse gun, rocket launcher, shotgun(wtf?!), firethrower(Haaaaaanz!) and redeemer. Literally, you can't deal AOE damage if you don't take launcher.
-no bot commands
In UT series, you could give commands to bots so they attacked/defended choosen target - guess what we have here...
-Greediness
Ok, I didn't bought this game as soon as it came out, 'cause I waited for a nice discount and IF I bought it with LESS than 66% I would be pissed off! There is a huge lack of content and devs don't even trying to attract community to this game. Believe me, FREE version became available after game was slowly being abandoned by players. And devs said that they are working on the new content! That is totally BS!
So, please, if you really wanna buy full edition of this game, at least wait for a -75% discount(minimum), otherwise get Unreal Deal Pack - you'll get more pleassure from this kind of competitive games.
As for this review - I'll gladly change it's status if there will be any changes in the game - because, I believe, it has some kind of potencial and looks promising, but still...

author: {'steamid': '76561198133155125', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1677783857}
review:
This is, hands down, my favorite fps. The movement, the weapons system, [i] the weapons themselves; [/i] everything about this game I love. It has a great skill ceiling, and a degree of customization. 
The only downside, which is a MASSIVE downside, is that it is practically dead. At my tier, almost every game against an actual human that I attempt to join boots me off for the tier imbalance. Outside of this, this is an incredibly fun game. 
If you have doubts, [u] the game is free[/u]. The free version gives you a great tast of what the game is about, and with this recent update, also gives you access to all the maps (only a teensy bit miffed that I paid for that, but it chill).

author: {'steamid': '76561197961731682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1564285386}
review: Do you like Quake or Unreal or Tribes or the multiplayer in Halo?  This is an awesome arena shooter with good mechanics.  The only problem is multiplayer has died off.  No one plays online anymore.  I have only seen a handful of ranked servers and usually they only have a few humans and bots filling in to keep the game going.  It really is a shame.  I think if they had better advertising they would have a thriving player base because the game is really good.  Single player missions and the server browser are only available in the full version.  The free version only has a training mission and auto match making for online play.  I really with there where more players online.  I think an advertising campaign could jump start this back to life.

developer_response:
As the author of this review disabled comments, we want to clarify that there are in fact two single-player modes: A mode called "boot camp" (freely configurable matches against bots) and also a so called "contract mode" (achieve specific goals tied together by a small storyline).

Both modes are available in the full version of the game only.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157710632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1540755055}
review: This is a well designed game that the devs put much time, effort, and heart into. And yet its underrated. People woh dont understand how arena style shooters work and bash it by saying things like "Why do you people create a unplayable game? How do you expect people to play online when for a double jump you need to pres 5 keys?" because they are not good at the game. Its very unfortuante that this game didnt do well and has one of the smallest player bases ive seen. However the bots help to make the matches not empty they only go up to two per team so you spend much time just running around. However I give it a good review because this is game devs should treat a game with care.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087916884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1581743465}
review:
Been playing some matches and I'm actually torn apart between UT Alpha and This.

First off, the Graphics are great. Not too bloomy or shiny to get in the way of the actual game and not too dull either.
I appreciate that it actually has modern graphics and very smooth gameplay.

Movement Mechanics are great, Tutorial explains almost everything just fine. Dodge Jump off walls is something to get used to but easy enough to learn.

Weapon choices are okay, I have no idea what the alternative firemode of the rocket-launcher does. Overall the weapons are not explained but hell, if it shoots, it can kill.
I appreciate that you can set priorities on weapons so you dont have to turn off auto-switch. You can just assign your preferred guns high enough priorities and you're fine. Big plus here!

Slightly different Gun-KeyMapping than other games (Sniper on 5? ok..) but luckily settings are very easy to change.
Mouse Acceleration is activated by default, that was very annoying.

Overall I'm considering buying it. I will give it another few hours of playing and potentially update this review.

Update:
bought it. The benefit of custom matches is great.
I dont mind the seemingly empty player base, the bots are quite challanging if you crank up their skill level and use the big-head mutator.
Also this is an ideal LAN game! I love UT99 but on 4K screen it's a pain to play.
Toxikk is deffo joining me to the next LAN and will be played for hours, just like it's 1999 again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198810402259', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1538173654}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116133365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1649198125}
review:
First of all, I just want to say that I personally enjoy this game quite a bit. The gameplay is crisp and challenging, the art style is decent, and victory is genuinely pleasing.

However, this game lacks one important thing, a player base. It is pretty rare for more than a dozen and a half people to be online at any given time. This means that you are stuck playing against the A.I. Even though the A.I. is ok, it just doesn't give the same vibe to me as I get playing against human players. 

However, I am not saying that you shouldn't try it. In fact, I am saying the opposite. If more people tried it and realized what fun it is, this would fix the only problem I have with the game. It's a great game, and I thank the developers for taking the time to create it. I just wish that there were more people playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964399141', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1537345987}
review:
***Free Edition Review***

This game is frustrating. 

Its frsutrating because it can scratch a very similar itch to UT2004 quake etall... but there is no one to play with and worse...the AI is little more than the digital equivalent of folding up the ping pong table in the garage and calling it a "match."

Problem is....sometimes the table leaps 3 feet to the left.....  the AI has its own quirks that are just disorienting and frustrating to adapt to as they are purely unpredictable and do not reflect actual play responses.  To be clear i have swept every match handily and have a strong grasp on the game (props on the controls, i only had to tweak one mouse setting, the twitch factor is spot on!)  But this flunky AI that has questionable hitboxes, inhuman reactions (dodging snipes while looking the other way 5 times in a row.... you can watch the AI go through these specific algo's)  and other goofy stuff with no player base keeps me from gladly buying this game.  Ive been burned so many times by terrible online play before i can't recommend this product as is.  I hope Reakktor studios can relaunch the core of this game into a new package and re-ignite interest in this genre, or find a way (NOT LAWBREAKERS) to rebirth the twitch shooter, yall clearly understand the thrill of it.


PROS
-the mechanics of a twitch shooter are all here [BIG PLUS]
-graphics are fine, when they don't get in the way
-smooth play overall

Cons
(besides the above)
-some of the lighting can get in your sightlines
-that damned spin animation when you respawn is a visual block and a timewaster, it has NO place in a twitch shooter!!!
-some goofy map design on the edges in a few places

author: {'steamid': '76561197980456557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1537219136}
review: I don't know whether to recommend this game or not. It's fun and fast-paced, very reminiscent of Doom/Quake Arena. However, if you download the free game, every time you exit the game, it launches your default browser and goes to a page that prompts you to buy the full game. Not only is this highly annoying, it is a form of malware. I uninstalled and will not recommend this game to anyone until this behavior is removed.
developer_response: Hi there and thx for your review. There's no "malware" in Toxikk. It simply opens a page, offering you the full version, because that's what we live off. Glad to hear you enjoyed the free version though...

author: {'steamid': '76561198218057457', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1536933488}
review:
After 3 matches with 0 players, I can wholeheartedly say that this game would be great if people actually played. At least the bots are decent, but aren't really a challenge. It could have just been the server I was on, but the only option I found on the main screen was "Quick Play" and no server browser. I did not pay for this game. I played the F2P version. However, the site lists that there are no competitive differences between the two, so it's not like these issues are exclusive to F2P.

Seriously, though, it needs more players to be any good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001344618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1536871003}
review:
This game isn't too bad. It's similar to Quake Champions I guess but it's just a lot easier and more basic.  It doesn't have the depth of movement like Quake does. They are both Free games! Might as well try them both. I personally would rather play Quake. I don't think it's fair to call this a negative review, there is just better Free options available on Steam.

Toxikk feels like a mix between Quake and Halo 3. If that means you'd like it, try it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972413068', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3536, 'last_played': 1644863081}
review:
Game is awesome, particularly for a f2p. This carries on the classic FPS experience, with challenging gameplay and some nifty vehicles to drive/fly.

Only negative I can offer atm is that the game needs a better tutorial section - the basic mvements are familiar to any FPS player, but the wall jumping dynamic need better explanation and practice areas.

Overall though, great game, fun if you need a few rounds of fast paced head to head, or work as a group to squeeze the opfor.

Best still the core game is free to everyone, and while buying it doesn't signifigantly increase the game, it is good to know that the people who gave this to me get a little something back - wish more developers offered this strategy.
developer_response:
Thx for your review. Yea, the tutorial is a bit tough. But overall the game emulates titles from a time where games used to be a bit more about exploring and trying out.

Anyway... thx & have fun! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198248201428', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1535555490}
review:
This game is free, UT4 is free... Why would i bother playing this game if UT4 is free? No reason at all :D because this is actually not a free game, that is just the main menu and 2 training levels... Want multiplayer? Buy the game! Want solo play? Buy the game! Want anything more than a main menu simulator? BUY THE FUCKING GAME :DDDDDDDDDD

Because you can only play with bots! Bots that, no matter what you say, are SHIT.

1. They seem to have [strike]down syndrome[/strike] problems navigating through some parts of the levels, still they are capable of... walking through walls?! Wait, how the fuck did this happen in the first place? Now there is someone fucking playing with me here, this that my eyes see can not be real in any fucking way!
2. They can see invisible players (making invisibility totaly pointless in every single situation unless you buy the game...)
3. They have infinite invisibility! 
4.Suddenly i get 900 ping out of nowhere... in a S I N G L E P L A Y E R  training match... ??????? Hello? I'm the host! All fucking latency i can have should be around 4-5 ms but nope, lets act as if i was joining an ucranian server, right on the other fucking side of the world!!! WEEEE!
5. E V E R Y T H I N G E L S E 

Now, let me go back to unreal tournament and have some actual fun with actual people or if not, at least decent bots... 
You may say "BuT tHis IS oN Ue3!!11!!" And i will tell you, "well fuck off because you can play UT3 or download UDK to play it for free and you will see how bots are way smarter than this game's"

I am sorry but this game with its amazing looks/designs is trying to make money off something others have made BETTER and for FREE. This game could be ok to pay if it was like some sort of expansion for unreal but since i see it is a totally different thing because, i am sorry to say this, but you just copied and fucked up the bots AI of the base game... That or you just dont know how to build up a proper nav_mesh in unreal engine...
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review. You may not have noticed it in your 0.4 hrs of total playtime, but besides the tutorial map and two free maps, all other maps can easily be unlocked in the free edition without paying.

Also, multi-player is (of course) fully available in the free edition and empty slots on servers are filled with bots. So, you'll always be able to play a match, no matter if playing the free or the full game.

Also, thanks for sharing your observations regarding bot behaviour in your less than 30 minutes of total playtime. I'll forward this to the team. HOWEVER, PLEASE REMOVE your comment / comparision to people with "Down Syndrome", as we cannot accept jokes about handicapped people on our forum / reviews.

Thanks for understanding and have a great day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036271110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1535307779}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114563476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1535227828}
review:
It's clear that the developers are huge fans of UT and Quake. 

Movement is just like UT2k4, weapons a bit of a mix of UT (Enforcer, Rocketlauncher, Plasmarifle, Sniper) and Quake (Gauntlet). No ASMD/shock-rifle, thats a big bummer. 

Weapons have right-click firemodes, just like in UT, although they are a bit different. 

It's fun for a fan-project. But it lacks the polish of a tripple A game and the visuals are horrendous. Everything glows way too much. It's very obvious that the developers don't have the experience (especially Art-Department) to make it a competitive and successful Arena Shooter. Servers are dead and the bots i played against were pretty bad.

It's a very passionate and brave project though, therefore, thumbs up.

review:
I knew for sure that I liked this game when I realized that one of the maps is a really slick remake of Deck 16 from UT. 

Seems like it's rare to find an arena shooter nowadays with good bot support, and this one has it. On top of that, it looks great and runs perfectly (at least for me). Plus Workshop intergration.

It doesn't quite hit the heights of UT99 for me, for a bunch of reasons, but it still feels like a great modern equivalent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053374920', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1533872033}
review:
This game is not dead, and never will be.  Ever.

"What are you talking about? There aren't any players online!"

No, there aren't many players.  That's right.  But you know what there *are* many of?  BOTS!  Bots for days!  Glorious, glorious bots!  If you're a super competitive player, maybe that's not good enough for you.  But if you just want the shiny graphics and pew-pews, the bots will provide those things just as well as human players would.  Really need human players that much?  Get the four-pack and rope your friends into it.  Hell, you don't even need to do that.  Play with your family or roommates on LAN - only the host actually needs the full version.

Seriously though, the lack of active players is the *only* flaw I can see in this game.  If you're like me and don't mind fighting bots, rest assured that this game's bot battles are just as good as the multiplayer battles.  Same exact content, just better latency.

Also props to the devs for staying active on the forum and not being discouraged by people saying the game's dead.  You guys made a really good & engaging game and just had a bit of bad luck on the multiplayer side of things.  I hope to see more games from you some time in the future. :)
developer_response:
Nice read and review. Thx!!
Yup, the bots where done with a lot of attention to detail. Thanks for noticing and pointing out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992981587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1558794054}
review:
The description says it all! Toxikk is indeed the spiritual successor to the FPS legends of the late 90s, a tag which their sequels craved for but arguably never deserved. Toxikk comes close to that crown, and had there been a more active communicty of players, I would be eating a few words here!

The gameplay is as you would expect from a fast paced multiplayer shooter. Just pick up a gun, jump and strafe around like your life depends on it, and shoot! There're no lootboxes, no complex levelling up (well there is a level tier system, but not the one which forces you to get your math hats on) and no pay-to-wins. Just pure, adrenaline pumping FPS gameplay, devoid of unnecessary storylines. The graphics are smooth, although respawn transitions could be faster (too much eye candy just messes it up if you respawn at the wrong location, if you know what I mean). The only area where the game could have significantly done better is the sound department. While enemy movement sounds are captured accurately, weapon effects and the background score could use some overhaul.

All said and done, it's FREE! You can unlock maps etc. through the XP you earn in MP matches. Single Player skirmishes require you to pay up, but you're not missing much if you don't want to. Grab this beauty, and keep your fingers crossed for finding other players online - then you're in for a treat! :)

review: I really love this game for its beautiful graphics and simple game play.  Since I have other things to do besides play games all day, I like that the learning curve is not too steep.  Being a newby is not an instant death sentence in this game since it doesn't have a bunch of extra ridiculous features like running up walls and shields and whatnot.  The online community is still growing, but I think that others will discover this amazingly free game and get into it.  Buying the game is really worth it if you want more maps and customizations.  I hope to be shooting at you soon!

review: Movement and gunplay feels pretty good, honestly better than Quake Champions, but the game is utterly and completely dead. I was dropped into a match losing 1 to 8 against a single other player, who left after I went 2 out of 3 with him. Won a match to timeout (took like 5 minutes including an "overtime" which made no sense considering the enemy had no players!), then lost the match to the bot getting the drop on me with a rocket launcher. Seems like it could be fun but I don't see how I could possibly play this when there's nobody to play against.
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review!

If you generally liked the game, but gave it a "Thumbs Down" review because of its playerbase, please allow a quick word from the devs behind TOXIKK:

A) You're reviewing the game, not its playerbase. Note that Steam automatically reduces the visibility of games with many "Thumbs Down" reviews (assuming these games are less worth playing) which results in less people finding (aka playing) TOXIKK.

B) Arena FPS is a niche genre and you'll not find the figures of mainstream shooters in TOXIKK. More info about server activity and the game's playerbase can be found at: https://steamdb.info/app/324810/graphs/

C) During main hours, you should easily find multiple active matches. However, if you want to play during less populatd hours and don't find enough matching challenges, you may want to visit the community's live chat hangout on our Discord server at http://chat.toxikk.com

D) Last but not least, TOXIKK features an extensive single-player/bot mode that allows you to either play missions (contracts) or freely configurable matches in the full version of the game. In the free version, empty slots on the online servers are filled with bots.


So, you can always play a few matches with the full and the free edition of TOXIKK, when you have that Arena FPS itching.


Thanks and have a great day,
REAKKTOR Studios

author: {'steamid': '76561198200718514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1573562649}
review:
Pros: 
Gameplay
Graphics
Sound

Cons:
Inability to use controller on the menus
No Linux support

Overall:
My judgements are based on the free version. Product page was a bit misleading, showing that the only difference between free and paid was maps and acheivements, but the use of single player bots is locked behind a pay wall. 

Either way, as someone who loved the early 2000's shooters (unreal tournament, etc), I find this game is a nice tribute to that era with modern graphics and effects before Call of Duty single-handedly lowered the entire Gaming communities IQs by a large margin.

Would be a nice addition to SteamOS/Linux.
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review.

[quote]Installs extra crap on my PC[/quote]

The setup installs only the game. However, Unreal Engine might install some "missing" run-time components and prerequisites. This is particularly true, if you currently have no other Unreal Engine based games installed.

There are no extra programs, bloatware or other BS installed with Toxikk. Just the game and its prerequisites (if missing).

Thanks and have a great day...

review: Amazing game. Fast-paced gameplay with no BS microtransactions, leveling up, or special class based abilities or stats. Everyone is equal and the only determining factor in winning is pure skill, just like a great FPS should be. The movement system is pretty much identical to Unreal Tournament 2004 which I really like, so if you've played that game before you should know what to expect. The only thing holding this game back is a lack of people playing it. So stop reading reviews and get in this game and start fragging!

review: Ive been looking at this for a while, and when i saw it was free, i instantly downloaded it. its a small file size, with alot packed in. a very fastpaced retro style shooter, and as it says, all players spawn equil, no pre-loaded weapons, apart from a pistol and melee. its skill that determins the winner, not who bought the best gun, or who is the highest rank. This plays like quake online, but with better graphics, guns, and physics. the free version dont came with any disadvantages compared to the full game, but the full game allows character customization (Aesthetics only), and all maps unlocked. many hours of fun, infinate replayability, and it doesnt require a particularly good PC! if you ever enjoyed any shooter, get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082955582', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1528924340}
review:
Tried the f2p version and was not pleased: certain maps are not available, u cannot customize your character (u can choose like yellow glowing which looks exactly like spawn protection).
Movement seems ok at first but compared to quake feels really clunky.

worst of all: the game runs really bad. nuff said.

Edit:I made a mistake regarding locked maps, as they are indeed unlockable with ingame currency, which still seems like a bad idea (make all maps f2p and put customization as an unlockable, release skins etc which buyers have instant access on or something).

I would recommend the game for people who would just want to chill in an arena fps, but those who want more of a challenge should look somewhere else.
developer_response:
[quote]certain maps are not available[/quote]

Hi there and thx for your review. Just correcting a piece of mis-information: ALL (!) maps are available in the Free Edition without paying. Three available right away, others need to be unlocked via MXP.

More info about map unlocks:
http://toxikk.com/map-unlocks

review:
+ Can play offline vs bots
+ Great gameplay/custom match options with lots of mutators
+ Looks gorgeous, I thought it was Unreal 4 at first, but it's actually made in Unreal 3
+ Fast, fluid, arena shooter fps gameplay with nice map variety
+ Only 15 bucks for the full game, but it looks and plays like a AAA-quality fps
+ You can even customize your crosshair's hit marker when your shots hit an enemy
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067902611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1527304255}
review:
Quake-esque PvP with a lot of polish. Back-to-fundamentals FPS mechanics with bonus parkour, play-dead, and invisibility that all let you express skill in more than your aim.
Vehicle-centric maps feel out of place, but otherwise they're well structured and every weapon feels relevant and worth learning.

Sincerely wish more people would play this game. All these empty servers make me cry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079854409', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1696016250}
review:
A really fun oldschool FPS that'll feel familiar to anybody who has experience with the Unreal Tournament franchise - In fact, I consider this an unofficial UT4; I prefer this to the official one. 

It strikes a nice middle ground between UT2k4 and UT3 that makes for a really satisfying experience (that is, once mouse acceleration has been turned off, which is on by default for some reason). Just make sure you have friends to play with you, because the online playerbase for this isn't vast at the moment.

If you're looking for oldschool LAN party games, this and Quake Live are your best options right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420745234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1528163744}
review: it's great game and it's for free

author: {'steamid': '76561198075717436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1577033819}
review:
This is an amazing looking alternative for Unreal Tournament and Quake fans who don't mind having only a maximum of 8 players per map (the first free map was small in size). Sadly, nobody is playing it. Even Counter Strike: Source has more players than this.
It's certainly good to have an online FPS witch such good graphics. That, along with low player capacity, are probably the reasons why so few people are playing it. Not everyone has hardware to support such graphics. They should probably also come out with potato mode graphics, so that more players can play it. I personally don't feel that the graphics requirements are all that high, but then again, it's just me! I'll be happy to play with bots online until I get accustomed to the guns and free maps. If enough players start playing it, I won't regret paying in full for the paid version.
PS: I'd say it's an amazing chance to enjoy a Quake and UT like game for beginners, until pro players overcrowd it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033653037', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1527886755}
review:
I started playing this game before it went the dynamic free to play model route, and honestly I did expect its popularity to surge post that. Though I hoped I would be playing this like I played UT 2004 back in the days on an absolute basic internet connection, it didn't turn out to be that exactly. But for what it is worth, this is a damn fine game, I love the guns and the maps, did I mention the maps? Yes, it might have benefitted from some more chutzpah in terms of the characters but on an average I do end up finding a couple of players on some servers and the bots take care of the rest. 

TLDR - If you're a fan of Quake/Unreal Tournament, this game deserves you, it is worth the money especially if you pick it up on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028732035', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1527981135}
review:
Toxikk is a fun Unreal Tournament clone built to look great on modern hardware. Runs perfectly on a Core i5-6500 with GTX 1060 at 1080p Ultra settings.

Great for quick skirmishes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033234654', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1527544956}
review:
Wish I could give a "neutral" rating, that's how I feel about this game.

I'd describe it as quake but without any of the good movement that made quake fun. The weapons are all laserbeams with 0 recoil which screams "arena shooter", but the movement system is extremely basic and slow like call of duty... So you're left with easy to control guns with easy movement and it just makes the game feel... dull. 

I'm giving it a positive review because the game doesn't do anything "wrong", the devs seem to have accomplished what they set out to create, but this game just doesn't capture me in any meaningful way. I'd much rather just play quake champions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978536655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1672526870}
review:
First impression on this game are great! Fluid and fast movement, meaty weapons and great great graphics. Easy to learn but hard to master. I also like the tutorial, explains the basics pretty well you can practice all the movement tricks. Just don't let it missguide you, the so called Pro-Route is definitly not only ment for "Pros". You should definitly try to complete it that way, because it shows some really important movement tricks, which allow to blitz around the map like crazy. Should you buy this game, you also get a singleplayer option with bots.

It puts a nice twist on the old Unreal Tournament modes, so they feel fresh and more modern, in a good way. I never really liked Unreal Tournament, it never really felt right for me, so i never got into the whole thing. This game alltough does it for me. Finding other players is no problem sometimes, sometimes you are happy to find two. So i guess the playerbase is somewhat small, but still active.

This game is absolutly free, by which i mean, you can access pretty much everything except for singleplayer botmatches and skin-customization, besides that buyers have not a single advantage over non-buyers. So if i keep having fun i will definetly buy this, because i think this game has competent bots, and lets face it: in future (and i hope this a far away future) this game's playerbase will die out (well any playerbase of any game does at some point).

I really hope this game stays on top, because i think its a well crafted one, and i'm having a blast with it :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197982780565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1529477172}
review:
It's unfortunate because this game has potential. I'm happy i did not pay for this game since there are so few people who play it. I always end up with bots. Haven't encountered a player yet. If i have to force myself to join a community just to play with actual players, then its not worth it.

edit:
12 juin 2018 - I had given this game a thumbs down. I have changed my mind and bought the game regardless of playerbase. the game is simply fun online or not. I recoomend to any 90s fps arena fans out there. there aren't many like this these days, honestly.
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review!

If you generally liked the game, but gave it a "Thumbs Down" review because of its playerbase, please allow a quick word from the devs behind TOXIKK:

A) You're reviewing the game, not its playerbase. Note that Steam automatically reduces the visibility of games with many "Thumbs Down" reviews (assuming these games are less worth playing) which results in less people finding (aka playing) TOXIKK.

B) Arena FPS is a niche genre and you'll not find the figures of mainstream shooters in TOXIKK. More info about server activity and the game's playerbase can be found at: https://steamdb.info/app/324810/graphs/

C) During main hours, you should easily find multiple active matches. However, if you want to play during less populatd hours and don't find enough matching challenges, you may want to visit the community's live chat hangout on our Discord server at http://chat.toxikk.com

D) Last but not least, TOXIKK features an extensive single-player/bot mode that allows you to either play missions (contracts) or freely configurable matches in the full version of the game. In the free version, empty slots on the online servers are filled with bots.


So, you can always play a few matches with the full and the free edition of TOXIKK, when you have that Arena FPS itching.


Thanks and have a great day,
REAKKTOR Studios

author: {'steamid': '76561198000693808', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1526751233}
review:
As an 80's kid who played a lot of these kinds of games back when they came out, I actually dig a good amount of what TOXIKK is attempting to do here and it has an old-fashioned first-person-shooter feel to it. So the gameplay is solid if that's all you're after.

TOXIKK's biggest issue is the lack of much that sets it apart from feeling generic. Characters all look the same with small differences in armour structure or colour, and there are no female models to be seen (I looked). So what this ends up feeling like is a bunch of robots mindlessly killing one another, rather than unique characters with their own personalities (which was one of the biggest positives of playing Quake III or Unreal Tournament back in 1999).

author: {'steamid': '76561198829386163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1559465900}
review:
[b] *WARNING: LONGISH AND MEANDERING AND PHILOSOPHICAL BUT HOPEFULLY INTERESTING AND INSTRUCTIVE REVIEW!*[/b]

So, yeah. There‚Äôs probably a long and polysyllabic German word that describes the surpassing satisfaction of getting something you didn‚Äôt realize you wanted. This hypothetical word describes the feeling I got after playing just two hours of Toxikk. 

I know ‚Äî a mere two hours? Who am I to render an opinion? Nobody, probably. I‚Äôm likely a freakishly atypical gamer by Steam standards ‚Äî and yet, I suspect on some dim level, I‚Äôm not as much of an outlier as I think, which is kind of what prompted me to write this review that‚Äôs less a review than a messy Rorschach of thoughts.

But here‚Äôs the kernel I want to get at before I forget: When I was perusing the Steam reviews before making a purchase, I took note of one constant refrain across reviews: "Great game, but no player base! No player base! No player base! No player base! No player base and this game is dead, doomed, terminal!" (*Reviewer collapses dramatically onto Victorian fainting couch*)

I only took notice of this complaint because of the frequency of it. I didn‚Äôt care about whether there was, is, or could be a strong player base. I just wanted to find out whether Toxikk has [b]1) decent bots for offline matches and 2) an at least nominally imaginative single-player experience.[/b] I was happy to discover that Toxikk has both. 

I‚Äôm all about the bots. (Well, mostly about the bots.) See, I‚Äôm an avid and casual but COMPLETELY AWFUL first-person shooter and arena FPS aficionado. I play for the sort of grabby, enthralling, meditative experience of them, for their dubious therapeutic escapism and (so I tell myself) to keep my reflexes, fine motor skills and spatial memory in shape. (I‚Äôm 46, obsessed with cognitive health, different story.) Sure, I savor the thrill of competition, but I have no illusions about a second-act career as some demigodlike esports streamer. 

I‚Äôm not, like, philosophically opposed to multiplayer online FPS games or anything ‚Äî I‚Äôve had great fun leaping into some multiplayer Toxikk matches and even managed not to completely embarrass myself ‚Äî but generally the players are so outrageously (and admirably! respect!) good that Smearing the Noob gets old for everybody pretty fast. (Note on player base complaint: For what it‚Äôs worth, I was playing last night at, like, 1:30 a.m., Vegas time, and found a server with a handful of humans. So, it‚Äôs not like a *complete* ghost town.) 

Now, I don‚Äôt profess to know the first thing about the market for PC games, let alone FPS games, let alone FPS arena games, let alone FPS arena games with bots, but I have a sneaking suspicion I‚Äôm not the only one who generally favors offline bot matches.

Anyway! I play the hell out of some UT2004 botmatches a couple times a week, but was intrigued by Toxikk after I recently got a new gaming rig that was manufactured, like, this century. (I‚Äôm intrigued by Quake Champions, too, which I‚Äôll pull the trigger on for sure if/when bots are added ‚Äî Quake players be scary!) I dropped the 15 bucks straight out and dove right in.

I won‚Äôt rehash what other reviewers have expressed more vividly, but, yeah: The graphics are posh, the maps beautiful and well-designed, the weapons simple but satisfyingly visceral, the speed and move-style fluid and frantic, and the overall design aesthetic slick and mature. On a more abstract level, Toxikk's total game experience suggests the developers have a real enthusiasm for the genre and a care for the craft. Again, I‚Äôve only played two hours, so, yeah, huge grain of salt, but I guess I feel confident in opining because the game feels like an organic continuation of a Quake 3 or UT2004.

And most importantly for me, the bots are convincingly challenging (I play them on ‚Äúaverage‚Äù ‚Äî go ahead, laugh) and they sport some basic customizability. (Wish list: sub-sliders for individual bots that could control aggressiveness, general playstyle, accuracy, specific weapon proficiencies and preferences, etc. Hey, I can dream!)

So, inasmuch as an idiosyncratic casual gamer who‚Äôs only played this game for like a couple hours but found himself so engrossed that he‚Äôs writing this review at work and is itching to play again soon carries even a modicum of credibility in this slice of subculture, I definitely recommend this game.

As for the chorus that Toxikk‚Äôs chronically shaky player base makes it ‚Äúdead,‚Äù that may or may not be true, but it‚Äôs moot to me. The fact that, in addition to the game‚Äôs other virtues, there‚Äôs a solid single-player experience with bots says to me that this game is self-contained, complete, and has high replayability.
developer_response: Thanks for an awesome read, xlurkrx!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068982092', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1526570300}
review:
This is a pretty damn good shooter.

Sadly it has a pretty low player count. But you can play it for free and it will put you against bot if there is nobody so it's absolutely playable.

I don't really expect this game to make a come back but if you are looking for a modern Unreal Tournament-like to play a couple rounds with your friends, this is perfect!
You can't host with the free version but you just have to all join the same server. (Have the player with the least Xp find a game first to be sure everybody can play the map and then all join him.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064872447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1526339655}
review:
THIS GAMES IS THE T I T S

Growing up in the early 2000s, Halo: Combat Evolved is seared into my memory as one of the very first FPS games I experienced. This game is that on cocaine and creatine. The movement is incredibly slick and smooth, mouse sensitivity will feel ridiculous at first if you're used to modern military shooters. However, within five minutes you're slicing and dicing in fantastically well-designed maps with well-balanced weapons and adrenaline pumping through your veins. The music is muscular and energetic but not over the top and everything in this game just oozes "90s bada$$" but with all the technological advantages of today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105059120', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 2316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2117, 'last_played': 1539477573}
review:
Back in the day when UT99 came out I played it a lot. Mostly offline with bots and I was always downloading the latest fanmade addons. When UT2003 came out I played it for a bit but had to put it away because I was spending too much time playing it and my pc wasn't fast enough. I played UT2003 again when I bought a new pc in 2010 but only for a bit.

I hadn't played any FPS game since, but last month when I saw UT3 was on a massive discount I bought it. That gave me a taste for more and Steam was suggesting TOXIKK. I put a GTX1060 6G in my 2010 system to enjoy UT3 more and decided to give TOXIKK a try.

The first time playing the free edition of TOXIKK be aware the game will let you know what's off limit to free edition players which can be a bit overwhelming at first.  I'm easily annoyed so I bought it shortly after testing the free edition :)

The game is similar to the UT games but with enough new features to be more than a MOD. It's worth the money to me. If you like (arena) fps games you should give it a try.

There are not many maps but the ones they made are absolutely stunning and can be used for different game modes. I would have liked to see more but it's a trade off. Less maps to learn for the casual player though :)

The campaign could have been made longer, it starts easy and gets a bit harder towards the last levels. The final level is a duel in a remake of a classic map. I don't like the layout but it gets better after practise. That one is all about timing your double jumps.

Since people can try the game for free there are regularly people online playing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303439090', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1524293389}
review:
Absolutely action packed, fast paced, classic multiplayer fun.
Unfortunately, also dead as a doornail. I can find 2 people at the most to play with and it's usually the same 3 guys.
After learning about Halo Online I never launched this game again, sad, but true. Sorry guys.
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review!

If you generally liked the game, but gave it a "Thumbs Down" review because of its playerbase, please allow a quick word from the devs behind TOXIKK:

A) You're reviewing the game, not its playerbase. Note that Steam automatically reduces the visibility of games with many "Thumbs Down" reviews (assuming these games are less worth playing) which results in less people finding (aka playing) TOXIKK.

B) Arena FPS is a niche genre and you'll not find the figures of mainstream shooters in TOXIKK. More info about server activity and the game's playerbase can be found at: https://steamdb.info/app/324810/graphs/

C) During main hours, you should easily find multiple active matches. However, if you want to play during less populatd hours and don't find enough matching challenges, you may want to visit the community's live chat hangout on our Discord server at http://chat.toxikk.com

D) Last but not least, TOXIKK features an extensive single-player/bot mode that allows you to either play missions (contracts) or freely configurable matches in the full version of the game. In the free version, empty slots on the online servers are filled with bots.


So, you can always play a few matches with the full and the free edition of TOXIKK, when you have that Arena FPS itching.


Thanks and have a great day,
REAKKTOR Studios

author: {'steamid': '76561198135308209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1682526124}
review:
A true homage to 90s Arena gameplay style, it succeeds in making you feel the same exact emotions.
Fast, brutal yet balanced (with exception of the classic big f*in weapon) and the best part is no need to buy it to enjoy the experience. BUT! I'd highly recommend you to buy the full status, not only for the customization features, but for the whole "Campaign" mode it offers.

I hope other developers copy this business model, in a world full of lame microtransaction arena-like games, this one asks you to pay only once!

The other thing I loved about the devs business model is that all the maps are unlockable for free players anyways.

This game is amazing! It really deserves to be more known.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120562345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1673, 'last_played': 1524457815}
review:
I have the paid version 


An extremely fast paced and fluid arena shooter. It is very responsive, and on top of that, the graphics are phenomenal for a game like this. If you played unreal tournament 3, then that is probably the closest comparison to this game. It plays similarly both in movement and level size. This truly does feel like a new unreal, but not so much that they strayed too far from the original formula. 

The playerbase is low, but you can always find a match, and if that‚Äôs not enough, there are bots which will help you immensely if you are rusty or if you haven‚Äôt played a game like this before. The learning curve is steep if you are used to cod or battlefield. 

There is no camping. Campers get wrecked hard, because if you stand still, you die. You have to constantly stay moving and always be prepared to run into somebody around a corner or get shot from behind. 

Dying is the best learning tool in the game. As is for all arena shooters. You die because the other player is better than you, and it‚Äôs up to you to figure out what you could have done better. 

Learning how to jump around the maps in a fast and fluid manner is difficult at first, but you will adapt overtime. Learn the maps and their power ups, weapon placements, choke points and dead zones are, because you always need to know where to go if you are outgunned. Somebody took the sniper rifle? Well that‚Äôs fine because I know where the rocket launcher spawns, and there is armor on the way, etc. 

Game modes are diverse enough, but nothing original. Deathmatch, TDM, CTF and 1v1. Your best bet is hopping in a straight up deathmatch and work on that aim and map knowledge.

For paid versions, you have access to offline bots and a nice contract list mode. The only real advantage in this is that you can practice against bots all day long with different mutators and workshop maps. 

In closing, the game is a blast and scratched that itch of a no nonsense shooter that requires skill over RNG. I really wish the playerbase would expand, but being that this is an old school shooter with a brutal learning curve, younger players and new players just don‚Äôt want to take the time to learn and get better because they can just go play a game with progression and upgrades, etc. That isn‚Äôt a bad thing, because this kind of game doesn‚Äôt hold your hand lol. It doesn‚Äôt care if you die 20 times in a row. Get good.

review:
I tried to play this game with friends. Joining them needs to go through the Steam friends list, which only showed one of the three (who were in the same lobby) as even possible to join. Then when I tried to join them, the game said there was no space for me to join... Despite there being four bots in their game. Right.

This may look good, but if you're really looking for a free arena shooter I'm gonna go ahead and recommend Unreal Tournament 4 instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141369171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1638426553}
review:
10/10 

Show this game to everyone you know, we need more players. This game is seriously a ton of fun.

F2P vs P2W Concerns: Paid users have ZERO advantage over free users. I was able to immediately jump in and start raising hell.

> Graphics: Downright beautiful.
> Gameplay: Satisfying. Plus fast parkour dodges make you feel like you're in the matrix.
> Controls: Simple and intuitive. It all works so well.
> Options: Just customize fucking everything.

Bonus Points: Customize individual weapon crosshairs. I now have a purple/blue heart cross hair for my chainsaw <3

Bonus Bonus Points: There's cars, hoverbikes, and mech suits for literally no fucking reason, and it's glorious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122479190', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1552117027}
review:
Holy crap what a good game.  Simple mechanics, no RNG, just an old school shooter with fun mechanics.  Can see myself putting many many many hours into this game, even if its with bots.

The sound track is phenomenal.

I really really respect the devs for following an old school formula, you don't see that that much these days. :)  Had a blast playing one match.  I generally hate shooters(my steam library is mostly racing games and sandbox games) but this one scratchs an itch that I havn't been able to in a while.  For you new children who didn't grow up in the 90's, this game is basically like a more mature Ratchet and Clank 3 online.

-Edit- Just bought it, cause why not.  I can see myself getting lost in this game, just so much fun.  

Devs, please please don't abandon this game, it has so much potential!!!  One day it should gain traction. :)

Gonna totally buy the full version once I have over 20 hours into the game just to support the devs, will update my review once I do.  Thank you very much!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994802538', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1523094309}
review:
I have no idea why but this game runs like shit on my machine. And that while I have a modern PC with an i5-6500K and GTX 1070. Any other game runs fine and often on the highest settings. Even when I set all settings in this game all the way to low it still runs with maybe 20-30 fps. No processes running in the background, no other load on my system.

It was fun for a match, but the performance didn't want to make me play another. Too many shots missed simply because it didn't ran smoothly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201743947', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1536939760}
review:
Cool idea, it really feels a lot like quake, the graphics are good, gameplay is also great, unfortunately there's really nothing forcing you to play this, like events, skins, or something like this. Yeah, sure, I Know there's skill class and kd rank and everything but it's not something you actually try to improve. After some. Hours of playing this game really just gets boring. On the other side it's free2play (you can buy the character adjustment thing for 15$ I think), it's basically a remastered quake with some more gamemodes, it doesn't need a whole lot of space,..
I recommend you to try the game

author: {'steamid': '76561197997840460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1522664501}
review:
This is a review for the free version of the game, as such it will not take any features of the full game into effect.

The Good:
-UI Customization is very in-depth.
-Game hits the mark it intends to aim at, it does feel like a 1999's shooter (Unreal for example)

The Bad:
-Players blend with the background, the opposite of what is needed in a fast paced shooter environment.
-Changing resolution freezes the game for me, forcing me to restart the computer as the game blocks my ability to use any other feature on the computer after freezing.
-The lack of a server browser in free edition forces you to press "Reject" on average 4 times to find a server with any players. The player count on said server is often 1, and has over 200 ping.
-No place to adjust settings like sensitivity and test them other than in a live match. A shooting range would help.
-Game constantly asks to be purchased while attempting to move through main menu, as well as placing a mocking "FREEBIE" tag over the player for all to see.

Because of the mentioned "The Bad", it is quite obvious why only 20 minutes was required to consider this review.
If this "Free Edition" would like to be "more than a demo", developers should consider their free players as equal, instead of cutting off necessary features to properly enjoy the game. Server Browser at the very least would fix major playability issues. The lack of this is just shooting the game's potential for population in the foot, it in no way sends a good message to lock away this feature behind a paywall in a "Free" game. It feels more like....a demo.

This was an objective and unbiased review of my experience, as such I do not require any passive aggressive reply from the developer. The review will not change, neither will my decision not to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046714846', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1522359347}
review:
I'd honestly recommend this game if the community wasn't dead. There's almost no one playing this game anymore which is sad to me. I love the way it played.

Shame. Game had so much potential.
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review!

If you generally liked the game, but gave it a "Thumbs Down" review because of its playerbase, please allow a quick word from the devs behind TOXIKK:

A) You're reviewing the game, not its playerbase. Note that Steam automatically reduces the visibility of games with many "Thumbs Down" reviews (assuming these games are less worth playing) which results in less people finding (aka playing) TOXIKK.

B) Arena FPS is a niche genre and you'll not find the figures of mainstream shooters in TOXIKK. More info about server activity and the game's playerbase can be found at: https://steamdb.info/app/324810/graphs/

C) During main hours, you should easily find multiple active matches. However, if you want to play during the less populatd hours, you can try our live Discord community chat at http://chat.toxikk.com

D) Last but not least, TOXIKK features an extensive single-player/bot mode that allows you to either play missions (contracts) or freely configurable matches in the full version of the game. In the free version, empty slots on the online servers are filled with bots.


So, you'll ALWAYS be able to play a few matches with the full and the free edition of TOXIKK, when you have that Arena FPS itching. ^^


Thanks and have a great day,
REAKKTOR Studios

author: {'steamid': '76561198063296642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1522415122}
review:
How to make the F2P version more true to the "shareware" roots:
1. Remove all the unavailable Tutorial missions completely. No "locked" teasing.
2. Gray out "Play Solo" and "Customize" with no reactions when clicked. (AKA, no "Sorry, this feature is not available in the trial version blah blah blah" popup)
3. Don't show the customization progression postmatch AT ALL.

If you want to advertise the paid version without being dicks about it:
Add an option to view a "Full Version Trailer" or something similar.
That's properly early 2000s.
UT2004 Demo was the primary goal-setter for this idea, along with Halo: Combat Evolved's Trial version.

Until the following is fixed, I don't recommend it, even for free.
I'll still play it, but those need to be fixed for the proper pre-2000s experience the devs claim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067557091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1521565921}
review:
Fragfest like I remember it. I like it.

WHY IS MOUSE ACCELERATION ON BY DEFAULT??!! 

Good now that's out of the way...

The good: The guns and map designs are reminicent of Quake. I never played Quake seriously, but am a huge fan of Unreal Tournament.
This checks all the boxes imho and I'd easily consider it a spiritual successor to Unreal Tournament 2004 and Unreal Tournament 3. (New Unreal Tournament (4) is kinda hit and miss. Mostly miss >< )
I love the Dragoneer's secondary fire. Blasts a wave of fire that murders everything in it's path.
I won my first Deathmatch equivalent game type. xD
Base game is free now. :D

The bad: Wonky framerates on my machine and I had to opt for high instead of ultra.
Again mouse acceleration was on by default which means the first 5 - 10 mins of playing I couldn't hit for shit...
Rocket Launcher only loads one rocket. No grenade mode. (See Unreal Tournament for reference)
Other guns in the game I've shot with are pretty meh.

Pretty decent arena shooter where network lag at 200 - 300ms doesn't affect gameplay too badly. Give it a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198375621910', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1540946816}
review: This has got to be one of my favorite games of all time. I've always wanted a shooter that was fast-paced, action-packed, and fun overall. It didn't take long for me to get the hang of this game. In fact, it seemed pretty easy. I got three killstreaks in a FFA round and won easily. But I met some challenges, players that constantly used rocket launchers, getting swarmed, you name it. I guess I'm good because I got what I wanted, and think this game is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041830254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2437, 'last_played': 1542516106}
review:
TOXIKK, as you probably know from reading the description and other reviews, is a revival of classic AFPS games. It does so very well, with a free version that definitely hooked me the first time I played. I first started playing back when TOXIKK first came out of Early Access, and I wish I'd known about it sooner because it's [i]that[/i] good. In fact, after only a couple of weeks of playing most every day I kind of felt bad for just playing the free version, so I bought the full game (at full price or near-to, I seem to recall) to support the devs. If you want to give them even more support, buy it on the [url=http://toxikk.com/editions/]official website[/url]. If you're totally new to the genre, as I was, don't worry too much about getting steamrolled by the veterans (at least, not yet). There's a skill class ranking system from 1-12 that should make sure you're relatively evenly matched most of the time. There are certain servers that accept all skill classes, so if you want to test yourself, turn SC Matchmaking off. All in all, a great game worthy of your time.

Pro(ish) tip of the day: Never stop moving. Ever. Use jumping, double jumping, and dodging to your advantage, and you might survive a few minutes. 

Now to address that rather large elephant in the room: "But McTaffer," I hear you say, "there's no one playing and the servers are empty!" You might get that impression if you boot it up once and come to a hasty conclusion, but in reality there is a dedicated community that plays pretty regularly. You can organize a game pretty easily on the official Discord, and the community is generally very friendly. Most evenings there are people playing, particularly Fridays. If you want the chaos you think of when you think of AFPS, join F3 (Frag Fest Fridays)- it usually starts around 4-6pm in both US and EU times, and the servers become really full really fast. Even a free player without the server browser should have no trouble finding a match. Seriously, come play on Fridays. Bring your friends. You won't regret it.

tl;dr: This is one of the best AFPS revivals you can get your hands on, with most of the full game in the free demo. There's a learning curve, to be sure, but there's nothing quite like remembering the days when you were struggling to survive more than half a minute as you go on a Godlike killstreak. Play on Friday nights if you want instant chaos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995098207', 'num_games_owned': 2168, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1520896903}
review: Dead game. Joined a game with 2 players and then after one round could not find another game with any players. Played at peak hours too.
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review!

If you generally liked the game, but gave it a "Thumbs Down" review because of its playerbase, please allow a quick word from the devs behind TOXIKK:

A) You're reviewing the game, not its playerbase. Note that Steam automatically reduces the visibility of games with many "Thumbs Down" reviews (assuming these games are less worth playing) which results in less people finding (aka playing) TOXIKK.

B) Arena FPS is a niche genre and you'll not find the figures of mainstream shooters in TOXIKK. More info about server activity and the game's playerbase can be found at: https://steamdb.info/app/324810/graphs/

C) During main hours, you should easily find multiple active matches. However, if you want to play during less populatd hours and don't find enough matching challenges, you may want to visit the community's live chat hangout on our Discord server at http://chat.toxikk.com

D) Last but not least, TOXIKK features an extensive single-player/bot mode that allows you to either play missions (contracts) or freely configurable matches in the full version of the game. In the free version, empty slots on the online servers are filled with bots.


So, you'll ALWAYS be able to play a few matches with both, the full and the free edition of TOXIKK, when you have that Arena FPS itching. ^^


Thanks and have a great day,
REAKKTOR Studios

C'est du n'importe quoi! J'ai r√©ussi √† me retrouver en face d'un ennemi on a vid√© nos chargeur tout le 2 sans se toucher... heureusement un pote de ma team est arriv√© et l'a d√©zingu√©..

Un fusil sniper qui sert √† rien tellement vous n'avez pas le temps de viser, un gun de base aussi puissant qu'un gun √† billes oblig√©s de tir√© 1 chargeur et demi pour esp√©rer d√©zinguer votre cible qui lui vous tue en 2s. Un fusil √† pompe sous prozac, un lance roquette tellement lent qu'il est facile d'esquiver les projectiles... etc. Et la pr√©cision...  La seule de potable: le lance flamme!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027701181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1594686909}
review:
The slogan "Frag like it's 1999!" pretty much explains everything right about this game.

Best part about it is its simplicity. It does not have hundreds of achievements/challenges, perks that affect the gameplay, unlockable weapons or weapon attachments and such. Nope. It's simple. 

You can customize how you look but it does not change the way the game is played. That's what Quake 3 did in 1999. Even if you have to unlock the customizations, you do not purchase them by spending MXP (experience points), once you reach a certain MXP, they're unlocked. 

Only money you'll ever spend for this game is when you purchase it. (And even that's only if you buy the full version)

I can't get enough of fast paced, action packed FPS games that you're constantly on the move. That's why it's a perfect game for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989952449', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1608668997}
review:
Yes. Crazy, hectic fun. This harks back to the days of fast, simple shooters, where movement is as important as good aim. There's no bullet spread, so it's down to your raw skill and ability to snap-shot, know what weapon to use when, and understand the benefits of movement.

It also has two nice addition, with the ability to "play dead" which can get you out of a tight space, and go invisible, for a second or two, which can be enough to confuse the enemy on your whereabouts. Used effectively, both of these can give you an advantage in a fight.

It brings back the classic gamemodes like deathmatch, capture the flag, and king of the hill. It doesn't take that long to learn how to play, you're mostly learning the weapons, though there is a definitely advantage to knowing the maps (though not enough to make a huge difference). 

Each weapon has an alt fire mode of some form, changing how many are used completely. The shotgun doubles its pump time but also doubles its number of pellets, the assault rifle launches a grenade, the plasma rifle fires a laser beam. 

Honestly, amazing game. The only downside is it would benefit from more players. But, given that it's free, you might as well download and play.

review: This game is really good-looking and very much like Unreal Tournament. In UT2004 there were so many different characters to choose from. UT3 had fewer, but still some variety. But this game feels like it's just a bunch of dudes in metal football uniforms running around. Still, it is a lot of fun and has good AI (if playing solo), cool-looking maps, and a variety of game modes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223565608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 2312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1535951671}
review:
Frag like fucking Call of Duty, Battlefield or Counter Strike never happend

Frag like it's 1999

Es gab eine Zeit um die Jahrtausendwende, als FPS-Arena-Shooter noch keinen Anspruch hatten, realistisch Zu sein. 
Eine Zeit vor den Military Shootern. 

Eine Zeit, als die Waffenauswahl und die Bewegungsfreiheit nicht in ein enges Realit√§tskorsett gesteckt wurden: So lie√üen sich die Gegner mit den abgefahrendsten Alien-Knarren in die ewigen Jagdgr√ºnde bef√∂rdern und man konnte dank Sprungpunkten mit abnormalen Spr√ºngen der Schwerkraft trotzen. 

Es war die Goldene Zeit der FPS-Shooter. die Zeit von Quake III - Arena und Unreal Tournament. Mitlerweile gibt es kaum noch Spiele, welche dieses Spielgef√ºhl noch gut vermitteln: Lange hatte ich noch viel Spass mit Quake Live, sozusagen der Steam Version von Quake III - Arena. Dank Workshop Anbindung und einer tollen Community war der kostenlose Nachschub neuen Karten hier stets gesichert - nicht so wie bei Call of Duty, wo man gef√ºhlt f√ºr jede einzelne Karte blechen Muss.
Leider sind auch die Quake Live Server mittlerweile down. Auf der Suche nach Ersatz bin ich nun in meiner Steam-Bibliothek auf Toxikk gestossen. Ich hatte das Spiel, welches sich als moderner Unreal Tournament Klon versteht, vor mehreren Jahren im Early Acces gekauft. Damals existierten zwar schon ein paar Karten, aber es war weit davon entfernt, fertig zu sein. Und die Server waren auch selten voll. Mittlerweile scheint daraus nun aber ein w√ºrdiger Quake/Unreal Tournament-Nachfolger im Geiste geworden zu sein. FPS-Gameplay war lange nicht mehr so so spassig, und dank Unreal Engine sieht es nicht nur prachtvoll aus - so gut wie kaum ein anderes Spiel in dem Genre - sondern spielt sich auch fast wie das echte Unreal Tournament. Dazu sind Die Server auch gut besucht und dank Workshop-Anbindung ist nun auch einiges an Kartenmaterial vorhanden.
F√ºr alle FPS-Fans empfehlenswert, die Quake und Unreal Tournament schon immer Call of Duty und Co gegen√ºber vorzogen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198278449624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1682614762}
review:
A good game with AFPS features.  Good graphics (Unreal Engine), has decent framerate (100-120 for me) with mid level graphics card (GTX 650 Ti Boost / i3 4150). But AI Bots act weird in most maps, they get parked near Armor Shield one way or the other.  Weapons are too shiny in most of the lighting scenarios, thats a bit distracting.  HUD is very distracting, hope they bring in some other options for HUD.

All in all better than most of AAA games around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186638343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1518813396}
review:
This game, Its AMAZING! There is no reason this shouldnt be the most played game on steam. Its everything that anyone could ask out of a shooter. 

Pros:
-The graphics are pretty freaking good for an arena shooter. There are other games that are more popular but have far crappier graphics.
-It works with crossfire....wtf, Ive come to expect that im going to have to disable it on 99.999% of games to keep them from crashing but nope, it works here... how about that.
-No framerate dips of any kind in large shootouts
-Its balanced and very effectively so. No guns are op in any way and every frag that you get you earned. The games guns are balanced even down to the weakest gun the pistol, its still very effective.
-The points earning system isnt super broken like in other games, it actually works quite well.
-The player base is still there. Some games like this that are hidden gems are incredible games that are lacking a player base. This game still has one although you will notice that your playing with the same people every so often.
-Its a PRO that i cant think of any CONS
-This game deserves your $7 now give it up.
-BUY IT!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025658869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1517904309}
review:
Free flowing and clearly well made and designed.
It does have a UT feel to it, far too much to be a conincidence it's definately a bit of a copy, but that isn't a negative. UT is a fantastic game and should be praised.

It's not too much of a copy to become pointless to play and I love the "no microtransactions crap" message that get's displayed.

I haven't bought the game yet, but that's personally because I'm busy and have many other games I own.

That said, I will be buying the full version at some point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108235797', 'num_games_owned': 4082, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1683514133}
review:
"Frag like it's 1999"
It's true but not entirely.

The game is good, the movements are good, the weapons are good (even though I still prefer those from the Unreal Tournament and Quake games).
The maps are not as better but they're good.

The problem is the lack of maps, it is way too lacking to be worth it, at least the game is cheap so that's a plus but It would be cool if they could add more official maps, otherwise, it isn't really worth it considering that Quake III and Unreal Tournament games have more maps and more community made maps.

Other than the lack of maps, it's a good game, it's totally worth it but I still prefer Unreal Tournament and Quake to this, but it's a good game anyway, you'll like it if you like fast paced arena games and games that requires actual skills unlke Call of Duty and Battlefield, plus this game has bots which is also a plus to me.

I hope that they'll bring more maps but I doubt it considering its release date.

8.2/10 - The mechanics are great but content-wise it's lacking, online mode has not too many players but it has bots so that's it, I guess it's better that than having lot of brainless Call of Duty players isn't?

author: {'steamid': '76561198067750813', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1517861344}
review:
Look... huge tf2 and quake fan speaking... 3000 hours on tf just 100 on quake.. but this 100 percent doesnt give me a feeling of either nostalgia or the "base original raw fps" feel...
movement is.. crap.. couldve been something the way tf2 or cs strafes work..
now... you jump with space... and shift AND control.. what??
okay admittedly shift lets u dash a little bit..
but BACK to the point..
movement is crap
and weapons?? its as if u had ALL of the overwatch + tf2 + quake weps and combined them ALL into like 9? bcs every weapon has this "alternative fire mod"...

closedown..
if u arent this 12 year old beta-fag then ull end up with a 5 k/d in ur first match of 4 people..
weapon balancing is not really their thing..
but i guess u can have some 50 hours of fun with this... WITH dedication.. after that ull never touch it again
