author: {'steamid': '76561198043871661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1517781486}
review:
This game is absoltely amazing: gunplay, movement, balance, optimization, even AI - everything's done right. Why so few people are online? Bad management and zero publicity I guess.
Also, locking server browser from a f2p players is deterring many (99,99% of time matchmaking finds bot games). Plus after you reach a certain skill score (SC) you won't be able to join most games from steam server browser due to "skill mismatch".

What a dying gem of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967271190', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1517176137}
review:
Pros:
Fast Gameplay: Reminds me of the good ol‚Äô days
Online Games: AFPS are niche genre so set your expectations appropriately. You‚Äôre not going to see a playerbase equivalent to COD, PUBG etc. Overall, it‚Äôs pretty easy to find other people to play with if your rank is under 11. Higher ranked games are a little bit more difficult.
Maps: ~ 12 official + Workshop. The smaller maps feel very much like Quake where the larger Cell Capture maps have close similarities to Halo
Bot Support: up to 16 in a game
Well Optimized: Over 100 FPS with all graphics settings on max @ 3440 x 1440
Native 21:9 Support
AMD Crossfire Support
Price: Free to $15

Cons:
Double Jump needs fixing

author: {'steamid': '76561198071702749', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1555470554}
review: Toxikk is a decent game sadly decent won't get you much these days it's either be great or go home. To understand what i mean by that the core gameplay of Toxikk is the same as any other arena shooter run around and hopefully kill opponent before they kill you.The game's core experience which is the multiplayer free although don't expect to do much with the singleplayer option for this game with the free version but it's a good way to test if you want this game. Now onto the player base which from what i saw in the chat function of this game there is one if the multiple usernames i was any indication however i can't truly say anything since for some reason whenever i try to play online it says steam services unavailable. Other than that the game is a nice trek back to when arena shooters were dominant and everyone wanted one but in today's gaming market most don't want to play games like this but i would still reccomend this game for anyone wanting to scratch that arena shooter itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047653311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1506881401}
review:
This game looks like a demo for the ut engine. Absolute Garbage. Reakktor is definately a synonym for amateur.

It is uninventive and unoriginal. Worse, there are so many irritations and neverending garbage noise on the hud that it is near unplayable. About 1/4 of functions cannot be bound freely. Some keys are filtered from binding, such as period, left shift and so on. The sound is painfully generic across the board. It is beyond unspecial, it is pathetic.
Performance is under par, again, pathetic. The interface is actually the worst I have seen in years, especially for trying to start multiplayer games.

You will have more fun with ut3 or ut2k4 than you will with this. Frankly, you're better off spending your money to have a scotsman nut punch you.

Worthless with an overall rating of 1 out of 10. 1 because it loaded up all by its lonesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035862782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1528308229}
review:
For now i only tried the free trail, so i cant review in a way that others can.
However this game already won me over.
Its a great and FAST (talking about 0.5 sec respawn timer on free for all)  arena shooter perfect for a 20 min break. 

Moreover the weapons are very different and fun to use, for the first time im playing a shooter in which I like every weapon.
The graphics are also amazing, the maps are beatiful (even if you are rushing through them).
No realoading, usefull pickups and great map design are not all that make this game fast and fun.
Its in the movement, You have double jumps and dashes in all directions, giving you freedom with your approach. 
The soundtrack is nice to hear and lets you concentrate, a friend of mine described it as "making you fall in trance".

The only downside for other players i could think of is the speed of the game. For me it feels like DooM2016 on steroids (but with way less gore) and i like it, others may not. 
If you are looking for a slower game where you buy weapons and death is very grave, stick to Counterstrike.
If you want a fast paced shooter that is quite unique in gameplay and has non stop action without any slowdowns try this game, after all in its free version you can play on all maps and see for yourself.

And I am sorry for my bad english

author: {'steamid': '76561198045396478', 'num_games_owned': 1073, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1515812998}
review:
Pocas veces entro a un juego free to play con algun tipo de espectativa positiva, y esta no fue la excepcion. Pero debo admitir que Toxxik me sorprendio con un golpe de nostalgia al entregarme gameplay y mapas de la calida y estilo de juegos como Quake y Unreal Tournament.

Solo he jugado la experiencia "Freemium", por lo que extra√±e la capacidad de crear y buscar servidores usando el server browser, sin mencionar el tener que ir desbloqueando mapas al jugar el juego. Sin embargo nada de esto mato realmente la experiencia para mi, me diverti asesinando bots y ocasionalmente jugadores con mi metralleta lanza granadas.

Por cierto, las armas en el juego no son muchas pero todas son distintas, utiles y memorables. Incluso la pistola basica no pierde encanto frente a sus hermanas de mayor poder y cadencia de disparo.

Como nota final debo destacar que no pude encontrar partidas en servidores latino americanos, nuevamente solo puedo decir, una gran oportunidad desaprovechada. No se si la version completa permita crear dichos servidores asiq ue tengan esto en cuenta si viven en la region.

En resumen, si buscas un juego de disparos rapido, frenetico y que exude ese algo especial que hizo a juegos como Quake y Unreal Tournament clasicos de culto, no la pienses dos veces y prueba Toxikk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004857260', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1515280296}
review:
Below are some bulleted thoughts on TOXIKK:

-Decent AFPS experience, very reminiscent of UT2004, with more modern graphics a-la Crysis.

-Controls can be clunky, I'd recommend setting them up to your preferences.

-Small but dedicated community, no problems finding a match without bots.

-Only minor issues with connectivity, and even then, the lag compensation is well-implemented.

-Small but Comfortable selection of Gamemodes, including the basics. (TDM, CTF, DM, etc.)

-Decent map selection, if you prefer quality over quantity.

-Will feel immediately familiar to any QUAKE / UT2004 vet.

-Very adrenaline oriented. Several times I found myself shaking inbetween matches, as the gameplay was tight and incredibly satisfying.

I can say that it's fun, even if only played in short bursts. The entry price is right, and the feeling of good play is surprisingly tantilizing. Note, it's not for everyone. The devs know their audience, and they know them well. If you've heard about "The Good 'ol Days", this is but one of a few really top-notch options on the market right now to experience them for yourself.


tl;dr: Give it a shot. It's free, it only takes about 4 GB of space, and if you don't like it, you can always uninstall. Happy fragging!

author: {'steamid': '76561198428171994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1515179696}
review:
Too start with I like the graphics of the game. 
Although it is a "quake clone" I like the movement system (even though im bad it.)
The weapons seem unbalanced as I only ever see people use the "rocket launcher" or "plasme gun" unless they havent got these guns then they will use that gun.  (Never the sniper)

* I keep experiancing bugs and I will act is if i am pressing a button eg: strafing continuously, or turning in one direction constantly.
*This will only occour once I respawn after I get killed
* and is therefor "unpolished?"

So although it is a great (looking) game. It is a clone / Slightly overpriced (in my opinion) / has unbalanced weapons and is almost unplayable with the bug.

Unfortunatly i would have to NOT recommend ->buying it<- but feel free too try the free version if you want to try it.

If these problems (that are my opinion) are changed I would say you "should?" buy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999938574', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 590, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1515085990}
review:
In a world where pretty much nobody plays Quake Champions, DOOM, Titanfall or Unreal Tournament, how do you expect anyone would play this one? It's basically the same, but not as polished and doesn't have a history with old FPS fans like me.

Besides, TOXIKK has an overly complex movement mechanics (two different buttons for jumps, really?) that makes things like wall jumps extremely complex and not really feasible in a real fight.

Finally, the UI is a nightmare. Whose idea was it to make all buttons the same grey color? Make PLAY visible so players don't have to look for it for a minute, perhaps then this game will have a chance.

P.S. If I want to "FRAG LIKE IT'S 1999", I will play Unreal Tournament.Most likely I will have to play against bots, but hey, the same is true about TOXIKK. It seems it has ZERO players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079004272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1517814790}
review:
The real reason why this game has an extremely low playercount for a fairly decent made game. I am livestreaming this game on my Twitch https://www.twitch.tv/theundernetwork

- Broken and unresponsive jumping mechanics that confuses skill with stupidity. You spend more time "air-humping" than "air-jumping" they consider their poor programming skills and game design as a "skill" to overcome instead of adding proper double-jumping and air dodging mechanics that older game companies have already mastered for well over a decade. It's sad that BO3,Titanfall 2 and Hawken do a much better job at this.

- The special "dodging" and "jumping" skills are absolutely useless in this game since 90% of the players on here never bother to use it. You are better off focusing on your aim instead.

- I tried to do your "advanced air dodging" tutorial for about an hour. The buttons are absolutely unresponsive and I fall to my death and react whenever they feel like it. This has to be a joke.

- The walking speeds are too fast and incredibly slippery. Because even at my mouse sensitivty at 4 is incredibly high. I have a Logitech G502 and the mouse moves around like crazy at the slighest touch.

- There is a lot of lag in the game eventhough I have 12 ping surrounded by players with 80 ping. You can't pick a server and just simply play the game. You have a lobby no different than Titanfall 2 which is the reason why it killed the community.

- I have 200+ hours on Unreal Tournament. The game doesn't take require much skill seeing as how classic games were fun but lacked a lot of depth.

- You can spam all of the weapons due to no reloading. This is the weakness of arena shooters. There is no punishment for constantly missing your shots. The game also doesn't tell you why the rocket launcher has a laser guide and doesn't serve a single purpose.

- The flamethrower and shotgun is utterly useless. Because even at point blank you can't even hit your target much less do damage. These are just tampon cannons. Your primary pistol is better than both of these weapons.

- You have to pay money to play with bots. Whut.

- This game is an exact clone of Unreal Tournament 3 Black Edition why bother investing money or time playing this game if I already own and bought it for $4? It is facing the exact problems that killed the game in the first place. Stop reinventing the wheel in fact just throw away any idea of the wheel and start going full hover car mode.

- The fact that arena shooters have failed in the past multiple times is because you are forced to travel through the routes like a rat in a maze following the trail of ammo and health packs only to have some idiot camping in the corner having to be waiting for the same cooldown as you. This ruins the momentum of the game and having a Chad duel showdown over a weapon.

- The game doesn't reward accuracy at all. In fact your accuracy only exists as a form of mental masturbation for those that actually care which is the <1% of the playerbase. You should force players to aim and reward them ammo for doing so. The game is littered with ammo so there is no incentive not to hold down your button doing an absolute pray and spray and someone randomly walking into your line of fire.

- Start by removing the jumping platforms which limits the players and simply give players the ability to wallrun,powerslide,air dodge like Titanfall or Black Ops 3. I feel no freedom having to jump the same platform when the walls and environment can BE the platforms.

- If I wanted to "Frag Like It's 1999" I prefer to "Frag Like It's 2999" with the future of gaming in mind. I could just play Unreal Tournament on my Epic Games account for FREE with a lot more players on it that pretty much invented the game. You have got to give me a good reason to play YOUR version instead. This is your major issue. Stop being the UT killer and start becoming the next level UT and fill in that market.

- I am a huge Age of Empires player and yet AoE Online bombed spectacularly. I actually put $500 worth of my money into Clash of Clans instead because they reinvented RTS games. I also put $400 into Combat Arms and $400 into Battlefield Heroes. I would have no problem investing that kind of money in an FPS game but your game doesn't deserve that kind of money because it isn't new or innovative.

- This game is more designed for hobbyists trying to relive the nostalgic past instead of profiting from a certain missing market that FPS gamers desire. I have no problem playing this game every once in a while but I have invested hundreds of more hours into COD,Overwatch and Battlefield with 600+ hours in each game. Look at Splatoon for example: A game made by Nintendo that has no violence,no blood and instead of just shooting at players you shoot at the walls and they reinvented the FPS genre. I suggest you do the same or create an entirely different game.

More coming soon.

review: This is an early review from me, as you see on my playtime. This game is Awesome. I mean, eventhough the game genre is a FPS game, which is a common genre these days, the game core is different. The game is fast-paced and -my personal favorite- the weapons are straight-forward. And even if you didn't buy the full game, the game's still playable (haven't had any unballanced match because of the full-game benefits). If you like character customization, like me, maybe you'll consider on buying the full game. 9/10.

review: Even though I own this games Free to Play mode, I can honestly say it is so f'n addicting! I love the fast paced gameplay, the soundtrack that just gets you pumped up, the lovely graphics, smooth transitioning mechanics, fair/balanced system, and that they care about their Free to Play player base, not making other online players have a HUGE advantage over you if you didn't pay. Only slight issue I have is the lagging sometimes, but it doesn't at all remove anything from the gameplay. Great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063880896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1513313445}
review:
No players to play against.

I mean it. It is dead.

The developers decided that you can only play against bots in 2 little maps, and the rest is closed to you if you don't buy the game. BUT even fter you buy it, because you can only play in the same map and with people at your same ability level, then the thing is you WILL NOT FIND any player at all. Well, maybe one lost soul, but that's it.

They took a horrible decision over a beautiful game. Shame on them.
You, reading this, HEAR WHAT WE ARE ALL SAYING: there are no players. DON'T BUY IT.

review: I was actually hyped for this game when I saw it, so I download it and the makers logo and stuff roll and then... Black. Just darkness and nothing else. I stayed there for like 30 minutes but it didnt work. I thouth that it failed loading the game (which it was) so I restart my computer, then I try again... The same thing happens. So I want to play this awesome game but it would be reaaally nice if you make the game ACTUALLY ACCESSABLE!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974772718', 'num_games_owned': 3174, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1694844007}
review:
[h1]TL;DR:[/H1]
TOXIKK's 'motto', [b]FRAG LIKE IT'S 1999, is accurate.[/b] TOXIKK is a really great FPS similar to the Unreal Tournament series and similar games. If you can't get enough FPS with your Quake or UT/UT2K3/UT2k4/UT3/Unreal Tournament (modern) or similar games like Nexuiz and don't want to pay microtransactions so common in modern games similar to this, [i]this is the game for you![/i]

Argh! I'm frustrated that I let the free version sit in my library for so long without playing it... finally did so, more than a year after release! It looks and plays great!

--------------------------

In the early 22nd Century, the world's energy is controled by mega-corporations and cartels.

"As a freelance MERCENARY, you offer your services to the two leading syndicates, DRAYOS and EXOCOM. Helping your clients enforce their claims abroad, you'll be sent to battlefields all over the world. The better you perform, the higher your rewards (MXP, achievements and ranks)." 

Fight using skillful movement and an array of weapons or in [url=http://toxikk.com/vehicles/]vehicles[/url] such as assault bombers, battle mechs, 4x4 high mobility vehicles, and hoverbikes. TOXIKK has [url=http://toxikk.com/weapons/]9 weaons[/url] by default and at least 11 default [http://toxikk.com/maps/]maps[/url]. [i](All links contain videos as well as depictions and descriptions.)[/i]

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
  [*]Completely uncrippled gameplay maps unlockable with XP earned each time you login/start the game and each time you play!
  [*]Play in first-person or third-person!
  [*]Awesome vehicles to pilot!
  [*]Polished, helpful and effective tutorial with multiple paths for training movement and/or piloting vehicles
  [*]Each day you login, you get 500XP plus cumulative additional XP when you login on sequential dates!
  [*]Fast gameplay with quick, responsive controls!
  [*]Maps filled with secret paths and quick multikill possibilities!
  [*]Great graphics seem fresh and detailed!
  [*]Cost seems low for the polished gameplay; one-time payment for ALL!
  [*]Advanced moves enable awesome maneuvers (see tutorial for details)
  [*]Multipe gameplay modes and mutators!
  [*]Skills learned in other FPS games apply to TOXIKK! You might already have a leg up on the competition!
  [*]Website has a [url=http://toxikk.com/guide/]player's guide![/url] Namely, the sections are -BASICS / -WEAPONS / -MAPS / -VEHICLES / -BACKGROUND
  [*]Live Discord channel!
  [*]Some maps pay homage to Unreal Tournament maps or have layouts licensed from Unreal Tournament.
  [*]The game assesses your skill and assigns you to multiplayer games against others who will be competetive for you.
[/list]
[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
  [*]Might feel grindy while accumulating XP to unlock features (free version)
  [*]If you let it sit at the bottom of your library and never play it, you miss out on this AWESOME adrenaline rush!
  [*]Gotta unlock features in the free version with XP to have extra maps/etc. available
  [*]The free version loads the website in your default browser upon quitting
  [*]Cost can seem high for the poorest of us if we're not up to playing the same couple maps and the tutorial multiple times to gain XP
  [*]The bots will win if you're not playing well (obviously)
  [*]Sometimes you're on a killing streak and low on HP and nearby health boxes haven't respawned since they were last grabbed! Ahh, the frustrations of staying alive long enough to rack up huge bonuses in well-crafted FPSs!
  [*]Learning curve for advanced maneuvers can require a lot of practice (typical for FPS)
  [*]The game assesses your skill and assigns you to multiplayer games against others who will be competetive for you, so if you're highly skilled you might be unable to join games against human competitors if all contain weaker players.
[/list]

[URL=toxikk.com/editions/](Edition quotes from this link)[/URL]
[b]Free edition:[/b] "Try TOXIKK FOR FREE with all its WEAPONS, mutators, power-ups etc. The FREE EDITION features the full core experience of the game and has NO COMPETITIVE DISADVANTAGES VERSUS THE FULL GAME. [...] ALL MAPS can be unlcoked with XP"

[b]Full game:[/b] "The FULL GAME comes with all MAPS and VEHICLES (both instantly unlocked), the complete single-player CAMPAIGN (Contracts), a bot-play BOOT CAMP mode that lets you train your skills in individually configured matches, SERVER BROWSER, character CUSTOMIZATION, [...]ONE-CLICK MATCH HOSTING[...], full LAN support, access to STEAM WORKSHOP CONTENT and the SDKK level editor[...]"

[h1]Play and/or Buy it! The more who do so, the more multiplayer battles we can have! Let's increase the size of the community of avid and active TOXIKK players playing![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970374105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1512498107}
review:
This game pegs itself as a skilled based arena game & with the sales pitch "FRAG LIKE IT'S 1999", but if you're an actual skilled Quake player (or any other kind of competitive FPS), then don't bother.

The player base is segregated into two sets of servers - SC1-8 range & SC1-12.

If you're above SC8 then you CAN'T play with anyone below that in the SC1-8 server range!  In other words, you can't play with the vast majority of players.  Less skilled players can however select SC1-12 to play with skilled players, but they simply don't.

The end result is that my first real game against human players ended with me scoring 30-0 & almost immediately being put into the highest skill tier where the game is effectively dead & has virtually no one to play with.

It's understandable why they've done this, but what you're essentially left with is an arena game that panders to n00bs.

On the plus side, if you've never played an arena FPS before, or you're just a low skill player that was always intimidated by the genre, then this is definitely the place to start.  The rocket launcher fires really rapidly & with a high velocity, so connecting shots is the easiest I've ever found in a game like this.  This, among other things (too many to bother listing), make this the easiest arena game I've played in terms of gameplay mechanics.

PS - I only have 69 hours in Quake Live (for skill reference).

Conclusion - TRY for a few hours before you buy.  If you remain in the low skill bracket after that time & like the game, then you're probably safe to buy (as long as you don't improve or get too much better).  Otherwise you'll be buying into a dead game, that might mislead you with player statistics or intial impressions that make the game seem more populated than it is if you're a skilled player & can't play with the majority of players.  I guess another plus, is that if you're a low skill player, you won't have to worry about superior players annihilating you, because they literally can't play with you unless you manually enable the option.

What you're left with is a game that feels like the antithesis of what high skill ceiling arena games are supposed to be all about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045388428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1511964710}
review:
weapons and maps seem really good, the action is also responsive and fun.

however.

tutorial didn't mention some key mechanics, like weapon spawns, what powerups could spawn, how stealth works, etc... instead it focused on movement mechanics. not exactly a bad thing, but why would you train newcomers on jumping instead of introducing the unique mechanics in this game?

lastly, there're some distinct problems for new f2p players:
- levelling doesn't seem to clearly unlock anything but new maps
- you'll be playing with bots 90% of the time
- there is no in-client chat outside of the server (nobody ever responded to chat in-game)
- discord has snotty know-it-alls who disparage newcomers

if you're looking for f2p FPS action with some RPG progression, Warface still feels better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960886414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1541551985}
review: Claiming to 'frag like it's 1999', as per its tagline, Toxikk has a hefty expectation to live up to. The game needs to not only draw inspiration from the golden age of twitch shooters like Quake 3 Arena and Unreal Tournament but to also make something new and relevant for 2017. It needs to remind us why we loved these games in the first place without being a pale imitation of a superior predecessor. Thankfully, Toxikk delivers. The game definitely feels more like a spiritual successor to Unreal Tournament: big, open maps with vehicles, a variety of classic weapon archetypes, and that classic twitch gameplay which nurtures a skillset all its own. While Toxikk doesn't enjoy the same expansive modding community that UT enjoyed, the Steam workshop integration has the potential of extending the life of the game beyond the standard experience. The solo campaign only takes a couple of hours at most but provides a nice introduction into the various game types before you choose to take on Multiplayer. This is where the game really takes you back into that simpler time of FPSs: kill or be killed without the burden of excesses of the modern shooter: no classes to choose from, no pseudo-RPG leveling to unlock weapons, and no microtransactions. If that sounds like a welcome invitation, then wholeheartedly take this trip to the past and fall in love with the FPS all over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041108401', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 496, 'playtime_forever': 10721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4355, 'last_played': 1661117399}
review:
I'll put this with the words of another decent Toxikk player:
"In this game it's a combination of movement, positioning, item timing, prediction of opponents, prediction of projectiles and lots of other things. 
In other games it's hiding behind crates and waiting for a pixel to change colors.
Personally I prefer fast-paced action, that's why I play Arena-FPS games and not CounterStrike."

This is just an awesome AFPS very much like Unreal Tournament! But I miss a Shock Rifle equivalent. All weapons are so straight.
Movement is very responsive and skillfull, feels great just to move.
I love their new invented maps and their remakes of old classic maps. If you liked UT you will like Toxikk too! Multiplayer community is very small but alive. You can't get human players all the time around the clock, but there are specific times when most are playing. Check out the Friday Frag Fest or Toxikk's Discord for some good fragging action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060907753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1542559722}
review:
Toxikk is a remarkably enjoyable Unreal Tournament clone. The visuals are sharp and stylish. The arsenal of weapons available are overall pretty fun to use. So are the vehicles, particularly the Mech. Movement in this game is very rapid with lots of options for traversing the maps. The mechanics will be very familiar to anyone who has played Unreal Tournament 2004. The gametypes are what you would expect from an arena shooter with Team Deathmatch, Capture The Flag and Domination all available. 

One minor area of fault with the game is the HUD and menu systems. These clearly put form and over function, which looks cool but feels cluttered and distracting. All the maps contain very detailed and vivid artwork, which is wonderful and that is where the visual complexity belongs. The designers have clearly put a lot of thought and effort into all the assets. Although this game is extremely derivative of UT and other titles in this genre, it amazingly feels fresh. I would recommend it! 8/10

review:
This is the robot on roboat gritty oily action that we have been waiting for boys and girls. 

With a wide variety of customizable appearences, a vast array of weapons, and a well designed selection of maps, TOXIKK gets a solid 4 out of 8 stars. 

The free version is a bit annoying with the incessant pressing to upgrade, but upgrading does grant access to numerous very enjoyable features. Highly recommended, especially if you have a small group of friends that you want to be able to kick the living bananas out of each other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237010962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1510866382}
review:
Has no personality: not good, not terrible.

Is it the worst game ever made? No. Is it as good as Quake 3 Arena? No. First of all, you need a very good computer to run this game, if you put the game at low settings you will get only about 20 fps. 
The game is overhyped, is it anything new? No not really, it's basically Unreal Tournament, but with sterile modern graphics. If you like sterile modern graphics, and you like unreal tournament, you may like this game, but you won't go crazy about it.
Now, the problems with this game.
The problems with this game are, the hitboxes are too narrow, making the pistol and bullet guns somewhat useless. The flamethrower is the only good gun, but you can't see anything that you are shooting when you flood the room with fire.

This game has no personality, no character, just the sterile, modern art style with nameless soldiers with no name, or identity, to be slaughtered in a meaningless, repetitive manner. There are no death animations, just ragdoll physics, to imply the most minimum effort possible when designing and creating the characters personalities. Overall, not the worst game ever made, but if you want a game with personality play Quake 3/Quake Live, despite the hype this does not "revolutionize" the fps genre and is actually filled with BS. Or you can play this and be flooded your soul with modern O.M.G. overflowing of modern just vacousness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085684229', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1624130551}
review:
This game is a very basic and traditional deathmatch shooter, with some slight variations depnding on map and gamemode, and that isn't a bad thing, because this game is intended to be a simple deathmatch shooter. It has the usual core shooter mechanics, weapon types and basic ranking, leveling and customising systems.
The game consists of a solo mode, which is different types of VS bots, and of course MP, all with a lot of customisable game elements, such as a lot of unique maps, and of course gamemodes, including all the classics, FFA, team elimination, and CTF to name a few. There is also somewhat of a competitive mode, but for neither of all gamemodes I found a lot of players, so most of my experience came from playing against mostly bots, with only so many real players joining me. But when an actual game consisting of real people comes together, the game kicks ass. 
Eventhough it seems quite inconsistent sometimes withexplosions or hit detection, it makes up for it in being a true fast paced fps, it even punishes you for camping, and honestly, the Dragoneer is straight up crappy and illogical, but the other weapons make up for it more than enough. Platforming is also included to make the game faster paced, but youll learn about that enough in the tutorial.
What a lot of people might be concerned with is the Full game. Let me tell you, it's purely game content, not gameplay changing. You really get the full experience, more maps, customisation options and an offline option to play against stupidly over- or underpowered bots (pls work on that). If you enjoy the game and have some 15‚Ç¨ around, buy the upgrade and support the game, because it deseves it.
Of course more content is always better, but for what it is and what it is intended to be, Toxikk excels in its promises. Try it out if you like uncomplicated and fast shooters in an older fashion, and maybe even upgrade to get more out of the game.

review: This game is a perfect ego-shooter. It has good graphics many cool and different maps, the character is individually customizable, there are different game modes and many different and creative weapons to choose from. The tutorial shows the most important parts of the controls and makes you familiar with the game. Only negative aspect: if you don't have the full version of the game you can't complete the tutorial and you can't train on your own. But so far I really enjoy playing the game.

review: YOU NEED TO READ THIS, DEVELOPERS: Overall, great game. However in the contracts, the AIs' skill is at the point of GODLIKE. Yes, I know. IT IS WAY TOO HARD TO EVEN GET A WEAPON BECAUSE THE STUPID AI WILL KILL YOU FIRST!!! THIS IS ESPECIALLY A PROBLEM IN HYDROPHOBIA(A contract). I love the game and totally recomend it, but the developers need to put an easy,medium,hard, for those like me who simply are raging because the AI is TO SMART. This AI skill level thingy is in the boot camp, but not contracts. This is not a hate review, it's just pointing out a major issue. Great game, great gameplay, simple, and chaotic. EVERYTHING you need for an arena shooter. Correct me if I'm wrong and there is an AI skill thing and I'm blind. Thank you and the developers need to fix this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973576983', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1507749015}
review:
Living review:

1) Why do I have to highlight a section of the options with my mouse but then use the keyboard arrows to change the setting if it's a slider? I dislike games that don't allow ALT+F4 to close it (at least bring up the Exit confirmaiton box) and please don't pop open my web browser after I leave a game. That's a trait that can stay with the games you are trying to emulate. UPDATE: Realize you can grab the indicator and drag it around now but I feel like clicking toward greater or lesser is fine and I was a bit surprised by this option.

2) I dislike this art style. I understand it was the style at the time of the late 90s but between this and Warframe I am already sick of this 90s sort of neo-noire edgy style again. Also ties into the font which I find taxing on my eyes and hard to decipher quickly especially in this age of people understanding why certain fonts are better for certain tasks.

In game the art style is bland but fine. Does feel very similar to Killing Floor 2 but I chalk that up to minimal tweaking of UE4.

3) I saw 4-6 "ready to join" servers pop up that I clicked "join" on each time only to be greeted with another option a few seconds later. There is no feedback to the player as to what is happening. And once you are searching for a match even hitting "reject" to an option won't stop the search process. Seems like you must join a match to be able to soft exit the game. Though "Close Window" in Windows 10 fixes this.

And that's it so far cause I have been unable to find a match at this point. I will swing back around to this at some point so until then...

More to come

author: {'steamid': '76561198120779395', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1506800931}
review: Es un juego muy bueno pero incomprendido. Apareci√≥ en una √©poca donde este tipo de juegos no ha sido bien valorado por su alta dificultad y los r√°pidos movimientos necesarios. En lo personal, me parece un juego excelente, lleno de acci√≥n y solo para jugadores h√°biles. No hay lugar para camperos ni cobardes, solo para gente con reflejos. Todos tienen las mismas habilidades  y oportunidades por lo que nunca estas en desventaja frente a tus rivales, ya que la diferencia la haces con tu habilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049927684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1670932818}
review:
Toxikk, This game is great and I liked it tops in the free version. I found the vehicle controls a little under explained back then so I didn't play those levels that much. Now that I have the full version, very pleased. I think people have their preferred arena shooters by hype and everything else just gets less fortunate marks.

Great performance, doesn't crash at all
If you prefer a controller as I do, that also isn't much explained and the upgrade from free to full disengaged my controller  for some reason. After a few plug ins at the USB port it started recognizing it again and played as normal even though my playing needs some practice. The new levels like cube and dekk  are total bonus along with the injury points displayed. The jumps this game has taken since the preview is substantial and it was building on fantastic game play in my opinion. 

One thing , the cerberus, I prefer the revolver pattern to have stayed , It seems to be stationary position if only I wouldn't die so fast to be sure. Definitely check it out.. There are skills and negative gravity that start becoming more obvious effects as you spend more time with it.  Also you'll find a few mega weapons in water locations under bridges in the water and what not
Its worth the graphics alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131487039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1530148736}
review: Loving the game so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153502673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1594452917}
review: TOXIKK is a beautiful combination of 90s shooter gameplay and stunning modern graphics. It doesn't try to be too complex like many games do nowadays. There is a simple singleplayer campaign, only a few weapons (all of which are easy to learn and fun to use), and the only progression is unlocking cosmetics. Everything about the controls, the aesthetic, and even the music is incredible and an absolute treat. It's unfortunate that so few people play, I think it's a real hidden gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247579680', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1527983764}
review: Horrible game. Only like 5 weapons, and it's not even fun in the free version. Instead get sompthing from epic games, they actualy know how to make them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972494812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1687548690}
review:
At this time I cannot recommend this game. As of October 2017, this is a weak remake of Unreal, but it has the potential to be the next interation. I feel Unreal 3 was better. The guns are clunky compared to Unreal 3, and slower. The bots go from super dumb to mega twitch head shotting fools in an instant. I the double jump is way to sensative to the jump from apex, giving inconsistant results. Wall jumping is just down right frustrating.

I regret not playing the free version a little longer before buying it, but I guess I am helping them with some money to develop it more. It just needs more time to mature, which is the problem with early realease games. It is really hard to build a strong community because people play in the early stages, get a bad taste when something is broken during development, and move on.

I hope this game does survive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218769760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1510980437}

author: {'steamid': '76561198163310154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1507252884}
review: I was browsing on the internet and saw some stuff about Unreal, and I got a bit nostalgic. I went on to Steam and browsed through the arena, when I saw a NEW GAME. The genre hasn't been active for awhile, so this was very exciting to me. The free version seemed like the best choice for the moment, so I downloaded it, and soon after, I was hooked. I LOVE this game. It runs perfectly on my computer, and all of the weapons are so fun to use. The maps are quite nice too. They give me sort of a cyberpunk feel. Another great thing about the game is that it holds up in today's market. Players who haven't experienced arena shooters before will still enjoy this, as it is not a nostalgia driven experience. The only downside is that the community is a bit small, which is a shame because it is such a good fucking game. PLEASE DOWNLOAD THIS GAME. IT DESERVES TO BE PLAYED. Hope to see some of you in multiplayer :) 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198161337095', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1609731521}
review: Although the catchphrase "FRAG LIKE IT'S 1999" isn't entirely accurate (the game has a tendency to incorporate things that don't belong in an early arena FPS video game), this is perhaps one of the most underrated games of the modern era. The community is dead, the servers unpopulated, but the bots offer enough of a challenge for this to remain an engaging experience. Try the free version and if you enjoy the gameplay and 'game-feel', pay the extra money, the full version is really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101220317', 'num_games_owned': 1594, 'num_reviews': 740, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1506959781}
review:
Que jogo otimo!!

Em pouco tempo de jogo percebi que o jogo tem um conte√∫do incr√≠vel e com sistema multiplayer mega simples e muito competitivo.
Vamos resumir. 

Pros.
- Jogabilidade - Mega simples
- Gr√°fico - Tudo e incrivelmente lindo e com efeitos maravilhosos das armas e explos√µes. 
- Trilha Sonora - Espetacular.
- Os Mapas - Um mais lindo que o outro. Lindas paisagens, sofisticados e futuristas. 
- Velocidade do jogador - Tudo e muito r√°pido. O jogo fica muito divertido. Lembra muito QUAKE.
- Sistema de Level - O jogo tem um sistema de level muito interessante.
- Modo multiplayer - Mesmo com ping 200 300 voc√™ ira conseguir jogar de igual pra igual com outros jogadores distantes levando em considera√ß√£o que a velocidade do jogo te ajuda a todo momento escapar de tiros etc..
- Resolu√ß√£o - Fiz um breve teste no minimo e m√°ximo de todas resolu√ß√µes e conclui com 100% certeza que mesmo jogando no minimo voc√™ ira jogar de igual pra igual com quem usa no m√°ximo. Usando a resolu√ß√£o menor ''qualquer PC'' e capaz de rodar com facilidade. E detalhe que para o jogo j√° ficar lindo n√£o precisa estar no m√°ximo. Resolu√ß√£o muito baixa o jogo j√° fica um espet√°culo.

Contras
- Players - Na primeira tentativa consegui jogar com 4 pessoas mas depois n√£o tinha uma alma vida em campo.
- Menu Principal - Achei as letras muito pequenas e ruim para escolher as op√ß√µes.

Joguei pouco tempo mas j√° afirmo que compensa muito jogar!
Recomendo muito!

Duvidas, criticas ou sugest√µes postem ai! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198079622015', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1509011052}
review:
If Quake and Unreal Tournament had a baby and that baby grew up into modern age of shooters this would be the game; TOXIKK

It has great visuals, fluid gameplay, great optimization and kickass soundtrack and atmosphere.

Just when you think modern-day fps shooters are repetitive and overly strict there comes a glint of hope that good old fun is still around the corner.

This game is definetely something you should at least try once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178350822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3051, 'last_played': 1571890568}
review: I absolutley enjoy this game to the fullest. I purchased this game before their was even a free version to play . I have played Unreal Tournament and Quake.So I wanted to see how similar this game was to them. It was spot on. The maps are great to play on, the graphics are smooth,  you have different game modes to play cell capture, bloodlust, etc, and the settings are simple. It's just like if you where playing Unreal Tournament. I say if you like the old style games like Unreal Tournament and Quake check this game out. Now their is a downside to this game their are hardly any other players online to play with. So get your gaming crews together and play mutilplayer matches with the bots, or find a server that you can all get on and into to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981643926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1505312427}
review:
Solid game.  Cool movement.  Nice weapons.  Fast paced arena shooter.

Major downside is lack of players.  I didn't play primetime US by any means - but matchmaking yielded one server with a couple players, over 150 ping.  Couldn't find any other servers with players, just bots.  Played a few matches in a US server hoping to get some joiners... eventually got one guy, but then was disconnected from host after match.  It's too bad because it's a better shooter than a lot of the stuff out there, but the market is saturated so I can imagine it's tough without a solid player base.

review:
... Well, plays like a slower Unreal with a really terrible sound track... So if you liked Quake I bet you'll like this! Plus all I seem to ever fight on the free version are literally 2 freakin bots with 1 on my team so the matches are painfully slow.

I guess maybe this -could- be a good game? Maybe? I mean... If you play with other players but I bet that option is only with paid versions. Or even if they just put more than 2 bots to fight in a bot match. I dunno, I'm not recommending this.

review: At first launch, I thought that i was going to have troubles getting it to run properly on my machine, but I was taken aback by how quick it runs. The tutorial is a bit confusing at first, but after figuring out the keys and functions, and playing for a little while, this game quickly became a favorite. Sure, the free version is limited on to what you are allowed to do, but I myself would love to purchase the game for the full price. $14.99 is a great price on this game as it should cost more. To anyone looking at trying the game out, seriously get it and try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993593824', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1473726349}
review:
A community of gun nuts hell bent on enforcing their bullet lovin sickness on the gamer population by reviving the FPS genre to its most gun loving roots. Just like Unreal Tournament and Quake before it, this game warps the senses of those who play and turns them into creatures of the night.

I had a cousin once who played a lot of Quake back in the 2000's and he enlisted in the army thinking he was good at shooting people, but he died when he got fragged overseas and he couldn't respawn. I can only imagine what the death toll related to violent video games is at now, I shudder to think about it.

Do not buy this game, go hug your family. Unless your family plays Quake and any games like it with big loud guns, which translates to government propaganda. The government wants you to whip into a frenzy over "charlies" and "bogies". They want you to whip up, whip it up, grab a bull whip and run around shooting guns into the air to the tune of Free Bird by Lynard Skynard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960912290', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1504078867}
review: Looks ok, plays ok. Game is mostly bots, couldn't find a human player. Game feels like it wants to be Unreal Tournament back when UT was at the top of its game, but it just doesn't move fast enough nor is enough explained in how weapons work. Smooth enough. The game talks big about not being a 'F2P' piece of crap, but opens your web browser in an attempt to get you to purchase the game every single time you close the game out. I get it, no profit in true freeware. Still, I'd rather cosmetic microtransactions over this blatant "buy buy buy" hounding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010992095', 'num_games_owned': 4542, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1527322500}
review: If you enjoy Quake or Unreal, you're missing out by not downloading this. author: {'steamid': '76561198033968435', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1503088145}
review:
Yet another FPS game attempting to achieve what UT and Quake did more than a decade ago.... a clear ripoff of them. just a fancy new face but please, dont be taken into mistake them.

I see a lot of comments mentioning older versions of these but, do these people know that they can get Epic Games Launcher and Bethesda Launcher to play Alpha/Beta versions of these?!! And they run like a charm (including older spec machines)

Yeah, save your money and give those a try instead. (in fact Quake will be on Steam very soon - days actually)

Be happy and play fair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307066100', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1507304589}
review:
TOXIKK is a great fps to get unbored quickly and if it weren't for the lack of players on this great game I would spend more then an hour at a time playing. The bots are still a lot of fun to play with but I don't get the sense of community for this game like other games, since there are so little playing. Yet great maps are made for the game by the few players there are.

TL;DR Great fps, needs more players, still fun with bots.

P.S. The best way to support the devs of this game is to get friends to play it, the other way (if your socially awkward) is to pay for the full version.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980089336', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1503040231}
review: Totally surprised by this game. Plays like classic arena shooters. The whole play like it's 1999 is 100%! Give the free model a try! The full version is only 15$ which is a goddamn steal!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027873867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1638250973}
review:
The only bad thing I have to say about this awesome, FREE game is that there aren't that many players. Ridiculous, right? Ignore all the stupid negative reviewers complaining because their old PoS computer can't run it.

What are you waiting for? Download this game, start playing and bring it back to life!

P.S. The skill system is really stupid. If you become a high level, you'll get locked out of servers with low level players. So, essentially, if you play the game a lot, you'll eventually be unable to play it with any real players; only bots. It's absurd! It almost makes me want to NOT RECOMMEND this awesome game! If you're a developer and you're reading this, please address this issue; many people have complained about this. Just think about it for a second; it's so stupid!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980537163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1504273098}
review:
Fun fps arena shooter with great visuals and interesting weapons. Plays like Unreal Tournament with similar movement, and with a look that I feel is very similar to Hard Reset. This gives it a nice NeoTokyo visual. Movement is fast paced and there are enough tricks and things to master to keep it interesting. I am considering buying the upgrade DLC to the full version of the game however at the moment I am unsure if it will be worth it due to player numbers.
A polished arena shooter that is a bit of a gem, just needing more players!

review:
I enjoy this game. it is very much reminiscent of quake. i really suggest installing this game to at least try it out.
Pros-
menus are clean and simple.
handles really smoothly, i personally really enjoy games that heavily involve movement (IG Tribes Ascent, Arms, etc)
if you have experience with other shooters and movement intense games, you will most likely be pretty good at this game
guns each have their own respective abilities, which therefore are more usefull then others in certain situations.

Cons-
..

I am still playing this game, and will update this review in the future

author: {'steamid': '76561198398273659', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1559516554}
review:
[u] Pros [/u]
+Fast paced, quake/UT style gamplay
+Great visuals, even on low settings
+Great tactile movement, even if weird at first
+Great maps and overall feel
+Lots of customizations, such as renaming the tag on the chestplate of your character
+Halo style vehicles you can use in certain maps
+Amazing fucking soundtrack, I would buy that alone

[u] Cons [/u]
-Need to buy the game to customize your player
-Need to buy the game to finish all of the tutorial
-Need to buy the game to play in a bot match (Seriously, wtf)
-The dodging and double jumping is weird, if you don't double jump [i] immediately [/i] after your first jump, you will not double jump, and you have to kind of wait for your dodge to "replenish" (I guess) before you're able to do it again. (I had a hard time in the movement tutorial)
-Low player base (From what I heard at least, I haven't touched the online modes yet)

[u] Conclusion [/u]
This game has a good amount of potential, but because of the way the developers handled the free version, it's hard to enjoy it without having to pay the $15. If you don't want to buy it, that's fine, if you do then have fun, though everyone says this game is dead so I wouldn't waste my money. People these days just aren't into Arena Shooters anymore, and I wish that wasn't the case, but if you want more players in a game that doesn't have any limits in terms of how you play or look ingame, just buy Quake Live or go play Quake Champions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208371032', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1678950410}
review:
This game is so fucking fun! I don't even like quake style games, and it has me hooked.

The game is fast paced, but not crazy fast like it's Sonic FPS.

The music, is fucking epic! It queues are perfect time, so when you engadge an enemy, if feels amazing.

I managed to get a demo of the paid version, and the game goes from epic to EEEEEEPPPPPIIIIICCCCCC!

My only issue is the play base. It's small. I would pay for the game, but there is not enough support for the comunity.

review: TOXIKK free version has no server browser... why.... You are almost ALWAYS dropped in a server filled with bots. You will at most find 1 other person in a server. It's a promising game and, at it's core, is really fun. But to be honest, your best bet is to just play Quake Live. It's basically the same thing. Plus Quake Champions is coming out soon so if you want to play a Quake styled game with good graphics then there ya go. TOXIKK on the other hand will be completely forgotten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045987179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1466734064}
review:
this game has good potential, i've bought it right after i was released, altho it was so unpopular back then that the servers literally were empty and the game was kind of dead.
it also had a lot of performance issues back then, and i really didn't wanted to but i requested and got a refund...
that has been nearly a whole year ago, and now it seems that the game got a bigger community of players and now you can actually play multiplayer with actual people rather than with bots.

from my experience with the game its pretty much like Unreal Tournament 04' but with modern graphics, excellent game truly.
its nice that they added a Free game option so that you could actually try out yourself and see if you like this genre of FPS games or not.
 overall this game is pretty fun and gives me fond memories of playing Unreal Tournament with friends back in the late 90s to early 00s in LAN parties XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198279595311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1528406904}
review:
Es erinnert mich sehr stark an ein mit Liebe zum Detail aufgemotztes Quake 3, mit verbesserten Mechaniken, neuen Funktionen (welche das Spielerlebnis nicht zum schlechteren wenden) und einer sehr sch√∂nen Grafik. Die speziellen Bewegungsmechaniken (double jump, dodge jump etc.) bringen das Spiel insofern weiter, als dass es sehr viel schneller wird und auch die Maps in der H√∂he anwachsen k√∂nnen. 
Das Tutorial ist meiner Meinung nach nicht sehr gut gelungen. Es verk√∂rpert in keinster Weise den Charakter des Spiels und erkl√§rt nur die Meisterung von (sehr √ºbersichtlichen) nie im wirklichen Spiel anzutreffenden Extremsituationen und tippt man nur einmal im sofort aufploppenden "Death"-Bildschirm , auf den man dank fehlenden Bloodscreens nicht vorbereitet ist, die rechte Maustaste, ist das Tutorial auch schon zur√ºckgesetzt und man darf von vorn wieder anfangen.
P.S.: Kein Schwein braucht das Tutorial! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198188842245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1500190568}
review:
Although its gameplay is fun, weapons don't feel overpowered and has alot of ways to just move around the map, but I cannot recommend this game for the following reasons.

Some weapons if not most feel as if it was stolen from Unreal Tournament and just reskinned, although some are new but the others feel stolen ideas.

One of the maps is literally taken from Unreal Tournament and just reskinned over. I am most displeased.

You are not able to customise or even play with bots to practice or pass time, you are forced to play with players right off the tutorial and thats it.

Servers are empty almost like a ghost town, if you even find a server with 1 or 2 players, get ready for running simulator. What a shame.

review: Great F2P shooter. Sadly, there doesn't seem to be many people playing it. The graphics/art direction is gorgeous, and the mechanics are fun and challenging. Very fast-paced matches and game mechanics reminiscent of old-school shooters. This is a good example of how a F2P scheme should be implemented.

review: Great game, very fast paced, with weapons that are both balanced and satisfying to use. author: {'steamid': '76561198108151575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1501609524}
review:
Update: The developer responded about the issue I posted, and I applaud the developer for reaching out to me so fast. Thumbs up! I guess every game has its rotten apples and the developer assured me that it has their attention and have systems in place to keep the game clean. 

This makes me change this review to a full recommend!
--------------
Disclaimer: only played free version. It's a decent shooter which is easy enough to learn. 

I was considering to give this a thumbs down because I've ran into players with aimbots or other cheats (seeing though walls etc) and the system did not detect it, but if that doesn't happen it's a nice frag. So, benefit of the doubt: thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035813612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1499921739}
review:
HALO 6 seems kinda dead at times (oh fuck it's under 50 players average), which is strange considering this is one of 2 or 3 sci-fi vehicular combat games in existence on the PC. Everything is well optimized and the controls are satisfying. Does need to focus more on the vehicles since they are incredibly FUN and satisfying and there's NO OTHER vehicular combat game like this on PC. 

No P2W BS. YOU CAN EVEN FAKE YOUR OWN DEATH. Much innovation. 

 Gives me satisfaction like TWISTED METAL and BURNOUT did decades ago. 

Battlefront 2 and hopefully Destiny 2 will heavily emphasize on vehicular combat, but  we only get games like this every 20 years, so support them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096126597', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1574882465}
review: TOXIKK came as a very pleasant surprise to me. I'm not super experienced with arena-style shooters, but I've played plenty of "modern" ones, namely the new DOOM, but this is definitely some of the most fun I've had in a game. There is a little bit of a learning curve, since the movement mechanics are very old-school, but once I got the hang of it, TOXIKK became really fun. The gameplay is extremely addicting, the devs are awesome about updating, and the no microtransaction policy keeps everyone on the same level. Only wish that more people would play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995732284', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1588314535}
review: Its a perfect game for a hardcore fps multiplayer lover. In first 5minutes your first thoughts are: you are playing Unreal Tournament?. Its really like old time fragging.  Maps are designed very good. Its a lot of fun. Big plus is customization of your character - different armor, mask, colour, etc. A pitty is that you can`t change the mask to some funny ones, or tu put down the mask and change the head to some funny one. the game has  minimum bugs. You can play it on lowcost notebooks or pcs but the graphic is still very good. I personally recommend it to all the players who liked old style of playing: Quake2,  Unreal Tournament, ... A lot of fun and adrenaline as it should be. headshot man!

review:
"Frag like it's 2004" would be a more accuarate tagline, because you have the exact same movement system as in UT2k4.
This game is essentially UT2k4 with a graphical facelift, VCTF from UT3 and some slight changes to the classic weapon roster to make them feel different, but each new weapon fits right in the classic roster.

As a UT player you should feel right at home with this game.

review: Remindes me of the good and old days of Quake, UT and alikes. Fast shooter, skill with the mouse is very important here. Too bad the playerbase is not big. Ended up buying a 4-pack so I could play with some friends of those old times. Totally worth the money!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996416028', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1543639237}
review:
An extremely-polished arena shooter with tight mechanics, smooth controls, and awesome netcode. Weapons are great and varied, maps are gorgeous and well-balanced and it's just plain fun to jump into. The game is extremely optimised to the point that I don't even know [i]how[/i] Unreal Engine 3/UDK can provide this smooth experience. 

The game's population is sadly pretty small, but you can mostly always find a game. And of course that's something that can only be solved by adding more players, and the free edition is a fantastic option, with zero actual gameplay restrictions apart from (very fast, XP-based) map unlocks and zero micro-transactions.

review:
First of all , i think this is a realy nice approach to the classic arena fps shooter genre .
Good mechanics and feel although i had a feeling of a delay on the mouse movement , but that wasnt noticable anymore after couple minutes ingame !

First impressions of the graphics and ui where pretty good i must say !

I didn't play enough to know how the community is like but i thinkl this game will only attract people with the same background " Classic fps arena lovers " . And when i read the dev's description off the game i think thats what they are aiming for !  

And best off all its free to play !

So if you are looking for a fun competitve arena shooter , you really should give this a go !

7.5/10 for me here

author: {'steamid': '76561197995423947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1498795723}
review:
If you are a fan of fast-paced arena shooters (quake, unreal tournament, ect.) then you will find that this game stands up to them competently.  The weapons are fun and fluid to use, feel balanced against one another and all feel distinct. 

The community isn't huge but I'm always able to find an active server with human players with at least a modestly playable ping.  (Sometimes on rare occasions I do have to jump regions and join servers located on other continents, but even then the lag is surprisingly minimal). 

Nothing particularly special about this game...no long-term progression or anything like that.  Just pure, no bullshit arena shooter goodness.  I decided to support the devs and buy the game for 10 bucks; i don't feel like what you get for actually buying the game is terribly valuable (mostly just cosmetic stuff), but the game is so darn fun to play that I don't mind paying them for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025287049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1498283415}
review:
Fun for a time. But this isn't how you do free to play. How do we get people who are trying our game to play? I know, let's rob them of a server browser as a premium feature? Oh you in Australia and there's only a server in Europe. Better than nothing right, let's throw them in there. 

Besides that the visuals are pretty good but as far as some of the gameplay goes. Why would you have spawns without adequate respawn protection when you spawn with just a pistol? ??? So if I happen to be spawned in front of an enemy I'm left to fend them off with a pistol with nothing but a good luck?

Press F to use your secret weapon.

Edit: There is a reject game modes that stop you from looking for games with modes you don't want to play which is how you aim yourself into games you want to play as a f2p player but unfortunately like many shooters, you'll have sparse population in non deathmatch servers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139501953', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1498718113}
review:
It's a blast. The incredibly fast movement speed and the advanced movements add a lot of depth to the game, and allow for some really good flanking and strategizing.

My first game I made the host ragequit though, because I actually took the time to understand the advanced dodging and was able to flank the fuck out of them. winning kills were a double kill from me, and it was a 2v2. it was like 48 kills to 25. 

Graphics are good, too. The red and blue really stood out from the background, and despite everything being a blur from moving fast, the models are very well detailed.



Overall, the gameplay is tight and very twitchy and fast, which is a really good for a game trying to be like unreal tournament. Graphics are good. It also seems to be a very active community, which is a blast.


The weapons do look a bit techy and generic, and sometimes it's hard to tell the difference between them. A shotgun should never be confused with an assault rifle. That's my only complaint, really.

Another plus: you can get it for FREE. The core game for FREE.

review:
It's a good game, not my absolute favorite, but it's far better than the crap mega-corporation giants like EA are churning out nowadays.
It feels finished, and it's fun. It has a nice Unreal Tournament feel to it, but at the same time, it's completely different.
The Free Edition has all of the content minus a few maps. 
So, what are you waiting for? Get out there and frag like it's 1999!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046256143', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1512969761}
review:
Simply amazing. The devs honesty about the free version and lack of microtransactions made me want to try out the free version and attempt to get all of my friends on board as well.

After a few matches, the pros and cons that I've reached are pretty simple:

+The matches were fun and intuitive; if you've played Quake or other arenas, you'll probably catch on fast.
+The controls feel good, not clunky or unresponsive.
+Awesome soundtrack.
+Servers are great, not much lag (big + because a lot of F2P FPS games have awful server quality)
+Weapons are familiar, easy to catch on.
-Hopefully more character customizations are released over time, as they seemed a bit lacking from what I could see in the free game so far. (I'm a huge fan of making a custom character, it would be big incentive to have a ton of options for customs)
-US Servers seem a little empty. (only 6 people in my first match, and 0 in my second)
 
I'll likely be playing this on and off until the Quake: Champions releases, easy 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013608095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1497916199}
review: Oh TOXIKK...I really wish you could have done more. Everything's here, the tight, responsive Arena Shooter gameplay, the small maps that are fun and easy to memorize, a great price model of Free to Play, no P2W. What went wrong? Was it a lack of adverisement? Did people see you as a UT knockoff? Who knows. I gave it my all to keep playing this game, but there is no one left to play with. I wish the developers the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006246304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1548430758}
review:
I could've sworn I've already used the phrase "my nipples haven't been this hard since UT2K4" once already this year, but damn it all; here I go again. My areolas could pierce body armor at this point.

Is it fast?
Is it skill-based?
Is it an F2P done right?
Is it a game competing developers should be shaking in their britches from?

Yes, yes, yes and yes.

I wasn't completely sold while doing the tutorial and slugging through my first match, nope.
But 3rd match in, and I've picked up the movement system like it was some repressed memory deep within my reptile brain, ready to be awakened. It's smooth and still brutally hectic, and I love some of the fresh takes it brings to the table.
Soon, I've memorized the maps and their item spawns, probably replacing stuff like the birthdays and whatnot of friends and family. Calculated loss.

And if you could see the dumb grins I make while nailing direct hit rockets across the map, you'd wonder how I'm even capable of such a feat, even less typing this.

It's just that fun. Just try it, it's free. You've only got a couple of hours to lose. Or days. Weeks... You get the point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064378687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1524351665}
review:
I figured any company to make claims this bold about a game to be as full of it as the rest... untill i played this.  If you loved fps in the late 90's and dont play this game at least one time you are literally stealing from yourself!  This is not a game you play to be nostalgic, this is a game you play to add on to those same good memories in a new way.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198063566810', 'num_games_owned': 974, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1691944716}
review:
Super Spiel was die Grafik angeht und (was noch wichtiger ist) auch was das Gamplay angeht. In der Kostenlosen version ist bereits alles wichtige f√ºrs Spiel enthalten! Alles was fehl ist Server Browser und Costimization. 

Die einzelnen Matches sind sehr Fast Paced und es kommst h√§fig vor das man Stirb, das ist allerdings nicht alzu Schlimm(Respawnzeit Standart von 3-5Sec). Man kann einige Modifikatoren ansetzen die das Spiel Noch interessanter machen(z.b. Die K√∂pfe der Besten Spieler werden gr√∂√üer je besser sie sind!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198042581764', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1496606205}
review:
Not a bad game at all, don't think it is, however there's just nothing really all that special here, and there's so few people playing it's not really worth putting your time into. 

Doom 2016 has a far more active community and a killer single player as well, so I'd recommend that if you're looking for a good arena shooter as opposed to this. It's fairly cheap most places as well.
