author: {'steamid': '76561198025565260', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1496502212}
review:
"90% of the people that posted reviews here - have never played unreal games or quake, or doom - or if they have - they sucked at it, big time!"

Its a shiny wannabe with poorly thought out gameplay mechanics. SHAME!
EDIT: It reads like a mashed up babble* - because yer part of the 90% m8! GIT GOOD! 
2nd EDIT: In all fairness - there's a GREAT ammount of correct reactions to my initial review and the comments that can be found bellow - so as a tip of the hat - i'm adding this here. 

I could correct what you see bellow - but i won't, since that was my honest opinion- unfiltered and without ANY MANNERS WHATSOEVER - not willing to change that.

I DO STILL BELIEVE it has poorly thought gameplay mechanics(OPINION - my godly powers stop there - go make your own now!). Now, however, i see it (after a bit more digging) also as an identity crysis - with a large discrepancy between what it was desired to be and what it could and probably should have been advertised AS.

Outside of the above argument - i believe everything you'll find bellow still stands. Even the comments section.
This is called an opinion...and i shall make no excuses for having one. 

Cheers!

TLDR: They over-sold the return of the classics - while delivering something akin to poorly copying someone else's homework.

The fact that they switched to f2p/limmited access should tell you a great deal about the quality of their product. 

The predecessors/oldies - or prime time HEAVIES of the arena shooters had raw mouse input and game dynamic tied in by fine-tuned gameplay mechanics and INTUITIVE level design. THIS ONE DOESN'T.
I had spent more time trying to figure out how to balance the mouse sensitivity due to the overwhelming pointless control development - than actual in game time. 

However - my short game time was enough to reveal just how poorly thought this game was...

Let me make it clear then.

1.Weapon placement is an issue here since its not intuitive at the least. Spawn locations are another issue.

2. Weapon reaction speed is similar to throwing a rubber chicken across the room. 
You launch a rocket and it takes as much time to reach a wall 5 feet away - as it takes me to deep fry a FUCKING GOAT.
Make an arena shooter and not build the weaponry in a proper manner? Why?

3.Dodging....is faster than the projectile speed. 

4. Lack of nuance in development. It has features the classics did (although twisted in a nonhumorous manner) but it didn't build up on them. What does it bring to the table - what is original?
NOTHING - that's what. You can find character customization in almost every f2p multiplayer FPS ON STEAM!

It actually makes what was once good about classics and prime time heavies like DOOM, deeply unsatisfying. Which is sad - very sad. 

5. It over promises and under-delivers. TO this day - you'd have a better arena shooter feeling trying out quake 3 or quake 3 live. Christ - even Unreal 2001!

This - does not handle- nor feel like one of the classics - which puts it UNDER the bar. Hire better marketing next time!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964252430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1496495187}
review:
Well if the game worked maybe it would have been fun???
I have a gtx980ti, a 6700k and 32gb of ram in 3440x1440p i am not able to get the game running any higher than 26fps even at the lowest settings and i am able to run stuff like DOOM maxed out at that res with a minimum framerate of 54fps and average well beyond 60fps.
So maybe if i ran it at some lower res and in 16:9 using the borderless gaming program i could have had it running but it does not look like it would be worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999471542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1526717047}
review:
Like Unreal Tournament 3, but faster movements and more modern. It looks really good.
You can try it for free, although the free version is limited. 
Not recommended on 32-bit systems because some maps require more memory than 4Gb.

What I dislike is that it goes out of 1st person view inside a vehicle. First person shooters should always be in first person view, or you should at least be able to choose it (hence "first person").
Also, in multi player games I used to end up in either one of only two maps, only these two maps is a bit boring. Last time I played it this was not the case anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170275002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1496440153}
review:
Free multiplayer-only version is OK. Tutorial is easy. 
Runs well, though controls are somewhat creepy [LShift]+[w]+[Space] 
Player's models are not realistic. 
Personally i wouldn't recommend paid version. Yet, the free version is playable to some extent. 
Sadly there are too few players online; and the impact of cheaters is more significant in small player base.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056759317', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1496375887}
review:
This game is annoying. It's buggy. The interface is clunky and unpolished. The graphics look good if you don't pay attention, but if you do you'll realize it's just a mess of hyper bright neon colors. 

As far as gameplay goes, I'm not one to critique. I'm not a fan of the quake arena shooter genre, but if that's your thing, then maybe you will have fun. That being said, I mainly play fps games, so if I don't like the arena shooter genre, then maybe that's because it's actually bad.
The game's not even something that's fun to just pick up and casually play for a bit.

Another thing that they do that i'm not a fan of, is that they don't have a singleplayer mode. Multiplayer only games are a recent thing. It used to be that games would have a story mode and a multiplayer mode, that way there was an explanation and context to the multiplayer mode. Toxikk doesn't have a single player mode. That means when you play the multiplayer mode, you won't have any context to what the hell is going. Something like rocket league, for example, doesn't need a story mode, because it's impersonal. When you are playing Toxikk though, and you are playing as opposing factions, not having a backstory is frustrating. There are other games that do this, such as league of legends or overwatch, but they make up for it by giving their characters personality, so it doesn't feel as half assed.

I would commend Toxikk for having good techincal(video/audio) customization options, but I think at this point those kind of things should be a given.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074569591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1574589397}
review: Toxikk reminds me of Perfect Dark, Timesplitters with all of it's cyber punk atmosphere and weapons. It reminds me of Quake and Unreal which was the direction anyways. To make a game that actually "feels" like 1999 again has proven to be quite difficult since the decline of Arena Twitch Based like shooters. I love the fact that even though it is modern and a lot of graphics and textures are painted across the map. I hardly ever find myself trying to focus away from the world because of the amount of detail or within the environment or losing them by the distraction of it. I love perfect dark I love arena based shooters I love quake and now I love Toxikk! Great job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083535344', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1612686850}
review:
You don't reload. I spent quite some time looking for a review that would tell me whether or not the modern shooter gimmik of actually reloading was a thing in this, and no. It is not.

Your average speed is pretty damn fast, your average life is pretty damn short, weapons on the map (fuck loadouts), armor and health drops (no regenerating health) and rocketjumping is, in fact, possible.

First time booting this up was like my first time playing DOOM all over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001174770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1424154044}
review:
From the short period of time that I owned this game, I can not recommend it to anyone looking to get into arena shooters, especially when Unreal Tournament is still in pre-alpha.

The HUD is absolutely horrid.  Epic Games detailed why manipulating the HUD on the Z axis causes problems with readability when moving at high speeds, and the HUD in Toxikk is difficult to read as a result of that transformation.  On top of that, the HUD was made using neon colors, which makes it even more difficult to read against bright backgrounds, or in some of the neon city maps.

And if you are still thinking about buying this game, download the UDK and check out the sample game (which is just stripped down UT3.)  Notice how the game feels very similar.  If I had a guess, the Toxikk devs took the movement model from the UDK sample game, and just turned it into Toxikk.

On top of that, everything just feels like a very uninspired UT clone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082842374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1496334320}
review:
This game is kick ass; I wish it were more populated. Having only played the free "Demo" I can see many hours of heart-pounding rampage in my future. 

I'm having one very strange problem though. I was playing a match and my guy decided he was done and layed down for about 45sec. During this time I could not do ANYTHING, I could not move or look around. Not even  alt+F4 or Ctrl+Esc would work. I had to Ctrl+Alt+Delete and close TOXIKK via task manager.  Is anyone else experiencing this, or is it jut my PC?

author: {'steamid': '76561198004057239', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1507478219}
review:
I played 2 matches so far. The gameplay is fast and simple, although the weaponn cycling got to be a problem cuz you can carry so many, it was fun and very reminiscent of Doom. Both cause of the weapon cycling like you're carrying an arsenal on your back and the way the pick ups are in this arena style. It really is great for anyone looking for a decent competitive shooter experience that you can just pick up and play. I'm not a very good gamer when it comes to shooters, but I was neck and neck for first place in the second match. It's easy to pick up. 

This is more of an at-a-glance kind of review, so for anyone thats debating whether to pick it up: do. It was a very positive experience and worth even getting the full version for at some point

author: {'steamid': '76561198068688724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1495793702}
review:
when i was younger i used to play alot of quake and unreal and i tought that id never get to play a new release with the same feeling

i downloaded this game and played it a few hours,and honestly i really enjoy playing it,its a really fun and addicting game to get into

PROS
-Fast paced and good feeling of movement
-the gunplay is very nice and responsive and when you frag someone you really feel like you fragged them
-FREE MODE: its not perfect and it locks some things off but its really not a problem for someone who wants a fun shooter
-Game modes are plenty from deathmatch,ctf,tdm and so on
-Skillballance is pretty nice,maybe because i got lucky but so far i had no problem finding people with the same skill level

CONS
-MATCHMAKING is slow as hell and sometimes id get thrown into the same game over and over and over again its like the servers are empty but it doesn seem like it
-no server browser kinda goes with the first con,i know the game must have limitations so thers a appeal to buy it
but id rather have the server browser then the mutators as i havent found any games with mutators
-everyone seems to have the abbility to pick up guns instantly,i prfered the good ol 1 gun spawn for everyone,it got cheap when people camped the rocket launcher but it wasnt too much of a biggie,i just  think the respawn time for the stronger weapons should be longer
-Learning curve is kind of steep if your completley new to these kinds of games but if you got patience it can be over come

other then that i really recomend the game to anyone who loves fast paced arena shooters my final score is a 7/10 for the free version but i must say the game got me into it just after 3 hours and i will defenetly buy it as soon as possible

author: {'steamid': '76561197998068380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 131668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1585938985}
review:
Pros

Excellent throwback to old-school arena FPS
The developers of Toxikk are extremely passionate about the game, and it shows in the gameplay.
The weapons are varied and satisfying to use, the movement is extremely fluid, and the game looks excellent.
The gameplay is similar to the oldschool greats, such as UT99 and UT2004, but Toxikk has enough of its own to set itself apart, instead of being a carbon copy that feeds on nostalgia.
thermoplasticsKeith Dean
Polished and optimized
Despite being in early access (written on the 23rd of August, 2016), Toxikk is extremely polished and well optimized.
The core gameplay feels like a finished product, and even on an average-spec laptop, Toxikk runs with a smooth framerate.
Keith Dean
Developers that care
Toxikk has a development team that genuinely cares about the product. You can feel the developer's passion throughout the gameplay.
Not only has this delivered an excellent product so far, but it means there is a far more optimistic outlook for the future of the game.
BryanKeith Dean
Free demo alongside full release
When Toxikk is released (9/9/2016), a free demo will be released alongside it.
This way, you can see if Toxikk is the right game for you without committing to a purchase right away.
This demo will allow you to play on official servers on a limited amount of maps.
The full version will have leaderboards, all maps, achievements, character customization and custom content (maps, weapons etc)

Cons

Low playerbase (for now)
This is a frequent complaint from newcomers.
As of now, Toxikk has a very low playerbase.
However, this is due to the developers intentionally doing zero advertising since it was released on Steam in Early Access.
Once the game is closer to its release day (9/9/2016), the developers will shift their focus to marketing to build the playerbase.
Keith Dean
Future is uncertain
Due to early access, and a current lack of players, the future success of Toxikk is uncertain.
It may do well, and gain a sizable playerbase, it may gain a small group of dedicated players, or it may flop.
If you are unsure whether or not it will be a success, wait for the full release to play the free demo.
Keith Dean
Currently in early access
Early Access is not a popular concept for everybody.
It has happened all too frequently where an Early Access game has had development dropped midway through the process, leaving unhappy customers with an unfinished game.
However, Toxikk has received solid, consistent support, and its release date has been announced.
ThomasHuayra
Yet to be released
The game is still in development (August 2016). There's no playable alpha, beta or early access yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137427725', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1495610242}
review:
I'll preface this with this: I really want to recommend this game but I just can't in good concience as-is.
The miserable lag compensation (stemming from wild rubber banding and poor hit detection) and reliance on a central server for hosting while playing on a healthy 5Mbit network connection with nothing else running keeps me from recommending this game, especially to anyone in the Western US. Which is a shame because the mechanics and graphics are polished to a reflective sheen. Movement is remarkably responsive and feels good, which rather surprised me because for some unknown reason most Unreal Engine games feel floaty and unsatisfying to move around in. 

The graphics are beautiful when they are not a suffering from a bloom overdose and even on a low end RX 460 the framerate stays at a steady 60+FPS. Not much for me to talk about here though as I don't care much about visuals, being the kind of person who still happily plays Sonic Adventure and honestly doesn't care that it looks terrible even compared to Fallout: New Vegas.

The gun combat has a good weight to it, with the weapons giving a felt kick with each shot and realistically jerking the bullet pattern upwards and inconsistantly out wide being a feature I didn't know I wanted until it felt like I had it. But the weapons themselves are lacking in balance, with the Plasma Caster being utterly useless when the Assault Rifle and Pistol do the same damage per hit but have a higher DPS and are hitscan, making even the Sniper Rifle look pathetic despite it's 70 damage body shoots. The rest of the gear is a cavalcade of bog standard shooter weaponry that behaves the way it has since the dawn of shooters, a M1+W flamethrower, a spammy rocket launcher, and a "overpowered" shotgun. 

But again, none of that really matters when there is no way to properly "track" a opponent as you are stuck teleporting around the battlefield with every alternate step. Even whilst walking in a perfectly straight line you will uncomfortably jerk forward every so often. Finally, hitting your enemy is difficult bordering on impossible when your opponent may or may not be occupying the same space on the server as they are on your screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041162922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1496075729}
review: A very solid successor game to the classic fragging days of Quake and Unreal Tournament. From what I understand, the developers seriously invested in this game to recreate a modern fast-paced shooter. Movement is quick and responsive, action is fast and neverending, and you'll always be moving on your feet to survive. Even better is that there is an active community of players keeping this game alive. Strongly recommended for anyone looking for 90s yet modern fragfest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126855988', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1589361973}
review:
9/10

TOXIKK invokes the arena shooters of old with blistering speed, overwhelming firepower, and a banging metal soundtrack to boot. The free edition contains only the multiplayer (sans customization) and access to all the maps. Best part? No microtransactions! No hats, no crates, nothing! Next time I play this, I will be paying for it just to support the devs.
What are you waiting for?
It's free!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131572060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1506504896}
review:
My play time seems to be in very small amount but it's already enough for me to write my experience and thoughts in this game. I rarely review games (this is my 2nd review) and I only review games that are worthy of my attention and actually enjoyed it ('cause I rarely enjoy f2p games)

To be honest, this game gives me the feeling of Unreal Tournament 3, my all time favorite shooter game. The weapon design in this game is visually amazing. 

It's also one of those rare f2p games that actually got the meaning of "f2p" correct. All WEAPONS AND MAPS AND GAME MODES are available for FREE. This is a pretty great deal and I'm not getting the feeling of "pay 2 win" stuff here. Customization and single-player (which I don't mind of not being free) are premium. 

I may have not explored all the maps yet but there are some flaws. While the map theme and design is great, it lacks the space. I mean, it's kind of tight. I guess that's my only negative point in this game.

Do I recommend this game? Definitely. Will totally buy the premium when I have money now

review: i like it, its fun, and i enjoy that you can play all maps in multiplayer for free. That said, theres no aiming system whatsoever. So youre stuck using crosshairs and everyones running around chaoticly firing at walls most of the time. Another thing i didnt enjoy was the fact it took a long time to exit the game, they used my browser to bring up their website and all that slowed down my computer for a few minutes. they also changed my computer resolution. If you can handle all that then its a really good game for a free to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045321167', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1608491998}
review:
Even though it barrows a lot of mechanics from Unreal Tournament. The gunplay is different as it leans towards "ballistic" based weapons than "projectile" based weapons from Unreal Tournament. Which is good, because getting into the game is somewhat newbie friendly compared games like Quake Live or Reflex Arena.

There is about 80-100 peeps during peak hours, so finding a match isn't too bad. However, it is sad that not a lot of people play this. Also, this game isn't for Linux! :( Maybe if it was for Linux, more peeps would play this...oh well. 

However, Toxikk is still a fun game that doesn't require a high skill gap compared to other arena shooters like Quake.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982604685', 'num_games_owned': 1494, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1494805945}
review:
A) The ranking system is absolute shit.
1. You get rankups for gaining exp, which you get for doing literally everything, including completing solo missions against bots (which are insanely good at higher levels, but cannot complete mission objectives for shit, and there is no way to make them cooperate either).
2. Getting a rankup matches you against tougher players (even though you were just playing against bots).
3. Those tougher players then proceed to completely wipe the floor with you. Great.

B) Advanced movement system is crap.
1. You have a kind of dash functionality by pressing shift while moving or double-tapping WASD keys, but it has a weird delay in between. If you double-tap, then it is not that noticeable, but if you shift-WASD, then it becomes glaringly obvious and annoying as fuck, because you can't chain it immediately, and there is no cooldown bar anywhere as far as I noticed.
2. There is a double-jump functionality, but unlike another game that implemented it right, Shootmania Storm, this game's second jump only has a very short time window to be activated. You press jump once, then you have about half a second or you cannot double-jump anymore. Again, annoying.
3. Wall-jumping is extremely unintuitive. In Shootmania Storm this was IMO done right - to jump off a wall, you run into it and press jump while moving TOWARDS the wall (if wall on left, hold A + jump). In a tighter space you could chain this indefinitely, provided you have the skill. In this game, however, for some dumb reason you have to LOOK AND MOVE AWAY from the wall to jump off it! But the big problem with this is that this game has strafing, meaning if you hold A/D midair, you bend your trajectory, which makes wall-jumping almost impossible since you have to jump towards a wall, time the absolutely perfect 1ms time window when you're touching the wall (assuming you want to jump to the same height across a hole in the ground; wait any longer and you lose the height), then look away, hold the opposite direction key (if wall on left, hold D), AND tap DASH, not jump. If that isn't bullshit, I don't know what is. It's an extremely useless game mechanic as-is, since only the absolutely hardcore players are going to use it with such a low chance of success.
Also, the wall jump essentially jumps horizontally, barely upwards at all, so cannot be used to scale walls. Shootmania Storm was so much more fun in this regard.

The new Quake is so much more enjoyable in both regards.

The flamethrower is OP in close encounters, has an insane range, and obscures the view for everyone.
The rocket launcher, in turn, has very weak AOE damage - direct hit does 100 damage, while a hit right below the feet/right next to the player does only about 30. One would imagine that the damage would decrease based on range, but there is a huge drop between a direct hit and the tiniest miss.

The good parts:
nice visuals,
decent guns (but maybe a bit too many of them, like there's essentially 2 machine guns, except one does more damage to machines, and the BFG seems kind of unnecessary),
decent game modes (but for some reason, they've renamed all the well known names, i.e. deathmatch = bloodlust, team deathmatch = squad assault, capture the flag = cell capture)

but that's not enough to outweigh the negatives for me.
If I could just somehow derank to play with normal people and not quake veterans, that would be nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082693172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1558777902}
review:
Remember the good old multiplayer game Rise Of Triads and it's gibs and gore? If not you missed out on a lot of fun, but for those who remember those good old days when we played with our friends and just enjoyed the violence, this game will bring you back.
TOXIKK is an extremely fun multiplayer game. Recently the developers released a free edition of the game which has most of the features, but still you notice the difference, for example you can't customize your player. But still it is a ton of fun. I remember seeing it and I didn't want to buy it for some reason, but then couple of days later I saw the Free Edition being released. So I decided to give it a try and it is fun!
Great graphics, great scenery, extreme fun, blowing enemies up, that is what makes this game awesome. Wish I had money for the full version, but still I am glad we have the free edition with us and the fun it brings!
I give TOXIKK 9.5/10
Not a straight 10/10 since I can't edit my player but still I love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198379025307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1495742578}
review:
Oh my god.

I honestly think what is above is all I need. And bare in mind I have played 20 minutes of this game, it is AMAZING.

1 - Paying aspect. Aside from the fact that the free version of this game has a great proportion of the game in the first place, I really love the fact you can buy no item, and it is to stay that way, if anything a free game/cheaper game should have DLC, but it does not, and everyone that plays this game appriciates this, thank you.

2 - How fun the game is in general. I have just completed the first mission of this game, slightly stressful and hard but extremely enjoyable, how this game is advertised is it being how a proper old game should be in the first place, I never really played old school games because of my age, but I feel I should, because it's damn fun.

3 - How the game runs. Runs like a gem, not a demanding game which matches my low end graphics card, but do not get me wrong is this game beautiful. 



I still need to hop onto the online proportion of the game and acctually buy it because I 100% want this game in my steam library, but I can see this game, presuming the multiplayer aspect is fun have a good 100 hours of gameplay on my account, it's terrific! Wow!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010864973', 'num_games_owned': 787, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1494279058}
review:
There's a reason that quake hasn't seen a sequel in quite some time. Toxikk is a relic of the past, an archaic style of first person shooter that brings back the 90s feel of "have a rocket launcher or have a loss." Maybe I'm just too used to modern day shooters, but even arcade style games like Team Fortress and Overwatch still have a balance that allows them to flourish in their own right. Toxikk is just the child of a bygone era and suffers for it.

At least it's free? Well, I'd rather pay for a game I enjoy than play one I couldn't care less about.

review: Toxikk is a damn solid arena shooter. It's fast, it's very fluid, the gunplay is satisfying, and it has the movement system from UT, but you keep your momentum. And besides, you can't go wrong. You can play the multiplayer segment for free, just to try it out. The only reason I haven't purchased the full game is because I'm broke. So yeah. The game is damn good. The only thing I can nit pick about is the fact that I don't see much difference between low and ultra settings. (IMO)

author: {'steamid': '76561198051080299', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1493950497}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019988173', 'num_games_owned': 992, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1533030772}
review:
Detailed review ahead.

10/10 Classic arena fps gameplay.  If you liked Unreal Tournament, or are a previous Quake player looking for a different style, this game is great either way.

10/10 Graphics.  They are really well optimized, which is all I really look for, and quite pretty, as an added bonus, and the particles don't kill your GPU as other games might.

7/10 Sound.  The design is really well, and it sounds good, but sometimes it's hard to pinpoint exactly where things are, although this might just be my sound driver.

7/10 Customization.  I've yet to expirement with too much of the HUD, and crosshair changes are kinda confusing at first, but the mouse and keybind settings are where it's at.  You have your bread-and-butter keybinds, you can use any wasd or esdf set up you want, however the mouse settings lack a bit.  You can't set up real mouse acceleration curves, at least to my knowledge, but you can set up acceleration damping.

10/10 Resource allocation.  For myself, it runs at around 1.7 GB of RAM, and takes up 33% of an i7-6700 3.4 GHz processor, and load times are ridiculously fast on a 512 GB SSD, and on a 2TB HDD.  At maximum settings, takes up around 43% of my Nvidia GTX 1070.

10/10 Weapons and Hitreg.  All weapons work just as they should, rocket and other projectile speeds are predictable and great, sniper and headshot registration is amazing, and the alt fires they have work really well, aside from the rocket launcher.

8/10 Movement.  Air control is lacking, but to be expected, and you do have SOME control of where you end up, just not as much as CPMA or Team Fortress 2 or something.  Dashing has a decent cooldown, but sometimes your input gets eaten.  Walljumps and double jumps work smoothly and fluidly, jump height is fantastic for each and every map.  The only movement thing that CAN be wonky, and it's mostly because of the dash timing is the slope jumps. movespeed is fast but not blazing, and you can reliably hit targets once you get muscle memory for aim down. crouch speed is good, not too fast, not too slow.

7/10 Vehicles and Combating them.  The vehicles I can personally say I'm not a fan of, I definitely prefer ground combat, although the modes where you fight them can be extremely fun, taking down a rather large mech with pure firepower feels pretty nice, although they respawn rather fast.

8/ 10 Ground abilities in misc. gamemodes.  You have a stealth ability, the ability to feign death, and a jetpack.  I've not much experience with the jetpack, but feigning death can be useful when timed correctly, especially because you can't tell how much health somebody when they are damaged.  The stealth is ok, makes a relatively loud noise and lasts a very short amount of time, but can be used to get away from a chasing enemy if they don't have headphones.

9/10 Skill factor.  Aiming and movement go hand in hand in this game, you stop you die.  Weapons like the plasma rifle are used for suppression, hitscan used for chasing and securing kills, and they are all great at what they are meant to do.  The only thing that barely limits this is the aforementioned hurt sounds not changing based on HP left, but this is a small factor in the grand scheme of the game.

9/10 HUD and Vitals.  The hud is really good, crosshairs are visible, ammo is easy to see, health is easy to see, the only reason this is a 9/10 is the armor display is rather small.

10/10 Maps and design.  Powerful items are out of the way, health is well distributed, be it a team gamemode or 1v1, armor is strong, so it isn't in the middle of maps usually, and is a rare pickup.  Weapons are plentiful and in appropriate locations for their use.  Maps are pretty and movement through them is fluid and precise, with no sticky geometry in most places.  Visibility is really good, and picking out targets is a breeze.  Chokepoints at flag captures and capture objectives are nice, and health pickups aren't readily available at them all the time, so taking an objective isn't a completely one sided fight.  Respawn timers are frequent enough to be available when you need them, but not so short as so someone on a rampage can continue indefinitely.  The map selection is decent, and there is even the classic DooM 2 Map 7, AKA Dead Simple.

All around a great AFPS, if you are a fan, play this game, and I personally bought the full game to help support some pretty cool devs.  The game is exactly as it is marketed, with a modern twist.  I really like this game, and it's free, so why not give it a try?

review: I was at odds when i first statted this game up. 15$ for an unreal tornament clone with just a different skin over it?? well that changed when i put some time into the game. Its oddly more fun and easyer to play this game and the speed is also fast pase dont think you can jump into a game and move sluggishly you will get smooshed. The Music is cool the maps well there not bad the olayout is reall tight for deathmatch matchs and the vehicals are alright. The free to play part really is free and there is no pay to win aspects you just get more for the full game. i plan on buying it when it goes on sale and i have recomended it to many of my firneds. If you r looking for a fast FPS thats really fun and easy to pick up (mostly to us old school kind of guys) i highly recomend grabbing this game you wont regret it unless you run acrost mee in the game lol.

review:
Great game. 
I will very definately reccomend, as it is another one of those arena shooters that we are all bound to love.
Though from my first look i would suggest some improvements:
One is for weapons, most of them are bullet weapons but some of them could use some variety. There are about 6 bullet weapons, if i remember correctly.

They look similiar too. This could be easily fixed with simple color changes with specific ones on each weapon.

As for the other suggestion, the free version of the game doesnt allow for botmatches, this hollows my gears. I get that you try to make money, but you could try and limit the botmatches to a singular map or something like that.

I really feel like some of my suggestions could make the game better. If any developer is interested in contacting me i would surely give ideas. [spoiler] i can only think of minor fixes at the moment[/spoiler]

EDIT: Whoa, we can play with bots now, in a singular map. Hmmm

Going to give it a Meh rating, atm.  I think the Ceberus needs a little nerf in terms of rocket speed, or direct hit damage.  I can back this up by stating that most matches are actually won using these most of the time.  You have to camp the Ceberus with one just to prevent the upper hand.  

My solution (instead of a nerf) is make it that you can only single spawn some weapons, meaing there can only be 1 during the match the entire time.  The person who dies with the weapon starts the cooldown on that spawn for another to spawn.  

(But of course that will never happen because most of you would prefer rocket spam over true aim.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198059922570', 'num_games_owned': 1024, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1506435885}
review:
TOXIKK is a First Person Shooter made by german Reaktor studio in 2015, first in early access, now fully available in demo and full version. What we see here is an underrated game really small community, yet not bad at all.

Story background is focused around a warfare between two military corporations, on various maps mercenaries are killing each other scoring frags like in 1999.
Gameplay is highly inspired by Doom, Quake and Halo, we have maps filled with many weapons we can have all at once, rocket jumps, running on walls, also vehicles on bigger maps.
The game offer us 3 multiplayer modes:Deathmatch,Team Deathmatch and Capture the Flag. All of them on classic rules. Every match gives us XP and specialisation rank, they both unlock cosmetic elements to our armor. Also boot camp offers some singleplayer missions meant to introduce us to game mechanics.
Graphics, music and climate are genius, but we cannot expect many players to be online, so you will most likely encounter many bots.
TOXIKK also has full support for Steam Workshop, so you can always host a game on fan-made map or with Serious Sam skin.

If only more players would be online it would be perfect, 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012790164', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1584303227}
review: This game pretty much combines all the best parts of Unreal Tournament - if you like arena shooters just go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097099850', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1492526864}
review:
[h1] so i used to play a lot of unreal tournament back when i was a kid. it was a lot of fun back then, and even today.
then, i found toxikk.
it's a very interesting concept done well. you really feel like you play an arena shooter like ut or q3a but with much better graphics. also, it's a f2p game with a very good model, aka no microtransactions or "optional" dlc and best of all, it's not pay to win. [/h1]

pros:
+great graphics even on low settings (that's because this game runs on unreal engine 3)
+awesome soundtrack
+great and balanced weapons (the flamethrower doesn't have the afterburn effect, that's how good it is)
+f2ps have access to most of the content
+all cosmetics are free (no unusuals or stranges here)
+it's a modern arena shooter executed well

cons:
-can't think of any

final rating:
[h1] 9/10 [/h1]
definetly buying the full edition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367400144', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1492411381}
review:
Well, where do I begin? With the fact that this game is an amazing re-creation of vintage FPS games? How about pointing out the great in-game design of the playing field? I'll just keep it simple.

This game is simply amazing. The graphics are awesome, the movement is fun, and the idea is timeless. I was browsing through the free-to-play FPS games to kill some time while I got my old copy of Quake 3 Arena set up again and thats when I came across this game. If I'm just being honest, this is pretty much a knockoff of Q3A, but it's dissimilar enough that I really don't mind as it's still a very fun game to play. Mind you, I've only been playing the free version which, unfortunately, only comes with one playable map. However, that one map has got me hooked. I think that the developers did an amazing job with re-creation, and took great care in crafting the playing field. The gameplay is highly immersive, and will keep you playing for hours (if you're into this kind of game). The movement mechanics are pretty fun, too, and make it a very fast-paced game, just like Quake.

The BIGGEST problem I can see is that there is a very, very small payer-base for this game. It's unfortunate, too. I would have guessed that more people would be into this kind of game as well, but I guess times change and people's gaming priorities will as well. If you do come across this review, though, and you've gotten this far.. Please give it a shot? It really is worth the free download at the VERY least. As for myself, considering buying the full download, I'll most definitely reconsider if I start noticing a larger player-base. For now I'm perfectly content with the free version.

Thanks for the amazing game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1656592849}
review:
TOXIKK is a free to play (demo) PVP arena FPS.  It worked in Win 10, sounded ok, played ok, looked good.  The free to play accounts are limited to PVP matches and have to unlock some maps with in-game currency.  Gameplay is like Quake and UnReal Tournaments.  Artwork is modern and better looking,  the maps are better looking, game using UnReal 3 engine.  Has some Vehicular combat maps, where some players can fly a bomber or drive a jeep.  You can upgrade your game to the Full game by buying the upgrade from steam store.

Arena shooters, at their core, are loosely defined by the following standards - 1) players compete in skirmishes in enclosed arenas, 2) where all players begin equally with only base weaponry and no disparate abilities, 3) where weapons and pickups must be acquired and controlled from the map and are not obtained through loadouts or killstreaks, and 4) that possess a definable system of locomotion that encourages constant map rotation and decreases the viability of camping.  

For more info:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S8fa6aTzoLk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mfLKrcNowl4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UnGDfrWl7ic

https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/tag/toxikk/

http://www.pcgamer.com/toxikk-early-access-impressions/

http://www.outofeight.info/2016/09/toxikk-gameplay-review.html

http://www.gameskinny.com/p4wwu/toxikk-review-the-arena-fps-is-back

http://www.honestgamers.com/13116/pc/toxikk/review.html

http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/toxikk

https://www.heypoorplayer.com/2016/09/23/toxikk-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561197982112350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1492099543}
review:
Great Game!

Great F2P Model, No MIRCO CRAP!!!

TOXIKK dam near nails the feeling of the classics like Unreal and Quake, the speed, the movment, fast gameplay.

NO PERKS, NO GEAR, NO LEVELS that effect gameplay, its all skill based, this is how pvp FPS games should be, but sadly in this COD era we are in now a days great games like this are not very popular.

TOXIKK looks great, plays smooth, and its optimized very well, I would Def give this Arena PVP FPS a Thumbs UP!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966882693', 'num_games_owned': 3109, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1491335826}
review: If Reflex Arena is the spiritual successor to Quake 3, this is the spiritual successor to UT'99. Between the two games I feel like TOXIKK is more fun to just pick up and play, as Reflex Arena is hardcore for the sake of being hardcore and is meant for hardcore Quake fans plain and simple. TOXIKK plays a lot more like UT with the dodge strafing and the overall feel of the weapons, not to mention the look and the game modes. Honestly between TOXIKK and the UT Alpha, I'd rather play TOXIKK (even though I enjoy both). TOXIKK is a lot of fun and it's one of the most polished feeling shooters I've played in a long time. I really look forward to putting many more hours into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967060366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1525024766}
review:
This is an excellent modern AFPS, clearly more influence by UT then it is Q3. Weapons feel nicely balance and game speed seems spot on without being too frantic. 

Two things I wished were better, however.

1. Gibs are a bit lackluster, not much blood or particles to them
2. No voice over for things like Double Kills or bot taunts.

Otherwise a perfect AFPS in my opinion that any UT fan should play and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215767357', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1491954254}
review:
The gameplay is pretty fantastic, but it needs a real ladder system to get people hooked, like CS did.
The game runs decently, not perfect, but alright.
There isn't too much content, but the content that is there is fantastic, I love the small team sizes, but the big ones are still fun.

Overall, the game is fantastic, but you can't expect the kind of things I'm asking for as a free game. If the P2P game is ¬£11, then it needs to have ¬£11 more content than the free edition. But it doesn't. Add a Ladder que for Premium, 

84/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198008749599', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1671140766}
review:
TOXIKK is a very solid arena shooter. Now I am not a huge fan of arena shooters (I only played a little bit of Unreal Tournament) so I can‚Äôt compare it to other games but I can judge it on its own. TOXIKK successfully brings that old school feeling to a new package. Gameplay is polished, smooth and of course requires a little bit of skill. The graphics are very good, map design seams fine, weapons are good, the game is well optimized. Overall I think this game has a lot of good things going for it except for one major problem ‚Äì its player base.

TOXIKK averages around 30 players per month. It is very difficult to find a match with actual people in it. Granted I played the free version and you might be able to find people with server browser which is offered in paid version. But the devs are trying to populate the game by offering it for free with some features locked and having weekly events. They are taking good steps but I don‚Äôt really know what else they can do. They made a good game but nobody plays it, it‚Äôs unfortunate. So if you like arena shooters you should definitely give TOXIKK a try, it‚Äôs free anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072199892', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1490147131}
review:
BOUGHT THE FULL GAME FOR 14.99 AND STILL 2.5 HOURS LATER NOTHING IS UNLOCKED AND KEEPS ASKING FOR ME TO BUY AND WONT LET ME USE THE FEATURES. WAITING ONE DAY THEN REFUNDING IF IT DOESNT GO  THROUGH. EITHER WAY SHOULD HAVE BEEN SOMEWHAT INSTANT. WILL UPDATE IF IT EVER HONORS MY PURCHASE AND CHANGE RATING...

GAMEPLAY DEFINITELY HAS AN UNREAL TOURNEY FEEL AND GOOD ARENA FPS.

UPDATE: Issue was resolved after two days. Still not a bad game but mostly dead. 1 other real player if your lucky. bots.bots,bots,bots. Some are AI and some are hacks. gameplay is fluid,decent looking enough and runs well. Some minor flaws but nothing game breaking. Sadly, no one plays. They need a new price model because the free map (one single free map) is ridiculous. yes, u can grind the heck out of it and try to buy other maps. but why bother. just pay the 15 bucks. right? i see nothing wrong with that in theory. others must though because no one is apparently willing to shell out 15 bucks for the rest of the maps or grind to unlock them.
            it is a shame though because the game could be fun and nothing is missing element wise except maybe some fancy frills like skins for your player (which at one time a moot point, is exactly not only viable its a flourishing option. what i can't see me? so what you can see me! look at overwatch. Blizz makes booku dough off their skins and tons of other FP perspectives do as well.)
  I support this game and reccomend it. I do not support the business model solely because its a fringe try and its not working. Put this thing on heavy sale for a limited time to rake in the players. I;m glad to see a game thats not looking for moby dick with the RNG god worship and whale hunting. But this model isnt bringing in the people a solid title like this should. Might be neccessary for them to figt fire with fire and give in to full free play with maps unlocked and offer subscriptions or weekly boxes of RNG goodness/badness to those who have already purchased the full game. its doable. its sad, and shouldnt even be necessary. But the servers are dead. its a sad state of affairs when a publisher is punished and a community in turn, for that publisher only trying to be reasonable and not hop on the "milk our clientele' as hard as we can and F the 99percent" route. I truely and genuinely hope for this game to blowup in popularity. it has more than just " potential  " it even has justification. It just needs a digital defibulator and some awareness. And sadly thats either not gonna happen probably, or end up becoming a free for base pay for frills and destroy the playerbase in the process. Luckily there barelyt is a playerbase to sadden. Mybe even hop on the VR bandwagon? I know id play on vive. Or cross-platform play. PS4 at least, and combine the servers so PC people play with ps4 people. at least initially then seperate the player base once you have one? IDK im at a total loss for what route these guys should go and its shame. but they need to do something. and something good. fast.

yes i reccomend this title, so much so that i've tried to get people to play and tried streaming it even. I just cant sit around waiting when there are games like doom,prey coming up, and other arena fast paced shooters coming back up out of resserection including UT4 which has been in testing freebie slacker to hell with the game let the public develop it" hell since forever. Good luck toxikk i hope to see u on the best sller list with a workable prodeuct and tons of people. And when they come or come back, i and many others will too. As hypocritical as it sounds it s just the sad fact. The truth can be toxic. Or Toxikk...

author: {'steamid': '76561198030040949', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1499033311}
review:
You've heard of Quake, right?  And probably Unreal Tournament.  You know, two of the greatest FPS's ever made.  But what about Counter-Strike and Team Fortress and all those games in my library I have 1000+ hours in?  Those games were mods of Quake.  MODS.  Quake started it all.  Unreal Tournament was released during the same time.  I personally like Quake better.

If you, like me, weren't around during the time Quake was popular and Counter-Strike was just getting started, then give this game a try.  It's like UT99 remastered.  The new Doom's multiplayer should be like this.

But yeah, enough yammering.  They just don't make games like this anymore.  And it's free, so download it if you're into arena shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083213902', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1579231767}
review:
Toxikk is an amazing game if you're a fan of Unreal Tournament, and it's free!
I played about 2 hours of it before I ended up buying the full game, the game is plenty of fun.
Pros: 
+ Decent Graphics.
+ Music is on point.
+ Maps are fun to play on, with fair elevations and no particular weapon has an advantage.
+ Every player, be it and F2P or someone who bought the game, is at the same level.
+ It's free!!! 
+ Gameplay is fast pace and nice.
+Devs keep updating and tweaking the game.

Cons:
- Not enough players at the moment (You don't even miss the "botplay" part of the game because there aren't enough players so you're playing bots anyway)
- Vehicles are a bit clunky and weird to play with but that's okay.

Verdict:
Even if you aren't willing to buy the game, just play is because it's truly free to play, as in you don't have microtransactions, special DLCs and now they've even made all maps available to everyone, and this is rare enough these days. When you start, you don't feel like you're at a disadvantage because you have low powered gear and stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997529945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1489433302}
review:
This is a genuinely fun, no-frills attached arena shooter. It knows what it wants to do, and it does it well, and it does it for -free-. Now usually, free to play is a dirty phrase that attracts all sorts of skepticism: microtransactions, DLC, hats, pay to win, etc... This game doesn't do any of that. The paywall only excludes character customization (again, no hats or DLC, just stuff you unlock through XP from playing) and access to hosting your own games. Otherwise, you pretty much get the whole of it.

PROS:
+ Free
+ No BS FPS action reminiscent of the early Quake arena shooters, complete with lots of jumping and hauling tons of weapons
+Solid graphics and a fun cyberpunk'esque soundtrack, like a legit soundtrack that plays ingame- I cannot think of the last time I had that in an online competitive shooter 
+Weapons and controls suit a wide variety of playstyles
+ If you want to 'upgrade' to the complete game, it's 15$. 15. No incremental payments, no dlcs, just one time payment of 15$ to support the devs. The game's already finished, and there's no dancing around any hidden shekelmancy. I'd say it was easily worth the 15, but....

CONS:
-Nobody friggin plays the game. Seriously. That is the only real issue to an otherwise well rounded, fun title. I've played with more bots then I have people, and that's just depressing. 

Final thoughts:
If you're getting sick of Overwatch's BS and you just want to blow some people up, this is a wonderful alternative. You're probably just gonna want to get a couple friends on board first, and being F2P, that (hopefully) shouldn't be an issue. 

In a day and age where Steam is bloated with tons of indie titles that are just asset flipping scams, half baked kickstarters and unabashed Minecraft clones, this is a pure little gem that just wants to give you the blistering action that was PC online gaming before it all became about chest high walls and waiting for the red jam to get off your screen.

 It's F2P and I absolutely reccomend it for that price. I'd even reccomend just paying the 15$ for the full, where it not for the game's sparce population.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340503255', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1643885493}
review:
TOXIKK was a great game.  It had that classic FPS fast paced action, excellent weapon variety, good maps, relatively intelligent AI, and a decent multiplayer.  Only one problem:  when you read the above statement that, "The Free Edition of TOXIKK is more than a demo: It features the core experience, has no competitive disadvantages versus the Full Game, and lets you play TOXIKK for as long and often as you like.", they lied about the "as often as you like" part.  Immediately after I passed 3 hours combined solo bot play and multiplayer, and once I had logged out, the next time I tried to play everything was paywalled off.  Initially I was perplexed and thought my gamefile must be corrupted, but after I reinstalled the problem was still there.

This is disappointing because I was intitially pleased with their paywall system.  Full access to all weapons, two great maps (both on multiplayer and in solo play), and the only thing taken out was character customization.

Before anyone accuses me of trying to free ride, I had no qualms about buying the game.  I was hyped to buy, but I wanted to get a good amount of play in before I paid, since they offer the free, UNLIMITED Demo.  3 hours, however, isn't enough for me.  You can tell I'm not exactly the pre-order type of guy.  

In conclusion, this is a great game, and I still recommend the full version, but I am very disappointed with the demo.  I would have been fine if it had been advertised as a 3 hour demo, but lying about an UNLIMITED demo is skeezy and dishonest.  

P.S.

Dear REAKKTOR Studios, 

Please come clean in the future about your demos.  This game is technically proficient, the gameplay is enjoyable and envokes memories of old FPSs, and the mods are especially fun.  But lying isn't, so please be honest.

review:
De todos os "clones" do Unreal Tournament que eu j√° joguei, esse √© de longe o MELHOR. E n√£o, n√£o estou exagerando ao me referir a esse jogo como um clone de outro; a jogabilidade √© praticamente a mesma, os power-ups s√£o praticamente os mesmos, os mapas possuem uma atmosfera bastante similar aos do UT (bem, na vers√£o completa aparece dispon√≠vel um remake do cl√°ssico Deck, inclusive) e at√© a trilha sonora √© no mesm√≠ssimo estilo. Ah, e ainda foi feito na UNREAL Engine 3.5. Sabe aquele meme do "copia, mas n√£o faz igual?" √â o caso do Toxikk em rela√ß√£o ao UT. E pra quem gosta desse tipo de jogo, isso √© de fato algo bom. 

O √∫nico problema da vers√£o gratuita √© ter apenas pouqu√≠ssimos mapas e conte√∫do dispon√≠veis, mas que servem muito bem como uma "demo". Por√©m, mesmo o conte√∫do total dispon√≠vel na vers√£o completa ainda √© meio pequeno se comparado com o que se tem √†s m√£os inicialmente em qualquer vers√£o do UT. Ao menos, tem conte√∫do "user-made" que d√° pra pegar pela Steam, pelo que parece - e isso √© outro ponto positivo para um jogo, ainda mais como esse.

Finalizando: recomendado para quem aprecia um bom FPS da "velha escola". Eu continuo recomendando os UTs originais a quem nunca os experimentou, mas esse aqui tamb√©m √© uma boa pedida para novos e velhos jogadores desse estilo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970386800', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 5575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3353, 'last_played': 1511411042}
review:
It is a great game.  The graphics are lovely and the music is fairly good too.

The nice thing is you can play against bots, which is usually more fun than against bunny-hopping humans.  Unfortunately the AI can have a few problems and may get stuck between two actions.  This can be a problem if they are carry an enemy cell.  The "intelligence" can be modified (you can either host online or keep it local) according to how you want things.

The weapons are pretty standard by FPS standards but are easy to find and start with a fair bit of ammo.
Vehicles are okay, although a fair few are a bit of a pain to drive - the only one that feels good to control is the Demon.

There are a fair few maps that come with the game, with one being a reimaging of an Unreal Tournament map.  Hopefully more maps will be coming out soon.

Action is fast and furious, and all game modes are fun, even playing against bost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077728810', 'num_games_owned': 1990, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1494524026}
review:
It's a perfectly Fast Paced, Classless, frenetic, 'move or die' FPS arena brawler - Unreal Tournament 2016, basically. Everyone has everything unlocked - F2P as well as paid players. You upgrade/ modify your soldier by picking up a different gun on the battlefield. That is it. That's the genius and the weakness of the game (OK I love buying the stealth modules in Pay2Win Games)

My only real complaints are that;
1: I suck at this game (I was the guy in yellow getting wrecked in the trailers)
2: Nobody else plays this game.


If #2 changes, I will be back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015035125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1488683765}
review:
I have only played the free version of this game, not the full version.

TOXIKK is a bouncy, fun arena shooter that reminds of Quake Arena or Unreal Tournament. Fast-paced action, punchy weapons, generous gore are all featured in this game. 

Unfortunately, TOXIKK does not seem to feature a consistent playerbase. After completing a quick tutorial on movement free players can only select the 'quick join' option, which has again and again dumped me into a match playing with bots. While fragging bots can be fun, as a free player I have no way to set how difficult these bots are - so far, I've experienced 'standing still facing a wall' and 'oh my god why do they have such good aim' from the bots.

Eventually my patience was rewarded and after about half an hour I matched with another free player in a mode called Arch Rivals, which is a 1v1 deathmatch. It was painfully clear that my opponent hadn't tried the tutorial - while I jumped and dashed around he slogged his way through the map on foot, and after I killed him twice he quit, and it was back to the bots.

The next time I squared off against an actual player I only spent 15 minutes playing against bots, and again we squared off in Arch Rivals. This player, however, was a different caliber. As I frantically tried to gun him down he blasted me again and again, a seemingly unkillable bulwark of blazing guns. "Get the powerups" he explained after exploding me into giblets with a shotgun. 

Powerups? Those weren't in the tutorial. Still, I had been collecting small bonuses to my health and shields, giving me small, cumulative bonuses of +5, but against my adversary it didn't seem to make a difference. Was I missing something? I asked my tormentor, and after incinerating me with a flamethrower he paused to explain further. "Not the little ones. You need to get the big ones. They're hard to reach." With that he proceeded to kick my ass for the next five minutes before the match ended. 

I decided that I would dedicate my next match to looking for these powerups so that I might offer a smidgeon of a challenge to the next good player I faced. TOXIKK, however, had different plans for me and instead stuck me in a match where the bots and I all had instagib laserguns with no powerups in sight. After losing to the bots I was matched against the same noobcrushing player, with the same game mode and map. "Find the powerups yet?" He asked me. That was the only thing either of us said as he slaughtered me with ease for ten minutes. 

With such a minimal tutorial, a tiny playerbase and a bar set high by experienced players, TOXIKK has not been an enjoyable game for me.

Edit: After being told that this game has a bigger playerbase on Friday nights, I figured I would give it another shot. I quick joined a game that had three other players, a high point in my experience with TOXIKK. After playing the last half of a match with these swell fellows, they voted for a cool looking map and I was promptly booted back to the main menu. The next two matches after that were, unsurprisingly at this point, populated entirely by bots and myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077623970', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1488544558}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010373350', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1492901371}
review:
How did I just find out about this game?  I've been waiting for someone to make a game like this for a very long time.  The game's credo, "frag like it's 1999" is right on the money.  If you are a Quake fan or UT fan from back in the day, you have to give this game a try.  It really recaptures the old feel and mechanics of arena shooters from ~15 years ago.   This game is what the DOOM 2016 multiplayer should have been.   Seriously, give it a try -- it's free, there's no risk.  I played about an hour of the free version and then bought a 4 pack to try to get some friends into the action, and to support this kind of development.

Suggestion to the developer, you might have a publicity problem.  I'm in the USA and I hadn't heard about this game until yesterday.   I wish I had been playing when it officially dropped last fall.  Keep up the good work, and keep trying different advertising strategies to get more US players into the game.  I'm not trying to sound like a snotty Yank, but you have to have a critical mass of American players for a game like this to take off.

review: This is actually a really good game. The physics remind me the old fps games that I ever played in therms of physics, gameplay and weaponry, including the double jump. The main problem in my opinion of the game is: If you want to use all of the features implemented in this game, you need to fully upgrade your game to a full version by 14 euros. For me it's kinda bad for a game like this. Well, in therms of gameplay, physics and weaponry, including the maps and all of the features implemented in this game, ill give it a 7/10. I recommend this game, but this game forcing you to buy the dlc's to have the complete game, getting all of the features which you need to have a complete edition. Atleast, its a fun game. It's worth to try and play it for a couple hours. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198146434472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1539146480}
review:
A free demo? In 2017??

Speaking as a huge unreal tournament fan, I was a bit skeptical of the game's claim that it is a "spiritual successor to the FPS giants of the late 90's". But 30 seconds into the demo, I was absolutely blown away at how closely the developers replicated the style of unreal tournament. I immediately fell into the familiar groove of running, strafing, jumping and shooting, and the game perfectly captures what made unreal tournament so great: the constant and nagging urge to get one more frag. I saw that it even has a recreation of the famous DM-Deck map, although it wasnt available to play in the demo.

Will definitely snag this title once it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003416630', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1689429465}
review:
1. Configured and entered a Solo/tutorial game.
2. Reached a two-ways crossroad.
3. Chosed the left side (recommanded).
4. Took the plane, reached the above platform, landed to the spot, left the plane, suicided myself because it was too narrow.
5. Respawned, and gone in the left way again, asking myself how to reach it again without the plane.
6. Found the plane reappearing, hurrah ! Retook it.
7. Landed next to the platform to not pwned myself and to reach it by feet.
8. Tried to jump to the platform, but not enough impulse ! Double-jumped, by not enough too : suicided myself by skidding on the platform !!!
9. Respawned, but this time, the airship doesn't reappear.
10. Waited 2mn, thinking it was a bug. But it was not.
11. Gone on the right side, doubled jump on a serie of platform.
12. After 5 jumps, suicided myself because the platform was too far.
13. Didn't want to re-experience this useless tutorial.

Bye.

PS : next time, try your game before releasing it !

author: {'steamid': '76561197966739917', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1496332119}
review:
Moins bien que uT 2004 mais vraiment bien tout de m√™me. Le c√¥t√© comp√©titif ne se fait pas ressentir, c'est dommage.

C'est beau et tr√®s bien optimis√© (tourne √† fond sur une 660 en ultra), les sensations FPS sont tr√®s bonnes (un m√©lange entre uT 99 et le 2004), les armes ne sont pas tr√®s originales mais proposent chacune un gameplay bien diff√©rent (dans le pure style des uT), les modes de jeu hors DM/TDM sont fun et bien speed.

Il ne manque que quelques maps et le jeu sera complet (le workshop va bcp aider).

Bref, √† tester pour ceux qui veulent un jeu √† la uT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242441344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1486819878}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044234486', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1539851640}
review:
Toxikk is a fast paced, high octane arena shooter which promises a "No bullshit" experience in its quest to let players frag like its 1999 and oh BOY does it deliver. 

I've been playing the free version for a good 2 hours at the time of writing and there is seriously no reason to not give this game a shot. The free version has tons of stuff to enjoy and is an easy recommendation. If you like the look of the trailer and love the old school classic arena shooters of the late 90s and early 2000's then for crying out loud try out the free version of Toxikk, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972982306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1487004347}
review:
Whilst this looked like it had a lot of promise I got stuck on the -tutorial- where you first get to play with a vehicle. There didn't seem to be any way at all to move beyond the orange bars, and no hints either. Taking the 'pro' course and the fairly-hard jumps until you're offered the choice of 'using a vehicle to complete' just wound up in the same orange cage.

I really like FPS games and have been playing them since the original shareware DOOM but I've never found an impossible TUTORIAL before.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996696985', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1473821874}
review: Great idea, but the execution is lacking. Gameplay feels stale, and no not in a nostalgic way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034313699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1486616154}
review: I'm close to liking it. To be fair, I only ever liked UT a little. And it's definitely just UT.  But I can't get over the balance issues, even if they're the same as they always were. In CoD you have bullshit like killstreak rewards and unlockable weapons -- there's definitely none of that here. But what you do have is a short list of weapons with vastly different power levels placed at specific points in the map. I know the people who really liked Quake and UT are used to this, but it leads to people camping the rocket launcher endlessly. There's always one guy with the launcher and you can't touch him. If you manage to get it yourself you're gauranteed kills for as long as you have ammo, but then you have to go find it again if you die. I think this is one of the main reasons we moved away from this style of game. I was hoping they had found a way to make it more well rounded, but the game simply fills a desire for nastalgia in those that are prepared to deal with the old style of bullshit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209405649', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1495905231}
review:
Definately a worthy throwback to the 90's shooters like quake,doom and others with a repectable code of paint even on low settings and optimisation is amazing as i can play with a decent fps without actually meeting the minimum requirements but the f2p or demo version limits so much of you but it still isnt a deal breaker

author: {'steamid': '76561197996497854', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1486461883}
review:
Technically free-to-play, but designed to shame and/or insult the player into buying. You can view the player customization menu, but your armor is locked to a stock white color with the word "FREEBIE" plastered on it.
Played a Capture-The-Flag map (one of two that free players can access) that stuck eight people, a humvee, and a war-mech into a frustratingly small box with no cover and said "go". So less a "map" and more a milk crate made of rockets.
"Blue core has been taken." "Entire blue team has clear sightlines to the core carrier." "Blue core was dropped."

The weapons aren't awful. Most of them are just future'd up classics like the assault rifle, shotgun, sniper rifle, and pistol. But there's also a flamethrower and a plasma thing. I guess. So you've got your familiar staples with arcane names, but nothing really inventive.

They tried to re-invent, and perhaps modernize, a classic. Visually, they succeeded.

Fundamentally they also succeeded, but that's not a compliment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981083440', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1486000143}
review: This game had serious potential, until I logged in and noticed only 5 servers and nobody playing. I paid for the full version expecting what was promised, a throwback to arena shooters of the 1990s. However, that promise fell flat on the floor when I realized NOBODY is playing this, no matter how good the game is, it's worthless without a player base. NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL. It's a shame because this game had some potential. Vote with your wallet and do not buy the full version, as matter of fact I can't even recommend the free edition, all the servers are empty!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974754241', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1485779049}
review:
this is the case when i want to give a neutral review
the gameplay is very good, like everyone else said.
but it has some techincal problem.
i know there got to be something wrong with match making system.
i only got matched to EU server.
4 out of 5 games are instagib.
every now and then it mini-freeze noticably when you got triple/multikill.
customization screen didn't warn you when change item that are in full version.
the game simply told you to buy it without offer the choice to save the free version item.
need to try it out 1by1 to known.

edit: the developer are looking into the problem so i changed to recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064634145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1485950791}
review: I only just started playing this S*** and as soon as i saw the rotating weapon pickups, and felt the way your character moves, I was like "Ooooh Hell yes this takes me back!" the devs nailed it if you ask me. Do I recommend this game? allow me to answer your question with a question, Do you like Unreal tournament? or perhaps Quake? do you miss running around at6 what feels like the F***ing speed of light and tearing people a new A-hole? You do? then yes i recommend this game, In fact why are you still here? GO! play the game!

I suck at this game compared to other on here, but its great. I hope this game gets the recognition it deserves.

review:
HERMOSO. 
 Es una carta de amor hacia todos los nostalgicos que jugaban al quake 3 en el 99-2000 y al unreal tournament. Este juego es una fusion entre los juegos antes mencionados, solo con la peque√±a diferencia de personalizacion de personajes, sopporte de steam workshop y herramientas para crear mods, y una buena conexion.
 Empezare a ahorrar para comprarmelo algun dia. Vale la pena. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198185830167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4879, 'last_played': 1537749786}
review: This game brings back fond memories of playing Unreal Tournament with friends from work at around the turn of the last century. Thankfully the makers of TOXIKK have made it possible for me to move ahead while staying right where I am. Some have complained that the userbase is small -- this is true at present -- but I find playing against bots to be enjoyable too. Personal preference. To the point: if you enjoyed Unreal in all of its various incarnations, you'll enjoy TOXIKK as well.
