author: {'steamid': '76561198014848065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1702154700}
review:
The networking for Toxxik has been problematic since launch. Problems with port forwarding, matchmaking, free vs paid version  issues and more with many of these problems still persisting. 

Toxxik should be one of the most played games on Steam. It's incredibly fun with surprisingly high quality visuals, decent weapons and solid mechanics but the plethora of networking issues, an obtuse menu system and a minimal amount of (incredibly grindy) content has given players little reason to stick around and very few reasons to come back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011184099', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 2263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1638574865}
review:
Cosa dire di Toxikk?
E' davvero un ottimo fps arena! si ispira ai classici (soprattutto UT2004) ma riesce comunque a distinguersi grazie a tante piccole innovazioni, prima su tutte la possibilit√† di diventare invisibili per pochi secondi grazie alla nostra tuta.
Ben fatte e varie le armi (anche se forse un po' troppo grigie e simili tra loro), quasi tutte derivate dai classici del genere, fatta eccezione per il lanciafiamme (cazzutissimo).
Belle le mappe anche se alcune hanno fin troppi neon e riflessi che ti sparaflesciano un po'.
Grafica e sonoro si assestano su ottimi livelli, soprattutto per un arena.
Gameplay molto buono, veloce e frenetico, merce rara di questi tempi!
In alcune modalit√† si possono pilotare jeep, piccoli aerei e robottoni giganti!
L'unica vera pecca di questo titolo √® la scarsit√† di giocatori sui server, il gioco √® valido ed √® pure gratis, dategli una possibilit√† e non vi deluder√†!
Lo consiglio sia agli amanti degli arena in cerca di qualcosa di nuovo, sia a chi si avvicina a questo genere per la prima volta.

voto: 8\10

author: {'steamid': '76561197981896021', 'num_games_owned': 1240, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1484498320}
review:
This game is actually quite fun once you learn the controls. This is a modern version of Unreal Tournament that unfortunately, just like Unreal Tournament 3, looks nice but has very few people playing.

There are peaks of activity though and tournaments, so if you really like Unreal Tournament, get this (and cry those tears of nostalgia, wondering why it can't be like the good old days of FPS).

author: {'steamid': '76561198167561658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3010, 'last_played': 1535191752}
review:
Fantastic game. Free version lets you play the game but with limited maps and locked game modes. It's easily enough to help decide if it's your kind of thing. Part of the new wave of arena shooters. Very smooth and fast. 

The Friday Frag Fest happens weekly where most members login for some multiplayer action. Other than this you have bots to play against and a workshop with custom maps to play in. Mutators also change up the gameplay in a crazy amount of ways, plenty of time can be spent on this which is definitely the best and most modern arena shooter on the market at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990579217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1507140639}
review:
I'm a long-serving, die-hard fan of Unreal Tournament, ever since UT99. A lot of reviewers claim this is a rip-off of Unreal Tournament (and even uses Unreal technology, oh the irony). They are right... sort of.

TOXIKK (which is a weird name, by the way, please change it!) is what would happen if UT2004 and UT3 had a baby. The fluid, functional, fast-paced movement of UT2004 combined with the astonishing graphics of UT3. UT3 always felt clunky and more suited for console play, and TOXIKK has rode in for the rescue, making arena shooters fun on PC again.

Enough about Unreal Tournament. Yes - they basically copied the blueprint. But when it's THIS good, who cares?

TOXIKK is immensely enjoyable, bringing all those post-millennium memories of UT, DOOM etc back. The movement is extreme and fast, bringing back wall-jumps and double-strafe-and-jump movements. The aiming mechanism is nigh-on perfect, possibly on-par with 2016 DOOM. The wide array of weapons on-hand, from flame-throwers to the unforgettable rocket launcher, creates an armoury palette every kind of player can enjoy. The graphics are simply stunning, with currently-available maps ranging from ancient jungle ruins to Chinatown! (I think... or something Chinatown-esque).

Time for the drawbacks. I've paid for the full version, so I feel I've earned the right to complain a little.
- First, the weapon-spawns provide an outline of which weapon it is (along with the name). A part of me feels they aren't clear enough, especially since every gun is essentially the same colour.
- Next, the UI could use some love. The scoreboard is very old-school, cramming data into tight rows and columns. In addition, the post-game victory/defeat screen voting panel on the right seems unnecessarily small. At this point, after a few seconds of seeing the winners and losers, can't we just use the entire screen for a much nicer map vote?
- The customisation menu is simple, but just bizarre. Using a toggle to switch between armour, helmets, colour etc. There's surely a better way to present the choices.

That's it for now. Otherwise it's a fantastic arena-shooter. I hope the developers keep working on it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995688827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1473940300}
review:
After trying this for a while I cannot recommend it to any FPS fans, as I find the design and execution to be rather disappointing.

1.The few levels are all very small and unoriginal, especially the one CTF map that was basically a big box with a couple vehicles and a pillar in the center.

2.The quickplay button tries to put you in full servers and ends up with an error message some times when you click it, requiring you to manually click it over and over again to get a match.

3. Weapons are rather lackluster, especially the melee weapon, which is just a pathetic re-imagining of Q3A's melee weapon.

4. Game defaults some pretty funky stuff, like the double-tap dodge mechanic, which you will repeatedly end up accidentally activating, until you finally find the way to turn it off is through a unintuitive slider in the key binding menu. Also, mouse acceleration is on be default. Who thought this was a good idea in a competitive FPS? (yeah I know some people actually use it, but I find them to be the exception in FPS games, not the norm)

5. Chat is hard to read and jumbled together with a bunch of useless information.

6. Bots on the servers are just terrible and only serve to feed kills to the other team.

7. Post-game screens are a jumbled mess that require you to uselessly left click to proceed through them, when all the relevant information could easily be presented in one easy-to-use panel.

I don't see anything that this game is doing that isn't already done better somewhere else. The controls are tight and easy to pick up (had a 13:1 kd/r within my first hour of playing), but that doesn't salvage it from the rest of the issues it currently has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049495259', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1523500342}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070371508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1482046565}
review:
Although its launch was harmed by being released prematurely, this game has always been wonderful. I've followed it since before release and i'm very happy with the final product. The game does what it set out to: revitalize the arena shooter for the modern day, but still put its own twist on things. And its free, but the payment is worth it.

This game isn't nearly as active as it should be considering how well polished it is and what a good game it is. I highly suggest trying it, as the player count is the only problem with the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187485603', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1494431184}
review:
TOXIKK is a amazing arena FPS game. It's a free game and is a very good game. Great character designs, amazing maps and cool weapons. I myself find this game super fun, but there's one problem. [b]The game is dead.[/b] There's barely any players still playing this. Everytime I quickplay, I always join a server in Europe and play with bots no matter what. Which is very surprising because the game is free, it has no overpowered weapons and [b] it's not pay to win at all.[/b]

Pros:
Great Character Designs
Cool Maps
No overpowered or weak weapons
Free
Not Pay to Win
Cool Vehicles 

Cons:
The Game Is Dead

[b]Result:9/10
Conclusion: This game needs more attention, this game is great and everything about it is perfect. It's just the lack of players makes it boring. If the game somehow gets players back, I'll give this a 10.

review:
10 / 10 Old Shool FPS w/ modern Graphics & Excellent content to back it with. WOULD recommend! 

Unfortunately the only downside is that if you have a slow PC I wouldnt recommened it to those with low end PC's, I used to have a mid to low grade PC when I first tried this game and then I ended up refunding it because my PC wasnt able to handle the beautiful high quality atmosphere without lagging and getting me killed. So for that reason I would NOT recommend it to anyone with a low end PC, with that being said the graphics are phenomenal once you can see them.

review: This game is really fun to play with friends. Several different maps and steam workshop is getting bigger.  The free version isn't too bad but you can still play with friends who have the full version.  I would encourage you to purchace the full-version and suport the developers as this seems to be the only game they produce.  Try the free edition and then upgrade to the full or just buy the full it is really fun.  Tell all your friends about it as we need to build up the community.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987922091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1496186442}
review:
In a time when everyone is just looking at pseudo photorealism I really started missing old-school arena FPS games.
The kind of game you would play on an offline LAN party with a bunch of good friends, all night long.
THAT is TOXIKK

Games that need good reflexes, aim and general awareness of your surroudings, not just what's inside the crosshair of your sniper rifle while you are sitting a mile away in a bush, waiting for some poor little fella to stick out his head.
That's not skill, thats just utter garbage.

I wanna run. jump and dash around, see laser beams cutting through the air, knock away enemys by the blast of my rockets.
The new Unreal Tournament does this too, but it is pretty hardware hungry.

This little gem here on the other hand feels incredibly fast, intense doesn't require a super computer to run on decent settings and is damn much fun. 
So far I like it, will keep playing. But generation CoD will most likely dislike it, they won't play it as it is not easy learn and goddamn hard to master.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197976027036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4749, 'last_played': 1597092105}
review: I started playing FPS with Doom over a peer to peer network via serial cable and null modem and later a hub.  Eventually Quake came out in the dialup internet days and LMCTF was my mod of choice, the grappling hook was awesome.  My next addictions were UT99, 2k3 and 2k4.  I played nightly for hours and even joined a clan, all cool people even other clans.  When UT3 came out, I was excited but eventually and fairly quickly stopped playing.  For me, the latest installment lost its intensity, agility and pace in comparison.  I was at a loss.  I tried many other fps games, each having something I liked but none had the feel of my UT days.  That feeling of loss ended the moment I started playing TOXIKK.  I hope it gains the same following the earlier UT titles did with a community of players, modders and mappers.  I'd like it to be my goto for frags, chats and stress relief for years to come.  Its got the potential!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982707009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1586202773}
review:
Only tried 'free' version. It's a really awesome old-school arena shooter with amazing graphics and gameplay on the Unreal engine, but there are almost no people playing it as of writing. I've suggested the devs to draw in more players. I they can build up a slightly bigger player base this will be a great game if you''re into arena shooters.

UPDATE: Changed recommendation to 'not recommended' after having thread proposing ways to draw in more players (to almost dead community, you can play almost exclusively bot matches due to no players) deleted by a developer (who also entirely ignored this thread). It seems to me developers, rather than try to recognize the problem of lacking player base and try reinvigorate the game with incitements for drawing in new players are instead opting to try to conceal the fact you'll be able to face only bots if you purchase this. Disingenuous as ****.

TLDR: This game could have been really great if more people played it but the developers are apparerently both dumb and dishonest so this won't happen. Stay away!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978362177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1507760332}
review:
If you like fast paced arena shooters you will love this game.  It has a nice variety of game modes and maps.  The maps range from small and simple to large and complex.  It also has vehicles and mechs that you can use for some of the maps.  The weapon choices should fit any playstyle.  The free version truly has no competitive disdvantages and it is NOT a pay to win game.  It reminds me of the hours of fun I had in the Q3A days!

The game has a Skill Class system that helps with balance.  Skill Class is tracked separately from your level so you could be level 10 but Skill Class 3 and it would group you with others of simliar skills unlike other games.

The only negative is the lack of players.  Unlike many other games it will load bots into the game to keep you from waiting forever for enough people in the lobby to play.

review:
It's a fun game, openly aping the arena shooters of the late 90s. You run around really fast and double-jump and collect lots of diverse weapons and try to shoot other players with them. It's good, but I find myself not playing it all that much. Something about it just doesn't grab me. Not sure why.

It's still good while it lasts, though. And it's free. Worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058641616', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1583890896}
review: The overall game is great and filled with fun, but not many people play it (as usual with many arena shooters) and I'm going to have to give it a negative review because of it. Even though there are people online playing the game, I still always wind up getting matched up with boring, basic bots. There's a ranking system that is used in matchmaking and most servers are 1-7 skill rating, I have one of 8 so I can't join those servers that have actual players in them. So the only way that I can play with other players is to make another account and smurf. If you're actually good at the game, don't bother paying for the full version and just stick with the free version as most of the players are Free2Plays and can't play on the maps in the full game either. If you get a skill ranking too high, just keep making smurfs to actually play with other people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062096357', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1480731776}
review:
What a mediocre game with obtrusive business practices. The game's an unreal clone, nothing impressive here at all, merely riding the wave of legacy from giant's past. Community is non-existant, there's barely any players around compared to other competitive games. Map design is bland, and there's too many post-processing effects that hurt the eyes, and don't allow you to concentrate on the action at hand. 

F2P build gives you such a minute amount of the whole experience it might as well not exist at all. You lack the freedom to be able to experience anything the game has to offer atleast one through, and then it constantly keeps reminding you to buy the game. Really? Give me atleast 10 minutes into the game before you start asking me for my hard-earned money. Oh and then ontop of that when you quit the game it has the courtesy to remind you of buying the game again. How quaint. 

Performance is optimized for the most part, but playing on the higher settings makes your framerate tank even on powerful systems. Visuals are pretty outdated on the UE3 engine in every aspect at this point.

I would not recommend this game, and will not be buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038509407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1481391983}
review:
Didn't think much of this game. Saw it on the steam store page, and the "Frag like it's 1999" motto caught my eye. 
I remembered the good times of '99 when I was play Unreal Tournamed (classic), Quake 2, and the Beta version of Quake 3, that consisted only of q3dm17 (think there were 2 maps though). 

Looking through the screenshots of Toxikk , they seemed a bit eye-candy, gave the impression that someone's heavy photoshop skills were involved, but I decided to give it a try nevertheless, so I hit install on the free2play version.
Game was downloaded fast, since it seems to only take up 4GB. "Something that fits in 4GB can't be that good, especially not look like in does in these screenshots", I thought.

Well, I was wrong. I started playing the game, and the minute I did, wife came to me and informed me I have to go to the store and get groceries, "We're all out of food, and it's lunchtime", she said.
"Just give me a couple of minutes to try out this game, and I'm going", I said.

Fast-forward 2 hours later, I'm still playing the game, wife's in the kitchen mumbling something about "..those god-damn groceries already..", and I'm over here just fragging like it's 1999!
Game seems to be a very good combination of the Quake-genre's high-paced action, and the Unreal Tournament-series mutators and map design. Whichever of these 2 games you've played, you should feel right at home with Toxikk.
This is the true multiplayer that quake fans expected Doom (2016) to have, and really what it should've had.
The graphics are superb, and the level (or maps, fow new-schoolers) design is absolutely marvelous. I salute the crew that put (probably) tens of hours of development into the level design alone.

Creating a free edition to this game was a nice touch. It gave us a chance to actually see what a wonderful gem this game is. 
For those of us that had the luck to play these kind of games in 1999, this game is a nice reminder of a time when life was easier, and games weren't a stone-throw away, yet we all had a lot of fun.

Keep it up Reakktor Studios, you're doing a good job. This genre deserves a comeback, one whose direction isn't dictated by today's modern trends.
I could blabber on about how unexpectedly good this game is, but the above-mentioned wife started thundering in the kitchen. That's my cue to leave for the grocery store. You'll just have to try it and see for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013624600', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1480370821}
review:
Pros:
Great Graphics
Great Controls

Cons:
To do 90% of the stuff a normal games allows, you must pay for the game. 

While the overall game is great, it suffers from what I like to call "give me money" syndrome. In order to host a match, or even look at the server broser and choose a server to go on, you must spend $12 to unlock it. These are things that even the shittiest, scummiest F2P game offers, and these people have the balls to ask for money to do it. Until this game chances on its most basic policies, I won't be playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966924238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 2748, 'last_played': 1712412689}
review:
Wer Unreal Tournament (alle Teile *g*) mochte, der wird sich in TOXIKK zuhause f√ºhlen.
Das ganze f√§ngt beim Design der Waffen an, geht weiter bei einigen Karten und h√∂rt beim eigentlichen Spielprinzip auf.

Dabei ist das Motto ‚Äû"RAG LIKE IT'S 1999" keineswegs schlecht, sondern im Gegenteil. Bei TOXIKK kommt es auf den Spieler und dessen k√∂nnen bzw. Reaktion an und nicht auf Gadgets welche man "erhalten" hat.

Meine zwei Kritikpunkte an TOXIKK m√∂chte ich aber nicht verschweigen.
[olist]
[*]Die Karten sind gro√üartig, nur es gibt viel zu wenige davon ‚Äì gerne mehr! :D
[*]Als ich TOXIKK zuletzt spielte, war im Multiplayer verh√§ltnism√§√üig wenig los, dieses wird dem Spiel in Kleinster wei√üe gerecht.
[/olist]

Ich w√ºnsche euch viel Spa√ü mit TOXIKK!


Update 23.11.2017:
Da sich die Situation an den Standartkarten leider nicht ge√§ndert hat, ja es sind viel zu wenige *g*, ein kleiner Tipp: Im Steam-Workshop existieren von der Community mittlerweile einige sch√∂ne Maps, einfach selber mal schauen und den Erbauern gerne einen Daumen nach oben dalassen - die werden sich sicher freuen. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039521298', 'num_games_owned': 1622, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1501792631}
review:
FPS der alten Schule (UT, Doom, Quake etc.), ohne verweichlichte Gimmicks, pure Action, geballte Szenerie und eine verdammt geile Grafik.

review: Rated 'S' for Stupid.  Your feet in this game feel like they're far behind you when jumping -- you can run what in all other games would be past the end of a ledge, and/or fail to make a jump on the other side that would be easily made on another game.  Sorry guys - i've played FPSes forever, but this just has horrible feel -- enough for me to rate this "not recommended" just with the tutorial level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988489805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1480095697}
review:
This game is nothing more but a lazy blender mix of 70% UT3, 20% Quake arena, 5% good music and 5% cheapness. I laughed so hard when I found out that there's a UT classic map inside of this game. Also, most of the weapons' fire modes are just shuffled fire modes from the UT3 weapons. I rather play Nexuiz which is the same concept but at least is adds more originality to the game, hell... I rather play UT alpha aka UT2017.

This game feels more like a mod from the contest "Make something unreal", a mod that didn't win because the only difference between this and the real deal, are the models, music and some maps.

...............OH LOOK!!!! THERE'S A MECH!!!!!... whatever....

author: {'steamid': '76561198171087553', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1495666282}
review:
Granted, I haven't put alot of time in this game, but I have to say my first impressions are excellent.

It's a throughbred AFPS, no two ways about it. It has the frenzy like feel of it, it has the equality in matches, it has the variety of weapons, it's all there. My only real qualm with it is that the health and ammo bars are a bit hard to notice. But that doesn't matter if you bunny hop fast enough.

I enjoy the variety of weapons, though I do have one question: a sniper rifle? In a fast-paced-neigh-bullet-hell? Really? But, the weapons are there. The assault rifle has a grenade launcher, the flame thrower is probably the best AFPS weapon I've ever seen, and the list goes on and on.

Doom would be proud 19/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198133025690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1480001137}
review:
Yes, Yes, Yeeeess - a thousand times YES

Cannot recommend this game enough. It really is what the FPS has been missing and such a fresh step back. It does what it claims very, very well. I used to spend hours on end playing DOOM with a friend over a 19.2K modem. Co-op games would at some point devolve into a 1 on 1 deathmatch that would go on all night. This has that same feel, and the Dead Simple from DOOM 2 remake is just a classy touch.

If you know what it means to "frag like it's 1999" then yeah, you need this. If you don't know, get it anyway and find out how it used to be done - and why old farts like me still talk about and play DOOM and Quake and Unreal - get some!

review: Really good game! I like Quake so I downloaded this game and it's amazing! The vehicles are really well done, the player models look really good, and the weapons are very diverse. I just wish there were more weapons, more mutators, and more contracts. But still would recommend to anyone and everyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198159624039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1526724622}
review:
Toxikk is has a couple of points that I want to address that were the selling point for me.

1) Movement - not many FPS games these days have good controls. With a lot of the genre focusing on aiming or reaction time, Toxikk is refreshing in that it focuses on all of the above and allows for error. It is fast paced action, has some amazing movement systems which allow you to effectively be Ezio Auditore, and has brilliant controls overall. Wall-jumping to dash-jumping to dodging, all of this makes getting killed hard and filming some awesome kills essential.

2) Vehicles - This game has mechs, cars, gunships and more depending on whether you have the free version or not. As a current player of the F2P version, I am in love with the only map that has vehicles available. Mechs are easy enough to get massive killing sprees with and not die, however, they are also not invincible like vehicles in BattleFront. Running people over is so satisfying...

3) Guns - Ok, so this game slightly ripped off the unreal tournament weapon system, however, the guns in this game are balanced, you won't get killed from across the map by a random with a machine gun, and you have a decent chance with the matchmaking.

There is 1 problem with this game... Player base. Nonexistent. It needs players, and with a game as good as this it deserves it. I have loved every minute of my 3.6 hours and need people to play with to continue playing.

TOXIKK - "[...], czyli ubo≈ºszy Unreal Tournament 3." - powiedzia≈Ç piszƒÖcy tƒô recenzjƒô gracz.

Gra o kt√≥rej m√≥wi siƒô, ≈ºe jest klonem ≈õwietnego Unreal Tournament 3, kt√≥ry swojƒÖ drogƒÖ jest troszke s≈Çabszy od UT2004 czyli swojego starszego brata, co moje sentymenty chwyta i nie daje o sobie zapomnieƒá, lecz recenzja ta nie ma na celu wychwalania kultowej serii UT ( ...kt√≥ra jest ≈õwietna ;P ), a ma za zadanie wyostrzyƒá walory tej gry aby gracz, co pakuje siƒô w tƒÖ grƒô m√≥g≈Ç wiedzieƒá czym siƒô ubrudzi.

TOXIKK uwa≈ºam za grƒô dobrƒÖ, lecz dobrƒÖ z tego powodu, ≈ºe jest tak jakby klonem UT3, oraz dobrƒÖ dla kogo≈õ kto z seriƒÖ Unreal Tournament nie mia≈Ç jeszcze do czynienia ( Serio !? SƒÑ TACY !?!? ). Wspomniana gra zosta≈Ça oparta o silnik Unreal Engine 3, czyli ten sam co posiada UT3, oraz inne gry. Szata graficzna wzglƒôdem swojego ang. Brother from another mother - pl. Brata z innej matki, r√≥≈ºni siƒô lekko bardziej podkrƒôconymi kolorami i lekko lepszymi teksturami, oraz ≈õwietnymi odbiciom ≈õwiat≈Ça, czyli kr√≥tko m√≥wiƒÖc o grafice w TOXIKK " jest podobna do UT3 " ( lecz troche lepsza ).

Mechanik gry i grywalno≈õƒá to praktycznie to samo co widzieli≈õmy w UT3, czyli dynamiczne starcia, ≈õwietne bronie, oraz przepiƒôkne lokacje itd. kr√≥tko m√≥wiƒÖc/piszƒÖc bomba ! Wzglƒôdem UT3 jeden z tryb√≥w r√≥≈ºni siƒô w TOXIKK i to bardzo, a mowa tu o hybrydzie Capture The Flag z Samochodami ( pamiƒôtny tryb "Assault" z UT3 ) czyli "Catch A Power Cell", jest on...no niezbyt udany...wrƒôcz g≈Çupi..., dlaczego ? no dlatego ≈ºe jak biegniemy ze wspomnianym "Power Cell'em" to szansa na to ≈ºe dobiegniesz z nim jest jak 1 - 10 000, a przy akopaniamencie koleg√≥w to ju≈º jakie≈õ 1 - 10 lub 1 - 20... manewrowanie postaciƒÖ nie zbyt pomaga aby uniknƒÖƒá kul itp. co wystrzeliwujƒÖ do ciebie oponƒôci, a pociski w tej grze raczej nie uznajƒÖ grawitacji, a ich zasiƒôg jest ogromny wiƒôc szansa trafienia czego≈õ w ciebie jest nader wysoka. Og√≥lnie tryb jest o ty≈Çek pot≈Çuc. Reszta tej gry jest dobra, gra dzia≈Ça piƒôknie, bez ≈ºadnych spadk√≥w FPS, du≈ºo opcji w tym modyfikowanie celownika, kolork√≥w na zbroi, nazwy na zbroi, markeru po trafieniu w przeciwnika itd., ≈õredni jest patent z energiƒÖ kt√≥ra daje nam mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá niewidzialno≈õci na kr√≥tki czas, oraz w trybie "C.A.P.C" zespawnowanie czego≈õ na wz√≥r latajƒÖcego motocykla bez k√≥≈Ç. Rankingi itp. wystƒôpujƒÖ w grze lecz sƒÖ "standardowe", czyli nic w nich unikatowego.

PodsumowywujƒÖc, gra TOXIKK jest dobrƒÖ grƒÖ dla kogo≈õ kto lubi szybkie i dynamiczne rozgrywki, oraz kto cieszy siƒô z wyzwa≈Ñ jakie postawiajƒÖ mu gry i nie szybko siƒô poddajƒô.

Ocena: 8/10

Plusy:

+ Podobna do UT3
+ ≈Åadna grafika i krajobrazy
+ Dynamiczna i szybka gra
+ Fajny Soundtrack

Minusy:

- Tryb "Catch a Power Cell"
- niezbyt dobry patent z energiƒÖ
- puste serwery...

review: Have you ever played Unreal Tournament? Well this is more or less Unreal Tournament with better graphics, same fast paced fps game. Also there is a free version alognside the paid version. The free version is missing the campaign mode, some maps, some vehicles and workshop stuff. Start playing the free version for multiplayer only and if you like it, buy it. Other than that though I enjoyed my brief time and planning to keep it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197977134900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1474336835}
review:
I really wish I could recommend TOXIKK. It's part of a genre of games that I really enjoy‚Äîthe good ol' FPS arena shooter. It feels, though, like playing an unthought mish-mash of games past.

The characters and weapons are designed and animated beautifully, overall the graphic fidelity is pretty great, but the game lacks character and inspired level design that is a trademark of intense, fast paced arena shooters. 

The game is fun at first, but somehow feels ordinary after you've played a few matches. In an oversaturated FPS game market this game doesn't hold enough to stand out, it doesn't carve out a niche but instead follows in the footsteps of games before it, and stumble a bit in this path. 

You almost wish TOXIKK had something that surprised you after playing it some. Maybe a weapon that wasn't in some way directly inspired by weapons from other arena shooters. Maybe a map that is super fun and well balanced. There wasn't something I could point and go "Yeah, this is why I like TOXIKK over [insert other arena shooter here]."

The lack of a unique product is probably why the game's community is close to none. It is also likely the reason why the devs released a free-to-play version of the game some time after its launch. It's too bad too...I think with a little extra love and some work between the developers and the game's community TOXIKK could end up being something really fantastic that helps bring in a new generation into the world of arena shooters.

review:
Just play it. You won't regret it.

As of writing this, I've only managed to get an hour in, but this game is absolutely fantastic. While everyone flocks to these new Hero Shooters, I still have a soft spot in my heart for the shooters I played and loved as a young teenager. 

You see, this game has a vibrant feel like a mix of Halo and Unreal Tournament. I'm currently just playing for free, but I fully plan to buy this game for a handful of my friends when the funds become available, even though the free version is completely playable. 

I am sorry I didn't know about this game sooner, but I hope you find it, read a couple of reviews, and spare a little hard drive space (maybe even a little time adjusting the settings to play on an older and slower computer like me) because I'll be in the matchmaking, and I will be more than happy to burn you to a crisp or send some shotgun pellets down your throat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091600207', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1515115347}
review: First off, I want to congratulate Reakktor Studios for engineering an amazing AI system for their bots in Boot Camp mode. I feel like im playing with real people. Their aim is not perfect, nor does it suck. If any of you remember Dirty Bomb, you wil recall that something was just off about that game, whether it was the crosshairs, the way you could ressurect people, or all the anti-OPd weaponry, it just wasnt fun. The gameplay of Toxikk is amazing, and the array of weaponry is decent. You can do map votes, but only when you are playing by yourself. The server issue is pretty annoying, like Quick Match is the only server thing in the free version, and 3/4ths of the time there's not enough people wanting to play it. To get arround this annoying feature, Go to View->Servers->Toxikk and there should be a list of servers to choose from, but I have yet to make that work. Please keep in mind that when I write this review, I will only have the free version. Maybe later I'll get the full version and rewrite my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118212719', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1478958189}
review:
Pure copy of Unreal Tournament 3 with exactly same weapons, vehicles and almost same maps, but with better graphics.

The problem is, as in all free to play FPS, you can't play at this game if you don't have an aimbot program. There is no anti-cheat in this game, as in Quake Live...

Download this game only for easy achievements, not more. Unreal Tournament 4 is much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003987422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1566919407}
review:
Fantastic game. This is specifically the exact game I wanted to come out. 
Agile player movement, fast walk speed, fast aim speed, weapon variety, items/powerups to ''control'', FFA game mode included, etc. A true first person shooter. 

Will benefit greatly from more populated servers but for now its still possible to find a game with humans. 
I'd love to see a FPS of this kind gain some real community. Outside of dueling in quake live and private online meetups for other games there isn't really much left for us old Deathmatch players.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970482328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 322, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1478717987}
review:
Toxikk is an FPS game styled like old Quake or Unreal Tournament, but you probably know that already.  

The graphics are nice and the gameplay is chaotic enough, but something felt like it was missing to me, and I honestly don't know what it is.  Maybe it's just because I've played too many of these types of games over the years.  I will say the combat felt just a little stiff, but otherwise it's a solid shooter. 

I also felt the user interface to be somewhat distracting while playing the game - there is basically just too much to look at and it gets kind of confusing when you are in the heat of battle.  Also, for my fellow motion sickness prone players out there, you cannot turn head bob off without going into the .ini file and setting it to zero.  Not a total loss to humanity, but considering all the other things you can easily adjust it makes no sense to me that you can't adjust this from the menu options.

I wanted to like this game more than I did, but I won't be buying it  The free version is just enough to pass a few hours if you have nothing better to play.  I wish I could give it an OK review, but since I can't I will go ahead and recommend the game if you are a fan of this type of gameplay.

review: It feels almost criminal that this game has such a small player base. It's well balanced, well paced... from the design standpoint I can't find a single thing I'm missing for this to be a great arena shooter. We haven't had a new one this good in what feels like forever. Come on. Give this a try. The only thing it needs is a good number of people to be sustainable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048893391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1517617681}
review:
Toxikk is a fast FPS game thats slower than Tribes Assend but faster than your traditional FPS.  Speed and intelligent movement along with proper use of the weapons makes Toxikk a very fun and skill based game.  I highly recommend getting a free account and giving it a try.

The only real downside with the game is the lack of people playing it.  If it had even 25 people on at any given time I might recommend it, but it doesn't.  At the time of writing there are 2 EU and 2 american servers up with only 2 of those full with the 8 player server limit.

If the player population increases to a sustainable level I'd definitely suggest buying the game to get the 2 extra company made maps and the other custom maps that people have made.  Sadly I can't recommend buying it for $15 simply because the future of this multiplayer game is uncertain.

I wish the developers the best and I hope they can get more advertisement and players in the coming months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271872170', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1478680408}
review:
The game was amazing until after I completed the tutorial.

I was attempting to find a free to play game that could be played with friends.

Only after completing the tutorial did I discover that most of the buttons for things that looked like multiplayer features were mearly buttons to display an ad for another game. Allegedly, the other game is just the full version of this one.

The ads do not end when you close the game either. When you close the game, the game hijacks your brower and opens a window to its website.

The one working multiplayer feature selects you a random server so you can play online... with a tag branded on your character indicating that you have not paid for the game. There is an option that looks like it will let you change your tag to something less degrading, but it opens an ad for the other game instead.

The nice things:

The FPS is amazing in the 640x480 resolution. More games should have this resolution, along with the 320x200. Reducing the resolution makes the ad text illegible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046258614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1596739633}
review:
Feels like Unreal Tournament 3, Plays like Unreal Tournament 3, Full game is cheaper than Unreal Tournament 3 on Steam.

Pros:
Fast gameplay which most Unreal Tournament or Quake players are familiar to
Great Graphics that can work on slightly older hardware
A variety of weapons with some having a more powerful secondary fire
Experienced players of UT or Quake can transfer their skill to this game

Cons:
Some graphics options can't be disabled
Some weapons don't feel satisfying to use
New Players will face Pros on their first match on Multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966818219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1693713826}
review:
My early review of the game:

First let me start off by saying that it's hard to believe that this game was made by an indie studio. I suspect here that Epic was strongly involved on this one. This game is just an overall an improved version of previous Unreal game. Depending of the map you play you sometimes will have the feeling that you play the original 1999 UT, while in some others maps including mechs and vehicules you will have the impresssion to play a modern version of UT 2003 and 2004.

Regular mode: 

This mode is basically an improved and much more polished version of the next upcoming UT4 pre-alpha version. It's everything what UT4 should be when it will be released , if it ever be anyways. No need to wait for UT4. I seriously doubt that it will be as good as Toxikk, unless they spend another 2 years at working on the game. Keep in mind that Epic is not really strongly involved anyways in the next upcoming UT4, who is actually made by indie studios, modders and gamers with programming skills.

Modes with mechs and Vehicules:

Wasn't too sure about this one. Never reallly liked this mode on both UT 2003 and 2004. Maps were way too big and the gameplay was kinda wacky. But this is just my own feeling here. On Toxikk you are fighting in smaller maps featuring a furious and intense gameplay. What you see in the trailer of the game is actually the REAL gameplay of the game. It is that good.
Best way to describe it is UT meets Halo and Warface. Playing CTF mode is a total blast. Expect a lot of playing playing this mode.

There are 2 versions of the game that you can get on Steam, The free edition version and the full version that will cost you less than 15$. Free version doesn't features all the maps. Also you cannot select the map and the mode that you want to play. It's random. You cannot customize your characters and probabely your equipements. You cannot surf or create your own servers. You can only select quick matches.
So basically if you want to get matches with your friends you will need the full game.

What I've seen so far in the game makes me feel like buying the game. At only 15$ that will be much cheaper than get Gears of War that I was palnning to get. It will also be much better than waiting for another 1 or 2 years for UT4.


P.S. Toxikk is protected by VAC (Valve) anti-cheat. ToO bad for hackers ...LOL. Not on ly they will have to face a goos anti-cheat but also if any hackers have been banned from any Valve games like TF2, Counter Strike or Left for death they will be automatically banned from Toxicc before they can even try to get a game online.

My score:

Graphics 9/10
Gameplay 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017230515', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1474605132}
review:
As part of the first wave of a resurgence of ‚Äúarena FPS‚Äù games, Toxikk is the first project of Reakktor Studios, aiming to capture the golden age of Quake 3 Arena, and other games. For the most part, it succeeds, offering angular, tight maps and a satisfying array of weaponry and customization. There‚Äôs your standard arena offerings: a pistol, sniper rifle, shotgun, assault rifle, plasma rifle, rocket launcher, and more. They all pack enough weight and carry enough force to blow any number of opponents off their feet.

On the flipside, Toxikk is, however, struggling to make a name for itself. Why would anyone buy into Reakktor Studios‚Äô effort when Quake Live, and the free version of Unreal Tournament exists? Ultimately, there‚Äôs not much that stands out about Toxikk compared to other arena shooters. Sure, maps with vehicles are a nice addition, but the community is already so tiny, that many members just vote for pure arena duel maps.

To that end, Reakktor has provided a free version of the game, with many of the features included. Strangely, some Steam reviews don‚Äôt quite understand what a ‚Äúdemo‚Äù means anymore, but it does allow for free players to play on servers with paying members. It‚Äôs hard to say where Reakktor will go from here, with the looming threat of Unreal Tournament, and the already established pedigree of Quake Live. Despite this, Reakktor have delivered a solid product in Toxikk, which they will hopefully continue to support in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011626866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1478095215}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997688268', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1477758016}
review:
Did you like Unreal Tournament (any of them)? This is pretty much the same thing. Looks a whole lot better though. Looks very good in fact even for the old UE3 engine. Runs well (ultra, 1920x1080 flawless 60fps - I capped it) on my aging rig (fx8350 GTX 760). Weapons are meaty and familiar, dual fire mode on everything, dm, td, ctf etc etc... You get the idea.

Sadly has a low player count. But it's good against bots, and there are a few people still playing. If you can get a few mates together on the same server for a frag fest you'll have a giggle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010734079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1498855182}
review:
VERY awesome game!
I would say it's very similar to Quake III as far as gameplay goes. Battles are fast paced and reward accuracy, tactics and overall movement/control. Guns are unique and satisfying across the board, each one calls for different tactics and ranges and the alt-fire functions offer some various ways to change up your fragging (killing people).  Maps range from mostly open coliseum-esque layouts to alleyway shotgun fests and every sort of mashup in between, as well as a variety of scenery; jungles, urban, future arena, you name it.

In short, it's EXACTLY what it claims to be: old school arena gib-tacular FPS arena at it's finest. WAAAAYY fun!!

review: This game is essentially a modern remake of Quake. It's quite fun and the wet-ish neon theme is honestly beautiful! I also really loved the sound effects/sound design/soundtrack- its a very fast-paced electronic theme and it'll have you hyped in no time. (I'm very biased because I almost exclusively listen to EDM...) The maps were as they should be for an arena shooter of this caliber and the gunplay also fit the bill. It doesn't seem like many are still playing it, sadly, but it wouldn't hurt to give it a quick download. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198321048208', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1473859574}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998664966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1490562765}
review:
This game is very nice. Not great, nothing to write home about, but still very nice. If you're looking to play a game like Unreal Tournament, but don't want to buy 2k4 again. This might scratch that itch. My only real complaint is the weapon balance is a little off, some of the fire modes feel uninspired. I'd much rather they wholesale ripped off unreal tournaments weapons and their balance. I feel this game could use some inspiration of its own in some regards as well. the jump for example is very similar to unreal tounaments. How about a more floaty, low gravity style jump. Or some kind of Jetpack. Just because it plays like UT doesn't mean anything. This game lacks character. Something UT had in droves. It doesn't even have a crazy announce MMMMMONSTER KILL KILL KILL. Just... bleh.

Runs like butter though. MMMF

author: {'steamid': '76561198059281936', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1477708650}
review:
The game looks great, feels like it could be a great game, but its unplayable since there is something going on that "sticks" so I am constantly looking to the left even when im not touching my mouse. Everything is set to default and I haven't touched a single thing in settings.  I have screwed around in the options menu for about 20 minutes and have accomplished nothing. 

Its a damn shame that its unplayable, I love arena type games.


EDIT: I fixed the problem, it apears all I had to do was remove a flight stick that some how was screwing with the Unreal Engine. It now works like it should. BUT with that being said, I still can't recommend this game with the small population this game has. It is fun to play, but only getting in lobbies of 3 other people, it gets dull fast. 

I would recommend getting the free version to try it out and see if you have any better luck than I could. Its a good game, but being held back by its tiny player base cripples it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076447761', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1488799075}
review:
Let me start this review by saying one thing. I no longer play Quake Live.... after YEARS of QIII/QLive Toxikk has taken the position of my AFPS of choice. That being said... let's dive into the reasons!

1. NO CLASSES! Just pick ups! Oh boy this is the big one. Recently, DOOM tried to capture the old style of 90's shooter. Though the Singleplayer was great, Loadouts kinda killed the Multiplayer's feel as well as a few other niggles but that's for a different review. The no class feel of this game opens up real map control. Weapon's feel balanced right an over all emphasize map control. You really don't wanna let the enemy team over the Cerberous spawn too much. 

Speaking of spawns, I love how in Team Assault weapon spawns are for each individual player which helps to avoid 'stealing' weapons from each other

2. THE COMBAT! It's fast. It's in your face. There's Gibs flying everywhere, explosions left right and centre and there's no remorse in this brutally fast paced shooter. As mentioned before, each weapon feels balanced just right and in the hands of a skilled player each gun has the ability to really decimate an enemy. Whether it's the balanced RoF and Damage of the Violator, the movement concealing billow of flames let out by the Dragoneer or the dealy rockets fired from the Cerberous, each gun has it's own style of gameplay and it's well worth learning how they all function

3. THE VISUALS! Really easy to identify a target without loosing environment detail. The game looks beautiful in any graphics setting and...

4. IT RUNS BLOODY WELL! I have tried this on both a gaming PC on ultra and on a  year old potato. I can get 30-50 FPS on the 6 year old potato on minimum settings in 720p and the frames stay nice and consistent

And finally..... 5. THE BASE GAME IS FREE TO PLAY SO TRY IT! GET YOUR FRIENDS TO TRY IT! FRAG LIKE IT'S 1999!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046895923', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1477152809}
review: Loads of fun. The bots are way too easy, and matchmaking sometimes puts me in EU (hello 300 ping), but I have yet to have a boring game. The graphics are pretty fantastic, the maps (with my free access) have all the flanking routes and half-hidden powerups that make a good arena map. Rocket launcher might be a little overpowered/too easy to find (it's less fun to use other weapons when you can oneshot everyone and everything), but I can't find much I disike about this game. I just wish matchmaking paired me with harder players and on a closer server, but I've only played a couple hours, so it could have been a bad day. 100% worth it for free, and I'll probably buy it later for the full map/gamemode access.

review:
I knew before I played this game that I was extremely interested in twitch shooters. Call of Duty become more twitch and I liked that. I never really played Doom but I know I would enjoy it! I love this game right here! has all the basics of a classic twitch shooter! No health regen, no weapon classes, platforming, and this game has such beautiful graphics 
I could hardly believe it. Anyway, this game is a fun, twitchy game that I can play for 10 minutes or 3 hours. This is no Battlefield or Overwatch, which I do enjoy, but I have a taste for twitch, and this satisfies it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970777068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1478402113}
review:
I play FPS games since ~15 years, in a just for fun manner.
I don't care about exzessiv competitive score based stuff and so on.
There are some nice/usefully customizations to fit the players game style and the game play feels pretty solid.

I didn't test any options and features, because i just wanted a quick impression.

The only things i dislike, for the moment are:
The graphic style is a bit odd, don't know.
The Rocket Launcher and Shotgun shots to slow.
And weapons could generate some more feedback.
(I need some more in-game time to describe this more)

So far i had some good fun with it. I think i will give it some more game play hours later.

Like I said, i just wanted a quick impression so don't expect  to much "deep knowledge" from my review here.

Bye (And sorry for my horrible grammar ^_^)

author: {'steamid': '76561198121525707', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1504038480}
review:
This is a review of free version of Toxikk



Ah...so nostalgic

If you have ever played any of Unreal Tournament parts, you will easily notice that this game is inspired by it, we can even call it a copy. Graphicaly wise, it looks alot like latest Doom game, but it runs alot better on my PC than Doom did. There are also some things from Halo, like master chief outfits and vehicles, basically this game has Halo theme

Gameplay is pretty solid, there are 9-10 different guns you pick up around the map just like in UT, however they differ a bit from UT guns, they are little more futuristic and realistic, as if you fused Halo and UT weapons. But they pretty much work the same. There is progression for armor, which is completly cosmetic and doesnt give any stat buffs. Jumping around felt smooth, hitboxes were okay.  Game pretty much feels like Unreal Tournament.

There is also single player campaign avalivable in free version



Now onto the bad part, even though this game is like Unreal Tournament, it doesnt feel as much fun, i miss alot of game modes and full servers, Toxikk was fun, but only for certain amount of time. It gets boring quickly after you play 10 matches in row in a server with 6 players where half of them are bots. Im not sure if there is competitive mode but there is leaderboard. Game is has pretty low playerbase, around 30-100 players playing at same time. Game doesnt have many maps, and they arent creative like maps in UT. 

This game is very good for 30 minute or less fast straightfoward fun, if you wanna chill out from other games and/or just shoot carelessly

Free Version restrictions:
- Cant choose a server, you can only play multiplayer via quick join (you can play with friends on f2p maps, via invite)
- There are only 3-4 maps playable in free version
- Cant customize armor


Pros:
- Good graphics, works smoothly
- There are some really nice looking maps
- Guns work fine, hitboxes are good, feels smooth even with higher ping
- Single player campaign, avaliable in free version aswell
- Good Unreal Tournament copy
- Perfect for killing half an hour and relaxing
- Free version offers good content
- Some maps have vehicles
- Bots for offline and online servers
- Steam workshop
- Customizable Crosshair and Hitmark
- Leaderboards

Cons:
- Even though maps are nice looking, they arent creative, and there isnt many of them
- 16 players per server max
- Needs more game modes (im not sure how many are there because i played free version, but i played only 2-3 different ones in around 20 matches
- Playerbase is small
- Doesnt offer much new stuff compared to Unreal Tournament

review: Fantastic game, yes it shares many aspects from UT but thats not a bad thing. Game looks great running on Unreal Engine.The movement is fluid especially with dodgeing and double jump, even though i prefer slightly faster gameplay I enjoy it netherless.Guns are well balanced ..maps are colourfull and rich in detail.I bought this game because im an Huge Arena FPS fan and miss the classic UT and Quake feel, when i saw the slogan 'Frag like its 99' I knew i needed to give it a shot.Im glad the Devs put not just their heart in this game but like many of us their passion for arena fps .

author: {'steamid': '76561198189925545', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1475872493}
review:
[h1]Playerbase[/h1]
I have this game since it was first released, but I've never really played it, 'til the f2p update.
The main reason why I didn't play it was the small playerbase, this game was dead, but now it doesn't have that problem anymore!
Yeah I know the playerbase istn't that great, but it's HUGE if you compare it to the time before the relaunch.

[h1]My Opinion[/h1]
I've never really played the old arena shooters, mainly because it was before my time, but I still know how they worked and I love this game! 
The graphics are gorgeous, but not distracting, the movement is really well done and I got into it very fast, the maps are very well balanced and [b]everything just works![/b]

I have to give my credits to the dev team, they did a GREAT job and they didn't abandon this project even though not many people played it. They created a better game with less ressources than many triple-AAA studios out there.

Last but not least I'm not a native speaker, sorry for my english!

[spoiler]I love how it got a LAN-Mode! there are not many dev's which still support the LAN-Party-Community![/spoiler]

[b]7[/b]

review: Great game. Even though the player base is pretty small, there's always someone joining me if I actually get in a empty lobby. Most, if not all of them seem like the devs took them from games like UT or quake, which is not bad at all, but I think some more 'original' weapons would be a cool addition to this already great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062531895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1500791678}
review:
The Best FPS I have played in recent years.

No pay-to-win.No "class progression".Everything is unlocked.No Skill divides either.Want to play with noobs-enable an option to get a skill-based matchmaking.Want no limits?Switch it off.Simple.

The only one getting experience in this game is the player.As it should be.
And it's free,with an option to thank the devs and get a few things on top-like the ability to host your own server.

Why it isn't more popular-I have no idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970735464', 'num_games_owned': 2915, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1532755370}
review:
If you are looking for a faithful old school RTS in the vein of Unreal Tournament '99/2k4 look no further. This game is awesome and hits all the high notes that those super classic UT games hit. It is not as big in scope but it is the best thing so far that I have played that captures that feeling. The only problem is that the online community isn't that big which sucks as this game is really good. That being said it has bots and you can host your own server to play with friends so there is tons of content to play even if the online community is lacking. Also, it is quite well optimised so it should run pretty well on a full range of gaming PCs. For the price there is no reason not to buy the full version and access the full content plus the workshop content.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198006555257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1478390855}
review:
It's a great game with a very low player base. What makes it worse that players have SCs (skill classes) that define how good you are. If you are better than average you won't be joining any game as most players are around SC 1-7. I am at SC 9 and I saw less than 5 people with 8-12 SC.

It's difficult to recommend this game because of player base and SC restriction in official servers. I would recommend getting Unreal Tournament 4 instead which offers more for free.

+Good alternative to Unreal 2004.
+better movement than UT4
+Interesting weapons albeit some are straight copies of UT

-Being above average bans you from most games. Average players like to join 1-7 SC games instead of 1-12.
-free version has more limitations than UT 4 including customization and ingame server browser (there's a workaround)
-UT4 has more maps
-Lack of translocators makes it harder to catch up with flag carriers.
-Ravager is absolutely garbage.
-some irritating lagspikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038717729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1566186783}
review:
Toxikk is dedicated providing an authentic retro-shooter experience for the dedicated fan of old school arena combat. It's a welcome distraction if you have a passing interest since it costs nothing to play, and is a ton of fun if you can have friends who are interested enough to purchase the full version and play alongside you. The core of the multiplayer shooter genre has always rested in its ability to deliver engrossing online cooperative and competitive play. Toxikk focuses on keeping that experience simple, with no loadouts, no player perks and no pay-to-win incentives, just like it used to be.

Pros
--------------------------------
+ Fast, competitive multiplayer
+ Strong sense of nostalgia
+ Steam Workshop support
+ Free-to-try for a casual player

Cons
--------------------------------
- Could use a little more creativity
- Annoying menus

Read my full review here: 

http://www.keengamer.com/article/14341_toxikk-review

author: {'steamid': '76561197960343348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1609902899}
review: This game easily rekindles a love for the old-school FPS.  No player classes here.  Everyone is on the same level.  Your skill with a mouse and keyboard combined with your knowledge of the maps is what determines your success.  The feel of Quake 3 and UT in a shiney new package.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997715737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1536943307}
review:
Pretty fun game. Frag like it's 1999, paywall like it's 2016. F2P peasants can play on 4 maps with approximately zero rights. Rank up, unlock features that you are not allowed to use. Play online on "quick match", where you are not allowed to vote for maps. Finish a match, get dropped from server because you're not allowed to play on the map someone has chosen. Play 5/12 solo contracts. Sixth will not unlock. You're no one, you're nothing but your fragging skill.
Oh, and most important thing - UT's DM_Deck (or BM_Dekk) is locked beyond paywall. The one that lured me in, yes.
Not allowed/10. Would post "Not Recommended" review, but not allowed.

Seriously, though, free edition is way too limited to decide: it looks nice, it plays nice, but after 3 hours (? I thought I played a little longer, didn't I, steam?) I still have my doubts about value to price ratio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011479897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1476226669}
review:
Oh my god, where do I even begin with this game. This game is probably the best executed FPS game in a very long time. Customizable controls, fun physics, great level design, fantastic graphics, downright impressive optimization, and the list goes on. This game is by far the most fun FPS game I have ever played, and I recommend it to everyone.

I started by getting the free edition, then proceeded to purchase the "dlc" upgrade because I strongly believe the game deserves it. The game is so wonderfully executed that I can't begin to describe how much of a breath of fresh air it is. Not a single detail of this game went unnoticed by the developers, and trust me when I say I notice every little issue. I've quit playing games because the smoothness of the looking mechanic wasn't good enough, or uninstalled games for similar small things. This game? I have not one single negative thing to say about it. Serious props to the developers.

Positives:
Amazing graphics
Wonderful optimization
Great business model
Beautiful interface
Awe inspiring customization
Fun physics
Balanced gameplay
VSync works amazingly (no input lag)

Negatives: 
The AI isn't "brilliant" but it's not stupid. Definitely retro styled.

My specs:
i7 4700hq @ 3.4 GHz
8 GB RAM
GTX 860m
(I can max this game at 1080p at a solid 60fps)

author: {'steamid': '76561198107676474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1499552455}
review:
This may not be the revival I wanted but its better than nothing, if you love the AFPS genre and just want to play a new one that has people playing it I reccoment this game. If you have high standards for AFPS and don't like rehashes or ut 2k4 double jump/dodgejump then don't play it, because you'll probably hate it. 

They should have gone with this business model to begin with, the devs really fucked up when they failed to market the game properly and listen to input from fans. Allowing people to play for free was one of the few things they could ahve done to prevent their playerbase from tanking even further. 

I don't have problems finding people to play with at the moment because of this and really even if its not the best, I'm just glad that there is an arena shooter that has new players and features vehicles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055422951', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1477860355}
review:
Feels like the best parts of old arena FPS games with all the right modernizations added, without dumbing down the game at all.
Every weapon is useful and feels like it has a place in the game for different situations, the movement mechanics are skill-based and easy to learn but difficult to master without being too steep or unforgiving (which is a thing that WAY more fps games should have, imo), the maps look pretty and are very well designed with many of them having several routes to take with fair pickup placement, and overall the game feels extremely fair. All the weapons are very balanced and you almost never feel like you were outmatched by someone just because they had a more powerful weapon than you, you can make your way through a lot of matchups just through quick reflex and good aim.
With the game having relatively low system requirements and being free to play, you pretty much have NO reason not to give this game a shot if you're a fan of fast-paced FPS games, and I'll certainly be buying the full game as soon as possible.

review: So I picked up the free version earlier, installed it, didnt wanna run on the PC absolutely acting the ballix. Then i thought to myself: "Hey, windows loves acting like a cunt, I have a fresh install, let's give this a shot again.". Boy, I couldn't have been more right. I fired 'er up, installed, loaded straight up, so we got a good start, one might say "now we're suckin Diesel". Entered a quick match, loaded up on the Jungle map, and as soon as I took 5 steps in game I was teleported straight back to my childhood when my classmates and I would get together to play Unreal Tournament. The weapons, the actions, everything. When you read the description and it says Frag like it's 1999, you better fucking believe it, cos these guys made a teleport that brings you right back there. It really is like fragging in 1999. Fucking tops.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968051276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1589005255}
review:
There's no shame in saying that this is simply a love letter/remake of Unreal Tournament (down to the inclusion of the UT classic UT DM map Deck 16).  A little more light and fluffy than the original, but not quite as flighty as UT2004.  Built on the Unreal engine, it very much maintains the basic physics and gameplay dynamics of the best of the UT series down to the dodging, and double jump/dodge of the later UT games.    It also runs smooth as butter.  A very comfy, easy to pick up and play twitch shooter.   I took the plunge after a bit and paid for the full version and it's well worth the $15.00, especially since old school twitch shooters are so few and far between these days.  But, the free version is a no brainer, simply a few options less than the paid.  

I definitely say pick this up and play around with it and get the word out on this free gem of a game, escpecially if you are vet of the classic Unreal and Quake franchises.  This is a back to basics, beautiful, simple, fun treat.  Included are classic DM and Team DM modes, plus standard Domination (king of the hill), CTF and other familiar modes (including vehicles/mechs in some levels) from the heyday of competive solo and team FPS of the last 15 years.  Looks great, feels great, helluva lot of fun.   It's nice to occasionally  pick up an easy to play shooter that sheds all of high learning curve RPG style shooters that are the rage now days.   Play for hours or a few minutes.  Easy to learn.  A shiny new coat of paint on classic FPS format.

Spread the word and build up a community for this baby!

review:
This game is really great.  I haven't paid for the $15 version, yet, but after playing the free version, i really enjoyed it so far.  It definitely brings back that "1999" feel the developers claim, so expectations were well met.

Level design is just as good as the classics, game play feels like a slightly faster unreal tournament and a slower quake 3, and the weapons are unique.

My only complaint is the weapons color, and the weapon bar.  At first look the icons in the weapons bar HUD look blurred, and the weapon models need more color to distinguish themselves from one another.

review:
D√®s les premiers instants la ressemblance avec UT se fait sentir. Et la ressemblance est si flagrante que ce jeu est donc excellent. Rapide, efficace. Les armes ne sont pas en carton, elle font des gros crat√®res et aucune place √† l'erreur. Quelques inovations au niveau des armes mais on perd le combo shock pour un lance-flamme. Enorme! Le syst√®me de dodge facilit√© permet une adaptation du syst√®me un peu plus rapide que sur les UT200X. 

Graphiquement c'est une bombe, au niveau du dernier UT d'Epic Games. Tourne parfaitement en moyen sur une config modeste, et il reste monstrueux √† la r√©tine. L'optimisation semble √™tre au rendez-vous, aucun crash ni bug pour l'instant.

Dommage, la quantit√© de joueur reste encore assez faible.. Allez les gars!

author: {'steamid': '76561198111005685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1528108813}
review:
PRIME IMPRESSIONI
Veramente figo, non avevo mai provato un fps arena e questo qui mi ha davvero preso.
Molti dicono che i server sono vuoti, io ci ho giocato alle 8 di mattina e vi assicuro che le partite le trovate facilmente in quick match.
Le armi sono tutte divertenti da usare e il gioco √® perfettamente bilanciato.
La grafica √® bella e pulita e mi √® sembrato di capire che possa girare anche sulle calcolatrici.
Insomma, che siate un giocatore con poca esperienza  o che siate un noscalgico veterano dei lan party (vecchi di mme) questo gioco sapr√† appassionarvi e coinvolgervi. 
P.S: potete provare prima dell'acquisto la versione gratuita. O anche senza acquisto, Che si sa l'italiano medio stringe il culo quando sente la parola "acquisto".

author: {'steamid': '76561197965838221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4446, 'last_played': 1475890082}
review:
Its an old school FPS like UT. If youre in to that stlye of game, you could get a couple hours of enjoyment out of it. It plays very much like the first Unreal Tournement.
This type of arena game style is dead and been dead for sometime and it shows from its player attendance. Good for them in making it but I dont know why someone would want to make this type of shooter anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119733688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1475523990}
review: This game really does play as an old-style shooter. I almost feel like I'm playing one of the originals, albeit with much better graphics. As such, it plays well and manages to retain the in-your-face action of modern shooters while maintaining simpler, balanced gameplay. It is a good game. That said, free players should note that customization is off limits. There is no detriment to playing free in terms of mechanics, but the starting skull-helmet is ugly. Which brings me to my only real concern - all of the helmets are ugly. Good game, but why must I look like an evil overlord in power armor?

author: {'steamid': '76561198103576402', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1483427034}
review:
Ever miss the old Quake III Arena multiplayer? Here it is, this reminds me of the old days when fast paced movement and last second decisions rewarded you with longer survival. I would highly recommend this to anyone who loves fast paced shooters, fps specifically. Not recommended for those who rage at deaths, as you will die within a few shots and respawn a few seconds later.

The downside is the lack of Australian servers, I was always put onto Vietnamese servers with 200 ping, regardless I would still hit the highest score. Additionally players are scarce, but I can imagine a heap of friends playing this game just for fun every now and then.

My rating: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055431218', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1755, 'last_played': 1604878724}
review:
Pros:
-I ran a car into a mech which exploded, and then mid-air headshotted the pilot
-Twin peaks, greatest map ever

Cons:
-Some balancing issues in spawn locations near weapons in arena maps.
-The streamer breaks if it touches anything
-Needs more contracts

But in all seriousness, just get this game, even the free version. I'm quite new to the arena-style shooters, and usually spend my time on tf2. And i didn't play tf2 for a week after i got TOXIKK. The game is very fast paced, with a weapon for everyone.

P.S. Sorry this is a bad review, just get the damn game.
