author: {'steamid': '76561197967535686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1475232885}
review:
I loved UT, played it from the very first installment. I loved Quake, I loved Doom and all that was hardcore fastpaced fragging action back in the day....

THIS IS NOT LIKE THAT.

The feel of the guns and the action is absolutely terrible. I'm sure itll be more playable with practise but every gun feels like youre trying to hit something a mile away. Don't make an oldschool shooter without the fun, visceral gameplay.
The hitmarker gives a little mechanical *bleep* sound. When I shoot someone with a shotgun, rocketlauncher or sniperrifle, i dont want to hear *bleep*... I want to hear SPLAT! DOOF! CRUNCH! AAAAIEEAAAUAUUGGHGHHH!!! WHY GOD, WHY!!? MOMMY! I WANT MY MOMMY!... But i digress.

Try it if it sounds good to you, its nice that its free to play, and perhaps you can get accustomed enough to the STEAMING PILES OF USELESS SEMI-FUTURISTIC GARBAGE that they call guns and have some fun?

Perhaps you will even be lucky and be online at a moment when theres more than 3 people online worldwide!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050361620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1498946902}
review: Gameplay is ok. The matchmaking is horrible however. If you do get this game and plan on playing against other people, DO NOT PLAY BOT MATCHES. The bots are braindead and you get ranked up by killing them, which will prevent you from playing with other people. Yeah you can kill easy bots and accidentally get such a high SC (this games mmr) that you can no longer play with the majority of people in the game. Not playing with bots restricts you to being able to play with one of the 10 other people in relevant game modes that are online at any given time. Don't you dare try to say anything about the matchmaking on the forums however, because the devs will come out of nowhere and basically flame you like its a youtube comment telling you that even though you just had a horrible experience trying to find a match for an hour, that you actually had a great time! You just didn't know! It is actually funny how childish the developers are. No joke. Just go to the steam community and look at any thread that even slightly criticizes the game. You will see multiple devs avoiding the topics being brought up and basically flaming the players! It is outrageous, but also kind of funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172265561', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1504711709}
review: TOXIKK is not exactly what I was looking for, as I was hoping more for Quake 3 than Unreal Tournament, which is essentially what this game is, but it is fast-paced and fun enough that I have decided to stay, and eventually will give the dev's my money, as I only have the free version for now. I haven't touched the vehicles yet. I see a lot of people complain about them, but in the free version, the maps with vehicles are so small that they are pointless. The game shines in its deathmatch and capture the flag modes, but there is a domination-like mode that I don't care much for. In most games, you have to hold the point. In this, you just have to touch it to capture it. I didn't care much for other games' domination modes in the first place, though. There is a stealth system, similar to active camo in halo, but it only lasts for about a second, so you really need to learn how to move before you can use it effectively. It adds to the gameplay's frenetic nature, as you fly around and suddenly are being ambushed from an angle you weren't expecting. This game boasts "frag like its 1999," and it definitely delivers. The guns feel appropriately balanced and movement is free enough to allow for crazy gun battles games like the Doom remake or Call of Duty simply can't deliver. Doom and Call of Duty also can't run on potatoes. So go ahead, break out that old laptop from 2009, and download this game, if you really want to, just because you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972159658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1507156556}
review:
Als alter Unreal Tournament Spieler muss ich sagen: Genialer Shooter! Denn das Gameplay ist absolut das selbe. Wenn man UT & Co. fr√ºher gespielt hat, f√ºhlt man sich bei Toxikk sofort wohl. Dodgen, Double-Jumps, Dodge-Jumps, Slide-Jumps, schnelles Gameplay - ordentlich Raum f√ºr "Skill" statt einfach nur ballern. Leider hat nur 90% der Spieler nie das Tutorial gelesen oder jemals Unreal Tournament gespielt. Anders kann man sich das "ich laufe nur durch die Gegen und schie√üe statt einmal zu dodgen" Verhalten erkl√§ren ;-) 
Insgesamt ein definitiv empfehlenswerter Shooter mit sehr vielen Einstellungsm√∂glichkeiten und durchaus Potential. Warum "nur" durchaus? Weil es 1) extrem an Spielern mangelt und 2) die Map Auswahl durch die "Free Edition" auf Servern meist sehr begrenzt ist f√ºr die "Full Price" Zahler + insgesamt ein paar mehr Maps zur Abwechslung ganz gut w√§ren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059609232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1536214172}
review:
This game is awesome. Theres the same action that UT2k4 has with a shiny coat on it. Framerate is really smooth with little to no tearing on 60hz. The options are excellent but I would like to have a drop down console for commands. The maps are great although there arent many servers that have more than the core maps. I would like to see some official servers support more modes and maps. I get bored playing the same 4 maps all the time.

Weapon design is very good. It took me some getting used to, but they are all well balanced. The action gets very intense and I love how the games music changes based on where you stand during battle.

Overall if you love Unreal, Xonotic, and Quake you will love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031533829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2278, 'last_played': 1522907770}
review:
Hey you!
Yes you. You, who remember good old times when first-person shooters like Quake 3 or Unreal Tournament ruled the world. I bet that you have fond memories of those times - playing death-match with friends, total strangers or bots all day long. You started slow but eventually you improved and rocket jumped like a king. It was fun seeing how your skill went up while still getting stomped by the real pros from time to time.

Now fast forward to present day. You are now in mid 30s, working hard in full-time job and you don't really have time to play games anymore. But maybe you should... play a game which feels like something from 1999. A game where your body automatically remembers everything - how to aim with slow rocket launcher, how to predict and shoot grenade launcher, how to snipe those poor guys in the air or just how to run faster and jump further than normal.

Yes, you should play Toxikk - a game which brings pure old school Unreal Tournament-like experience (as opposed to Quake-like) just in new "clothes". It costs only 15E but there is also a free demo. I think that if you loved that kind of games in 1999, you will definitely like this one. I mean - you deserve this game.

Also tell your friends about it too :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198060644661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1475089094}
review: Didn't take long for me to delete this game. It feels like a knockoff HALO to me. Meaning it turned into rocket whore paradise. The free version is really a demo and nothing more. There is no customization for the free version and you are stuck with one game mode.  I can't experience the full game because they want $15, which is no big deal, but the first impression just didn't justify it. Another thing I found strange was that if you turn down your mouse sensitivity you can't turn left or right. WTF? I don't think I have ever seen a game do that, that I can remember, but it seems the norm if I like it turned down then I should be able to move. I think I might have had a different opinion of this game if I could experienmce it more. Maybe if a full version F2P comes along for the weekend I might give it try. Until then, I'll pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007607571', 'num_games_owned': 862, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1512576456}
review:
There's a looming threat hanging over any multiplayer game, becoming more and more apparent as time goes by and digital distribution stores such as Steam offer more and more content. It is, as you know, lack of playerbase.

Lack of playerbase is a degenerative sickness of game medium. In its first phase, it brings games down to their knees and than completely destroys them. Simply, there are no well defined rules which game will suffer from it, but most affected are indie games without well oiled and highly paid PR machinery. 

TOXIKK's been on my radar since I first saw their "Frag Like It's 1999!" tagline. It aims to provoke warm and fuzzy feelings in the belly of all arena shooter players who were active playing that kind of games at the end of the nineties and beginnings of 21st century. In digital years, we're talking about one of the prehistoric eras of gaming - let me remind you that kids born in 2000 are now 16 years old and may have never heard, yet played your favorite old school games.

Of course, the whole arena shooter concept has been almost beaten to death by FPS evolution. Come to think of it, we haven't seen any significant games with that ancient concept in the last few years. Loadouts, items, cover systems, iron sights, all these elements made FPS much more complicated and, unfortunately in many cases, more boring beasts. They became standards so many people these days don't really understand the concept of arena shooters.

Probably after experiencing an extremely low playerbase during their paid Early Access phase, Reakktor Studios made a brilliant decision and offered new players a chance to try their game for free. TOXIKK's FREE edition is much more than a demo - it basically keeps only several game elements behind the paywall. These are server browser, map voting, customizing your character and some maps. As such, Free Edition will suit casual players more than fine and, by buying Full Edition, you will be able to customize your gaming experience even more. Mechanics-wise, it needs to be said, there's no difference between two versions and when you shoot, you need to shoot to kill. No money deal can save your from rocket launcher fire, you know?

If we judge TOXIKK by its tagline, it's making an obvious reference to arena shooter classics such as Quake III Arena and Unreal Tournament. However, it isn't that simplified. Yes, TOXIKK does follow the rules: you spawn with simple pistol, you pick armor and weapons off the ground and they don't last beyond your death. It's fast paced and frantic, you will be missing more while backtracking than standing, shooting and hitting the target. 

However, it also implements vehicles so game clearly and closely resembles Unreal Tournament 2004 which is still being loved, cherished and played around the globe. UT2004 seems like the main inspiration for the game in the terms of movement as well. Also, some ideas have mutated and presented itself in TOXIKK as its own: short-term invisibility and playing-dead abilities are definitely adding a new layer to the same ol', same ol' routine. They especially come in handy when it comes to matches that require a certain amount of strategical thinking, such as Capture The Flag.

If we talk about ideas, TOXIKK basically brings nothing new to the table. We have seen it all. However, innovation is not purpose of TOXIKK's existence. As a homage, Reakktor's game is doing wonders - all weapons have double modes and have that 'I've seen this somewhere before' feeling attached. You will be fighting in well known and classic modes such as area domination, capture the flag and deathmatch. These modes have been named differently (for example, deathmatch is Blood Lust), but the rules are still the same. 

Game visual design is what really makes TOXIKK stand out - it is modern and awesome looking. However, this is double-edged sword because colorful maps and shiny weapons will sometimes impact your game performance, not in the technical, but skill field. I like to keep all the shine toned down a bit because sometimes it's rather hard to concentrate on your opponents and their movements, especially on maps that boast different neon lights and colors.

Level design is spot on. From cramped, arena style spaces to wide open levels, TOXIKK has it all. Interiors and exteriors are brilliantly modeled and designed for balance. However, only a blind person or someone who didn't play the classics will not see obvious thef... (homage!) of blueprints that most TOXIKK's maps are based on. DEKK is basically Deck 16. The Citadel is larger version of Facing Worlds and so on. But I don't really mind because good copies are more than welcomed here. 

TOXIKK also boasts its own experience level and skill class system. First one is a way for person to unlock many different personalization options which let you customize your soldier's appearance. Skill Class is a concept of keeping the players of the similar rank on the same servers. However, if you want hardcore experience, Skill Class can be turned off so you will be able to join No-SC servers and be obliterated by veterans of the genre. 

Skill class and EXP points can be earned via multiplayer games or solo experience which consists of contracts and skirmish games. Contracts are basically matches that have several objectives listed such as winning, finishing within certain time limit and so on.

TOXIKK's gameplay is enjoyable. As stated previously, it is fast-paced and there's no need to think - you shoot and ask questions later. It is important to mention TOXIKK does not feel like a cheap knock-off and that's the best thing about it. If UT2004 was made in 2016, it would definitely look and feel like this. There's nothing wrong with it if you're a member of niche audience. I wholeheartedly recommend you to, at least, try out Free Edition.
 
***

Hey, you've liked this review? Hated it? It made you buy the game / abandon the idea of buying this game? Super awesome! Share the love and join the group here: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/libereviews Follow the curator's page here: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10953338/

author: {'steamid': '76561198126382801', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1473852790}
review: From playing for 40 minutes i see that this game has pretty much nothing in it, gt730 can run it only on 800x600 (as i did) and on lowest graphical settings of course. First training level is confusing and really bad quality. I like did all stuff till the veichle repair part and i had nothing more to do than just go to the "pro player" path. This game really reminds me of COD, so i would say that it is a little bit ripoff to that style games. I would sell it for 5 dollars/euros if i get to choose. Yes graphics are good and maybe online is too but game inside it reminds me too much of COD:BO3, also the training levels look too confusing and has barely any textures. They give you free game wich from first sight seems like legit full game but next day they just put this blue box "The free edition of Toxikk is a lot more than just a demo... " and i realise that i spent time on waiting for it to download and having huge ping in CS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238252608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1484047121}
review:
Ich habe Jahrelang, tausende (!) Stunden damit verbracht einen indizierten Titel, der "2004" im Namen trug zu suchten. Ich habe es geliebt aber dadurch, dass die CoD Serie damals zu popul√§r geworden ist sind viele Mitspieler dort hin abgewandert.  Es waren auch schnelle Shooter - aber nie das selbe wie der indizierte Titel, der "2004" im Namen trug.

Und jetzt gibts Toxikk - Frische Grafik mit dem alten Spielgef√ºhl!

Obwohl ich Jahrelang keinen Arenashooter mehr gespielt habe ging das Movement direkt in der ersten Runde geschmeidig von den Fingern. Das Gameplay ist schnell, impulsiv und bockt einfach total!


Wer die Klassiker damals geliebt hat wird hier richtig derbe Spa√ü mit haben. 

..und da es sogar eine richtig gro√üz√ºgige Free-Version gibt kostet es euch nichtmal einen Cent euch davon zu √ºberzeugen. Da ich diese Art der Verkaufspolitik richtig gut finde werde ich mir kommenden Monat die Full-Version zulegen. Nicht mal wegen den paar zus√§tzlichen Features sondern weil es die 15 Kr√∂ten wert ist. Bei vielen geldgeilen Publishern bekommt man f√ºr die Kohle meist nichtmal eine von dr√∂fl DLCs und Reakktor legt hier was auf den Tisch was mir jetzt schon mehr Spa√ü bereitet als die 4 letzten MW-Teile zusammen! GEIL GEIL GEIL!

PS: Der Rocketlauncher ist nicht OP - der passt so. Man muss halt nur mal √ºberlegen, wie man sein Movement ihm gegen√ºber gestaltet. ;) 
H√∂here Position, nicht direkt vor W√§nden/Hindernissen/schmale G√§nge bewegen und dann passt das.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999082048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1474829872}
review:
[b]Short version[/b]: If fast arena shooters a la Unreal Tournament are your thing, I heavily recommend checking this one out. The free version doesn‚Äôt give you access to all maps for example but TOXIKK is not a F2P game with ingame microtransactions ‚Äì it‚Äôs a great way to test the game before buying it.


[b]Longer version[/b]: After being in EA for some time, Toxikk now got fully released and offers an experience focussed on players who prefer the old-school way of competitive multiplayer games.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Of course the game has some kind of background story with you playing as a mercenary fighting for one of two giant corporations who‚Äôre battling each other over the newly discovered element Edenium but you can safely forget all this now: It‚Äôs an arena-shooter where you‚Äôre running and jumping around the level and killing opponents ‚Äì there‚Äôs no big story stuff going on or even a real singleplayer campaign for you to experience.

On a couple of different maps, several being used for more than just one game mode (there are: Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag and Domination), you‚Äôre fighting with a variety of different guns: your standard Raven pistol, a shotgun and an assault rifle as well as more exotic weapons like the Stingray plasma gun or the Cerberes rocket launcher. All weapons have two fire modes, the assault rifle for example can also fire grenades and the Stingray either fires single plasma projectiles or a long-range plasma beam.

The maps vary greatly in design, from straightforward ones like the factory map Ehrgeiz over snowy environments (Twin Peaks) to far more complex ones like the city-map Foundation or the jungle and ruins mix Artifact. Most maps offer several paths as well as open zones and several height levels which means there‚Äôre a lot of ways to get to the objective but also a lot of positions to get shot from; some maps give you access to vehicles like a mech or an assault bomber. Mutators can be used to modify match-settings.

This old-schooly-ness (sorry for the creation) is summarised by the dev as ‚Äúno bullshit‚Äù: there‚Äôre no loadouts, no health-regen, no cover and no classes. You have to collect health and armour on the map, weapons and ammo also have to be picked up but you can carry all the weapons in the game at the same time and then switch between them at any time you want.
The only type of progression system the game has are 16 levels of experience you slowly gain over time; this doesn‚Äôt have any effect on the game though and your skill is measured separately in 12 levels and then used for match making. This seems to work quite well, but as a beginner you will still need a thick skin and get used to getting destroyed horribly in several matches before celebrating your first successes ‚Äì unless you‚Äôre a pro at this type of game to begin with ofc.


[h1]Technical stuff[/h1]
Game performance is, as expected and needed for this kind of game, very good with very moderate hardware requirements. It‚Äôs not a bad looking game under any circumstances but overall it‚Äôs nothing special art-wise; I much more enjoyed the colourful style of UT 2004 for example ‚Äì TOXIKK looks a little bit‚Ä¶bland and generic sometimes. 

Since this game screams old-school arena-shooter from every cell, I think I don‚Äôt need to say much about the controls: they‚Äôre spot-on and work perfectly.


[h1]Summary[/h1]
For the exact differences between Free and Full version check the description page of the game; here‚Äôre just a few points: Free version means access to less maps, not the full contracts ‚Äúcampaign‚Äù and no customization options (which are purely cosmetically). In addition, you miss out on some nice features like the server browser or the vote-map system. 
Personally I‚Äôm not a big fan of this genre, its‚Äô too fast and too chaotic for me; I prefer games with a battlefield and frontlines and my performance in this game is accordingly bad.

Nevertheless, I can appreciate what Reakktor are doing here and for this low price of just about 15‚Ç¨ you‚Äôll get a full package of action-loaded fun in a clean but cool environment. It‚Äôs nothing innovative or new but that also never was the dev‚Äôs intention. If you‚Äôre still not sure if this is your thing I recommend checking out the test-version and playing a few matches ‚Äì you can even play against bots.



You will find a full video review (incl. gameplay, who would‚Äôve guessed) here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X4aDJD-V9KY

author: {'steamid': '76561198087866521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1594849858}

author: {'steamid': '76561198302153288', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1497984053}
review: I don't think anyone asked for a game like TOXIKK in recent years however its refreshing to see the fast pace of games like Unreal Tournament be revived and with some fantastic graphics to accompany it. Even for a free game, TOXIKK has plenty of content to be satisfied with and even with a paid version existing using the free version you aren't inferior to paid players. Though in the free version you may have a limited amount of maps and zero customization, it doesn't take away from the fact that its a fast paced and highly fun game. It's a great game and it's free. I definitley reccomend this to fans of arena shooters like Unreal Tournament and I reccomend it to FPS fans in general. Games like this should be supported. For a rating I'd say an 8/10

Anyways, the game probably follows through on what it promises, I just don't care to stick around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128547733', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1542473320}
review:
Shareware. Now that's a term I haven't heard in a long time.
Honestly, this game is really freaking fun. It reminds me of my favorite childhood game, Timesplitters, where you just gun all day and have no care in the world. The only issue I see in this is weapon balancing, like a few other people have seen. The Flamethrower, aka Dragoneer, is highly powerful with a longrange flame stream that kills people in a second and a half, with the assault rifle having a highly difficult time killing somebody within three seconds. Same for the rocket launcher, or Cerebrus, whchever you perefer, save for the fact it does not have a ridiculously high charge alt shot like Dragoneer and instead (taking accurate guess) has an anti-vehicle homing system. Now, with this recreating the 1999 experience, the high power weapons seems like a must as most older arcade shooters had one weapon to rule them all type of pvp shtick, so I say recreating that experience? Pretty damned well, I'd say.
EDIT: Speaking of high powered weapons, I feel as if explosives and the Dragoneer are commonly used, as the feeling of innacurracy really makes people want to use explosives. With the cerebrus also oneshotting a newspawned player, it tends to turn them off especially if the leader has a godlike by using mostly only Cerebrus and Dragoneer. On one match, I litterally felt like I was camping the Cerebrus spawn because it was constantly getting swarmed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084003984', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1500610881}
review:
The free version is pretty seriously trimmed down, and it's disingenuous to try to sell it as something more than a demo -- especially saying "it's the same core multiplayer experience!". You can only use 'quick match' matchmaking, which seems to prefer to throw you into basically-empty servers, and playing games with friends is out of the question, unless you happen to accidentally be thrown into the same quickmatch server. You seem to be restricted to two maps, neither of which have vehicles, although there's some interaction with vehicles in the singleplayer boot camp missions. The game is still fun, but it's definitely not a replacement for the real retail version, as they might lead you to believe.

It's unfortunate that TOXIKK has adopted a full-retail no-microtransaction model... I'd rather play a free arena FPS and pay the occasional $5 for a custom hud/weapon skin/player model, versus dumping $20 into a game I can't even play with friends that run the free edition.

That being said, the game is BEAUTIFUL, and is playable maxed-out on even modest systems (I'm on a xeon w3520, 8gb of ddr3 1066, and a gtx 570). There's a lot of advanced movement mechanics similar to warsow -- lots of wall jumping and sprinting up slopes, air strafing, etc. It seems like it'd be a lot of fun to play at a high level.

review:
Je sais pas vraiment si je peux recommander toxikk: c'est un tr√®s bon jeu, mais il est quelque peu obsol√®te et mis en PLS par Unreal Tournament, dont il s'inspire, mais dont la version la plus r√©cente a tout de plus que lui, en √©tant gratuit.

Toxikk est rest√© sur l'UE3 (mais il est tr√®s beau pour un jeu sur ce moteur) et est tr√®s proche de UT, ceci dit...
- feeling d√©gueulasse sur les armes
- d√©veloppeurs qui se niquent eux m√™mes (parties bloqu√©es selon son rang qui casse bien le multi)
- Prix/com/early access rat√©e = presque pas de joueurs.

Sinon dans le gameplay c'est UT avec des innovations, donc forc√©ment c'est bon, comme tout FPS d'arene bien foutu. Si il y avait plus de joueurs, j'y jouerais beaucoup plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024728469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1659, 'last_played': 1570404495}
review:
In time where all is "Classes",  "Heroes with abilities" and etc. people needed and wanted somthing like that game ! I'm long time HL1 DM player and im sick of all kinds of MOBA type games! I still pay HL1 and wanted to play somthing new and diffrent but without all that MOBA elements. #@!$&^%$#% even Quake is becoming class type game .... I think one of the reasons why TOXIKK will be one of the best arena shooters of 2016 and next years is because it will be only game with cutting edge technology engine and classic hardcore lerning NO CLASS base game!

I try free version and buy it after first nonstop 4 hours session!
Free version coming with limitations but after last patch 1.01 ( if i remember correctly ) you can play with friends in same official server! Just read official discussion forums for more info about that feature! They do allot for FREE version!

Another great feature is that you can run dedicated server and you can add mods to it! So someone can make HL, CS, like mods to this game ( i hope to see AGmini mod like HL1 ).

I just love this game and if you love classic FPS Arena shooters you will love that game too :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016467148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1476381353}
review:
This game really gets close to how it was back in an earlier period with shooters. It's got vehicles, and good game modes.

But the one glaring issue that I have is being able to just cloak at the drop of a pin. You don't know how many pathetic cowards I've ran into that just grab a rocket launcher and spam cloak every 2 seconds that they can. Which its funny they  even think they're good if they do well. Obviously I know it's a suit feature as of the first time I booted it up and the first game I entered it was already hotkeyed to my mouse if I actually ever was to use it. But then again as I said cowards use such a feature. I've cloaked about 11 times? For the 2.7 hours I've put in so far?




Also I'm glad to see this little well made gem of a con written by someone else. (Pretty bad to see up to at least 9 cons.....)

"9. Maps are made for controlling a particular area, usually that has a rocket launcher. Area's give alot of advantage versus any other player (RL, super armor, megahealth can be found in close proximities on some maps, to rocket launcher, which also leads to high, advatage areas on the map that usually have 1 or 2 entrances)."






Last time I checked old school shooters had power ups availible for pickup, not built in your suit for free use. Old school shooter games are supposed to be about twitching faster and killing that guy the split sceond he hops around the corner, not just tapping your cloak and camping for your UAV. Oh! or just being a rocket launcher piece of trash that can't aim.
 Which kills a lot of the fun in this game you pass by a guy cloaked in a corner with a rocket launcher (Yes, people are still visible but they're more so while moving.) Now I just have to await the royal b|tchatry by the game's fanboys. Every game has them.

Oh well I can't be too harsh they haven't gotten my money. I doubt they will until they change some sh|t.

review:
Mitig√©...

1 : l'acc√©l√©ration de la souris, par d√©faut √† 0, n'est pas nullle : mettre √† -30 !! (miais bon, c'est juste un r√©glage)
2 : apr√®s cela, les contr√¥les, d√©placements et tout, cool ! C'est entre un UT et un quake (double jump, esquives...)
3 : les armes, sympa, ce qu'il faut dans un FPS arena (bien pens√©, le lance-flammes !!)
4 : le petit bip quand tu fais mouche, c'est cool
5 : visuellement, il est sympa !
6 : la version DEMO, c'est le jeu complet "lite", et √ßa, c'est cool !
7 : 100% compatible √©cran 21:9

pourquoi mitig√© dans ce cas, me direz-vous ?

Extr√®mement brouillon dans le design des power-ups ! Impossible de vraiment identifier si ce que tu ramasses est de la vie, de l'armure, ou une munition de teller ou telle arme.... Et dans une ar√®ne, ce qui est vital, c'est justement d'identifer ce que tu dois ramasser quand tu es a cour de munitions / vie / armure.
En + de cela l'HUD est mal pens√© : les infos sont vraiment aux extr√©mit√©s de l'√©cran, monochrome, oblig√© de chercher pour trouver ce que tu cherches.

Pas cool donc.

Je penche donc pour le NON, car ces points sont cruciaux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233850300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1527445059}
review:
Fast passed, adrenaline fueling awesomeness. 

The game is FREE! Just try it.

You get a great first person shooter, that takes queues from Unreal Tournament. This isn't a bad thing though. 
Classless multiplayer means that it‚Äôs like a Black Friday mob for weapons. 

The payed version is worth it, you get server browser, more maps, and customization. 

In the end it‚Äôs a really great free shooter that has a payed option. 

I have to applaud the developers for getting their game out of early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040322873', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2420, 'last_played': 1587247481}
review:
I played this for almost two hours straight when first DL and for a free game, it was a good ... from time to time the game did freeze specially when you were low on an energy and in the middle of combat ... other than that didnt really experience anything on this game so far... since it was late at night thats why i stop playing ... I would recommend this game and thinking of purchasing ... for $15 i dont think its bad compare to some of the $60 games out there ... One other thing is that when it switches maps I dont recall seeing what the objective was and it did get me confused at times on what to do...one minute i was in a team then the next its a free for all then its capture the flag ...no description on what to do ...


Edit: July 14 2017 
well since my review the game has improved a lot .. the maps have expanded and the game balance is a whole lot better ... more choices .. being able to vote on a map and a few other things ...  I still enjoy playing this as I still recommended giving this game a try ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198023900055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1492747886}
review:
A great arena shooter inspired by games like Unreal Tournament and Quake. The developers are awesome because they don't have microtransactions or any free to play business models with gimmicks. There is a demo version, and the full version and that is it.

The game itself it great, it feels like a combination of Unreal Tournament and Halo. There is a good variety of game modes and maps, as well as Steam Workshop Support for people who want to make maps to contribute to the community.

The weapons feel great, the sound effects are awesome as well and make each shot feel powerful. There are vehicles in some game modes, but they are meant to support combat and not be the center of attention, the vehicles are very simmilar to the vehicles in Unreal Tournament 2004.

There also is character customization which is a nice bonus to make your character look unique and to personalize your appearance.

Overall, I give it a 10/10. The game is well made, fun, and has a great community around it with very few toxic players.

Definately go out and buy it if you loved games like UT2004 and Quake 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020549899', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1699729606}
review:
J'attendais un "nouveau" fast FPS digne de Quake, je suis enti√®rement satisfait, techniquement je trouve √ßa mieux qu'Unreal tournament, mais moins bien que Quake.

Niveau technique de mouvement on peut aller tr√®s vite, combiner un walljump pour rejump apr√®s c'est une super id√©e, niveau des armes il manquerait un petit shaftgun mais bon c'est vrai que c'√©tait assez p√©t√© sur Quake d√©j√†, moi je suis combl√© en tout cas avec ce jeu, √©videment la seule chose √† reprocher c'est qu'il y a peu de monde et vu que je dose pas mal les fast fps je me suis retrouv√© tr√®s vite avec un skill class de 9/10, ce qui fait que je tombe que sur les bons joueurs qui ne se connectent pas forc√©ment souvent, mais bon, il y a quand m√™me plus de joueurs en ce moment que certains autres fast fps tr√®s connus ! (skill class √©tant le syst√®me pr√©tendant pouvoir √©valuer le skill d'une personne sur une √©chelle de 1 et 12 sur des crit√®res encore inconnues apparement, qui ne se font pas que sur les victoires contre des skill class plus √©lev√©s).

review:
Un juego muy al estilo Unreal Tournament o Doom (2016) Multiplayer pero con la opci√≥n de jugar gratuitamente o pagar por todo el contenido. Su problema NO es el Pay2Win, sino que la versi√≥n free est√° extremadamente limitada: S√≥lo 2 modos de juego (kill them all y kill them all in teams), s√≥lo 2 mapas, no se puede buscar manualmente servidores, no se puede crear team con amigos, no se puede elegir los mapas para cada ronda, no se puede jugar a la campa√±a.

El juego en s√≠ mismo en su aspecto t√©cnico y jugable es bueno, las partidas son entretenidas, pero los servidores vac√≠os (4/12 jugadores) y la imposibilidad de buscar manualmente servidores con m√°s jugadores (en la versi√≥n free) impiden una verdadera entretenci√≥n online.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966913375', 'num_games_owned': 1010, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1474123153}
review:
The game shares a lot of similarities with Unreal Tournament, its obvious source of inspiration. TOXIKK has a free edition, which does not include all the maps, the ability to vote for maps, the level editor, Steam workshop integration, a server browser, or character customization, but does include everything else. While the game focuses on online multiplayer, offline bot matches are available as well. Typical game modes are included (deathmatch, team deathmatch, capture the flag, and domination), along with a host of rules mutators. Weapons are also fairly uninspired: a melee attack, pistol, shotgun, assault rifle, sniper rifle, plasma rifle, flame thrower, and rocket launcher. All weapons have an alternate fire attack, and larger maps include vehicles (bikes, jeeps, hover jets, mechs) to get around. Game pace involves quick movement with double-jumps and dodges and expedient kills. Overall, TOXIKK is an acceptable substitute for Unreal Tournament that doesn‚Äôt add anything significantly new to the classic formula.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lPnQqsNacn4

author: {'steamid': '76561198192316310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1475697114}
review:
This game is essentially a RECENT RELEASE that has the following:
-No Microtransactions
-No 'Early Access' Tag that usually gets the unsure/never buying it reaction
-Optimization aplenty *though I recommend lowering graphics settings as THAT can cause lag otherwise, especially Blur as no one wants to practically throw up after a life.*
-A Free Version that is only SLIGHTLY neutered but otherwise is just the full game.
-Excellent Mobility Options that, combined with the good weapons and some well placed aim, makes you feel like a GOD.
-VEHICLES That actually work *Including a Giant Mecha you can pilot* And a good feeling moment whenever you would drop those vehicles on foot.
-Aforementioned Good Weapons like a Laser Rifle that fires a Straight Laser as the secondary fire, A Rocket Launcher, An Assault Rifle with Grenade Launcher, A Flamethrower that can shoot charged fireballs with Alt Fire, and others.
-A good Development Team who will get right on any problems they can see.
-And did I mention no Microtransactions?

Just..get this game, even if only the Free Version and if you don't like it then its fine: It may not be everyone's cup of tea, but if you want some UT mixed with Quake in a setting of PMCs. This game is for you.
Also it was made by a SMALL studio, with the refinement seen? You'd think it was something much bigger than it really was.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992155494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1489864247}
review:
Sometime before Epic announced UT4, I remember reading that they were pretty much OK with someone taking the UDK, which UT3 was a tech demo for, and building their own UT-like game out of it.  So someone went and did it.  And here we are, with a game which is for all purposes a UT3 reskin.

And the result is in no way a bad thing.  UT3's core mechanics of running and shooting were the most technically sound of the entire UT series, but there were otherwise some severe flaws -- primarily in the visual and gameplay design.  It's nice to see these recognized by a developer who is consciously taking steps to not make these same mistakes.

The blurry, drab, monocrhome color palette is gone and replaced with bright colorful hues that make the levels a pleasure to look at and the gameplay situation easy to read.  And UT2-style dodge jumping is back, bringing a new (or rather forgotten) level of depth to movement mechanics that rewards players for being as skilled with their keyboard as they are with their mouse.

It'll all feel very familiar -- it's a bunch of old ideas bolted onto something you've already played before.  And it's all done rather well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970547128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1542317800}
review:
Toxikk, der neue Shooter, der von sich selbst behauptet, man w√ºrde (ihn) spielen wie 1999. Ein Grund also f√ºr uns, das mal anzutesten.

Und tats√§chlich: Toxikk kommt ohne viel Schnickschnack, Klassen, Perks und riesigen Maps daher. Der Ablauf ist schnell und gewohnt wie man es von Quake 3 Arena oder UT 99 oder UT 2003/2004 kennt. 

Dodgen, schie√üen, Health- und Ammopacks und fertig. Und dazu noch ein klein wenig Unsichtbarkeit f√ºr wenige Sekunden - der Taktik halber. Bisher macht das Spiel absolut Laune, wenngleich der "Cerberus", der Raketenwerfer nervt, da er zu h√§ufig zu haben ist und auf den kleinen Maps einfach zu schnell den Spielern den Garaus macht. Daf√ºr bietet Toxikk aber einen LAN-Modus, ein eigenes Serverhosting und Moddingm√∂glichkeiten, von denen die ersten Bastler auch gleich Gebraucht gemacht haben, wie man im STEAM Workshop sehen kann.

Dazu l√§sst sich Toxikk kostenlos und unbegrenzt lange in in begrenztem Umfang spielen. Und wer den Titel dann kaufen m√∂chte, kann dies derzeit mit 20% Rabatt zu rund 12,- ‚Ç¨ tun. Und die Entwickler setzen noch eins obendrauf: f√ºr rund 32,- ‚Ç¨ kann man ein 4er Pack erwerben, das man an seine Freunde verschenkt. Damit kostet jeden das Spiel weniger als 10,- ‚Ç¨

Soweit macht Toxikk also alles richtig. Hoffen wir, dass das so bleibt und das Spiel k√∂nnte eins der Dauergames wie UT, Q3 oder CoD UO/4 werden!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039608072', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1511052129}
review:
This game is a lot of fun. I spent some time trying out the game before deciding to buy and here's the summary of my experience playing the Free version. Let's start with the stuff you can't do:

[*] You don't get to see all maps in the free version
[*] You don't get to see all vehicles: this it's understandable since the vehicles you can't use happen to be available in the maps you can't play
[*] The campaign is limited to the first few missions
[*]You can't get all the achievements: again, it's because the achievements you can't get are tied to the maps and contracts you can't play
[*] You can't access the server browser in game: I say in game because steam has a built-in server viewer under the view menu, so by going View>Servers and filtering Toxikk (and ideallly ping) you can join games right away provided you pick games on maps available in the free version.
[*] no customization of your character
[*] You can only quick join online games
[*] You can't access custom content and steam workshop.

From that list, it's pretty obvious that you're getting more of a souped up demo, but I thought their written documentation was fairly open about it even if it is a bit of a mess how it's handled on steam.

With that out of the way, let's dive in. 

Toxikk is an FPS in the vein of Unreal Tournament, so it has a particular old school feel to it. The game is fast without being extremely so and requires good map knowledge and reflexes to be competitive. At the same time, there is a solid variety of weapons, lennding itself nicely to casual play. Infact, I think casual play is the main reason the flamethrower is in there, even though it's a powerful weapon.

The old school design means there are no load outs, no better guns or sights or perks locked behind an experience or pay wall, which should mean that you are in a somewhat more even field against a no lifer who has tons of time sunk int the game. At the same time, you have to realize that a lot of the arena shooter skills are transferable, so people with previous UT, quake, or similar experience will be at a large advantage when confronting a new player, especially in terms of movement speed. Therefore, if you are used to more modern shooters like Call of Duty and their ilk, you should be prepared to lose a lot until you learn a bit more about the movement.

All players start with the same pistol and are pretty much required to find something better to actually have a fighting chance, which may or may not be to your liking. I personally am partial to having a good starting gun like in halo CE, but I understand the reasons they went for more of a Halo 2 approach. The weapons are varied and have a fair chance of being useful in combat, though obviously the sniper rifle and shotgun have more specialized uses.

I think the free version lets you play on four maps, though I've only played 3 online (foundation and two jungle ones) the maps are fairly good and allow for a lot of interesting jumps and turns. Also, the stealth and feigning death buttons let you try to get away with stuff in some of the multiplayer modes. the gameplay is fast (though there are faster arena FPS out there, most notably Warsow) and while the matchmaking may nneed some work and the servers were messed up for free layers during launch, since version 1.01 I haven't had issues.

As I write this the player base appear to be on the lower ed of healthy for this type of game (around 300 people last time I played) but I imagine the existence of the free version will bring a good number of players every week even.

All in all, I had a good time with Toxikk. I think what I get for free is quite substantial given that they can't make money from anything other than purchasing the full game, and the game itself is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997691407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1483930863}
review:
Only doing a short review since i've only played the free version, but I've heard of this game for a while now and finally able to have a taste of what this game will bring to the table?

You really do frag it like it's 1999, and Toxikk does exactly that!  So, here's the deal:


This is a perfect example of an Arena FPS.  (middle finger at Doom 2016's sad excuse of a multiplayer)
there's no loadouts.  no perks.  no player attributes.  no regenerating health. no, a player doesn't die because the other person saw them first like in a military fps.   There's no such thing as bullshit.  You spawn in, find a random weapon somewhere and fast, and go fuck someone up....like it's 1999.  you died?  well, suck it up.  just get your ass back in and try again. Try some tricky movment techniques,----yea this is like unreal tournament but I think this is way better than UT4 alpha as of right now.

 LISTEN UP:
Free version gives you access to a tutorial mode, all weapons and other pickups to ensure zero bullshit on competitive games, and SOME maps, so this review will not get a full vesion until I have further played the full game and see what are the pros and cons there.  Look at the chart comparing both editions of this game.


and if you seriously like Arena FPS, then I could suggest another game on steam called Reflex for the extra seasoning for your steak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200432030', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1474169285}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071235697', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1478811167}
review: Do we need another arena shooter? Not really. But is TOXIKK good? Definately! The game plays how you expect an arena shooter to play. Its buttery smooth with skill based combat and movement that's "easy to learn, hard to master." I only wish the free version came with more maps. Currently, there are only 4 maps in the free version and 11 in the paid version. Some of the maps are gamemode specific so if you are playing one gamemode, expect the same map A LOT. Also, why can't free users use the server browser? I find that decision kind of odd. The new update fixed a lot of the issues invoved in getting into a game and it's worked very well for the time I have been using it. The single player mode is just bot matches but I still thought they were fun. Otherwise, I think this game is worth checking out.

review:

 It looks great, controls are on point, and all-in-all it feels just right. It's a high-octane Arena-FPS action at its best! You get to play it for free, too! How cool is that? author: {'steamid': '76561198020934278', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1662721110}
review:
Eventhough I bought this game before it was announced as free, I don't feel ripped off. The reason why is because was hardly any players on originally, the game was very unrecognized but it was still very fun! I knew the game had potential, and im glad it went to a free version because the game just sprang into life with more players.

A great throwback to a Quake style areana shooter with a unique modern twist, made me nostalgic because Quake 2 was the first game I played. This is a great game, and if you really love it, buy it. It will show the devs people have an intest in these types of games still. 

Also, theres no retarded CSGO/COD kids that flock here cause theres no microtransactions, so they can't say "I have better skins and loadouts than you", so that refreshing to get away from. All the weapons are satisfying to use, and are balanced in my mind. All in all great buy, even if it is free now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013665979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1488401486}
review:
I only discovered this game today and as many of the other reviews say its so similar to Unreal Tournament you could be excused for not realising its actually not. 

That said, I can highly recommend this game! I've only played a couple of hours to this point but its been great fun and im only playing the Free edition. Hopefully if any of my friends take my advice and try this game out and enjoy it I will not hesitate to purhcase the full game.

The only thing that i can imagine being an issue with this game is the playerbase. 400-500 online at peak times on a Saturday but thats no reflection of the quality of the game, I think like myself alot of people dont even know about Toxikk. I would love to see these numbers grow and hope they do as if they dont it could get a bit stagnant.

Excellent game 10/10

review: If you are an oldschol Unreal Tournament fan then this game is for you. I use to play Unreal back in the day before Unreal Tournament 3, which isnt that great. If you like Unreal Tournament 2004 or earlier this will probably be a good investment. Only thing that sucks is I dont think enough people know about it so the servers do not seem that populated, but its worth checking out especially for the price point. Graphics are great, music is decent could be a little better but not bad by any means. Buy this game you wont regret it. Oh also I know theres a free Unreal Tournament game thats out (Its in beta I think?) This is much better at being Unreal Tournament then the latest free Unreal Tournament.

Honestly, I have been looking for a really good Arena styled FPS for a while, when I saw this on Steam I immediately loved its character.

If you are looking for something that is easy to pick up, has easy controls to understand, and can get your heart racing..blood flowing..and makes you excited to gain levels, then this game is definitely for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989008863', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1481477038}
review:
Do know that I'm playing the free version but next month I will buy the full without a second doubt.

It reminds me of when gammes needed you to focus and at the same time think and at the same time be completely random, Something I haven't seen since 2004 (Quake 3 and UT 2k4). The weapons feel like they were ripped straight out of UT 2004 and it is just pure movement that will help you win. 

Stuff like crouching and aim down sites are dead and to be honest I hated them anyway. This is a game where you will throw the graphic settings to low just for the FPS. If your playing at 30 FPS I feel bad for you son, I got 99 problems but FPS aint one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139368320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1533049714}
review:
Niente Male come gioco. 
E' un classico FPS arena, non ha molta innovazione visto che ha lo stile di un Quake, ma con armi abbastanza bilanciate, un design spettacolare e uno stile futuristico, abbastanza sfruttato bene.
Le mappe sono l'unica pecca, visto che alcune sono molto strette, e un'altra caratteristica non tanto piacevole √® il timer che indica il tempo per il rspawn delle armi da prendere.

Ottimo lavoro. Magari prendere il gioco completo mi convincer√†.

Voto: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198146612681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1474030848}
review: THE GAME IS IN A "DEMO MODE" WHEN THEY SAY ITS FREE

author: {'steamid': '76561198002943764', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1568966269}
review:
What can I say? It's basically Unreal Tournament with a slightly higher graphical fidelity and slightly better movement freedom.

But sometimes, slightly more is just what Unreal Tournament needs. And TOXIKK delivers just that.

If you had played Unreal Tournament 3 before, then you'll feel right at home in TOXIKK. They're both basically identical games with almost the same type of weapons used and with some maps that may or may not have been shinier versions of the previous Unreal maps. Rocket-jumping exists in this game (as per arena-FPS standards) and you can also traverse around the map Titanfall style, which is great. There's even workshop support for this game, although the submissions are pretty much barren so it'll be awhile before we get some nice mods, maps and customizations.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

The graphics are absolutely beautiful. If you have a decent enough of a system to run this game, run this game with everything cranked up to the max. The visuals are beautiful and the sceneries used in the game are vibrant which makes the game look really pretty. There are plenty of flashing lights and colours, although they aren't seizure-inducing like in Beat Hazard, so you can marvel at the graphics without the need for sunglasses or visors. The UI is also pretty darn sexy, with a futuristic style and best part is that you can edit the UI to suit your needs which is great. Almost everything about the crosshair and the hit marker can be changed so if you want a crosshair shaped like a Quake logo (no kidding, there is a Quake logo as a crosshair) painted with a bright magenta and a black glow on the back, you can do that.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Gameplay-wise, the game doesn't stray too far from your average Unreal game. It plays a lot like Unreal Tournament III, although I reckon Quake players can also jump in on the action without any problems whatsoever. There are several jump moves which can allow you to traverse the map at mach-10 speeds (figuratively) and of course, you can also rocketjump in TOXIKK, although the rocketjumping isn't as OP and as useful like in Quake, so you best be using your legs instead. Almost all the weapons behave the same way in Unreal Tournament 3, with all weapons having a default firing mode and an alternative firing mode and each with varying stats and characteristics which adds to the dynamic element of this game. Overall, a really great experience.

[h1]Content[/h1]

In terms of content, there's actually not much. You have maps that share similarities to the ones in every Unreal game released, the workshop is pretty bare and the Contracts (basically TOXIKK's story mode) are pretty... miniscule, with only 12 contracts to complete. This is the Vanilla Built 1.01, so I expect more content in the later updates and considering the Workshop is pretty new, this is subject to change at a later time. But as of now, the content is pretty bare. Pretty standard though, as this is supposedly a competitive game. The content shouldn't be too vast anyway or it'll take forever to learn every aspect and master. So it's pretty much forgiveable at this point.

[h1]Is there any problems with this game?[/h1]

The game is considerably new, so of course, bugs are to be expected. Although I can't find many (unlike the bunnyhop update for CSGO), I did find a bug where falling off for a long time and then, strafe-hopping causes your player to land normally like a live player even if you're dead. Apart from that, not much bugs I can actually notice.

Aside from that, the rocketjumping is severely lackluster. The rocketjumping in Quake is absolute madness and I kind of like that, although this may not be what TOXIKK is trying to achieve, so this is down to personal preference.

[h1]FREE or FULL? Does it even matter?[/h1]

At first, I played the Free version and I can confirm that the game has almost no difference in terms of gameplay compared to the Full version. It's basically as it says on the tin. You get both the Singleplayer and Multiplayer experience free of charge and you can play as long as you like. So why pay though?

The truth is, if you're the kind of gamer that wants to jump into the fun quickly and without any hassle, you don't even have to purchase the game.

(pls don't kill me toxikk i'm just being honest)

But really, if you pay for the game, you can unlock the character customization (pretty minor, disregard this), workshop content (also minor, depending on how you want to experience this game), server browser (actually important if you want to cherry-pick servers with low ping) and the ability to host your own server (also important if you want to play this game in LAN or host an online match by yourself).

So if you find yourself thinking "I don't need any of those!", then by all means, play the Free version. It's definitely worth your time and effort. However, if any of the features listed are features you want to take advantage of, then by all means, purchase the game and support the devs. It's good that we find devs who publish games in this style of try-before-you-buy done in the best possible way without any bullshit DLCs (I'm watching you, PAYDAY 2).

[h1]In conclusion[/h1]

TOXIKK is a game that takes UT3 and made it slightly better. Whether it's a great game or not? To be honest, it's a lot like jumping from Counter Strike Source to Counter Strike Global Offensive. There are some similarities here and there, but sometimes a slight upgrade is what the game needs and TOXIKK delivers basically that. The slight upgrade that UT3 needs.

And it's free. How can you beat that?

I will be updating this review if warranted. This review is made for Vanilla Build 1.01

author: {'steamid': '76561198103297004', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1532816256}
review:
TOXIKK is an extremely well-developed AFPS (Arena-FPS) game that really sets itself apart from other games of the same genre.

I was looking for a break from Counter-Strike, which I put more than 1,700 hours into, as I was getting pretty bored with it.
Earlier this week I came across TOXIKK and have been in love with it ever since.
If I had to compare it to other games I'd say it is a mixture of Counter-Strike and Call of Duty - the weapons and characters, I feel, are more COD-like and I think the overall concept of the game is similar to Counter-Strike.

[u]Pros of TOXIKK:[/u] 
- Runs extraordinarily well even on fully maxed out settings (do note that my GPU is a GTX 980 where I get well over 100fps).
- Every map looks beautiful - the artwork in TOXIKK is extremely well done.
- Free edition has no advantages over the paid version which will mean no one has an advantage over anyone.
- No in-game purchases, so again, no one can get unfair advantages.
- A hitreg system that actually works - CSGO people will relate to this.

[u]Cons of TOXIKK:[/u] 
- Most servers are empty as not many people know about the game yet though this isn't really a con...
- Controls can be fairly difficult to master at first but can be learnt from consistent training.


[u]Do I recommend TOXIKK?[/u] 
YES!
The game is absolutely phenomenal - totally not making this change to get my Steam badge... Nope!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018692526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1494179470}
review:
DISCLAIMER: i used the free version only (so far).

Well, what to say? It's a FPS Arena, old school magic, but made with Unreal Engine 3 for shiny and up-to-date graphics and animations. Maps are well-built (some spots can be reached by well-using movement commands), weapons work pretty great (they all have an alternate firing mode just like UT plus you can get even a FLAME THROWER yay!), vehicles are nice (its not an "fps arena feature", they are present only in large maps built for certain game modes).

The point of view of the dev team is well explained in their trailers, videos, web pages: each and every player has no class and no loadout, thus there is no "disadvantage" at the beginning of the game.  A match is won by the best player only. End of the story.

Technical note: patch 1.01 solved some connection issues and loading crashes, so the game is pretty solid

Community note: very few people playing it.

Final statement: just get this game, it's the best arena you can find at the moment (UT4 won't get finished anytime soon).

author: {'steamid': '76561198034315837', 'num_games_owned': 7745, 'num_reviews': 764, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1481610306}
review:
Gorgeous UT type shooter with some tweaks here and there on the formula so it doesn't feel like an uninspired clone. If you enjoy a good arena shooter this game is that and more and the free version of the game basically lets you get the full experience with a few caveats such as no in game server browser (you can use their external browser app though or quick join to join a match with friends)

Here's the latest info on the free and complete versions.

http://steamcommunity.com/games/324810/announcements/detail/791894995316661343

If you are a genre fan or interested in a skill based arena shooter there's no reason to not try this game out for yourself. The price tag on the full version is quite reasonable for the quality of the gameplay as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994567639', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1474006535}
review:
Frag like it's 1999...
...More like frag like it's 2007.

To start off this review, I'd like to say that this game has very nice, and beautiful design to it. I like the designs of the weapon's models and textures, I like how each and every map looks by appearance and not gameplay, and I like some of the sounds and some of the music. Pass that though, I'm displeased by the decisions that the developers have taken.

Toxikk is just a reskin of Unreal Tournament with no new innovating ideas that makes this game seem fresh and stand out. The only thing that stands out (and why it's only fuel for hype) is the fact that they say it's 'Frag like it's 1999' when its gameplay mechanics is nothing like Unreal Tournment 1999. Mostly of UT3 and a bit from UT2004.

One might ask: How is this a reskin of Unreal Tournament?

Before we answer this question, we must ask what a clone is.
Comparing what a clone could be, and from I can remember, a lot of people said many games were DooM clones back in the day, like Duke Nukem, Rise of the Triads, Dark Forces, Hexen, Heretic, etc. However, with these clones, compared to DooM, they are something special because they are nothing like DooM other than some gameplay mechanics. Like the weapons and how they fire or what the actions the enemies do when they see the player. A reskin is like taking a weapon and plastering a new model and texture over it, and be done. Making it into a game and selling it for a full version of a reskin is just garbage.

After explaining what is a clone and what's a reskin, we can finally talk about how this game is a reskin.
First off, without even playing the game, there are some maps that have been 90% ripped off.
http://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/324810/ss_073479a127b2c7f1a9a948756421fa60db7841a3.1920x1080.jpg?t=1474002486
I wonder what this map is?
http://www.redfactionview.net/screenshots/mapscreenshots/deck16-dm.jpg
The first image is from Toxikk, but I have no clue what it's called. I'd laugh if it is called Deck18. The second image is from Unreal Tournament 99. It's a nearly exact copy.

Now the weapons, which is the biggest reskin of all.
In a nutshell, here's how each and every weapon works compared to Unreal Tournament:
Impactor = Impact Hammer
Raven = Enforcer (UT3's Enforcer, does one shot and a burst)
Violator = UT2004's Assault Rifle
Falcon = Sniper Rifle.
Stingray = Reminds be a little bit of stinger from Unreal 1, but also the Shock Rifle.
Cerberous = Rocket Launcher from UT3 (Three shots, just secondary you cannot load all three shots).
Hellraider = Redeemer, primary and secondary.
Bullcraft = Similar to Flak, but it's a shotgun without using a flak grenade.
( I'd like to thank FirebornForm for this list. He's on EpicGames )

The only new weapon that's different from Unreal Tournament is the Dragoneer, which is just a flamethrower.

As for the vehicles, and only basing it off from the trailer, they all look the same as UT2004. Just reskins.

Now is being inspired a bad thing for a game? No. Fallout was inspired by a movie called 'A Boy and his Dog', 'Mad Max', and other things. I thought that turned out to be a very good and new game for its time. S.T.A.L.K.E.R was inspired by a movie and a book. It turned out good as it was loosely based off both the book and the movie. S.T.A.L.K.E.R even inspired Metro to make their game.

It's just if you're going to be inspired, make the game new, make it fresh, new gameplay mechanics, new everything. Hell, make it into a competitive arena with brand new ideas and not existing ones. Don't make the gameplay exactly like Unreal Tournament, but make it new. If you can't think of anything new in your product, then it's simple enough not to sell your game (Keyword: Sell, different from free... and fully free and not limited). Don't try to be an old game. Be a new game.

And, in case people say I'm only giving this a bad review because I suck at the game, well here's a score from an earlier match:
http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/258218355747279552/B37C51E2FD00921F02EC0B1A4A71DBCD3D29EEDC/
30 kills and 6 deaths.

Another thing, nerf the rocket launcher. It's OP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1474681294}
review:
[h1]A First Person Multiplayer Arena Shooter[/h1]
https://youtu.be/n5LaUGPIJUc
+ The gameplay is a ton of fun if you are into FPS games like Doom, Halo, Quake, etc. Great for casuals and competitive players alike.
+ A variety of weapons that each have two different firing modes. 
+ Visually the maps looks fantastic, very detailed, great lighting, and just very appealing to the eye
+ Great movement controls. You can dash around using shift, and can double jump which can be very useful for evading enemy fire.
+ This is a bit silly but you can actually fall on the ground and pretend you are dead. I'm not sure if this is intentional, but I found it so unique and hilarious to fall down and then get back up when other players walk by.
+ The Free Version of the game is surprisingly GOOD! No unfair disadvantages, you mainly just can't choose maps and are blocked out of a few minor features like custimizing your character.
+ Vehicles!  Some maps have vehicles that are a ton of fun to use. I think they were mainly inspired by Halo vehicles like the Warthog, Mantis, and Phaeton. The mech can fire a machine gun and a barrage of rockets across the map which can be pretty terrifying. (Although vehicles are weak, and can be destroyed easily for those who are concerned)
+ Great background music

- I'd say the only downside is that at some times during the day it's hard to find a full game, and I feel like the game is a bit dull if there's less than 8 players in the room.

review:
Ever wanted to play the new Quake game? But for free? This is basically Quake, but it's f2p, yet NOT pay2win. You can either play the free version or buy the game for (currently: 12‚Ç¨). I had a lot of fun and I would recommend it! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198075741673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1474202620}
review:
TOXXIK reminds me so much of my childhood when I spent like everyday playing Unreal Tournament with my friends. 

IMO this game appears on the market is a needed sign for FPS games. While COD is getting worse and worse, Overwatch...nevermind dont want to talk about that game, TOXXIK is here to remind us there is a kind of FPS that once dominated the game scene (Quake, UT series), and seriously people need to give more attention to this game because of what it can deliver. Fast paced, crazy Arena FPS shoot em up just like the old time. 

The game is pretty good overall. There are minor issues with bugs here and there but the game can become a big title once it gathers enough player base. I might just stick with the Free version for now but once more people come in I definitely grab the real game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032114222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 6598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5470, 'last_played': 1686314681}
review:
A few things were fixed since I did leave a negative review. I actually like the game now even as a free player. It's actually the best Arena Shooter of nowadays. It has the best visuals IMO, ever compared to Quake Champions, this game is better, it has no crap, no microtransactions and stands for a true competitive shooter when everyone starts with the same character, so there're no special abilities, different base character stats and no any disbalance as a result, this should not be an another Owerwatch or Paladins. This game is a perfect competitive game in its core, plus has very good visuals, very good movement mechanics that takes time for a new player to get used to, but very fluid and satisfying to use. So that IMHO it's obviously better than Quake Live, UT 3 Black Edition and Quake Champions, the closest competitors.

This game is much closer to Unreal Tournament than to Quake(Arena), people often compare it to Quake, it's wrong IMO. It feels like a new stage of evolution of UT. I loved UT in my youth much more than Quake for some reason, although played enough of Quake with my friends at home and at a computer club (yay yeah), but still loved UT much much better. But I hated it's strafe jump mechanics (evade) when you need to push "move left/right" button rapidly for two times, it annoys me. WELL, IT HAS BEEN SOLVED IN THIS GAME: TOXIKK. You have to just press LEFT/RIGHT + SHIFT. Veeeery right made and very intuitive, finally.
 
The game has a player amount issue, BUT for me it's not a problem, bots are good enough, surprisingly. Sometimes I like to play against bots even better, when I know that they don't feel any emotions, it's a good way to rest in piece, yes it sounds strange. By the way Quake Champions does not have bots at all... yet, and has character balance issues.

A flaw IMO:
The pistol (a secondary weapon) is useless. It has too low dps so if you did not have time to take any weapon from respawn points over the map you'll be killed, no matter what skill you have. Do you remember the times when in UT99 you could kill someone with a pistol? Forget it. Then you're resping you have no defense, like a rabbit among hunters until you'll take some weapon and your pistol is just a joke on you.

I have a RECOMMENDATION FOR A NEW PLAYER: if you like the gameplay against the bots lvl 5 (the tutorial deathmatch mission, you can replay it as much as you want) then you actually like the game. Can't ever try to play against players for the first time, it'll probably ruin your first impression, it's a very skill based game and takes time, better play against bots at the beginning, the bots lvl 7 ("SC 7") are too strong for a very beginner that's for sure, those bots are usually on each online server, but level 5 are in the tutorial missions available for a free player, a good starting point. Have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004697579', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1482114887}
review:
Super easy to run on high/max settings. Controls feel tight & responsive. Even for someone who has never played an Unreal Tournament game, I think it's a totally fantastic and rewarding competitive shooter. 

In my own opinion, def worth the money for the full version.

review:
I kinda like it's style but seriously...this is the most buggy and glitchy jumping system I've ever seen in an fps. I couldn't even finish the stupid tutorial, it just won't work, half the time it won't jump, nevermind dodgejumps. I love a game with high paced action and fast movement but when the controls doesn't work that pisses me off sooo much....
Twice I had to kill the game in half an hour because it wouldn't handle that I put a fullscreen game to icon...I coudln't even try the multiplayer yet and it's already made me angry, just no thanks :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198181009222', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1474026869}
review:
Gioco effettivamente molto simile ad Unreal Tournament. Dunque un FPS arena, ricco di variegate armi, salti doppi e tutto quello che questa tipologia di giochi generalmente riserva. La grafica √® molto buona e davvero appagante, i dettagli, soprattutto relativi al personaggio, sono curati.

Ho giocato solo la versione free-to-play senza acquistare il gioco full; questa versione vi permette di accedere comunque alla modalit√† multi e singolo, ma ovviamente sarete limitati nella possibilit√† di personalizzazione etc.
Non √® la mia tipologia di gioco, nonostante questo, se invece amate questo genere, vi consiglio di dargli un'opportunit√†, poich√® pare abbastanza ben strutturato, inoltre, essendo in parte free-to-play, potrete giocarci e poi decidere se vale la pena l'acquisto della versione full.

review:
Fast paced, Beautiful graphic design, Exhilarating battle soundtrack, Really easy to pickup & play, and an unlimited FREE version with no microtransactions? 

You'd have to be crazy to miss trying this game out! You'll get hooked on the classic feel of how shooters should feel, and it runs smooth on pretty much any computer on high setting graphics!

I bought the full version because while Free is great for what it is, I simply could not get enough of this game in the few hours ive played it. Fantastic job! 

[WORTH THE BUY!!] Get your friends in this game ppl!
