author: {'steamid': '76561198031959684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1474009215}
review:
This game has nothing to offer that hasn't already been done before and done better. The art is generic and uninspired. The "Campaign" is literally just you and a team of bots fighting another team of bots on bland preset maps and bland preset gamemodes with preambles of text containing names, groups, and conflicts I neither know nor care about. Everything about this game just screams a meek "bleh".

Seriously just play DOOM.
http://store.steampowered.com/app/379720/

author: {'steamid': '76561197996843445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1478490334}
review:
This game wholeheartedly buys into what made the original Quake and UT games so wonderful, while also adding a flare, style, and movement all its own. Very fun for anyone with even a passing interest in the genre. It feels great once the settings are tweaked to your liking. It's also crazy to be playing an Unreal Engine 3 game in 2016. It looks wonderful.

Great movement. Great guns. Great maps. Great music. Great customization. This game plays at 100000000 mph once you master the movement. It also has Steam Workshop support. Great game. Check out the free version and if you start liking it I highly suggest buying the full version. Lots of well integrated steam achievements and customizability. Very cool to see a game like this. The devs clearly know what they are doing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051091750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1474067647}
review:
DO NOT BUY.
The free version they've decided to hand out to people is an attempt to get a few more suckers to buy this crap game before its gone the way of the dinosaur.
Here is a list of complaints...

A. Servers are either full of people or barely anyone, and bots.
   
When you qeue up for "Quick Match", it will try to access servers that are full, then say SERVER FULL and throw you back out into the main menu after waiting for the server to load.
If you do get into a server, it will either be crowded with people who have been playing the game for years and know all the moves and maps and will pwn you, or its filled with bots and maybe 1 or 2 people. 

B. Gameplay is boring. 

Jump dodging is tedious and repetitive and made for try hard game enthusiasts who think they're elite somehow playing a game that requires so much practice just to be good at such a crappy game. No sprint key. Default movement is set to "Run", but running feels like brisk jogging, and if you want to move fast, you have to "Jump dodge", using a combination of the shift button and jumping, and it turns ever match inevitably into players jumping around like stupid gorillas firing rocket launchers that kill you in 2 hits, and yet, seem to miraculously do no dmg randomly, when you fire right at someone it may not even affect them with splash dmg, I have repeatedly hit in the vicinity of someone with a rocket within 2 feet of their body, and somehow they survive after 5 hits and kill me in one hit, even when i have full armor.

They advertise vehicles in this game. They are clunky to use and after the novelty wears off, you realize you're better off out of them. Also, there are only 2 maps that even have any vehicles, and most of the nerds playing it will monopolize the servers with the SAME map (Hong Kong deathmatch) OVER AND OVER again. I only saw ONE Map the entire time i was playing with the air flying hovercraft vehicle, which is kind of cool, but NOONE even likes the map and it never gets played. Good luck getting into a match with more than 3 people in this map, and most of the time 2 of those 3 are bots.

ONE vehicle, the hoverbike, isn't even sitting in a garage anywhere, its activated by the G key, (what does my guy pull it out of his ass??) and when you get back off of it, it disappears and you can't use it again till you die. LOL WTF??

Primary weapon hand gun is awful. Its only primary weapon, i know. But its shot is so delayed that even if you have your sights aligned, when you push fire the guy doesn't instantly fire it, it goes through some kind of animation when it fires, and it throws you off on making accurate shots.

Rocket Launcher does lots of dmg if its a direct hit, can even kill you in one shot, yet splash dmg seems to be completely random. You can make a kill on a guy hitting within 5 feet of him twice with it one time, then be firing withing 1 ft of him 10 times in succession and he somehow survives then kills you with a shot that hits near you. WTF?

Other weapons are useless and you find yourself just looking for the rocket launcher the main weapon everyone uses. 

C. The hit boxes are ****ed up. 

You can be pointing directly at someone that isn't even strafing or dodging just coming RIGHT AT YOU, fire 10 shots directly at them, and only 3-4 shots hit.
Who designed the hit boxes on this thing? The people who made Counter Strike? 

Graphics are nice...i guess?

You can customize your guy and make his armor look different types, but it requires Experience points. *rolls eyes* Yet another modern fps that has decided to add in RPG features to its game.
You need to play 5000 games or something in order to get the xp required to make your COSMETIC helmet and armor all the types it shows you you can choose in the "Customization" menu.

In the end its an awful game that you should STAY away from and save your money. Trust me you aren't missing out on anything.  I guarantee you you will play it for a couple days, then just wish you hadn't bought it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247034732', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1473991571}
review:
Yes its true it is difficult to get into a server in the free version.
However after several attemps I did manage to get into one. 
I played Two full matches and had fun didn't do to bad
Though I felt I would have done better had I been added to a server on this side of the planet.
The game seems as fun as anyother like it. Though I found it difficult to determine the edges of some maps and often found myself trying to jump into an area you could not get into. That said the maps are intresting and do not seem to favor anyone one weapon over another. that is to say I found no OP sniper spots in the 2 maps I played.
Someone said in another review that if you want a free game like Unreal tournament than go download Unreal Tournament... I agree.  I do now recomend (at least the free version) this game

review:
Vous aimez les Arena Shooters ? Vous regrettez la "bonne vieille √©poque" de Quake, Unreal Tournament, Doom, j'en passe et des meilleurs... Et bien, vous avez trouv√© votre petit ilot de bonheur au milieu de tous ces shooters triple A fadasses ! Comme le disent si bien les devs "Frag like it's 1999 !"
La sortie de son Early Access au apport√© les rafinements et la finition attendue sur une version 1.0 ! Et le m√©lange de petites cartes nerveuses et de modes de jeux plus vastes avec des v√©hicules apporte une saveur assez originale, un m√©lange de Halo et de UT ! Le tout tourne comme une horloge suisse sur l'Unreal Engine 3.0 ! La communaut√© √©tait assez ridicule, voir morte pendant l'acc√®s anticip√©, parfois il y avait 16 joueurs dans le monde entier, parfois moins... mais depuis sa sortie 1.0 on d√©passe souvent les 1000 joueurs ! Alors encouragez les devs, testez la version gratuite si cela vous chante, mais j'insiste : ce genre de petit jeu qui respecte ses joueurs, sa communaut√©, et fait un Early Access r√©glo', ca se f√©licite !

review: Have you ever played Unreal Tournament 2004? Did you enjoy it? Then this game is for you. This game does a very excellent job at creating a very similar experience with a nice, clean UI and really fun gameplay. Just make sure to upgrade to the full version if you really want to be able to customize your character.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972406720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 12039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5697, 'last_played': 1701834129}
review:
Toxikk is a really fun send up of Unreal Tournament 2004. It gives you what it promises: A good old fashioned Arena FPS. You'll see over the top weapons, vehicles, and trick jumping. It has the modes anyone who played UT, Quake, DOOM, DUKE 3D, ROTT, etc. will remember. The quintessential Death match, and Team Deathmatch, along with Point Capture, and Capture The Flag. UT2k4 fans will be pleased to know that a few of the maps make for VEHICULAR CTF, and VEHICULAR PC stages too. 

But there are also some things for people who never played these kinds of FPS games before. Particularly going through the tutorial levels, as they'll get you better acclimated with the trick jumping. Which is tied to the layouts of the maps. It's also crucial for avoiding the myriad of bullets, lasers, rockets, grenades, and fireballs headed your way. It may seem daunting at first but I highly recommend checking it out. My full review can be seen at https://commaeightcommaone.wordpress.com/2016/09/15/toxikk-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198009601896', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1474917177}
review:
Wow! It takes the movement system of Unreal Tournament 2004, adds updated graphics, the customization from UT3 and packs it together in a face paced arena shooter! The music is modern and fast, the maps are a mix of different geographical locations (Hong Kong slums, Guatamala, etc) and the single player options are, whilst not on par with UT2K4, more than you would expect for this price range, giving a small bit of depth to the world and maps and there appears to be a progression system, from rookie to general.. fun! Yay! Also, the developers seem to not be dicks, so, that's cool.

Admiditly, I miss having different player models, gore and the old ULTRA KILL announcer of UT2K4 and whilst Toxikk‚Ñ¢ is based on earth and in reality, UT could go to infernal dimensions and have demons running around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090399974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1504575815}
review: Speaking from the heart, TOXIKK is an amazing multiplayer arena shooter. The controls are tight, the game is simple and hard to master, and it is frantic without being chaotic. The game lacks some maps, i think only 8 maps atm give or take, but the steamworkshop communitty has got that covered, and they have even brought some maps from Unreal Tournament over into TOXIKK too. Also, if you have ever played Unreal Tournament then you know what the game is like. In my opinion, it doesn't really matter if URT is better than TOXIKK and vice versa, TOXIKK is fresh while still maintaining that old classic 90's shooter feel. Not to mention that TOXIKK released in todays internet society, meaning it has alot of potential of becoming popular because of things like Youtube and the like. Also, the developers even offer a shareware (free) version of their game, meaning if all you wanna do is frag like no tomorrow without any preference then you can just download that instead. Now I must confess, I was not old enough to experience the hype and success of the games Doom and Quake (where deathmatch started, though TOXIKK has way more in common with URT), and I didnt really understand Unreal Tournament when I played it, I was too young and still in diapers. However, I DO get to experience a game like this, something that is similar but slightly different to those two games, something that I can call my own. This game has the potential to pull in fresh players like me and old vets from Quake and URT to play TOXIKK, and boy do I hope it does just that and its not me having wishfull thinking. This game makes me want to go up against masters of this type, to see what true skill is to see a player dominate the map with all weapons. So to anyone having doubts, try the shareware version before you buy! I did and I don't regret a thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005667452', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1474575551}
review:
I've played a lot of FPS games in my time, from Halo, to the Battlefield series, to Unreal Tournament, and UT2004 is one of my all-time favourites. Yes, Battlefield was nice for big epic battles, but I liked the all-out chaos of an AFPS. Kill streaks didn't matter as much, there were no perks, and everyone was on an equal footing - the only difference is skill.

I'm pleased to say Toxikk, at least to me, feels like a solid AFPS with the potential to be a classic. Granted, there's some things I'm not happy with but I'll mention that shortly.

I bought Toxikk when it was in early access, months ago. I've played here and there but, as is the case with many EA multiplayer games, the online was dead. Now, with the released of v1 Vanilla the online population has exploded - granted, not as quickly as I'd hoped, but it is early days.

Toxikk plays as well as one would expect, the maps are visually great (the visual bloom isn't for everyone, however) and it's great fun with friends or by turning the skill class of the bots up and giving yourself a challenge.

I do like the idea of the Demo/Free model, however the idea of machmaking only and no server browser is indeed an odd choice - the demos of Battlefield 1942 and UT2004 had a server browser way back. There is the steam server browser which works so this isn't a huge issue. I would have liked to see "scenario" or "assault" gametypes, as this was one of my favourite modes in UT2004.

Some of the weapons feel like they don't have enough ammo to start and you run out too easy. Some of the weapons don't feel particularly inspired (rocket launcher, shotgun, etc) and I sorely miss my ut2004 Minigun. Luckily the modding scene and potential is huge so if you don't like it, there's tweaks to be had. I like the spawnable speeder for larger maps, I like the Discord channel with game devs for discussion, and I like Reaktor for Doing Something Different.

My main issue is with the population - it's hovering around 500 at the moment. I can only hope that this increases.

Note: I have not had any of the issues reported by other players, including black screen, matchmating issues and being stuck on the free versions after buying the game.

tl;dr some minor flaws, but a classic AFPS that deserves a lot of attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033622458', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1476893776}
review:
Well, this is definitely a good arena shooter. Looks good even on lowest possible settings, with fast and fairly intuitive movement and fairly satisfying guns. Too bad my poor old laptop can't handle it and starts throttling the game when it gets even slightly warm.
Can't wait for glorious -20 degrees celsius winter so i can properly play it.
If you want to play an arena shooter that offers exactly what games like unreal tournament did (except the instagib mode and low map variety, for now), this game is at least worth a try.

As of patch 1.01, the developers have fixed the black screen on changemap bug, so i have no further problems with the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136372843', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1526835243}
review:
*Free*
Yeah...no.
The Free Edition is bs, no customization, you cant host games and you cant even see the server list.
All you can do is play vs bots or join a quick match so my idea of finding a party-like game was ruined.
The game mechanics are decent, its a pretty generic FPS with bouncy physics and ok ai.
If your into FPS games and this is on sale maybe i could suggest it but the way tey advertised the free edition was disgusting.
 "The free edition of Toxikk is a lot more than just a demo. It comes with the full core experience, has no competitive disadvantages versus the full game, and lets you play TOXIKK for free, for as long and as often as you like."

This is less a review of the game and more a review of the advertising and the dissapointment of getting on and making a cool character then seeing the message that this feature is not included in the free game, i thought "oh well atleast i can play a few hours and maybe its good enough that i wont need character customization" *tries to host a game* same thing *tries to look at the server list*...you get what im getting at here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102249092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1594412576}
review:
Great. Just buy it.
-Even starts
-Fast as hell pace (Unreal Tournament speed)
-Modern grafics
-Cool vehicles (again old arena shooter)
-Bots to play offline
-Matchmaking, but also server browser
Kudos to the developers, having the balls to go against the current trends, and making a real "arena shooter" gameplay is frenetic, though a bit rough around some edges. Finally thanks for offering a demo, on top of increasing player pop, it allows people to see that this is what they want before buying it.

review: Casual Gamer, play when I can . First thing I noticed was the graphics are pretty decent. gamelpay against the BOTS is fun for about 10 minuts. Contracts are fun ... But I couldnt tell you anything about playing in multiplayer. Everytime I try, it either fails to connect to the server, the connection is lost, or the server is full. this has been consistent for 3 days now. It would seem that I would be able to play eventually....but noooooo   so I am  not keeping a game I cant play....uninstall. Right now as it stands I would no reccomend it. If they can fix the conection issue...or whatever the deal is I think its quite promising

author: {'steamid': '76561198118792764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1483201455}
review: Matchmaking is horrible. There is a 10% chance to get connected to a server. It is always connecting me to a full server or a "living in a forest" high ping. Servers constantly crach, and connection times out. In free versoin there is NO SERVER BROWSER IN A MP GAME. You have to pay for the server browser whic is total horse$$$$. Vehicle combat doesnt fit into arena shooters. Movement feels weird, jumping is overly complicated, tutorial is so frustrating i coudnt beat it after 30 minutes. Game modes are boring, in cell capture all players staj at bases with one or two sometimes attacking enemy base and dying every time. Everything except free for all deathmatch is boring. But hey, trying this game is free, runs fairly smooth and Uninstall button works flawlessly wihtout lag or server issues. Skip this game, buy Quake 3 or UT2004 for dirt cheap instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039498181', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1475175912}
review:
"Frag like it's 1999" is indeed the best way to describe this game. It plays every bit like Unreal Tournament and Quake 3 (mostly UT) do and I believe this industry is sorely missing that kind of game, so I'm not blaming Toxikk for having almost no original bone in its body.
As far as performance goes I'm getting 144fps (capped) 90% of the time and 120 at the minimum with a R9 390 so I'd say this game runs pretty well. If you want to check for yourself there's a free edition anyway.
Talking about the free edition, it really is more than a trial version than the full game. You can't customize your character, which I don't find all that bothersome but you also can't select what game mode your want to play, or access custom content/server which may become a pretty limiting factor after a while, though by the time this happens I expect you'll already have a good idea of wether or not you want to buy this game.
Finally, the soundtrack is in line with the rest of the game: it's made of early 2000s-sounding electro, which is very in line with the spirit of the game.
Anyways, if you're looking for a modern-looking game that plays just like the great FPS of old do, play this.
...Until UT4 gets a full release, anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976940060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1473933833}
review:
Well what can I say, besides that it doesn't even work.
All I could try out so far was:

- Customization, which, after you've spent 10 minutes doing so, tells you that it's unavailable in the Free version. Nice to know after you customized your character.

- That it's a bad connection simulator, one among lots. Most of the time you see "Connection to host lost."

- If it does not lose connection, you'll just see "TOXIKK stopped working ..." and that's it.


Fun game, would definetly buy it. Not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987071384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1494227268}
review:
A very fun arena shooter that is pretty much UT2K4 slapped into Unreal Engine 3.
Bought it while it was in Early Access and its nice to see the devs go through with the game. Still growing and as long as people keep playing, I can easily see this game become a PC staple.

The few negatives about the game only consist of the lack of variety in terms of player models (everyone looks like a shiny robot) and the serverbrowser relies too much on the skill ranking system, which doesn't really mean anything since the game is so new.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143877145', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1474247281}
review:
This is just a first impression. And WOW I didn‚Äôt expect this to be such a fast fluid first-person shooter. The aiming can use a little work. Being that this game is so fast pace is difficult to get the aiming where i need it to be. Other than that the gun play is great, fast, fluid, and impactful. This really captures the look and feel of 90s shooters like Doom and Quake. 

There are so many weapons to choose from. You can quickly and easy pick up a weapon and never have to reload, this works well this the fast pace nature of the game.

I'm playing on the free version and that even feels like a full game. Free players are locked to some restriction. Only some map will feature in the free version and locked out of customizing your character. Other than that the game feels like a full game. 

TOXIKK really surprised me. I didn‚Äôt think this game would hook me like this. The fast pace motion of the game keeps everyone moving and active. And with many verities of weapons you can pick and choose what kind of playstyle you would like. I'm going to give this a little more time before I buy the full game. I really like this game and hope other gamers will try it. Do you guys think that TOXIKK can be a good first-person shooter?

author: {'steamid': '76561198258422208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 475, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1487645220}
review:
I played if for free then after two games decided it needed to be bought for full attention and playabillity.
I am happy about it's quality at such a stage.
It has great graphics and smooth gameplay.
Low recoil on most weapons and it is definatly a frag and dodge sort of game.
There is no voice chat which is annoying but then there is tspk and Discord channels.
so here are my Pro's & Con's in {CAPS}

[PRO'S] 
IF YOUR A FAN OF QUAKE AND UNREAL YOU HAVE A NEW LOVE.
IT HAS GREAT GRAPHICS
SKIN CUSTOMISATION
TEAM/CLAN BASED CAPABILLITY'S
VECHICLES ON BIG MAPS I HAVE NOT SEEN YET
LOTS OF DIFFERENT GAMES LIKE TEAM FRAG, FREE FOR ALL, CATCH THE CELL .etc
AND ABILLITY TO PLAY SOLO WITH BOTS!!

[CON'S]
NO VOICE CHAT
SERVERS ARE NOT STABLE
FOUND THAT YOU NEED TO QUIT TO MAIN MENU AFTER EACH GAME TO PLAY AGAIN OR FREEZE AND CRASH
NO FREQUENT BUGS ALTHOUGH I DID FALL THROUGH THE FLOOR ON 1 STAGE ONCE..
NO CUSTOMISATION FOR GUNS WHICH I THINK WOULD BOOST THIS GAME TREMENDOUSLY

[WHAT I WOULD LIKE TO SEE AND IMPROVE]
The servers are not perfect they need alot of work and there needs to be something done about not being able to wait for the next round after a game it is very annoying to keep quiting to main menu.
A clan based add on where competetive factions design there own base and get challenged to defend there core. get extreme xp as rewards for new skins and team buffs.
A solo career as bounty hunters would be a great add on to the bots side of the game...
But this game is amazing as it is but those bugs need killing nobody likes a buggy game that crashes and forces you to have to ctrl,alt,esc all the time :(

My Scores:

Graphics 9/10

InGameplay 9/10

Mechanics 7/10

Overall 25/30

Certainly worth a go and then a purchase..

author: {'steamid': '76561198003473206', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1711021670}
review:
I bought this game. Don't know about the free version. But payed is definitely worth the money.
Pros:
- It's super well optimized and looks great to boot
- It's highly customizable
- It feels like UT, but the weapon systems are completely different
- It has Deck 16/17(whatever as a map
- Amazing rock/electro soundtrack like it's 1999
- Fragging someone makes them drop a bit of health -> neat
- It's fast as fck
- Weapons feel punchy and each one is distinct from each other 
- Everyone starts with the same chances, opportunities for weapons -> purely skill based -> no unfair kill streak rewards except greater score
- Rocket jumping possible
- Special actions like headshot, double kill are rewarded
- Maps with awesome verticality and actual map design (as opposed to the pseudo realistic, not well thought out maps of spunk gargle wee wee)
- No-Bullshit game development policy (no payed dlc, no pay to win, no free to play) 


Cons:
- Strange ranking system
- quick match currently not working

Cons are fixed by using the server browser.
I'm going to rewrite this review when I have about 50 hours clocked in. So far: Fucking awesome.
PLEASE regard the free version as a demo.

Here is a bonus rant on arbitrary kill streak rewards, which this game luckily does NOT feature:
What sense does it make to give players who are dominating anyway even more power? None.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153176634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1473908011}
review:
NO. Just No. I guess i have to review this game....kill me please. I will review this game in a pro/ con style and i will be as descriptive as i can.

Pro:
The game looks simple which i find it appealing to me visually.

The music is ok even though i only heard the first level music.

Con:
The first level sucks in solo play. It is a whole lot of platforming and not in the good way. The double jump needs to be pressed short time span, the dash jump is complete ass, and the final part i got to the game just gavee up on me and pretty much said to figure it out myself. Cool i love how games especially on the first level leave me to figure out some type of strategy on my own, thanks.

Platforming sucks, alot of times you will need to do some pixel perfect jumps. I am looking at you dash jump part. If it isnt that then maybe you might need to jump on narrow platforms because reason.

Did they even try with the save points? I got to the last part of the first mission and fell. That wouldnt be a problem if it didnt land on the save station. Guess where i started after i decided to kill myself at the new save spot. I wouldnt think it would be hard to disable a save spot once you activate one futher preventing me from saving myself backwards in the level.

Combat? Whats that? Seriously if the first level has combat but it is more like a shooting gallery then why give me guns? I was able to kill all the enemies in the first mission without much effort.

You can pay or get it for free from what i see from the store. Thats kinda weird seeing that for the game. If i have to say anything get it for free if you want to try it out rather than pay for it. Would paying for the game give you bonus materials or something because if you have 2 options to choose from i can safely say people with get the free one instead of paying unless they want to support the developer.

Conclusion:
It is a poorly made game. Very focused on platforming which isnt a bad thing if the platforming was good and some jumps are not leaps of faiths on whether you can make it or not because the dash jump sucks. For those interested in the game go ahead and try it out, it is free but for those expecting much from it. I can say it does not deliever on a good experience. I played for a short time and gave up after i saved myself backwards in the stage meaning i had to do what i have already went through to get back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277815807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1473906412}
review:
[b]I have edited the review below to correct the following information: TOXIKK [u]does not[/u] appear above paid games when listing by ascending price. This was an error on my part.[/b]

As a game, TOXIKK is fine. It runs well even on low end hardware, it looks nice, and it's easy to pick up and play. The game has a pleasingly fast pace and fluid movement, and its weapons are varied and interesting. You can even map a controller if you are a former console gamer and don't mind losing a lot. The game's soundtrack is great, really gets the blood pumping. Net code seems solid, and I was consistently matched with servers that were close by, which was nice.

The game developers did something kind of clever, and also kind of shady, in offering the free version of the game. Now make no mistake, if you read the description on the store page it makes very clear the free version of the game is actually a demo, which is exactly what it is. The demo version is also remarkably generous by demo standards. However the free version remains a demo, not a true free to play game.

So why does it matter if the free version is a demo or not? By having a free version, the game now appears when searching for "free to play" games on the Steam store, despite the fact that the game itself is not free, only the demo for the game is free. [strike]Likewise, if you sort games by ascending price, TOXIKK will appear at the top of the list as its price is technically free, but that only applies to the demo of the game.[/strike]

To put this in perspective, paid games with demos do not appear in the free to play section of the Steam store (a free demo isn't a free game), [strike]and do not appear above games of a lower price when sorting by ascending price (having a demo doesn't change what your game costs to buy.)[/strike] In a sense, TOXIKK has managed to cheat its way into a category it does not qualify for, [strike]and to a place in the sorting where it does not belong.[/strike]

The store page for TOXIKK does not mention that there is a limit on the number of free players who can participate in multiplayer, nor does it mention that if the game switches to a paid map you get taken to a prompt to buy the game, nor does it mention that every time you close the game it opens the TOXIKK homepage in your browser and asks you to buy the game.

These are all small annoyances to be sure, and if you are going to buy the game they will not affect you. However they did leave a bad taste in my mouth just the same. I won't personally be buying the paid edition, or continuing to play the free version for that matter. If you don't care about the ethics of the free version, then the paid game seems like it would be worth the price. I would not personally recommend bothering with the demo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058343832', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1473906870}
review:
Mechanicly i cannot say a single wrong thing about the game. however in terms of theme and originality the game sorely lacks in an identity. the maps are nice and all of the classic weapons are there but there is nothing at all to make it stand out from the other arena shooters of the time other than pretty graphics that run really well. But of course there is also the problem that none of the weapons feel unique to the game. theyre all more or less the same weapons of the time with slight variations.

The game's lack of a proper theme makes it much less interesting to play on a casual level. its just generic space marines in generic pretty maps. If i bringed this game to my group of friends and asked them to play this instead of quake (or any other arena shooter from the era) there would be no reason for them to switch over.

Of course the game tries to prevent that with the help of workshop support. however any skin is counted as a mutator meaning that unless you host a game your stuck with the generic lack-of-theme. The game dosent even have a proper announcer to amp you up and sound cool.

Overall, other than the fact its an arena shooter in 2016, TOXIKK isnt much to turn and look at other than there's people playing it 24/7 wich is more than some older shooters can say.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997934524', 'num_games_owned': 3413, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1611418619}
review:
I've played just about every retro-throwback Arena FPS on steam. Reflex, Nexuiz, Wickland, you name it I've played it. I enjoy all of those game immensely, but their playerbases are basically dead beyond trying to find pickup games in IRC servers and Discord. Enter Toxikk: Not only does this game a huge playerbase, I think it can become THE arena FPS to play on steam.

The basic gameplay is similar to what you would find in classic Quake or Unreal, but it does a good job of not feeling like a clone. In it's basic mode, you've got a bunch of guys in a map trying to kill each other and that's about it. The weapons are satisfying to use and the maps are tightly designed (although there's one map called "The Cube" that I don't really care for, it felt simplistic and unfinished). The visuals are very pleasing to look at and the game runs very well. In addition to basic deathmatch, it has some capture the flag and team deathmatch modes, but I haven't played these and don't really intend to, since no one ever uses teamwork in this type of game.

Like I mentioned before, this game has a huge playerbase and I think the decision to have both free and paid versions was a great idea, as it allows the game to start with a ton of players and lets new players come into the fold easily. The only issue I have with Toxikk is the process of actually finding a game. The Quick Match tool frequently connects me to a server, only for me to be told upon connecting that the server is full and cannot be connected to. Quick match also doesn't have any kind of filter or settings, so if I want to jump in for a quick deathmatch, there's a good chance I could get dropped into a game mode I don't like. Another issue is that there doesn't seem to be any way to make a party other than to just make a server and invite your friends to it individually. 

One aspect of the game I have mixed feelings about is the skill rank. I like the idea of having a guage to show players their skill, but many servers are locked to only allowing players of a certain skill to enter. This has both good and bad consequences. On one hand, it allows new players to play with each other and grow into the game, while skilled players don't have to put up with noobs that offer little challenge. In theory, this is good. However, I've found that most of the Bloodlust (deathmatch) servers are for players with skill of 1 to 4, and my skill was recorded at 6, meaning it was kind of hard to actually get into a game after I won my first match. It also means that players looking for a challenge might not be able to play with players better than them to try and improve.

Despite the issues I have with the stuff between the matches, I think Toxikk is off to a good start and hopefully it will only improve over time. A lot of talent clearly went into this game and it seems to be catching on, so hopefully this will be a safe choice whenever I'm itching for some classic deathmatch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034990540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1473949376}
review:
Fantastic arena FPS.
It does exactly what the developers made it for. Frag like it's '99. And exactly, this game is a clean, microtransaction-free, balanced arena shooter that every arena FPS fan will appreciate and enjoy.
One particularity that I liked about the game is the level progression, and the skill class system. This last one in particular is a bit empty of depth in my opinion, you could have used actual ranks with each correspondent symbol instead of just numbers (example: SC1-2 is bronze, SC3-4 is silver, etc..). Apart from this little detail, it is pretty precise on calculating your skill level.
The game does have customization, an aspect I really want on any game. You can change many in-game settings for each weapon, a must-have for an arena shooter.
So.. what are you waiting for? You can try the game in a demo for free, infinitely! Some options are locked for the full game though, which is very cheap in my opinion, definitely worth the price. The developers did a great job here, creating a game that perfectly balances graphics and gameplay for a fun fast paced competitive arena shooter experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998494596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1473470374}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071007223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1474383862}
review:
It's been a very long time since I've played a multiplayer shooter that kept me grinning from ear to ear in every match I played. The adrenaline rush from Toxikk is incredible and they certainly achieved their goal of making an old-school style fragfest!

Toxikk has some pretty fun guns, the movement is stellar and the pacing of the matches is crazy. The music is absolutely brilliant and the maps make for some frantic play. Plenty of game modes, some vehicles as well as well as a load of character customisation. It runs on the unreal engine and it looks gorgeous and runs buttery smooth.

Oh, and they released a free version, allowing you to try the game and experience the core gameplay before putting money down for the character customisation, server browser and a whole host of other goodies like the level editor and steam workshop! Kudos to Reakktor Studies for essentially offering a demo version to whet your appetite.

Now if you'll excuse me, I need to frag like it's 1999.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978691399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1491611244}
review:
This is essentialy UT2K with brilliant graphics and gameplay to match.  Seriously, if you even have a slight passing interest in arena FPS games, or even FPS style games in general, then you need to grab this game NOW.  

The free version is just that, free.  Think old skool shareware, free to play but if you purchase, which is balls ass cheap for a NEW game of this caliber, then you get more feautrues than the shareware version.

I cannot recommend this title enough.  As someone who has literally hundreds of hours in UT2K, this is more of a successor than UT2K3/4 ever thought of being.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042235258', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1536514920}
review: So I started this game up and immediately went into the tutorial level and I had almost no trouble with it until the last jump which to my knowledge required a perfect double jump into a perfect wall jump. I spent 30 minutes attempting this jump. I even tried a dodge jump into a wall jump only to find out (to my knowledge) that isn't a thing for about 5 minutes. So 30 minutes later I give up on the this jump which locks all the future missions off until I finish that one. So I jump into the multiplayer. After a minute of waiting on the quick join it found me a server then told me it was full. That happened twice. Then I joined a match successfully and then the game ended. After waiting until the next game I got into one and spawned next to a rocket launcher which is OP and everyone just grabbed one. There are 9 weapons and most of them are useless except a few with the rocket launcher at top. This game just isn't that balanced or fun. Also in 2 multiplayer games/maps I never even saw a use for that perfect jump.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1473833610}

review: Grafica faina, instructiunile sunt cam naspa, degeaba e free pentru test ca tot nu poti face nimic daca nu il cumperi, controalele sunt un pic ciudate.. partea cu douge jump 02 e enervanta la antrenament.. intro. author: {'steamid': '76561198047208911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1473789912}
review:
LOVE it love it love it love it
Remembers me of the good old Unreal Tournament times. 
Shoot, get healthpacks all around, and if you cant play, you just die. 
Downed the P4free version and if you only wanna play and dont care for outfits (which is all you can buy with money as far as i saw at least) the game is great. 
Bots are a bit dumb but hey.. thats why they are called Bots and not reallife players (ok, even though there might not be that big of a difference between both of them at some point). 
Anyways, if you like Shooter for beeing a Shooter, this is a really nice game for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121837435', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1482275885}
review:
Great game indeed. I've been playing the free version for a while now, and i couldn't find anything bad except for when you exit the game it opens your browser and directs you right into the website where you can buy the game. 
This is really what Doom 2016 MP should've been like. Try it, you'll have some great time. I'll be buying this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027648893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1473798267}
review: The free version as far as I can see is not worth your time. I spent about 30 minutes trying to play with a friend. In that 30 minutes it never tried to connect to a single NA server, almost as if none exist. It tried to connect to various EU servers and a single Nam(?) server, it only ever got through to the game once and that game was in the map vote for about a minute, when it went to the next map it crashed my game. For anyone looking to check out this free game that looks like Quake and UT, I would just say do not bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020678413', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1488733705}
review:
Als ich von TOXIKK geh√∂rt habe, war ich erstmal skeptisch. In letzter Zeit betiteln sich ja viele Spiele als "oldschool", wobei sie dann im Endeffekt recht wenig damit zu tun haben. Ich hab das Spiel im Stillen einige Monate hinweg beobachtet, mir diverse Videos angesehen und erstmal abgewartet. Klar h√§tte ich es mir kaufen k√∂nnen, aber da laut einiger Aussagen die Playerbase relativ gering war und mein Interesse zu dem Zeitpunkt relativ gering war, hab ich es dann doch gelassen. Au√üerdem wurde auch gesagt, dass es zum Release bzw. kurz danach eine Demo geben wird. 

[b]Das Gameplay:[/b]

Grund genug jetzt mal in die Demo reinzuschnuppern und bisher muss ich sagen, dass mir das Spiel recht gut gef√§llt. Es spielt sich wirklich sehr oldschool, hei√üt: Kein ADS, keine Klassen, keine Gameplay bezogenen Unlocks (eine Krankheit in aktuellen Shootern). Nur extrem schnelles, fl√ºssiges und Skill basiertes Gameplay. Das Arsenal besteht dabei aus den meisten Waffenarten, die man schopn aus bekannten Klassikern kennt. Pistole, Shotgun, Assault Rifle, Plasma Rifle, Sniper Rifle, Flammenwerfer und der allseits beliebte Raketenwerfer darf nat√ºrlich auch nicht fehlen. Dazu bieten die meisten Waffen auch einen alternativen Feuermodus a la Unreal Tournament. Waffen findet man nat√ºrlich frei nach dem Motto "Frag like it's 1999" auf der Map selber und nicht in einem Klasseneditor.

[b]Die Grafik:[/b]

TOXIKK basiert auf der inzwischen etwas veralteten, aber beliebten Unreal Engine 3, was man auch sieht. Das Spiel ist definitv nicht h√§sslich, aber an manchen Texturen und speziell an der Beleuchtung erkennt man eben, dass die Engine doch etwas in die Jahre gekommen ist. Die Maps dagegen sind sehr sch√∂n und unterschiedlich gestaltet. Von √ºberwucherten Ruinen, bis hin zu industriellen St√§dten oder Gebirgsarealen sollte f√ºr jeden etwas dabei sein. Im Zweifelsfall gibt es auch diverse Mods, welche man sich √ºber den Steam Workshop runterladen kann. Daf√ºr ben√∂tigt man allerdings die Vollversion.

[b]Bugs:[/b] 

Ja, auch dieses Thema m√∂chte ich nicht verschweigen. Da ich momentan nur die kostenlose Demo spiele, kann ich nur das Matchmaking bewerten, da der Server Browser und custom matches nur in der Vollversion erh√§ltlich sind. Die Idee ein Matchmaking System zu integrieren, ist gut. Das Problem an der Sache ist, dass ich oftmals auf volle Server connected werde, was nat√ºrlich in einer Fehlermeldung endet. Au√üerdem bekomm ich auch √∂fters die Nachricht, dass ich die Verbindung zum Host verloren h√§tte. Ich denke mal mit Host ist der Server gemeldet, weil ich mir beim besten Willen nicht vorstellen kann, dass ein Arenashooter auf ein Peer To Peer Matchmaking setzt. Ab und zu crasht das Spiel auf den Desktop, was besonders h√§ufig passiert, wenn man zwischen den Runden raustabt. Zwei eher subjektive Dinge w√§ren zum einen das extrem laute Intro bzw. die Intros (Unreal Engine und Entwickler Intro), die man leider nicht per Tastendruck √ºberspringen, aber per Startbefehl "-nostartupmovies" √ºberspringen kann. Au√üerdem habe ich auf einigen Maps relativ starke Framedrops, was eigentlich nicht an meiner Hardware liegen sollte. (FX 8350, R9 290). Klingt aber alles deutlich schlimmer als es ist. Das Spiel st√ºrzt relativ selten ab und die angesprochenen Framedrops treten bei mir nur auf 1-2 Maps auf. Auf den restlichen Karten l√§uft das Spiel super. Trotzdem sind da Punkte, die man in Zukunft fixen sollte.

[b]Die Demo:[/b]

Die Demo umfasst quasi die volle Gameplayerfahrung. Die einzigen Unterschiede zur "Vollversion" sind der fehlende Server Browser (Man hat in der Demo also nur Matchmaking und Bot Matches zur Verf√ºgung), keine optischen Anpassungen und einige Map-Limitierungen bei den Bot Matches.  Der preis f√ºr die Vollversion liegt momentan bei 11,99‚Ç¨ und ist in meinen Augen absolut gerechtfertigt.

[b]Fazit:[/b]
Das Spiel hat hier und da noch einige relativ nervige Macken, macht aber f√ºr ein paar Runden zwischendurch definitiv Spa√ü.  Wer oldschool Arena Shooter mag oder einfach mal wissen will, wie sich Shooter fr√ºher gespielt haben, macht hier nichts falsch. Die Demo ist kostenlos und bietet einen super fairen Einblick ins Spiel. Sollte sich etwas an meinen Eindrucken √§ndern, werde ich die Review nat√ºrlich erg√§nzen.

[b]TL;DR[/b]

Positiv:
- Echtes oldschool Gameplay
- Schicker Artstyle
- Schnelles, fl√ºssiges Gameplay
- Visuelle Anpassungen (Nur in der Vollversion)
- Modsupport (nur in der Vollversion)
- Super faires Demo Konzept
- Angemessener Preis

Negativ:

- Matchmaking versagt relativ h√§ufig
- Das Spiel crasht ab und an (unter Windows 10)
- Das viel zu laute Intro (l√§sst sich mit "-nostartupmovies" skippen)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040160667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1475187014}
review:
Love it. Properly love it. Just the kind of thing I've been looking for for a long time. Play against bots, play against actual people (yep, real hoomans), and complete the training courses. Enough there to keep me occupied for many hours, high replayabilityness. Yep, it's a word.

Well worth the money. Buy it direct from the developers - they get a bit more and it's a piece of wee to just add it to your Steam account. Highly recommended.

Oh and there're vehicles.

Peace and love. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198059983463', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1473793038}
review:
You know, they're absolutely right. This isn't a demo. Demos generally offer more than this. Primary feature of the game: Vehicles. You get one in the tutorial and no enemies to fight with it. That's it. Multiplayer? Very slim chance of connecting due to the extremely limited number of free servers. For all intents and purposes you can rule that out too. Any customization bar choosing crosshairs and weapon bar? Nope. Two maps in bot only mode. That's your lot. I can't not recommend it as I paid nothing for it, but come on guys, isn't it a little bit stingy? 

Also, it's listed as "dirt cheap" or something along those lines. ¬£14 base price. ¬£10 right now. Not what I'd call dirt cheap, per se, for an almost 2 year old game.

As for the gameplay itself, it's good. It's pretty damned good in fact. But sadly I can't comment much as so much is locked away that I don't feel like I can judge it properly. Sorry guys, but I can't really feel that this model's working.

Side note: Props to them for including everything in the paid version. No "Locked map packs" or anything like that. Get what you see if you do buy it, I'm glad to say.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043782822', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1473784441}
review:
Super fun, but I'd only reccomend if you plan on buying the full version.
-You can't choose your gamemode unless you have the full game, so if you wanted vehicles and objective gamemodes, pray for rng to put you in a game with it.
I for one was only interested because the trailer showed all these badass mechs and shit, looked dope. I played 4 rounds, then got anxious and started leaving lobbies when I saw "team deathmatch" on the title. TDM meant there would be NO VEHICLES AT ALL, and just running on foot with rocket launchers. After joining and leaving about 15 lobbies, I joined a game with vehicles - and three bots to play with.(2v2, I was the only human.)
Pretty fun, but don't expect much without the full game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976769622', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1473620575}
review: This is basically just old school unreal tournament... which is completely and totally fine and I'm very happy with my purchase. Sometimes you don't need to reinvent the wheel, sometimes you just want a newer, shinier wheel. There are a lot of nay sayers about the "free" version. The "free" version is called such because it's actually just a demo but they couldn't put just a demo on steam as-is so they're essentially skirting the rules. I played the free version first and decided to pony up the whopping $11 whatever for the full game. If you're on the fence just try the free version, it isn't a free to play game so the free version is intended solely to get you into a couple matches to gauge how you like it. Matchmaking worked perfectly fine for me on both versions as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045952823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1473790885}
review:
Nice design in general, guns are really nicely put together as well. You have some standard guns and then there's more special ones as well.

But!

The training map (in solo "missions") is pretty hard already. Jumps and such sometimes do not record or fail for some reason. Also, the game keeps on crashing in mid-game. I only played this little because it annoyed the hell out of me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967357795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1473789462}
review:
A hard style classic arena shooter with Mouse Acceleration ENABLED by default. Sure.
The concept is nice, but unclear graphic ruin it for me. Unreal Tournament 2004 is way better in providing clear visuals to each weapon and attack type. Here you have a basic gun, an assault rifle, a sniper rifle and some other handgun which leave exactly the same bullet trail.

IMO it's an attempt at competitive gaming, but it's not working this way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064580433', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1511822716}
review:
Gonna use my review to answer all the critics toward the game, from the valid ones to the most 5tup!d. 
Im doing this because this is a genre no one cares about anymore, then Reakktor took this risky chance nobody is taking and it seems some people is really mad and attacking a good product just because their childish nonsense.

1. New UT is coming: I remember installing the Alpha like one year and half ago, and there was practically nobody playing, the  game looks like UT 2004 with the new engine, which is was good, but there was a lot of placeholder textures everywhere, you cant create your own game but play what others did, then I checked out again last month, just to receive a 3GB update and the game was almost the same with no new maps, the update was those season skin packs which IMO are pretty useless if you arent in the trend of "dressing" your character. And it was still alpha, lol, 2 years and half and still alpha.
Even having to install a new DRM stuff called Epic Games isnt appeal for me, I already have to deal with my Bnet, Origin, GOG, Uplay accounts to have more stuff installed just to play an alpha game.
2. Crashes, Black screens, etc: I have receiving those black screens after two or four matches, guess devs will fix them soon, it seems you can fix it by yourself enabling shader cache in your video card settings, for me no crashes so far, and no disconnections, the problem is that as a freebie when the server is changing to a map only for paid players it will disconnect for obvious reasons, still some kids who doesnt know how to read, thinks the game just disconnect for bad programming.
Ironically some people claiming the game is bad developed has Batman Arkham Knight in their libraries.
3. Demo is so limiting: Wow, I cant get why people is complaining about a demo being limited, isnt that the concept of a demo, a limited version of a full game so people can test it if it suits their tastes?
4. Not enough weapons: We got a shotgun, a laser gun, a sniper, rocket launcher, a SMG with a grenade launcher, a flamethrower, a melee weapon, a nuclear weapon and a handgun, but its not good enough, then with a lot of weapons comes unbalance, then people will be asking for removing OP weapons, gamers are just so weird these days...
5. Cant see what is good about: Guess if you are a Halo/Cod based player, you will not like this, stay away.
6. Epic fans: Im UT fan, but more important, AFPS fan, so if some game developers want to recover or save the last of the AFPS outthere, be my guest, some people are just mad because its not an EPIC/Bethesda game. Whats worst being a Toxikk fanboy or a AAA companies fanboy? I prefer to support a company that is taking the risk of giving us a AFPS for a affordable price.

Aside from the critics, I can say I like it because.
1. Mod Support with workshop and mod tools.
2. Dedicated server, play with your friends and setup the most crazy mutators to have all the custom fun you want. 
3. Affordable four pack, get a four pack as ten dollars each license. 
4. Nice devs. Most games on steam has the lack of devs showing up, Toxikk its not the case with devs answering questions and stuff.
5. Balance, Imo the game is good balance and the weapons give you the choice of playing the way you want, maybe you are a close combat player, you have the flamethrower and the bullcraft, or fracking your opponents from far away with the sniper or laser gun second fire.
6. Sick movement, changing the jump hop to shift was the right choice, now you can hop in every direction, not only left, right, forward, backward, but in right-forward, etc.
7. Air control, make a long jump and move, you will see how you character can move in air.
8. Jump, double jump, triple jump, wall jump, you can make long straight jumps pressing shift for hop and then pressing space, pretty good for reaching opponents or escaping from them. Some ramps are strategically placed in maps so you can hop and then performing a double jump so you can reach a platform.


The game is good, the game is affordable and the devs are doing their best to fix stuff, so I just can recommend this and I hope to see you in game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102784127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1473887252}
review:
Tried out the demo version because "there's no way a free forever game could possibly be worth $15"

Good God was I wrong. I had barely missed out on arena shooters because I was too young to play them when they were still the kings of FPS, but this game scratches an itch I didn't know I even had.

Hopped into the first contract and (embarasingly) died 23 times just trying to figure out the movement conrols. Got bored and decided to try a bot match. Sudenly everything clicked and I was flying across the map like a goddamn spidermonkey on crack fragging adept level bots left and right.

Backed out and bought it right then and there.

Kind of wish there were more customisabilty options, but for what the game is and what the devs promised, I call it a damn solid 9/10.

Frag on, bitches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067497489', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1473772783}
review:
Looks pretty and seems to play just like quake areana, however i would love to know if there really is a single player or if its just multiplayer gamemodes against bots? ive tryed the first training "mission" a nasty little obstical course and i just cant beat the thing< the advanced movment abilities in this game are outright stupid! first the game doesnt tell you how to perform a "wall jump" then once you google it you realise pulling off the manuever succefully is slightly harder than me after your mum finished the strip tease. Toxikk< this isnt warframe, its a meathead, shooter simplified controls for navigation is a must! yes im harping on the same problem and i know you can jump straight into online multiplayer without so much as exchanging nods with the solo training level, but, way i see it is the bar to access the rest of the game should be behind a solid intoduction to its mechanics and controls and if you fuck that up then as far as im consurned youve tripped at the first hurdle of game design.
Fan boys will tell me im just shit at the game and granted im not a league tier player on any platorm but ive been gaming long enough to know the difence between bad player or game and as shiney as it is with fairly tame amount of weapons this is rushed and generic. reccomend it if you really really really still in to quake 3 areana but just wish it had a fresh coat of paint but otherwise give it a miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988660340', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1473745563}
review: Unreal Tournament 1999's movement system and UT3 style weapons and vehicles with newer graphics. The free trial is a bit limiting but it's a trial nonetheless unlike some other games which don't even present you with a demo, this one gives you part of the multiplayer for free. Definitely try it out, you might be surprised. (Also, play the first contract and actually finish it, because you'll have no idea about the movement system otherwise.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983742560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1473783309}
review:
A very nice Fps arena, it has same movements base of UT 2003 with double jumps + dodge jumps.
I played many years UT 2003.
The only advise that I gives to the developers is to decrease the time of some weapon's switch:
for example switching from the Rocket laucher to the Sniper rifle need a century....
So the game need faster weapon's switch and maybe a little balance in weapons (rocket seems pretty OP).
The game is very nice, I will take a look after some fixes, I will buy it for sure.

p.s.
If in UT 4 alpha they will add the same Double Jumps of this game...it would be the best arena fps of the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999030632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1473646137}
review: God this game is solid. It seems like half of the negative reviews are from people who played the free version (which is essentially a generous demo) and were pissy that it wasn't the full version. Get real guys. I played the free version too but had realistic expectations. The matchmaking isn't great but the gameplay is very true to its source. It feels like a great quake/unreal tourney blend. For $12 this game should be exploding. I hope it's player count makes a rebound because the devs really care about this game and have a passion for classic arena shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093492663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1473775107}
review:
Where do I even start?

The game tries to be a combination of Halo and Quake, but done oh, so wrong. Quake's linear maps (some of them were ya know) and halo's combat mashed into one thing. 
It's not good, I'd recommend you to stay far away from the "free game" button, as it isn't free, it's mostly free, which is good, but not being able to use the server browser unless I pay 15 dollars is a little shite imo. I wouldn't even make this a point if the Quickplay didn't try to connect me to full servers all the god damn time, I expected it to work to some extent atleast which it clearly doesn't. It's almost as if the quickplay button is made to be that bad so people actually buy the game.

The game's dead and should always stay like that.

Oh and one more thing, if you're gonna play this, just get your hand on a rocket launcher and you've won, it's stupidly overpowered. (sniper's good in damage but the maps suck so badly that it's hard to find somewhere to snipe from)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960939300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1474220177}
review:
Thank you for producing something that has been missing for sometime, a tech updated fps schmup. 

You even stood behind your work with a non-knuckle dusted, non-derpy, non-nerfed version to try for free which felt like the era of quake arena and unreal tournament.

Appreciate the no bull-pucky straight shooting approach to getting your stuff out there - just bought the four pack for the family. Time to frag the kids tomorrow :)

Good on you Reakktor hope it flies for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062793269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1474825149}
review:
I've spent about an hour on this game so far, but its one of the best FPS shooters of recent years. It reminds me very much of Unreal Tournement as it has similar guns, gameplay and maps. I've only got the free version but i'm am very much interested in buying the full version, so i can personalise my character and unlock more awesome maps. 

I'm sure other people will prefer this over the recent Call of Duties games and for a fraction of the price. I recommend this to anyone who loves FPS shooters!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962179148', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1481283315}
review:
Review you say? Yes I will!!!

Do you love UT2004? Well then this is the game for you! Everything is very well polished, the lighting is fantastic and the game speed feels great. There's more movement functionality than in most arena shooters and everything is smooth as butter. 

Also... FREAKIN' MECHS. Awesome.... No doubt!

One of the best experiences I've had in a long time. The UT4 alpha can't touch this game, at least not yet. 

I hope this is the one that brings arena shooters back!

9/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085635951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1473835487}
review:
First off, this feels really good as a shooter. Just you, your weapon and your skill. The mechanics are very 90's shooter. You know...Unreal Tournament, Quake...That sort of thing. No sprint, no health regeneration, armor pickups, no reloads... And it's a good thing. With no powerups, the only thing keeping you on the winning side is how you play. How did I find it, though? I like it. The dodge mechanics and a camo ability (albeit for a few seconds only) help you get out of a sticky situation, and I find myself getting the heck out of there pretty handy. It's very ability based though, so no matter how well you dodge you still have to learn how to shoot straight and overcome your enemy through wit and ability.

Weapons? There's a few. You have your classic slew of automatic rifles, shotguns and rocket launchers. Nothing too unique other than a mega weapon that has the ability to wipe out an entire team although I haven't seen it in a public match yet. The weapons have no reload though so your entire inventory is loaded already and the only way you can top up your supply is through pickups either from specific points on the map or from dead enemies. Health and armor are scattered throughout the map. These come in pretty small amounts save for the larger yet rarer mega versions. You can also customize your player's appearance as well. These are unlocked by progressing through the ranks. You've got a helmet, body, primary and secondary colour, camouflage pattern and the glow of the lights on your body. You can add initials on your body and that's about it. Nothing too fancy or deep, but then again with the very fast paced action this game boasts I'm guessing you catch only a glimpse of your assailant before either he or you bites the dust.

One thing of note to me and which I like a lot is the options and settings. You can customize a lot of the settings HUD-wise, including crosshairs (which you can set up individually for each weapon) as well as a weapon selection display where you can change colour of each weapon so you know what weapons you have from a glance.

Overall, if you really like old shooters or just barebones, skill-based FPS then maybe this is for you. There's a free version out here that omits a server browser, game host option and character customization. Just to get a taste of what to expect and if you like it enough, you can get the full thing. They're not forcing anybody, so that's a plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042259317', 'num_games_owned': 4316, 'num_reviews': 414, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1473766416}
review:
Tried the free version.
Attempted to join some quick matches.
Connection to host lost on three seperate attempts.
Went to Server Browser.
Can't use server browser on free edition (lolwut?).
Attempted over a dozen quick play attempts.
All attempts failed due to max capacity or lost connection to host (which would be mitigated by a server browser).
Can't do anything in customize besides a clan tag and letters on my chest.
Can only play bot match which I can't customize any settings because of the free mode.
Default settings INCLUDES MOUSE ACCELATION. 
Bot play is at least functional, but I am only whelmed and gameplay provides nothing new/interesting except for a quick dodge function.
Can't enjoy core features of the game and the game will remind you to buy the full version when using full version features and when exiting the game with a browser popup.
Uninstalled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060357558', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1563460294}
review:
(Account play time not representitive of full play time)


A fast game with faster shooting, and one of the best PC launches in a long time.


So far, I've been plaing with the free version of the game, so some elements of the game aren't up for review. But that does bring up one huge aspect of this game. It's PC release.

There is a lot that game companies could learn from the title when it comes to PC releases. Firstly, the free version. This isn't some EA Access, play one hour and tough luck affair, it provides the core and impotant parts of the game for you to play and try, for free...forever. Yes a lot of the functionality isn't there, but it's for you to try the game out and it's a method of marketing I wish I saw more of. When first seeing TOXIKK, my first thought was, "Oh, here we go again! Another Quake clone trying to 'bring me back to the '90s'. We need these like we need more zombie games." Honestly, if it wasn't for the free version, I would never have played TOXIKK. Now I'm buying it. The devs are attracting more customers, I feel more confident in my purchace, and I have confidence in the devs. A truley excellent trial like this, is worth 1,000 pre-rendered trailers.

Though of course, the game. Does it play well? Is it fun? Are we back in 1999? Well, yes and no. Though first, is it a good PC game? We PC gamers are only seeing more and more dodgy releases each year. Just yesterday, I re-installed The Division to check out PTS, and still, there is a bug where running Rainmeter caused the game to lock up when  the mouse was moved. Halo 5 Forge, released by Microsoft for God's sake has a locked 60FPS and locked 55FOV, making my sick when playing. So I'm glad to report that TOXIKK is a shining pillar of star-light in the ocean of shit ports. Framerate going all the way up to 242FPS, a plethera of in game options, an FOV slider with a huge range, and nigh-on mouse lag-less Vsync, and 100% lag-less when off. It even feels snappier than CS:GO. Which really is saying something here. Though of course, performance. Does it run well? Yes. My God yes. The game looks great, not amazing, certainly not ground-breaking, but runs like a dream. No stuttering, hitching, spikes of any kind, pop-in, and only one-or-two blurry textures. When stood still. Staring at something. Which will last 1/2 of a second before you're shot in the head. Using a GTX 1080 @ 4K w/ maxed settings, I see a range of 105-133FPS. Very, very impressive. And excelent news for high-refresh rate users.

Though the game. Is it 1999. No. More early 2000s. And that's what stopeed this game being another Quake clone, and made it a killer game. The weapons, their designs and charecter movement, are all 1999 to the bone. But the enviroment and charecter design is very 2001. Big burrly blokes in metal clad armour with seeimingly pointless blinky lights, that you'd assume would make you more obvious to other players. Ancient ruins of an unspecified people covered in highly detailed lights from torches, in-explicitly lit during the day. Huge furistic bases made wholey from whit metal and sharp angles with tubes of...stuff in them. All because of one reason. It looks cool.

So really, all-in-all, we're not fragging like it's 1999 here in TOXIKK. But that's it's best quality. It's light Quake if it was to have had it's debut in 2001. A beautifully old school shooter with all the pro-PC user features you could ask for, at two price points that instantly make my little niggles with the irrelevent. Or at least that would be true until I tried "Quick Play". One major niggle is the servers ping times in quick play, which brought a last minute rejig of the score.



8.9/10

Keep fragging Reakktor Studios. Wait. Reakktor. Oh, that's the reason for the double 'K'. Thought it was  them emulating the '90s edge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149724553', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1473835095}
review: Very Quake-esque. Alot like other free to play 'Quake Clones' if you will, although I'll admit that it has some pretty killer graphics in comparison. Just imagine Blacklight Retribution crossed the new DOOM's multiplayer mode (with different maps and guns of course). Overall, it's got solid gameplay mechanics and a sweet Sc-Fi graphics style. Unlike most other modern games in its category, this one isn't pay to win or pay to skin. I'd recommend it on a sale, but at its current point, I wouldn't pay the full asking price for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103949246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3097, 'last_played': 1524964267}
review: Did you like Unreal Tournament 2004? Buy this right now. I actually never really liked UT2K4, always preferred the first one, but I'm really enjoying this. So buy it even if you liked the original more. Shift dodge is a really great idea and the movement feels awesome. It also runs really well too. If you like playing a true arena fps then this is for you. Probably my favorite game of 2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045434041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1556811429}
review:
I've only played a couple of hours but I'm convinced this is a good game.
It plays just like Unreal Tournament and in my opinion is better than UT, which i've played before, it runs smoother and its gorgeous. The weapons are a little different but there's your typical rocket launcher and sniper rifle and a lot of features, such as vehicles.
I definitly recommend getting it and supporting the developers, 'cause this is some quality stuff. The servers have worked properly and I've had no problems so far (and hope I won't have any in the future).
I'm more of a Quake guy, but this game is very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993682469', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5871, 'last_played': 1474149459}
review:
Amazing Arena Shooter,

author: {'steamid': '76561198071247129', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1473761678}
review: Okay, so I played it for a bit and I'm really liking it. The matches are really sporadic and wild. Respawn time is really nice. The guns are varied and the weapon respawn rate is also really good. I never found myself stuck with just a default weapon for too long. It runs sooo smoothly. Really easy to jump in and go. I haven't tried out any of the vehicle gameplay yet. It has really neat things like steath and feign death. Really well put together. The reviews were spot on. Great game to sink time in when you just wanna gun-N-go experience. This game is pretty amazing at doing what it does and offers a fresh take on the arena shooter without being too samey. It feels unique and not like just another Quake or UT rip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005430488', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1474190666}
review:
Gday
This seems to be a great idea , 
releasing a game like UT99/Quake3/Doom 2
but its held back by using a crippled free edition .

I did some footge of the vs bot bootcamp mode here:-
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JGXo6x88Egc

It took 2 years from Early access to 13/Sept/2016 
and now the free edition lacks:
* Server browser
* Clan tags
* Ability to limit region/ping in match search
* Zero servers come up in Asia/Oceanic/Australian region
* You cant turn off the bloom blur
* no party system to join the same game with mates/clan people

I cant shake the feeling this game should of been USD$5
and released on Steam OS/Linux with OpenGL/Vulkan support
along with 64bit exe support to take off on steam machines, 
along with a good free game on Windows but they missed the chance
