author: {'steamid': '76561198023355506', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1473757983}
review:
Can't really see the reason to play this over the new Unreal tournament that is basicly the same game but even in alpha feels a lot more polished and balanced. UT Has more and a lot better maps, UT has more and better weapons, UT feels smoother in movement somehow even tho it's almost like a clone. Maybe because the maps are made better or maybe they just have better polished movement...?

Maps in this game are so cluttered with grass and objects it almost hurts your eyes after a while, and let's face it, i don't think they thought as much about using the different moves like walljumping and stuff, all the armors and good stuff are easy to get and there is few shortcuts and things like that that you can use when you start getting ninja-level when it comes to movement.

The rocket launcher is extremly annoying, on some maps it's basicly everywhere it feels like and everyone tries to just kite eachother shooting rockets backwards while running backwards and the rest of the weapons are just not good enough for the very many corridors that the maps are made up of, they feel very small and stuffed with too much walls. It feels like when you play UT and are up against the best shock rifle player in the world, at least those shockrifles take some skill to blast off right in peoples faces.

In short, there is nothing this game has made better than UT, and on top of that you cannot customize your character or find decent servers unless you pay, while UT is completly free and let's you play the gamemode you want on the map/map rotations that you like, by letting you choose server or even set up your own that you can customize a LOT. The only plus with this game is that it is on Steam, but that is one small plus since it's just a small annoyance to have an extra launcher to open. It's worth the time tho because it is just so much better at everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971524214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1476349984}
review:
Ohhh yeaaaaa, 1999, I remember a day, a good day, where this was this game called Neocron that these guys made. It was the first cyberpunk 1st/3rd person MMORPG! If WoW had not been realesed around the same time and these guys visibility didnt suck cause they werent loaded, we might have been able to avoid 10 years of WoW clones!

The game was the first to literally solve PvPvE with law enforcers in your head for who didnt want to pvp, but played on the same sever. Small penalty as a better implant could have went in but way ahead of the times. You used to fight in the outzone to hold territory called get outposts to be able to get factory or research bonsues, dependin on the OP, to mass build/research weapons, armor, vechicles for the gratest chance of 5 slot weapons. Keep the best and sell the rest at yo's pawn shop! You had your own appartments, items to put in their, cabbies, and no AH you had to trust peeps. Tech parts were IDed from warbots or tech mobs to piece together rares weapons and run around with bad ass shit in the outzone or red light district just to drop it! Epic days of good times. 1 locked slot weapon slot you would not drop, so not full full loot, such a good balance. Running around in the OZ at night with rare weapons with neon spinny orbs around the barrels looked sick, especially durning war time! Oh and power armor, Ohh and no questing!

Anyways so far I got about an hr into their newest title and its a total throwback. Character models and unlocks for the camo look sick as your character progresses you can unlock this. There are mechs and vechicles on some capture maps. So far there is 3 game modes I found. CC Cell Capture, Blood Lust, and FFA. Had alot of fun with 3 friends, but it was difficult to get on the same server because of the 8 slot servs. Couldnt host our own server,  probly needed to forward a port.

Verdict: Worth the few bucks they are asking, I hope it funds Neocron 3!!! And remember Tangent Technologies has an EYE on you...

review: I liked it enough to bother buying the full version, I'll say that for sure. Maybe I just like the Unreal engine though. I could never get into CoD or other games like this. I'm a little concerned, though, because I usually suck at FPS games, and so far every round I've played(on different servers against different people), I've earned all three points for a flawless CTF victory, while my teammate "defended" our flag, or our cell thing... Anyways, either I found the one FPS I'm the best at, or everyone who is playing right now sucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998124890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1473922165}
review:
Does what it says on the packet. V hard to complain given it's free.

Don't even bother with the tutorial, you've got double jump and a strafe button. Combine them how you like. Anyone who grew up on UT or Quake multiplayer will be fine jumping in and playing with the bots, and tbh I had just as much fun there as online. It's got decent graphics and a similar flow, you'll be mapping that best route to your fav weapon/shield and fragging again in no time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019073073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1701940219}
review: Tired of the same old military shooters? Been waiting to play Toxikk for a while because you didn't want to spend on a "dead game?" Wait no more. It's a fast paced UT like game with good graphics, good action, soundtracks, and no fuss fun. Even if you aren't great at arena FPS, it's a slick experience with some serious polish, one of the best looking out there in the genre if not the best. Give it a try, esp UT fans, this won't dissapoint. We've got to a juncture where UT4 probably isn't going to succeed and something needs to fill the void, this game should do it. Toxikk did not deserve to be dead, now that it is free, there is no excuse not to support it. Took a while to be free, and now that it is, there should be some interest and players. I would like to thank the developers for making it free and hopefully a community can be built where everyone benefits. Have fun. I know I will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003513357', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1511585109}
review:
This is a review from the trial, which is limited for 2 Maps and up to 8 Players, and without vehicles. The full version comes with vehicles and up to 16 players maps.

In overall, I guess it is fine. The movement pacing it is a bit slower than UT series, which might be a good or bad design for you, but in my opinion it is Ok, it should have been a bit faster. UT and Quake it is noticeable faster. 
Most of the weapons are similar to UT including the secondary fire, there are mutators as well for the matches. Same as UT, there is double jump, level design mechanics, etc.

+
Steam workshop support
Customization options for weapons HUD (such as UT). 
Good performance, decent graphics, audio and music.
There are some new mechanics, as going completely invisible in game when pressing Q (but only last a couple of seconds and can be replenished), this comes with default matches, but can be disabled from being a host.

As I mentioned, the trial or demo, does not come with maps that includes vehicles, so I couldn't try these, which comes with land and aerial ships. I guess this is a plus, because after UT3, the new UT F2P does not have vehicles yet.

Cons:
There is a flamethrower (my opinion, but who wants a flamethrower in a arena shooter?).

review: Nothing that hasn't been done before and better, although what it does have is polished to a mirror shine. Standard face-paced arena shooting with weapon pickups, health/armor pickups, no reloading, and no ADS. Definitely a good remake of 90's-era arena shooters like Quake and Unreal Tournament, which means if you're a call of duty kid you're going to think everybody but you is using hacks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040934941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1473745835}
review:
"There are too many free players playing at this time. You can still play with bots on boot camp"
How about no. Sorry. That's kinda stupid in my taste. 

Other than that, I like the gameplay. It is a true twitch shooter in gameplay. I enjoyed the gameplay, I might buy it, and just play it with friends. I actually won a match, which surprised me, because I'm usually horrible at online games.

Clearly you can't have more than 800 people playing free. Why have it free then? I'd buy it, but the fact that there's only 800 people, isn't very much of a good community. Very small. While I'm not gonna downvote it for the fact that there are limited server space for free players (It's not listed in the disadvantages of the free copy) I will give it as a warning.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993844514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1478822721}
review: Overall pretty good game. Just wondering which games in 1999 had overpowered vehicles? I like the quake/ut/halo feel to the game, but you can't put a huge ass 'halo' map in and expect to have fun 4v4. Dunno who thought that was a good idea. But, gameplay without the vehicles is fun for now until the guns that require aiming get nerfed while the ones that don't, get buffed, just like every other game out there. You're already half way there with your vehicles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003589830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 3285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2073, 'last_played': 1709163002}
review:
Yah baby!
-Pretty much UT2004 2.0, mixed with a little Halo and Quake. Yum. There are a number of little details that give Toxikk it's own feel.
-Bots. I noticed bots jumping out of the way, being at least pretty smart; I've also seen them get stuck sometimes, but not enough that it seriously hurts.  Speaking as a casual player, the bots are pretty good, even at adept. If you buy the game you can play against them in "boot camp" matches that allow custum map selection but don't give xp for unlocking appearances, or "contract" matches which do give xp and are a sort of ladder of unlocking matches, or you can host a server with bots; you get xp for that too.
-Movement is good, similar to UT2004, but slightly expanded upon.
-Weapons are pretty standard but good, a reshuffling of  weapons from other fps. Highlights are a proper scrolling zoom on the sniper gun. And a flamethrower :) 
-Low cost, can try for free (buying the full game gets you instant access to all the maps, including workshop maps, bot matches, and ability to host)
-Small install size; even with most of the workshop stuff, still only about 5 gb.
-Toxikk has a very cool screenshot tool, press f10. 
-The vehicles are cool, especially the mech.

Could be better:
-small player base... but there are events, you can play with friends, or bots are quite fun
-There is not a ton of maps...but, the ones there are are gorgeous and well designed, and there is enough in the workshop to keep things interesting; some of the workshop maps are really nice and are up to snuff to have been in the game, or close, and others at least play well.
-Only characters available to play / fight are Halo type armored sci-fi marines. You can customize them some but there is no Nali Cow, Orb, Klesk or Skaarj. This makes things simpler, but less interesting (There are some player models and mod weapons out there but not a ton; there are no bot mods to my knowledge). I'd love it if there was more emulation of UT2004's bot selection UI and some crazier characters.
-no way to give bots commands (?)... but they seem to play ctf pretty well anyway
-map rotation ui could be better. I believe you have to exit a match if you finish and want to play another custom map. The load times are not bad, but seems like an extra step. You can switch to a standard map just fine.

I wish some of these smaller fps arena teams would band together, theoretically combining content and players to make a more successful outing. As it is though, Toxikk is one of the best. UT3 clone? Sure, but very well done and it fixes a lot of UT3's issues for me. UT3 has a lot more mod content, but I found it's bugginess frustrating, it's style jarring and claustrophobic. Toxikk is cleaner, smoother, less overdone than UT3 and looks more like UT4 in that attention is paid to keeping the nice detail from being overwhelming. Simply put, I find Toxikk more fun to play than UT3, or UT4 and Quake Champions too. And it continues to be fun as I keep playing it.

***Pressing F10 in Boot Camp (single-player) matches = screenshot mode, an  out of "body" picture taking experience
[wasd + mouse] move camera around map
[MOUSEWHEEL] Adjust Field of View (FOV)
[F12] Save Screenshot via Steam/JPG
[F10] return to fighting (be ready!)

review: I really liked the premise, "frag like it's 1999" - yoo hoo! Untortunately, this is not the case. Maps are good, and that's pretty much it. Player movement is slow and cumbersome, you have to press shift to do wall jumps, weapons are boring, vehicles feel superfluous, player models are generic robots, there're tons of changing game mods with no clearly stated objectives. But mostly the player movement sucks. UT4 feels way better even in alpha stage.

Tutorial level ends with "See if you can figure out the move to get pass." which by definition isn't giving me any help on advanced player movement.

Fix these bugs, and when you release your next big update, maybe we can try again.

If you cannot connect or find any servers, or if my ports are misconfigred for your game, perhaps tell me, instead of just saying "searching". That gives me no info on if the problem is your end or mine.

Sounded cool, but ended up being a 3GB download for a incomplete tutorial level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996633876', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 370, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1473741333}
review:
Obviously, I didn't play much of this one. But, [b]that is the entire point of TOXIKK‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢[/b] - you can just pick it up and play it.

Yeah, okay, so this game is alright, it's in the best engine out right now, it feels good to kill stuff, everything makes a beep when you hit it which can be okay unless it gets annoying, but overall it's really just Unreal Tournament - but they took some of the weapons from Quake, made one or two of their own ones, and added UT style secondary fires to everything.

Now, I grew up with Unreal Tournament and Quake 3 CPMA. I loved both of these games. But TOXIKK‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢ just makes me want to play CPMA again. It doesn't make me want to play TOXIKK‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢.

I want to talk about the bad and why I don't recommend this.

For starters, the obnoxious 'f2p' kind of thing they have going, the way you have to buy stuff with points at all in-game (if you buy the game) and the fact that you really can't do anything if you're just playing the demo - if you are only playing the free version, you can join quick-game. That's literally it. You can't even host your own listen server or play against bots or anything like that.

So, if I may ask, [b]what in the hell is the point of even having a demo like this?[/b] This is a game that doesn't need a demo. I appreciate that it has one, I guess, but it just pisses me off. I've played it now. I know literally everything it has to offer - pointless customizable stuff locked behind, what, in-game store crap - and what boils down to a stopgap before that new Unreal Tournament remaster thingo that Epic Games are currently working on.

Another problem with this game is that, I don't actually understand what they mean by 'advancements' and 'arena-shooter enthusiasts'. I'm an arena-shooter enthusiast too. Does that make me qualified to rip off Quake and Unreal Tournament in the Unreal engine and then sell it for money when Epic themselves are apparently giving away a UT game for free in that self-same engine? And I don't see any advancements. In pretty much any way you look at this, it's UT2004 in a new engine. Great, I guess. But again, I'd rather just stick with UT2004.

There's just very little that's new here. Maybe some new guns? I really don't know, but that's closer to what I'd expect from a whole new game. New guns and new innovations, new gameplay, new things to make me interested. I get that we need to constantly relieve the nostalgia of the 'old glory days' of gaming, but moving forward works too - IF you do it right. This game doesn't move forwards, it feels closer to a recreation of those 'old glory days' so I don't really feel it draws me in enough.

Because there's nothing new, and I know the older games already did this better, I'm not going to buy TOXIKK‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢‚Ñ¢

But then again, this isn't a bad game, and I do kind of want to support it... but I really can't bring myself to. So I won't.

...

Oh, also, there don't seem to be any Australian servers. But hey, there are at least Vietnamese servers! 100ms ping in a 'fast-paced' FPS? OH YES PLEASE!

EDIT: boohoo someone doesn't like my favrite game so ima downthumb them with all my might instead of actually considering their arguments and making a well-thought out counter-point

author: {'steamid': '76561198028307114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1508864774}
review:
THIS GAME IS SO MUCH FUN...

(*cough* Overwatch) Forget long boring stories, forget complex crafting/special abilities, forget $60 pricetags.

This game is just about running around and shooting. The environments are nice. The game runs well on anything from an old laptop in low-res to 4K on a gaming PC.

This game is worth the $30 price tag - oh, wait... 

If you like games like DOOM, Quake, Halo, then DEFINITELY get this one! Especially on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984651231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1473748460}
review:
Game is fun and I wish I could recommend but the fact that you can't party up with your friends and have to resort to searching specific servers by IP address or name (and even then you're not likely to be on same team) is a deal breaker. I bought the game expecting to squad up with my friends but apparently that's not an option.

Additionally, the servers split up the community by "skill" ranges on an ALREADY SMALL PLAYERBASE (why? Learn to adapt. Most games don't have this. I don't need my hand held on what types of people to play against.) . There are a few "all" skill range servers, but very few and they're always full (no server queue either). If you're playing by yourself, the game can be fun but the issues mentioned above are reasons to steer clear. Yes, you can join empty servers but I don't play games to play against bots and hope the server fills up just so I can play with my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119124084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1473739348}
review:
Throwing me in and telling me to figure out some stupid wall jumping BS and i tried it a hundred different ways is clearly the perfect way to stage level 1. Here's something impossible have fun. Lol waste of my time. Glad i didnt pay for this. Bad choices in being smarmy to the player. 0/5

Enjoy the positive reviews until you take the free version down developer.

Update: Called it, free version still up but nobody wants it even for free. Being right is fun and all, but it is sad seeing devs put time into junk. Develop your games out of love, not trying to be an addicting sleeper hit. Plus, theres enough shooters man, try adventure games they're dead and dying now. Give them a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075324976', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 16622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1634395068}
review:
Host Game: Not Available to Free Players
Browse Servers: Not Available to Free Players
Quick Match:
Connection lost....
Connection lost....
Connection lost....


Would love to give a more positive review but so far this "free" game is nothing but a paywall and a broken server. Anything I click on (like customizations or host a game) just ends up being an advertisement to buy the game and the Quick Match never connects.

Maybe I'll try again some day in the future and revise this if it's playable. Not willing to spend $15 on an old school shooter without a demo first and this free version just never connects.
---

EDIT 1 (2016): Having given the game another attempt I still have nothing positive to say about it. The servers can't handle many players; it brings nothing new to the arena FPS genre and the community is one of the worst I've experience online in a long time.

If you enjoy being rude to other players and playing a game that is basically the same as what was available 17 years ago for cheaper, this might be the game for you. I'm done.
---

EDIT 2 (2020): It's covid-19 quarantine, gave this game another chance.

Pros: The server actually connects this time. There's people to play with (at least for now while everyone is home). The game runs smooth and plays OK. Several of the paywall features are removed, free players have more access to the game than they did before. (there's still cosmetics you can buy)

Cons: It's still just a routine old-school shooter, if that's not your thing there isn't anything else here. The player base is still a bunch of rude trolls making rude comments at each other.

I mean, it's a free game, you don't need my recommendation to spend your money since it won't cost you anything. I'm playing simply to waste time and mindlessly kill people, but I can't say that's enough to bother recommending it to other people. 

As a game I should probably give a thumbs up, but I honestly can't say I like it so that part of me wants to thumb down and since Steam doesn't let us give neutral reviews, I'm leaving this thumbs down simply to counter some of the positives on the store page.

It's free, you can just ignore this and play it yourself if you cared.
---

author: {'steamid': '76561198142976696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1548395883}
review:
I played the original Unreal Tournament while I waited for this to download and it felt like I was just playing a prettier game (with different weapons) going into TOXIKK.  The game feels more like the original UT than any of the newer ones.  The game looks beautiful, runs great and the AI is top notch sometimes even placing among real players.  

This game is not your typical shooter, it is what shooters were back in the early 2000's: arenas filled with guns and letting you loose to kill everything. No muss no fuss, this game is fantastic and well worth my $12. I have not had any issues with the multiplayer to this point, I have lost connection a couple of times but I was able to find a new game very quickly. 

Support these devs and buy this kickass game!
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197990506088', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1473736789}
review:
Frag LiKKe it's 1999,
Toxikk is the complete 1999 arena shooter experience, from the janky movement, to the server instabilities all the way to the invisible walls.

Ever tried setting up a LAN in 1999? This is the real deal with all the joyful waiting and disconnects.

On the other hand, it's KK and the game when it actually runs is the most fun I've had in an arena shooter since I had two root canals in a day.

10/10, would play Neocron again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119265833', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1473735513}
review:
I downloaded the free version of this during the sale.
I opened it on my gaming laptop, with my 2.4 ghz processor, 4 gb ram, and built in HP graphics.
I optimized my settings to play at the best fps.
I played a single match at about 12 fps.

It was fun as hell

Then I cried because I want the full game and a better PC but I do not have money.

Seriously this game was so much fun for the 12 minutes I was able to run it on my potato.

9/8 m90s

author: {'steamid': '76561198052856632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1685232005}
review:
Alright let me start this off by saying,,

Do you or have you ever played Unreal Tournament? If so this is just like that very very much just like it and it feels dam good..

The free edition is well free. So whats the difference from free and the full version Well nothing important really.

Then what am I missing out on then? Just small things like all maps, cars and cosmitics. Thats all your missing nothing real eye opener.

PROS:....
Full core game
Easy controls
Quick fun
Amazing graphics
Arena shooter

You can easily go in and just start playing like any shooter and you will adapt real fast there is no hard controls just simple and fast and thats what an arena shooter is suppose to be nothing complicated or frustrating just simple and to the point.

CONS:..
Not the full game (but it was free sooo...)
matches to short
Not unreal tournament (but who can you blame its just like it)

There isn't much cons for this for my time playing but its free and its a quick fun game.

Grap it while its free who knows if they are gonna remove it or not.

Thank you Devs for giving me this free game and letting me enojoy the CORE game and i can tell you it is well made amd very fun.

review: The free version has a low player count at present, but I can tell that this aint like other modern shooters. This is classic 90s arena FPS action. Like they say: No classes, no loadouts, no bullshit. This is multiplayer shooting as it is meant to be played. If you've played Unreal Tournament, Quake 3, Nexuiz, Xonotic, anything of the sort: you'll feel right at home.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028020101', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1473732268}
review:
Honestly? Call a demo "Free Edition". I hope you know by saying "Free Edition", you're calling it a F2P game, which it obviously isn't. "Freemium" users can't even access a server browser. I'm sorry? That's a premium feature?

Besides the bullshit (such as not even being able to join a game) and the uncompletable tutorial thanks to the movement system being utter crap, Reakktor calls this a spiritual successor to the older Frag'n'tag titles. It's not. All it is, is more graphical version of UT2004. That's it. Oooh, but what about the levels? You mean the levels that "Freemium" players can't access? You mean the quick match that doesn't even fucking work?

I was straight up told that my copy was a "free trial". Again, you don't know what the hell a "free trial is".

So in my half-hour debacle, I learned how clunky the movement was, why there was a random-ass block leading from the tutorial area that did absolutely nothing. I learned of our character's 2-inch hop and 10 ft pelvic thrust. And I learned that I died 50+ times trying to clear a wall-jump gap that was seemingly impossible because of our 10ft pelvic thrust and 2-inch hop that has to be used in the correct order.

Honestly, this game is trash, and is most likely going to stay as trash. Also, if you're going to market your game, don't market it on another games commercial failure. That's not being "comedic", that's called being a big ol' piece of humbug.

Edit: Apparently there's people witchhunting the negative reviews. Honestly, go fuck yourself. This is the pure unadulterated truth and you refuse to believe it, go ahead. It doesn't make my stance any less wrong.

Here is a cherry pie recipe that i love

4 cups fresh or frozen tart cherries
1 to 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
4 tablespoons cornstarch
1/8 tablespoon almond extract (optional)
Your favorite pie crust or pie dough recipe for 2 crust pie
1 1/2 tablespoons butter, to dot
1 tablespoon granulated sugar, to sprinkle

Place cherries in medium saucepan and place over heat. Cover. After the cherries lose considerable juice, which may take a few minutes, remove from heat. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and cornstarch together. Pour this mixture into the hot cherries and mix well. Add the almond extract, if desired, and mix. Return the mixture to the stove and cook over low heat until thickened, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and let cool. If the filling is too thick, add a little water, too thin, add a little more cornstarch.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Use your favorite pie dough recipe. Prepare your crust. Divide in half. Roll out each piece large enough to fit into an 8 to 9-inch pan. Pour cooled cherry mixture into the crust. Dot with butter. Moisten edge of bottom crust. Place top crust on and flute the edge of the pie. Make a slit in the middle of the crust for steam to escape. Sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for about 50 minutes. Remove from the oven and place on a rack to cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966880749', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1473904574}
review:
You know your arena shooter is good when:
* It takes 5 tries to get in to a match without it telling you the server it matched you with is full.
* After a match it disconnects you with a generic host error instead of going to the next map.
* Trying to play more than one match in a certain amount of time lets you know that "the maximum amount of free users are playing" but you can still play... AGAINST BOTS IF YOU WANT!!!
* It starts at 720p.
* It auto-enables mouse acceleration, vsync, motion blur, chromatic aberration, and caps your FPS to 2x less than your monitor refresh rate.
* It nags you when you close it by opening your web browser to a store page to buy it.
* 8 people per server (even consoles do better than that...)
* Uninspired generic bullet weapons + a rocket launcher.
* All NA servers are hosted on the west coast so you can enjoy your 60-80 ping.

tl;dr
go play the new UT

author: {'steamid': '76561198200436277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1473727844}
review:
Before you judge TOXIKK based on this review (because my one opinion is soooo important....) know that i only have the free/vanilla version of the game, and my experience may not be accurate to the paid version. 
Pros:
 Doom/ Unreal Tournament feeling gameplay
 amazing graphics
 fun to play (when you can)
 simple

Cons:
 one of if not the most basic game i've ever played
 bad servers
 "too many free version players, but you can still play solo"
 i was only givn 2 maps and game modes to play solo

with all of that being said, and reitterating that i only played the free version, this was a fun game, but if you're going to play it, buy the full version and save yourself the headache

author: {'steamid': '76561198051754713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1473727142}
review:
Downloaded the free version to see what it was about, and was not disappointed. I did get dropped from the first game I joined (via quick play, I have not tried server browser yet) because the server was full. 

Visuals are awesome. Runs smoothly and looks great. 120 fps without turning anything down (i5 2500k @ 4.5 Ghz + r9 290x)

As far as actual gameplay, its been fast and fun. Its honestly a lot faster than I'm used to (and maybe even too fast) but its exactly as advertised. No complaints there. 
All the weapon drops are readily accessible in the maps and allow for a broad range of playstles. Every gun also has a secondary fire too that is more powerful.

Looking forward to trying this game out more

author: {'steamid': '76561198013244899', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1473725205}
review:
TL;DR : YOU CANNOT play this game, because you cannot connect to servers. The game does not let you pick any servers to connect too out of the hundreds there seem to be,  so you cannot ever connect to a nearby server at ALL. Un. Playable. 


This game is GARBAGE for free to players. It is clearly stated on the site that "FREE PLAY HAS NO COMPETATIVE DISADVANTAGES COMPARED TO THE FULL GAME" Well, in a sense? that is completely correct, because you cannot fucking play it if you're a free to player. The reason why? Well, if I told you it was customization, would you believe me? Well, apparently choosing what country you're in to connect to what server you'd like to play on, is classified in the same catagory as fucking changing your armor color and your character. So basically, this game is unplayable because you cannot pick a server to join in on, so you get put into Nam servers, European ones, I've tried connecting to a server an upwards of eighteen times, only TWICE has it connected to one succesfully, you'd think after that painful wait it'd be over, right? NOPE, NOPE NOPE. It's not over, you lose connection to the host. In short, TOXIKK is unplayable and they only made it free for today, for literally no reason. I don't think they get a SINGLE benefit from this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096556146', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1473777379}
review:
*Note: This is for the free version of the game*

I played around in the "Boot Camp" which is basically a way to test your skills against bots. I thought it played pretty fun but in less than an hour I already found two major issues with the game that make multiplayer virtually unplayable. Issue one is that you seem to literally only have access to TWO maps. Just two. Issue number two is that there is NO SERVER BROWSE OPTION. Only quick join. This is a horrible issue combination as whenever you join a server playing a map that you don't have access to, the screen just stays black. You can't press anything so you have to alt+tab and then exit the game from the task bar. Yes, I know there needs to be restrictions to the free players vs. the ones who pay, but this particular set of restrictions is terrible. The two map selection restriction would be bareable if I could manually choose which server to join (perferrably a NAM server playing one of the two maps I can play) but most of the time I get auto-joined into a EU server that is apparently playing a map I can't. Say hello to the black screen again.

Ofc buying the full version would probably fix these issues but I'd like to play a bit more of the game before I make the final decision. Unfortunately, they made playing the game pretty difficult...

Please don't treat this as a glorified demo, because it really is only a demo. If you don't change the current state of things, you will continue to get a lot more angry/negative reviews despite how good the actual full-pay-to-access version of the game is

author: {'steamid': '76561198073413676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1474078572}
review:
Just can't get into the game. Literally.

I could do the tutorial, but no quick matches. Definitely want to play it, as I like the controls.

I see some are saying "It's free, what do you expect"... simple. I expect to get into AT LEAST ONE game. A free to play game that you can't play? that makes no sense. My 0.6 hours on record? about 3 minutes in the tutorials, and about 30 trying to get into a quick match. One of three things happened on each try. 1) game glitched, nothing would happen. 2) Server is full. 3) Sorry, you can't do this with a free version (Yes, I got this message while trying to play quick-match)

I will try again tomorrow when it lets me for one last shot. I'll change my review if it works, even if I don't like it. Just want it to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056570242', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1459301368}

I bought this back during a sale. And it was worth every penny, even back then when there was no one playing (and I mean literally 0 people aside from my friend and myself). 

It's massively fun and really takes you back to playing games like Unreal Tournament. Even without other players, the bot matches are great fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018348970', 'num_games_owned': 1889, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1477011479}
review:
This game came out of nowhere and I'm glad I checked it out. Fast, frenetic, fun. This is the best old school-style arena shooter to come out in a really long time. DOOM wishes that it had this game's multiplayer. The graphics are gorgeous, sound design is good, the maps are varied and well designed (for the most part), and all your favorite arena FPS modes are in there. It's simple, has a small but varied selection of weapons, and does just about everything right. This game does not seek to reinvent the wheel, and that's what makes it so good. For all fans of the old school Quake-style multiplayer FPS, this is the game for you. 

EDIT: I'm still enjoying this game quite a bit so I thought I'd respond to some of the criticism I see in negative reviews.

"There's nobody playing" - These were all during early access. The game has a consistent player population at least right now, shortly after release.

"You can't play with friends/It's hard to get into a game." - Pay the cheap price for the full version to gain access to the server browser, solving both of these problems.

"If you want to play Unreal Tournament, just get Unreal Tournament. It's free!" - Yes, and it's also currently in a highly incomplete state whereas Toxikk is a complete experience. In addition, Toxikk handles differently with different weapons and movement mechanics. There's room for two good Unreal Engine arena shooters in the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036894971', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1474156797}
review: Finally able to match make today so I am changing my review to positive. Initial impressions are that the movement is fluid and on-point. It's essentialy UT2k4 with a modern tweak(the ability to use a single dodge button modifier). The weapons lack "punch" or any exciting "weight" to them. The rocket launcher is borderline game-breaking currently. All of this can be fixed pretty easily imo. The graphics are crisp, the level design so far works fine but I havent played enough to completely know. I am a die-hard UT2k4 fan that's been hoping and praying for EPIC to breathe life into the alpha. They just don't care. Will Toxikk take UT's place? No, not currently. Does it stand a chance? Yes, but there's still work to be done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309600496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1474936709}
review:
BEST game ever. 

It reminds me of halo, doom, quake and pretty much all the 90's FPS. You can customize your armor as you gain XP. You make your own crosshair for every gun and you choose your hit marker. The weapons are insane and the music in the game is incredible. 

The game modes are old school like " Capture the flag " , "team deathmatch" or "Free for all" . You have to press "fire" to respawn so if you go to the bathroom you dont get killed 20 times. 

Best maps I"ve seen so far, perfectly well done and they all have something special.

It's coming from a guy that played CSGO, COD, BF, DOOM, QUAKE, CRISIS, HALO, R6 and a thousand other FPS.

Buy this game if you want to have REAL fUN instead of getting mad or being yelled at for no reasons.

SEE YA in the game (:

10/10

review:
Looks good in the trailer.  Here is my first 30 minutes of play:

1.  Quick browse for game (free version doesnt allow server browsing)
2.  Searching for game

4. Server at capacity
5.  Repeat steps 1-4 multiple times until you catch on that there is no game.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198009346845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1473721657}
review:
Its basically a Wild Tangent game, in that it dangles all the features above your head right behind its paywall. That would'nt be a huge issue except its literally unplayable without a server browser, cause their quick play algorithm is completely bjorked. Dont waste your time.

If you do waste your time, prepare to be greeted only by error messages saying server connection lost, server is for premium only, etc.

The only gameplay I was able to experience was the sub par tutorial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037879922', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1473738459}
review:
Well.... wanted to try it out and do a review... won't join server LOL oh well....

EDITED:

Finally got it to work, however I can't join multiplayer server with the free version. Its definately fast paced and fun.... moving and shooting has never felt so fluid in a while. In the bot modes simplexity equals more frags and more action. Thats a perfect blend and each weapon has its own pros and cons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048284952', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1473721095}
review:
Ok so im going to be a staight shooter (no pun intended) and be honest here. i would not recommend this game for alot of reasons. 

1.) the controls are easy yes but WAY to sensitive, if you can change them then great. i didnt bother looking i just wanted to shoot folks in the face.
2.) Red Cell is BULLSH** but also kinda fun. its both the worst tutorial ive ever had the pleasure of playing in any FPS game and also a great hoot...kind of. the contracts were way to easy. i mean come on the bots on other games like this were dumb as hell no difference here. it does make for some good dumb fun though.
3.) sure this is a "succesor" to games like UT, Doom, Quake etc etc. but those games are better. this game borrows WAY to much from them.
4.) combat: boils down to who has the rocket launcher/shotgun/ or that lucky turd who found the super weapn...the hellraiser is that it. oh and about that: REDEEMER MUCH! 1 shot dumb fire rocket primary fire, 1 shot guide it with your mouse alt fire. redeemer style. who else remembers that from unreal?
5.) other personal reasons i wont go into. 
now with my opinion being said. its not nessecarily bad but its not good either. its ok. run of the mill. since this was written when the game was free. sure give it a try if you want. but dont expect anything amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137367816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 146776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12, 'playtime_at_review': 64059, 'last_played': 1711321047}
review:
I love the game.

Yes, there are technical difficulties right now after the launch, but they will be fixed soon.

What you then have is a fantastic looking ArenaFPS with a very solid and smooth movement system.
I am playing AreaFPS for 15 years now and this game brought back the fun I had many years ago before it all turned into tryhard e-sports.

The "Free Edition" is a free demo and should not be confused with free-to-play. It's not called demo because on Steam demos mean you can't play with owners of full game. In TOXIKK you can.

What you get with the full edition are more official maps (the better ones actually), access to community servers with can run community made maps, game types and other modifications.
The steam workshop is already full with community content.

TL;DR: 
Don't listen to the haters. Wait a day till the initial matchmaking issues are fixed, then try it out yourself. During Early Access 85% of reviews were positive, and probably 10% complained about issues that are to be expected in Early Access. And since then the game has become only better (except for the matchmaking bug).

Wow. I am impressed! I usually stay away from shooters but this "old school arena" style is as great fun now as it was way back when. Get the free edition and try it out!

Runs like a dream on my 970, and should be easy on even the most basic of modern gaming systems. Gotta love that Unreal Engine.

And hire these guys to make the Doom Multiplayer, seriously.

EDIT: Please note, you will find yourself saying "Trrrrriiiple Kill" to yourself... alot. Recommend having throat lozenges nearby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007196943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1579584049}
review:
Don't listen to the nay sayers. I got into a game within seconds. Yes I had 1 time where it said servers were full, big whoop, it's not like you paid for the game. Complaining that features aren't in the FREE BASE GAME is dumb when it's literally marketed that way. You don't lose anything with the free model. You jump in, play and that's it. At least you can jump in and play a few matches and see if you like it enough to buy and unlock everything compared to just buying it and crying about it later. Some people just complain to complain after reading most of the reviews.

TL:DR, it's a free base model with "limited" features unless you buy an unlock key essentially. Fun game for mindless shooting arena with friends or people online

review:
Its weird. No depth, no strategy. Its a weird combination between the original HALO, Unreal, and DOOM multiplayers. It doesn't know what it wants to be. It's pick up random weapons lying around the map, without much control and go. It's run and gun at its most barebones. 

No strategy involved. Don't waste your cash. I'm glad I didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028068160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1606077454}
review:
So - this is a quick impressions after a few bouts in the game (using the free version at the time of review). Before I say anything else, I clicked on quick-play and was immediately put into a game. Whatever issues may have been about to cause the mass of negative reviews either didnt affect me or have been cleared up. You will need to check this for yourselves with the rest of the community. Now - the game is solid. Like - proper solid. Everything a twitch shooter needs, its here and polished. Maps are decently designed and heavily reminiscent of UT (a plus for me). The movement and shooting of weapons feels natural and theres plenty options to adjust the mouse control to just how you like it. To those who liked the old guard of the genre - this is the UT school of shooter, not the Quake one (again a plus for me). Basically - its what UT3 would have been if UT3 was more like UT2004 (and, you know, wasnt totally shit). 

The problems here are, unfortunately, not all related to what the devs can do. Primarily - this game will live or die by its community. It needs one - its the life-blood. And twitch shooter fans will find a lot to like here. The game itself could do with a bit of a visual alteration. Looking to the inspiration - UT - the models there were visibly identifiable and bright, easy to see. A foible of the engine, however, means that its easy to blend with everything else on screen. The game does a lot to avoid this issue, but I feel they could improve it by making the characters something more than just "dude in armour" - if not for any other reason than to add some soul to the game. Weapons could also use a face lift. On paper they are fine and they are fun to use, but I didnt feel they had distinctive enough shapes when approaching them. Again, the game should look to its peers and remake the weapons to be easily identifiable by shape and colour. Make the flamer yellow and the plasmagun blue, the rocket red... make one short, one long, one bulky etc. As it is, its hard to tell, am I picking up a shotgun or a flamethrower?

Beyond that, at the minute, the community seems to be feeling the game out and the servers I tried were filled with low level players. Maybe as your conmetitive score rises, you will be matched with better, longer playing vets, but my short stay saw me pitted against other freebies (who I promptly dominated). This should change if the game gets a solid grounding. Which it should. This genre lies all buy forgotten, while having so much potential for fun gameplay. It was honestly really refreshing going to a new game and feeling the nostalgic excitement of wall jumping and landing a perfect rocket shot. I gotta say - Im also somewhat surprised by the almost good-will style business model. Try this game - if it doesnt work, it was free so dont complain and just tell the devs what is wrong. You cant lose. You either like it and buy it or dislike it and leave it behind at no cost. 

Big thumbs up here. If the community grows - this could be a very fun title. Just - the community must grow.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960865917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1474240537}
review:
I don't review all that many games but I've been playing games since before most of you were born. This is Unreal (the game) and that's no bad thing. It's frantic and tactical, you'll die many times and all the deaths will be worthy.
This isn't some namby pamby Battlefield with shiny graphics this is the gameplay of old. 
Free version seems fine and full version has all the bits without spending more for nonsense DLC.

Live, kill, die, live and smile.

Frag me like it's 1999 again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003320091', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1473713291}
review:
Toxikk is a watered-down arena shooter that absolutely [i]does[/i] take some inspiration from military shooters.

[list]
[*] Mouse acceleration on by default
[*] Hard framerate limit of 242
[*] DX9 only
[*] Cumbersome movement
[*] Vehicles??
[/list]

Navigating the maps is a constant struggle against the movement mechanics. You can jump, long jump, double jump (after jump or long jump), wall jump (after jump or double jump, not after long jump or long-jump-double-jump). Your normal jump is so short that you have to double jump up small ledges. The window for double-jumping is also incredibly short, so you can't jump forward, shoot, double-jump back or use a double jump to break your fall. Long jumps and wall jumps seem to be unecessary mechanics at best.

But, that's as far as I got. Tried several times to join a match, "disconnected from host" every time. Free users can't access the server browser, either. Just wait for Quake Champions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011519368', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1473722723}
review:
Free Version:

Started out doing the "Contracts"
Felt comfortable with the controls.
Went into a Quick Play.
Died 19 times.
Got 1 kill.

My mind says salty hackers but my heart says I'm just bad.

Got into quickplay just fine. Did contracts just fine.
That was definately the full core experience.

I even modified my crosshairs.

If you want to feel abused, beaten and broken in a severely painful and unforgiving environment (Much like the 90's shooters) Then this game's pretty much spot on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987738660', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1473713876}
review:
I can't really write a review of this game due to my lack of playtime but it really is not for everyone. I found myself questioning game mechanics and weapons more than I had fun playing it. I would give it a positive review if I could see myself playing it down the road. It really played like a free to play game due to its clunky mechanics, low FOV, terrible graphics and general gameplay.

I also could not join servers for the about 10 minutes every time I wanted to play due to the lack of servers. If you want a game that is fun and you can "frag like it's 1999" Just get cs 1.6. I found that game to be much better and more refined. 

The character customization is kinda cool though. I could see myself using one single model for my entire 3 hours of playtime before I got so bored that I wanted to play BF1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002235078', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1473714031}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048980407', 'num_games_owned': 2513, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1473539647}
review:
[h1]A Time For Comebacks[/h1]

TOXIKK joins in on the trending resurgence of niche gaming that was once popular near the turn of the century. More importantly, it is equipped to quench the thirst of many arena/twitch shooter fans that have been left wanting more after playing DOOM's new multiplayer. The fans I'm referring to, by the way, are other Millenials that have been dying to play a new Unreal Tournament clone. Now I'm not saying that TOXIKK is without fault, or that it is capable of bearing the title of UT's illegitimate successor (excluding UT4), but TOXIKK presents an admirable effort and foray into a genre that was once forgotten by many. It deserves a chance to prove its worth to the arena veterans, and newcomers alike, waiting for UT4 to finish development ‚Äì which is currently in pre-alpha.

[h1]Free vs. Full Versions[/h1]

The developers have provided a free version of TOXIKK for anyone to enjoy, for as long as they like. Their reasoning behind this, and differences between the full version can be seen [url=http://toxikk.com/newspost/upcoming-free-edition/]here[/url]. Bottom line, TOXIKK is [b]not[/b] F2P, and the free version will only have access to the [b]core[/b] experience. As an Early Access supporter (full version owner), I am perfectly satisfied with their decision to release a free version in order to help bolster the online community, spread awareness of the game, and ensure longevity of community support. If this fact isn‚Äôt enough to sway you into at least trying out the game, or if you are on the fence about purchasing the full version, feel free to read the rest of this review.

[h1]What to Expect[/h1]

Online multiplayer is, of course, supported offering classic deathmatch, team deathmatch, capture the cell, and area domination modes. A server browser helps you navigate custom, private, and public matches alongside a quick join feature. Game customization options include: mutators (Instagib!), # of combatants, score, time, etc. A single-player mode is also available for play, tasking you to complete contracts to advance your career.

There are no classes, loadouts, weapon carry limits, or health regeneration as seen in many modern FPSs. Going back to the good ol' days, every weapon or item must be picked up after the game starts (excluding a common starter pistol). As expected of an arena shooter, some of the types of weapons you will see include: automatic assault/sniper rifles, rocket launchers, plasma blasters/shooters, flamethrowers, and a razor blade thingy. Also, every weapon has a primary and secondary fire mode, effectively doubling the variance of gunplay.

Some maps offer the ability to operate futuristic vehicles, such as: an assault bomber, battle mech, 4x4 SUV, hoverbike, and hover jet. These vehicles are extremely satisfying to use, yet do not cause any major balance issues gameplay-wise. And don't be alarmed, it isn't that difficult to take down a vehicle, especially if multiple allies are helping.

[h1]The Arenas[/h1]

12 available maps, a few taking heavy inspiration from classic Doom and UT arenas, provide varied battlegrounds for you to wreak havoc. They each have so much style and themed scenery, ranging from: jungles, ancient Italian strongholds, Canadian Rocky Mountains, Cambodian temples, Bolivian Andes, sci-fi Chicago, Hong Kong slum districts, to a secret research facility in Moscow. In the same vein as the classic arena shooters, the map design tends to incorporate 3 levels (upper floors, ground, underground), multiple staging areas for hostile engagement, and various hidden/side-paths for flanking. Also, a native level editor is provided for use, and synchronization with Steam Workshop allows for the creation and sharing of amazing maps!

Standard arena shooting controls are utilized; however, advanced movement controls derived (with changes) from UT2K4's system are also implemented, including: WASD movement, jump/double jump, 4-directional dodging, crouch (avoid falling off edges), high elevator jumps, wall-dodges, slope jumps, and so much more depending on how well you can utilize the combinations of moves. I have seen some straight up high-tier Lucio movement going on, making me think that I was in the wrong game for a moment. These fluid combos are made possible by retaining velocity after jumps (unlike in UT2K4). If you seem to be lost in the wealth of information, or scared that everyone will be Spiderman'ing around you, worry not. There is a competent movement tutorial and everything will become second nature after a while.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

Going back to my previous statement that TOXIKK is without fault, I would definitely love to see a better UI. It is very minimalistic as is, and detracts from the futuristic sci-fi immersion that everything else manages to put forth. I also need to see bunny hopping servers (obstacle courses) to be able to finally replace UT as my go to arena shooter. But other than minor personal preferences, TOXIKK seems to be one of the best arena/twitch shooting experiences (multiplayer) that is currently released, especially on Steam. Until UT4 is released, which may be a very, very, long time, I can easily recommend fans of the classic shooter genre to tryout TOXIKK, at least the free version, and support the full version.

[table][tr][td][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/BeforeYouBuy]Before You Buy[/url] ‚Äì analyses of newly released indie games[/td][/tr][/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198077335356', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1473713219}
review:
Having played UT3 Black Edition, i really think this game feels like a complete rip off, and i felt like that from the moment i entered the menu for the first time. It's basically the same game, just worse. Worse animations, worse weapons, worse graphics, worse voice overlay, worse sounds. It has a slightly different customization that is more "neutral" and deeper than UT3, but that is about the only good thing i can find..
I mean it's sort of fun, and i did after all play my first match to the end.. But being an owner of UT3, i would say, if you want to spend money on a game like this, just better, then go for UT3. Else, i don't bame you for freeloading on TOXIKK.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995795249', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1473712389}
review:
My first negative review on steam, not that I was never dissapointed with a game before but this is a special case.

I actually really like these kind of games which is why I went ahead and supported it during early access, I'm a long time UT and Quake fan but what we have here is basically UT3 with UT2004 movement (which is easily achievable with mods) and way more boring weapons instead, non of them feel unique or original or too much fun to be honest.

I'm ok with games beeing spiritual successors to other games like Reflex is to CPMA - having the same wonderful gameplay and implementing modern features - but this is just not nearly as good of a game as UT3 for example, it doesn't even look much better, doesn't sound any better and sadly the active player base is also not much better than in this dead (yet great) game from 9 years ago.

Gameplay issues aside, as of version 1.0 the server browser is not really working too well and connecting to servers is problematic as well. Also you may sometimes not be able to join a server due to not being in the right "skill class" and I can't believe there's no server browser access mid match.

Also I find it a bit funny how a game with a trailer stating in big bold text "NO FREE TO PLAY" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B28oQvaL7Mg goes free to play...

And:
‚ÄúThe price for the full game will be higher than the current one, but if you buy the game in Early Access, you'll get the full game for free."

Yeah not really... And no compensation whatsoever was given for those who did pay more when buying the game during Early Access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283918989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1474678587}
review:
This game is an awesome reminder of what FPS games used to feel like. Run & gun, no crap to get in the way of that.

+ Great graphics
+ Great sound
+ Fun, even with bots
+ Workshop for maps
+ Weapons reminiscent of the old arena shooters
+ Simple (not necessarily easy) gameplay
+ Brings vehicles to the old arena feel
+ No loadouts/tiers - you get your weapons from the map... so everyone has the same resources
+ Carry all the weapons at once, weapon auto-pickup options/preferences, auto-switch to another weapon when you run out of ammo

Even if you didn't play games like Unreal Tournament or Quake back in the day, if you enjoy current FPS games or relatively recent FPS multiplayer like Halo, you will probably feel a bit refreshed stepping into a game like this. It's also much less expensive ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198019730955', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1473583750}
review:
[h1]Gameplay video vs Godlike (strongest) bots:[/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mujfFtqrro4
[b]TL;DR: the weapons are boring, and nothing kills a FPS more than boring weapons.[/b]

Hello, Unreal Tournament veteran here. I'm not necessarily recommending the game, I wish I could give it a neutral rating, but I definitively don't want to give it a bad review. 

Me and a couple guys from the UT forums jumped in and gave the Free Edition a try, see what it's like on high-level plays. This is one of the only afps games that imitates Unreal Tournament (more specifically UT2004) rather than Quake/CPMA.

The UT community has always been very fragmented, because each UT game is very different. If you liked UT2004, you will probably like this game, as it has dodge-jump in it - a feature that half the UT community likes, the other one doesn't. I happen to be the latter, but I won't go into detail why, [url=https://forums.epicgames.com/archive/index.php/t-551455.html]there's a 100+ page thread on the archived UT forums for that[/url]. Just like in UT2004, the problems with dodge-jump start showing here as well, once you start entering high-level play, and can handle Godlike bots. Admittedly, this game noticeably tries to do something to mitigate those problems, but it does come at the cost of weapon balance - the rocket launmcher in particular is outlandishly powerful and so are most of the hitscan weapons.

But that's not really the problem with weapons. I'm sure balance will change over time. The bigger problem is the lack of imagination. UT has flak cannon, which is many people's favorite waepon. This game has a regular double barreled shotgun, which is hitscan. UT has a minigun. This game has a regular assault rifle (which is quite OP). Of course there's at least one shining examples of fun weapons like the Stingray - a combination of plasma and shock rifle, but without the shock combo (what a shame). Then there's the outright weird one, which is the flamethrower - I really don't know how the mechanics behind its primary fire work. None of the weapons have a particularly interesting effect or mechanic behind them. Not even knockback/pull or any sort of combos, or movement lockdown, blocking... nothing.

Another thing to note is the vehicles seem very week. A little bit of spam from the stingray kills even the big mech. The vehicles seem to be loaded with firepower, but could really use a little bit more tankyness, [strike]especially since this game doesn't have a link gun to repair the vehicles.[/strike]
EDIT: apparently your #1 melee weapons alt-fire can repair vehicles and it costs suit energy.

I do like the invisibility ability! Such a wonderful revamp of the stupid Adrenaline system from UT2004. Your suit energy recharges slowly and you get to use that for a very limited invisibility, which does create some interesting comebacks! I love it.

I also like how in DM and TDM the enemies drop health packs on death! What a wonderful solution to the problem of always being low on health after every fight and all the nearby health pickups being on cooldown. It might not be a good idea for CTF, Domination and Duel, but it's sure as hell a welcome addition to DM/TDM.

I must also compliment the devs for their work on some of the maps. The mayan ruin/jungle themed maps are very good and visual clarity is very good on them. Lots of verticality and places to use wall-dodging :)

[i]NOTE: God save me from the bloom. The strong neon lighting on maps like Hong Kong is very distracting and on maps like ArtifactXL the team-colored lights around the bases make players meld with the background. The Capture The Flag gamemode has these shiny-ass cells instead of flags, which completely blind you when you look at the carrier. Turning off lightshafts does help with, but I wish there was a more elegant solution, because it does make the carrier less noticeable.[/i]

I am wishing the devs all the best and hopefully there will be some small ctf or duel tournaments in the near future. That would really help this game's reputation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145186196', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1431366896}
review:
This is the first game I ever bought on Steam, as I loved old arena shooters. I bought this in March 2015.

It is pretty unique and I respect the developers for finishing it and keeping with it, whereas most EA games never see the light of day. 

If you are simply curious, I would wait and use the Free edition. But if you like FPS or arena shooters in general, I definitely recommend it. Even 2 years ago on an R9 280 it ran great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986454273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1620910843}
review:
2023 review update:

If you enjoyed the Unreal Tournament games or similar arena shooters then you would enjoy this. Unfortunately the online player count collapsed years ago so really all that's left is bot matches. The bots are competent but if you buy now you should realise that bot matches are pretty much all that's left. Such a shame because Toxikk was / is streets ahead of the UT4 that was in development by Epic. I guess arena shooters simply aren't popular any more.


Old review:

If streamlined, fast paced, no-nonsense old-school UT-style FPS action is what you crave then look no further. The game very obviously wears it's Unreal Tournament heritage on its sleeve but that's no bad thing at all. In the current days of shallow, 10-part DLC COD games that are all the same as the last 15 COD / Battlefied games, Toxikk comes as a breath of fresh air.

The maps, though most are re-imagined UT maps, are beautifully rendered in full UT4 engine glory and are both well designed and nice to look at. Content is somewhat sparse at present but there's apparently much much more on the way.

This is the game that UT4 should have been. Very highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967630443', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1629563323}
review:
Full Disclosure: This game was given to me as a gift.

Toxikk is a completely unrealistic FPS and I've never been happier.  If you've been playing FPS online for the past 15 years or so you'll find this game is a great throwback.  However, it is also breathing some new life into the formula with some well thought out tweaks.  Weapons are familiar, but different enough to make the gameplay fresh.  The Classic maps and Steam workshop support make this title a worthy addition to any shooter junkie's collection.  I really look forward to Toxikk's final release to see what content additions the community makes to the game.

My ONLY complaint is the re-naming of the game types.  You need to familiarize with the new names of classic game types like Deathmatch and Team Deathmatch.  However, I can't say much else negative about the game other than the lack of players online at the present time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045360067', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1504300576}
review:
As soon as I saw the trailer for 1.0 - I knew I had to try this game. 

I spent some good hours on half life 2 deathmath and was desperate for some arena FPS again since I'm mainly playing Counter Strike GO right now. 

The game feels great! Weapons already seem senseful, graphics are overwhelming at this price point, even the cars which are part of some maps feel better than expected. Toxikk needs a bigger player base, but other than that I will definitly stick around. 

I can definitly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055629534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3482, 'last_played': 1622457405}
review:
I'd easily recommend this to any arena shooter fans. The game is gorgeous and all the guns and maps feel great. My favorite map is easily Foundation though. If you've played a lot of Unreal Tournament in your time, this game will feel right at home. Each weapon has an alternate fire mode, the maps are designed well, and the movement is this game is very fluid and you will get used to the mechanics quite fast. Do yourself a favor and buy this game now. This is amazing quality for an indie game and I hope to see this game flourish (Severe lack of players at the moment which really hurts this game as it deserves much better)

For a modern day arena shooter, I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978376136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1490745318}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021840203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1498707589}
review:
Well.. got 2 hours on the game, this is definitely a furious furball firefight. This is a very shoot and move type of game engine with liquid smooth graphics. I did not see any glitches or apparent bugs during game play. Good variety of weapons with no P2W crap, you get access to all the weapons immediately. Any ammo, mini-perks, health/armor fixes, etc.. are available to all players and they respawn every few seconds. The TDM maps are a bit small, some medium and large maps for those game modes would be good for bigger battles. Configurable boot camp mode with bots with different quality levels for the bots, adjustable numbers of bots, and most all games and game modes available. End result.. great game for the single and multiplayer FPS gamer.

Overall a fun game for FPS freaks and definitely better then some of the other FPS games out there.

Follow ups below.. scroll down for more! ;)

Thanks

review: Toxikk est un fps classique et c'est justement ce qui fait sa force, pas de classes, pas de loadout, pas de leveling, juste une ar√©ne et m√™me certaines de unreal tournament. Leur slogan "Frag like it 1999" est parfaitement adapt√©, ce jeu respecte parfaitement les r√©gles des fps arena de cette epoque (unreal tournament et quake pour les plus celebre). Pour moi ce jeu est un peu le sauveur du fps multijoueur qui a mon gout aujourd'hui est trop "mobatis√©" des classes voir des personnages, des loadout, des lvl, etc... Alors ca fait plaisir de retrouver l'excitation t'avoir un lance roquette rotatif entre les mains et de faire des frags que tu merite sans avoir payer de dlc, micro transaction ou parceque t'as plus de lvl ^^ Ce jeu, je vous le conseille vivement :) ceux qui ont jou√© a unreal tournament retrouverons leur marques facilement (dans la vid√©o c'est ma 3eme partie) Si vous voulez decouvrir ou retrouver les sensations vicerales d'un bon fps arena foncez ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064637940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4581, 'last_played': 1608209283}
review:
Toxikk is an amazing game. I love arena FPS games, and this fills a niche in my life that has been empty for ages - a polished, well constructed, balanced, (nearly) finished AFPS.
The maps play incredibly well, the weapons are (for the most part) very fun to play with and play against. There is a community of talented modders, all creating content for the game such as fun mutators and new maps.

There is little playerbase at the moment, however that is to be expected. It is, after all, in [u] early access [/u]. There has been no advertising done for the game whatsoever.
Definitely worth picking up if you're into fast paced FPS games. There will be a free trial at launch, so follow the game so you can see when it fully launches if you're unsure about buying it.

It is worth noting that I have had some crashing issues on certain maps, and it appears to be related to the Discord game overlay. If you use the overlay, [b] disable it, uninstall Discord, reinstall Discord, make sure it's [i] still [/i] disabled, and that should fix it. [/b]

There is also another issue with texture streaming. Often it causes crashes in the middle of a match, if not right at the start. Disable texture streaming completely, and that should fix it.
