author: {'steamid': '76561198004551307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1207, 'last_played': 1507495595}
review:
-Should you buy it if you like arena shooters?
Yes

-Should you pay 19bux for a early access alpha?
Considering what it is right now, yes.

-Are the servers packed with players?
No, not at the moment. Most servers only have 5-8 active players. It's still fun, but a few more wouldn't hurt.

[u]pro[/u]:
[list]
[*]fast paced, smooth gameplay
[*]requires good point-click aim
[*]INSTAGIB mode <3
[*]nice look
[*]ranking system for MM
[*]crosshair individually customizable for every gun
[*]no cheaters (yet)
[*]not P2W
[/list]
Basically what's in the About section.

[u]con[/u]:
[list]
[*]only a handfull of maps
[*]underpopulated servers
[*]no *friends* feature
[/list]
All in all minor stuff that can easily be fixed.


If you are unsure about buying it, go watch some (recent) gameplay footage and/or wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023352551', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1470710534}
review:
I suspect it will be in beta for a long time, given the lack of communication.  (The developers are apparently more active in the forums, but their actual updates over the steam news stream, where most people get their information, are less than helpful, when they could simply copy and paste patch notes into the news).

The game is fine in its current state, it's an arena shooter with health+armor powerups (plus a cloaking mechanism, which I personally disagree with but there's an option to disable it), a standard, nothing special variety of weapons (I'd argue that this point is a positive - they didn't try to reinvent the wheel), and a moderate number of maps.  No groundbreaking AI, which isn't unexpected - this is a primarily multiplayer game

What this game is missing in comparison to its competitors: maps, customization, community size
MAPS: There just aren't enough.  The ones that have been released are for the most part well designed, but they certainly don't shatter design conventions in their glory.  Steamworks is enabled, which isn't bad, but in my opinion inferior to developers "adopting" community maps for the sake of ease of use and a solid base.  There's still time
CUSTOMIZATION: Has been moved to a "progression" system.  Camo/color patterns, helmets, armor, even basic colors are now unlockables.  Unlocked through gameplay, yes, but this goes against the very idea of an arena shooter, in which all players start on an even playing field, or at least have no barriers to entry/enjoyment.  Putting armor/camo/even colors behind an unlock wall immediately breaks the "spirit" of the old school arena shooter, their explicitly stated goal, by encouraging appearance to be a show of power instead of personal preference.  This is really the biggest reason why I can't recommend this game: it promised a game free of the regular BS involved in modern shooter development, then went straight into the "let's put things behind an experience wall, that'll attract players 5 months into release!"

Overall, 7/10, a solid game, but buy a more established shooter instead and you'll get a larger online community, more maps that seem more varied than "2 lanes and 3 floors" (this is applicable to more than a few maps, though the ones that avoid it are great), and cosmetic options that don't punish new players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032751389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1407, 'last_played': 1560110618}
review:
I'm guessing that you, dear reader of this review, have played DOOM 2016 recently. You loved the fast-paced style of the game, how standing still meant certain death, and how every moment you were standing on a razor's edge between life and death. 

Then you booted up the multiplayer.

After that stellar dissapointment, I imagine that you're craving something more, something better. A game that put you on that razor's edge, where you must consistently tap the space bar, where you max out the FOV and the mouse sensitivity, and where you seek a monitor with a refresh rate that can keep up with the pace of the game.

Strap your seat in, because whether you find an active server, or simply up against bots, you're in for a wild, wild ride when you play TOXIKK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202028729', 'num_games_owned': 822, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1665089613}
review: Fantastic game! Reminds me of a lot of Quake. Amazing that you can play and customize bot matches with options such as instagib. The game is being updated frenquently enough that you feel that the devs care. Game is smooth, polished and controls really well. Already some workshop maps available including a Q2DM1 remake. Good stuff! Worth every penny!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048936444', 'num_games_owned': 1630, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1479823445}
review: It is really awesome, the viduals are nice, the guns feel good and the bots are very well done too, this is all you ever wanted from Unreal Tournament... but still, the game is not done yet and not too many people play the game ... I think what we need right know is the update, that adds the serverbrowser. With a serverbrowser, it doesnt matter that not that many people play the game because you can just find the servers with players on it... SERIOUSLY, give this game a try, playing with bots is as much fun as it is with humans( i played only with average skilled bots and they already knew how to sniper xD )

review:
Ich, Baujahr 83, habe die grosse √Ñra der Arena-FPS hautnah miterleben k√∂nnen. Anfangs mit einem Pentium II / 233Mhz MMX, 16MB Arbeitspeicher und einer Diamond 3dfx Karte bewaffnet, st√ºrzte ich mich in die Unreal Tournaments und Quake 3 Arena¬¥s dieser Welt!

ALSO...Ich behaupte ich habe Ahnung... :D

Toxikk tritt in die Fussstampfen der oben genannten Urv√§ter der klassischen Arenak√§mpfe. 
Was soll ich also sagen?
----------------------------
ES ROCKT!

Die Grafik ist geil!

Das Gameplay altbew√§hrt und die schnellen K√§mpfe machen super Laune! Das Feeling kommt genauso r√ºber wie im Slogan!!!
---------------
FRAG LIKE IT`S 1999
---------------
WOW!

Was Reakktor hier abliefert ist spitzenklasse! Haut mal Q3 und UT in einen Topf und r√ºhrt mal kr√§ftig durch! Bisschen Chili rein und fertig ist TOXIKK!!!

Einziges Manko sind die MP Partien! Aber nach 5-10 Minuten kriegt man n Match gegen andere Spieler zusammen. in der Zwischenzeit werden BOTS anstelle echter Spieler gesetzt. Also tun dem Spiel keinen Abruch!!!

Ich bin begeistert...

4,5 / 5 Punkten!

Tendenz ansteigend!

review:
Awesome graphics, runs smooth in 4K resolution with an r9 390. Not very many players online, however bot matches are very fun. There aren't very many maps but there are some cool ones in the Steam Workshop. The UI is very polished and the art is phenomenal.
Vehicle physics are arcade-like but fun and bouncy! If you like Unreal Tournament, you'll probably also like Toxikk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027781948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 19162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15051, 'last_played': 1588367853}
review:
Like Unreal Engine 3 and Quake 3 had a baby, more alive than UT3 and with cooler devs.

Even though Toxikk might not exactly be the most "active" game, everything in it screams "care" and shows that a lot of time and effort was put into it. The customization system is fun and interesting, and the game's modding potential is sky high and encouraged. Whether you're playing in a deathmatch game against bots or kicking back fragging your friends, Toxikk is always fun.

Mechs, hoverbikes, intricate and attractive armor design, Toxikk has it all. If you haven't picked it up yet, it may not be a $2 game, but the money that you put into that first and only purchase will definitely be worth it.

‚Ä¢ Weapon crates
‚Ä¢ Cosmetics
‚Ä¢ Pay to win
‚Ä¢ Pay to use multiplayer
‚Ä¢ Must buy gems to join online games

[i](Not really, but people seem to think this way)[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026295055', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1524617464}
review:
Imagine back to a time when games were still good, and imagine nice old arena shooters like Quake III or Unreal Tournament, but merge that with some of the most beautiful graphics you have ever seen and lots of customization and cool sci-fi weapons based off of original deathmatch weapons and no reloading. That's TOXIKK.

TOXIKK takes you back to those days in which there was an incredible amount of chaos, explosions and people dying everywhere, TONS of pickups, etc. It clashes old with new and brings the PERFECT balance between the two generations in which there are no breathers except intermissions between matches, and no standing still to aim to take your shot, just fire away.

The story goes like this : Drayos and Exocom are two giant companies battling for global domination. There, done, go, fight to the death. In the profile menu when you click on customization, you get a semi-wide variety of options. Pick which company you fight for (Which you can change at any time, they just have different variants of what your armor looks like) colors of your armor, the secondary color, and the color of the glowy lights on the armor even. Name tag in which it displays whatever you want on your armor, and you can change color of the text, too, and a clan tag, so if clans are your thing (Which they aren't for me) there ya go.

There is an experience ranking system like in modern day shooters which you can only earn from matches with real people, and not bots as common sense would dictate. That unlocks more colors, armor types, etc. and the maximum rank is 16.

The weapons are a heavy dosage of classic deathmatch kind of firearms and they have new names and a bit of backstory, too, and each weapon comes with a secondary fire.
Ravager : The Ravager was used as a demolition tool in the future to tear down buildings without having to rely on heavy wrecking gear, but it works great as a melee weapon in combat apparently as well. The drill is the primary fire and the secondary ignites a plasma flame based wielding beam that can only be useful at close range and can repair (Another subject I'll touch on) vehicles. Oh and ammo is non-existent.

Raven : Your everyday average pistol but with a cool sci-fi design. It's gonna be your bread-and-butter of the battlefield basically. Primary is a shot, secondary is a three round burst-fire but requires a short cool-down, which, in a game like this, is NOT handy, but it still can quickly kill, providing your aim is more than average. Holds up to fifty rounds.

Bullcraft : Shotgun! Useful only at close range of course, nice little pump-action tool to use, very handy in cramped maps or maps that don't really have huge open spaces meaning that there'll be more of a chance of close-quarters-combat scenarios to put it to good use. Primary, single shell, 6 pellets. Secondary, double shell, 12 (duh). Holds up to 24 shells, use them wisely.

Violator : Very reliable assault rifle for close, mid-range, MAYBE long-range combat, depending on where the hostile is located. Primary, FULLY AUTOMATIC ASSAULT BABY!!!!!!!!!!!!! Secondary, pump-action grenade launcher attachment. Holds 90 rounds, starts out with 30.

Falcon : A sniper-rifle. Not the most useful for clusterf**k arenas and stuff, but a not-so-populated server it serves pretty well. Primary, fires. Secondary, scope with 32x zoom. Comes with 9, but holds up to 30 "deep impact" rounds. Headshots cause instant death, the only thing to save you is just sheer player speed and dodging skills. Has a slow fire-rate.

Stingray : Plasma rifle! Basically an upgraded in all ways Violator. Primary, shoots blue plasma orbs at opponents. Secondary, Railgun like plasma beam that can really obliterate targets providing you hit them. Energy beam is hit-scan. 80 plasma rounds, or EDEN energy units if you will, comes with 40. Headshot with beam = instant death.

Dragoneer : Perfect weapon to fight off multiple opponents, for this my friends, is a flamethrower! Least glitchy flamethrower I've ever seen in a video game, so that's good. Good for close range encounters with players, and the primary fire is a ray of burning napalm, secondary is a charge-and-release napalm fireball that can travel over 50 meters, losing effectiveness over time of course before it completely dissolves. Holds 60 rounds of napalm, starts with 30.

Cerberus : 90s Deathmatch arena shooters would not be complete without a rocket launcher, and here is the grand-daddy! Shoulder-fired launcher with a silo magazine and "Hades" missiles. Primary, fires a rocket! Secondary, aiming reticle turns circular and laser sight turns on to guide the missile. Comes with 12 Hades missiles and holds up to 20. REMEMBER, AIM AT THE FEET. And there, now you're a pro rocket launcher!

Hellraiser, THE Hellraiser : Stays true to it's name, this megalith sized weapon is incredibly difficult to find and is rightfully so! Devastating amount of damage so much so, that I haven't found a safe spot to fire it from without killing myself! Primary, unguided death-struction sphere. Secondary, remote controlled sphere-missile projectile! Fueled by ONE Beryllium (Beryllium is a chemical element with symbol Be and atomic number 4. It is created through stellar nucleosynthesis and is a relatively rare element in the Universe. Beryl is a form of mineral made from beryllium and other elements and Emerald is actually a green colored form of Beryl and many other famous minerals. Sorry about the science-expo.) Fusion Gasificator. Obliterates just about...Life, the Universe, and Everything.

Some maps in TOXIKK feature vehicles such as :

Phantom : The PHANTOM is a medium sized assault bomber, excellently suited for providing air support to infantry units in difficult terrain. Vehicle type, assault bomber. Primary, Minigun. Secondary, unguided missiles. Special ability, maneuvers at high altitudes.

Demon : The DEMON is a heavily armored BATTLE MECH. It's not really fast, but can dodge, jump and even hover/fly utilizing its limited amount of boost energy. The DEMON's weaponry comes with two heavy miniguns and a multi-rocket launcher which launches up to eight missiles simultaneously. It's a devastating beast and confronting it on the battlefield shouldn't be taken on lightly. Vehicle type, battle mech. Primary, dual minigun. Secondary, multi-rocket launcher. Special ability, dodge, jump, hover/fly (Not so special to me).

Rhinoceros : The RHINO is a 4x4 powered high mobility vehicle for two passengers. Press [1] or [2] to switch between the driver and the gunner seat. Press [SPACE] while driving to activate its boost mode. While in boost mode, press [E] to eject from the Rhino and to initiate its self-destruction sequence. If there's a gunner aboard, he'll be ejected too. This way the Rhino can be used as a high-speed land torpedo to destroy heavy targets. Vehicle type : 4x4 high-mobility vehicle. Primary, plasma projectiles. Secondary, focused plasma beam. Special ability, Kamikaze torpedo/ boost mode.

Streamer :  The STREAMER is a very fast and highly strategic vehicle. Whenever you need to cover long distances, press [G] TO SPAWN A BIKE (keep in mind that the spawn requires your suit to be fully charged and the map to support vehicles). It's also good to know that THE STREAMER IS THE ONLY VEHICLE THAT YOU CAN USE WHILE CARRYING THE ENEMY'S ENERGY CELL. If this doesn't mean anything to you, ...you're not supposed to read this. Vehicle type, hoverbike. Primary, N/A. Secondary, N/A. Special ability, very fast/ can be spawned.

There's also the Banshee, but I'm running out of space! All in all, an excellent well-polished and made game. I feel like I made this review too long and all of you just skimmed through it. 9/10 The reason being the community is small and you mostly have to play with bots. Definitely worth your time if you like games like Quake II and Unreal Tournament.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057805390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1486091005}
review:
Even though I've played only a little bit in this game, I can tell by the mechanics and gameplay to say this is a great game. It's as the trailer says: no reloading, no cover system, no classes. 

My first geniune FPS I've ever played was Goldeneye 007 for the N64. The game is a classic and didn't have so many FPS standards we're so used to today. TOXIKK manages to bring the FPS genre back to basics, gameplay found more typical in '90s shooters a la Unreal Tournament and Doom, but in a way that's refreshing and just purely fun for this current decade.

My only gripe is that no one seems to play online compared to other FPS games. I might recommend making this game free-to-play to bring in more players, but that could cheapen the quality of this game. I'm hoping with the recent release of DOOM that arena shooters such as TOXIKK get more popular.

Overall, this game is quite good for Early Access and I'm quite excited to see where the game goes from here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115503354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 6516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6516, 'last_played': 1640133982}
review:
Arena FPS is arguably one of the hardest genres to bring back into the public eye. I have seen so many different attempts to bring it back in new flavors, whether that was Nexuiz to Unreal Tournament 3, and each time it is attempted it fails. It doesn't matter how hard the devs work, how much they listen to their playerbase, or how much they spend on marketing the game. AFPS simply cannot appeal to the average Zoomer, or even younger with the Fortnite generation. Toxikk was simply doomed to fail because it does not meet the criteria of mainstream gaming, and therefore it will always die regardless of how hard the devs work.

I made my previous review back in 2016, and now I wanted to see how well the game holds up on the precipice of 2022. 

Pros:

+ The weapons, albeit weirdly standard for an AFPS, are well balanced and have serviceable sound design. There is no point where the shotgun is useless, or the melee weapon is just there, everything serves a purpose and that is exactly how an AFPS should feel. An exception would be the rocket launcher, as despite how many nerfs have been done to that thing I can still easily dominate with it due to the absurdly abundant ammunition just everywhere. I feel the only thing really holding it back in any way is that its alt-fire is exclusively set to deal with vehicles.

+ This game tries to be different from other AFPS, and that includes a short stealth ability pressing Q that allows you to make a well timed get away when things are hairy, or enemy players dropping health packs when they die so you can continue the spree. Survival is highly encouraged in this game, so I gotta hand it to the devs in how they handled it without it being ridiculous or half baked.

+ With the exception of the Rhino, the vehicles are really fun to use with the mech being the most enjoyable of the 4. Whoever designed it did an amazing job, and I honestly would have enjoyed an entire game mode with them as the main focus.

+ The art design, while not anything spectacular, it's alright with maps having a nice level of detail to them. They're nice to look at and fun to play on which is not easy to pull off. Most of the maps are different enough that they never feel the same, with the exception of course being maps with day and night versions. The armor could certainly look better, but it's nothing hideous like Unreal Tournament 3's customization.

+ Music can range from 'meh' to actually pretty good. It's mostly dubstep wubs and generic ambient pieces with a few tracks featuring a nice electric guitar for combat. It's no Razorback, but it's solid.

Cons: 

- The map pool is just too small. Reakktor spent a lot of time and energy mostly trying to get the ship to float period, so content updates were already really sparse towards the end of Early Access, and practically non-existent after release. There are 4 DM/TDM style maps with only 2 large vehicle maps. Even if you really enjoy playing Toxikk this will get stale before you know it. There are Workshop maps, but don't expect new ones to be made unless you're willing to do it yourself, because the workshop is just dead.

- Speaking of dead, and this should come as no surprise to you, the online playerbase for this game is very small. If you're reading this review to play an AFPS then you should already be used to this. Even so, AFPS veterans chase away any potential new people by dominating them in every conceivable way, then write up a thread asking where are all the players at. If you are committed just create a friend group for AFPS, because that will be far more easier to accomplish than finding a match on your skill level.

- The bots are really dumb no matter what difficulty they are set on. On one hand they will get stuck on things or stand still in really awkward spots for a second, and then on the other they're perfectly landing every shot from 500 yards away with an assault rifle. I understand there's an expectation to play people instead of bots but jeez, there was plenty of time to fix this.

- The game still isn't well optimized. I've played a lot of Unreal Engine 3 games, and this isn't the best running one I have come across. I still can't explain why this happens despite all of my efforts, but whenever large explosions occur or I die the game drops frames and then comes back. It's not too big of a deal, but it's still annoying even with a gaming PC.

- Reakktor has cut their losses with this game, and I really can't say I blame them. It means no new content will ever appear for this game, but when I think back to the amount of effort these few guys put in to make sure the game was in peak condition only for it to amount to nothing, it's understandable the game is no longer supported. My only hope is that despite this game flopping nobody lost their jobs over this, because the developers did everything right on paper. Maybe this is another lesson of designing by committee going wrong, or perhaps it's just another example of why AFPS can never return in any successful capacity.

In summary I can only recommend the game if you have people on your skill level to play with, as with practically any game it's going to be better with friends. How long you play will be determined on how much you enjoy the gameplay and the microscopic pool of maps to play on. Only then can I really recommend the game. 

I'd say it would be worth buying Unreal Tournament 2004 over this, but I haven't seen that game go on sale in years ever since Epic decided they want to rule the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216757277', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1706559096}
review:
"No classes", but there's factions
"No leveling", but there's ranks
"No loadouts", but there's deployable hover bikes
"No regenerating health", but there's regenerating invisibility
"No iron sight aiming", but there's secondary fire

The only thing good about this game is the graphics. For a game that's "taking the arena fps back to it's roots": the movement speed is as slow as Halo, there's vehicles (including a jet), there's a periodically spawning super weapon that can blow up half the map, the pickup items are virtually impossible to distinguish, there's dodge jumping and double jumping, you can turn invisible for 5 seconds with a 10 second recharge. Also most importantly: There are no players online, it's emptier than reflex.

EDIT: I recently started playing again. It's a step in the right direction to make a free version to get more players. But the ranking system prevents players of different skill/experience from playing with each other. For a game this new, the player population is too low for this restriction and Toxikk will continue to suffer of low player base. I criticize this game for having vehicles and what do the devs do? They invent a new vehicle, good job. Let me also emphasize the item respawn times are ludicrously long, 15 seconds for a weapon to spawn really? Also 1 minute for mega health and heavy armor?? We might as well not have items on the map, especially since shotgun ammo, sniper ammo, and 25 health look practically identical. 

The ability to spawn hovor bikes is also another pointless additive just like the temporary stealth. Why does every FPS have to add these pointless additives for the sake of being unique or for the sake of adding "depth" and "strategy". If you're going to add these things, you might as well go all out and make it another class-based moba shooter, but please don't make an appeal to old-school shooters if you're going to add stealth, vehicles, and clumsy movement mechanics. 

This game lacks strafe jumping, lacks rocket jumping, lacks 144 hz performance. The only thing good about the game is the graphics. But a real "frag like it's 1999" type of player does not care about graphics. This game's graphics serves more to hinder player skill by having too much glare, too much detail (even on the lowest graphics settings) and not enough distinction between the pickup items.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049098821', 'num_games_owned': 1436, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1521319505}
review:
Halo and Advanced Warfare had an incredible baby that was forgotten about... This FPS game has the makings to be the best shooter around, unfortunately it seems nobody noticed this gem.

Toxikk has a pretty unique feature (As far as i'm aware) where you can ragdoll in order to trick your enemy into thinking your dead. This accompanied by the awesome level-design make this game very special amongst shooters, I have never found a shooter that feels this fluid and well-thought-out. The vehicles are also really cool, there is a vehicle ability thing where you can simply summon a bike to drive, it has a cool-down timer and can also be used as a very fun and interesting weapon!

Overall I would have to say this game has so so SO much potential, but there are no public servers for this game, so if you wanna play this game I recommend finding a big group of people to play with, if you decide you wanna give this game a try shoot me an invite to your game, I am always looking for more people to play this with!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964739687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1509924418}
review:
Great old-school arena shooter with weapons that all have their own strategies to be effective, twitch-timing and fast movement, lots of mutators, and a surprisingly lively playerbase--with one caveat.

You won't see other players until you spend a half hour or so in a server with a friend. Lobby-based games kinda killed server-lurking, and Toxikk requires some server-lurking to see it shine. Get a full 8v8 match with real people, and it turns into a freakin' gem.

It's still got some rough edges, and if you're expecting something with "modern weapon" values, you're best served to look elsewhere. Toxikk is tooled around spamming rockets, bullets, and not blinking for five minutes at a time. You'll probably see a lot of complaining about balance--but any player that remembers playing UT '99 when it was new will tell you that's a load. You'll see rockets, grenades, energy beams, shotgun blasts... and it's a riot. I nearly had an aneurism when I first read some of the threads cropping up about the rockets being OP--back in the day, you didn't get to tank three hits, you gibbed.

My only real complaint so far is limited to the Raven starting pistol. Don't bother with it--unlike the Enforcer of UT fame, the Raven is essentially there to keep heads from popping around a corner in time for you to snag a real weapon pickup; which is disappointing. Entire strategies existed for single and dual Enforcers, and I'd like to see the same come into this as well.

For an early access title, it's rather well assembled. The maps are pretty and hectic, with natural hotspots that gravitate players so you spend more time shooting and less time running, the weapons are cathartic and satisfying, and the play itself is quite satisfying when you rustle up three spare warm bodies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044403889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1539368690}
review:
I‚Äôve have been playing the Doom Beta looking to scratch that itch of true old school arena shooter, but ultimately it falls short. Doom has loadouts, damage marker indicator like borderlands, and burn cards like Titanfall. Doom seems to be a game with a bit of an identity crisis, it wants to attract the old school crowd without alienating new comers, I understand the thought process. But I feel it fall short of being stellar at either and with a $40 season pass just for the multiplayer I think I am going to ultimately pass on Doom, but we will see. 

After having that craving reignited I went online searching for a old school arena shooter an came across this GEM! The gameplay is rock solid, no loadouts, no burn cards, no iron sights, no bullshit! After playing the game for a hour or so I can see some holes in the armor, I can‚Äôt seem to easily host a private game with bots and mutators so my brother and I can play, we had to join an existing server and play normal rules. Another problem at the time of writing this is I didn‚Äôt see a lot of other players.

But you can play offline with like 16bots with a slew of awesome mutators. Something else to note is the game is still in early access and for $18 you really can‚Äôt go wrong. As I see it for I am going to save $80 and be able to play this game whenever I want because it is not dependent on a active player base. Bottom line is if you are looking for an old school arena shooter look no future, buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004017373', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1427834574}
review:
Game is great.

Are you amazing at Arena FPS games?

No, thinking "Yeah I'm pretty good at FPS games" isn't good enough.
Are you AMAZING at Arena FPS? Did you destroy people in Quake?
No?
Then be prepared to get destroyed.
When I played this, I was amazed at how fun the game was, but I was also soul crushed because everyone was so damn good at the game, that it made me feel like I didn't deserve to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017744567', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1708111161}
review: Even though at the time of this writing this game is Early Access - it is going to be a good old-style FPS arena shooter. I recommend getting the game now while it is cheaper, already functional, and to support the developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008925168', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1495050206}
review:
It's so good, and nobody plays online! Amazing!

Yes, It's difficult to get into a game with anyone actually populating servers, but this is intended, somewhat.

The games still in a phase where getting balance, feedback and testing is more important than marketing the game in it's current state. 

The sad part of all this is that the game is currently in a state where It's absolutely playable, enjoyable, but lacks any online fragging. It's been in EARLY ACCESS for quite a long time now, and yes, I do have more than 6 hours of playtime.

It should be coming to a close, and hopfully Reakktor can market this game out so we can finally get some fragging going up against actual players. (And with stable server connectivity)

So, question you must want an answer to, and that must be "Are the BOTS any good?" Yes, they are, and It's still fun to go off SOLO. 

This literally is an ARENA FPS, and while it doesn't do anything that revolutionizes the genre, it does great in what the team set out to do with TOXIKK, and that's to transport us back to 1999 (More like 2003) with better graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006295276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1459569242}
review:
Doesn't really deliver on what it promises. Or maybe it does, a little too much.

I'm sorry devs, I wanted to like your game. I purchased it to support you guys, but I just can't bring myself to enjoy it. I do hope you use this money to improve the game for other people.

Dodging is anemic, vehicles feel anemic, and weapons don't do much to differentiate themselves from one another.

It's a UT reskin in many ways.

Sure, some things are pretty, but even an ugly game can have good mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079319322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1626561204}
review:
As a fan of Unreal Tournament series since the first version I am extremely happy with Toxikk! This is true continuation of UT style (and not unintentional, obviously - lots of direct hints there, like the infamous Deck 16 map from original UT, which has been Deck 17 in UT2004 and simply Deck (18?) in UT3 is now Dekk 19 in Toxikk - and what a Dekk it is! It is probably even better than the original, which is barely possible). This is what we've been expecting (and didn't get) from UT3. It‚Äôs finally here!

But most important is that even if one disregards the whole UT franchise thing, Toxikk is a very good looking and very well performing (even at this pre-release stage) game, which is very fun to play. What more can you ask for? 

Well, perhaps a bit more content, but more on that later.

Just like UT, there are several game types, a variety of nice weapons which are fun to use and all have alternative fire modes, a vehicles with different specializations (including ground and aerial vehicles) and some with external seats for shooters besides driver. And the trademark ‚Äúmore moderate than Q3 but still faster than CoD/CS‚Äù game pace which I‚Äôve been missing so much since UT2004.

Besides that, the visuals in the game are stunning. Everything looks beautiful and professionally designed - weapons and projectiles, vehicles, maps (hell, Dekk maps is a work of art). The virtual world of Toxikk is a pleasure to be in even if you get your butt kicked by other players :-)

So again, I‚Äôm very happy with this game and I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more.

Regarding the content though: the sole notable downside of Toxikk is the lack of maps. There are just a handful at the moment, and only one that has vehicles (Twin Peaks). 

Also somewhat notable is lack of vehicles (there's scorpion cross hellbender with UT3 style eject+self-destruct (which is total fun) but hellbender style weaponry, there's a raptor cross cicada thing, and there's some manta-like hover tank, but that's it - no tanks or other slow heavy vehicles) and game types (I know Last Man Standing is soon to come, along with some Duel whatever it is - but no Assault, which is a pity - it was a true highlight of UT, and most sad - no Onslaught, which is a best game type and true highlight of UT2004 IMO). 

But I expect more content to be there at the release and some more to arrive later - as DLCs perhaps, and of course some third party content from workshop. There are already some third-party maps in the workshop, and they are very good (an absolutely amazing version of Grendelkeep for Toxikk, a very stylishly Borderlands like looking Novus map, and a smaller space massacre FusionKKore map, which is clearly inspired by UT'99 DM-Fractal - well, not directly but by it‚Äôs UT2004 version DM-Gael, which author did mention in comments). So I‚Äôm not getting any points off Toxikk for that, because I expect this issue to go away eventually.

And thus final verdict is - 10/10. Get it. Now. The 4-pack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072593255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2153, 'last_played': 1492871543}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024983186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1485462802}

If to be short - this game is exacly how the new Unreal Tourname should've been...and not that community/Epic Games bullshit that is being currently developed...
U can easily take this game to Epic and say - this is what people loved, love and will love in arena FPS genre!

review: Honestly, don't listen to any of the reviews that state this game is good. It is absolute garbage. My friends and I bought the game in a four pack pre-release and the dev couldn't even get their forums working properly. People would IM me asking me to play the game with them and I had no way to respond because the option simply wasn't there.  Then once the game actually opened  a year or more later it was so dull no one wanted to play it. This was a complete waste of time and money for me. If you choose to buy it, it will most likely be a waste of time and money for you too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161018648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1626920441}
review:
I really really really really really really really really really wanted this game to be better than UT4, but it is stilll a bit buggy, and UT4 is free and runs on a newer engine. It's difficult to compete with established arena shooters, especially when the ideas and gameplay arent exactly original. This is not to say that this isnt a great game, the graphics are great, as are the weapons, and so is the gameplay. It's just that it plays like a clone of UT3, with slightly different weapons.  I would have expected to see this on a place like Mod DB and not Steam.

 I am glad I gave this a shot, if anything I think its worth the money just for the few custom maps and to experiment with the new weapons. I dont think this is an end all replacement of established arena shooters, but I do think it is a fun game that is different enough to play if you get tired of others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002096070', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 54943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 37, 'playtime_at_review': 18406, 'last_played': 1711777783}
review:
You know that part in an action movie where the protagonist barges into a warehouse only to be greeted by a hail of bullets and manages to escape unscathed after single handily killing everyone inside?  You think to yourself "Bullsh!t...That's so unrealistic."  Well, that's what it's like to play an arena FPS and it better fukking feel that way!

Toxikk is the damned finest AFPS to be released in well over a decade. With a perfected, silky smooth movement model akin to that of Unreal Tournament 2004 and a set of 9 skillfull and rewarding weapons to use, this is the type of game your dad would play when he was done laying your mom.

Seriously, if you long for the days of adrenaline pumping, heart pounding, non-stop action gameplay in the likes of Unreal Tournament and Quake, look no further-- Toxikk is the game you've been waiting for.

Now go FRAG LIKE IT'S 1999!‚Ñ¢

review: UT and Quake 3 had a child and it kicks asses! A no BS fast paced classic shooter, where only skill (and possibly a good connection) matters! As said in other reviews, it needs new players, so come and see! Wether you're nostalgic or tired of modern FPS, it's definitely refreshing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083831496', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1491132455}
review:
Very nice gameplay and visuals.
The game feels smooth and runs very smooth. It's got wonderfully fast and "back to the roots" gameplay, no leveling, no grinding and nothing that might distract you from the actual experience of the game. The one and only reason for playing it is the gun action itself. (Unlike a lot of other modern shooters which kind of are transforming into RPGs, not that that's bad, mind you, but that are not simply shooters anymore)
The one downside is that currently there are not many players around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023631416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1474975475}
review:
toxik doesn't look quite as good to me as unreal tournament 3 and it doesn't play nearly as well either. it looks okay a glance but the trade-off's they have made here for performance are mostly in the textures and there isn't any of the fancy stuff that makes modern games look superior to ur3. let's face it, you can only do so much to make ur3 look good amongst games on the newer engines but i think we've seen ur3 engine games that look better than this although most of them aren't twitch arena shooters. nexuiz, which is on cryengine, performs and looks much better than toxik and it plays better and it appears that nexuiz are about to make a comeback on steam. nexuiz might be a better option for this gameplay style if they start selling it again. but none of these indies are going to touch unreal tournament 4 in terms of graphics and gameplay. if you're going to play a game like toxik, you may as well be playing ut 3 because the ai are superior and toxik's player base probably isn't much bigger than ut3's. the ai in toxik ranges from unstoppable to bumping into the walls but there is really isn't much in between and that's on the "average" difficulty setting. also, i rarely find myself able to make a one-hit-kill with the rocket launcher. yet, if a bot should shoot a rocket anywhere in the vicinity of a player, the player invariably goes down instantly from 100% health. sniper rifles also appear to take up to three hits to kill a bot while they are one-hit-kills in the hands of a bot. i'd like to know how that worked out. that's not a challenge, it's a punishment. also, you can't pick the team you want to be on, even playing solo with bots. i have always played on the blue team in every ut game to this point but toxik doesn't see fit to allow the player this choice. additionally and probably the most annoying of the annoyances in toxik and nexuiz too, is that you can't issue orders to your ai team-mates, the bots can't be controlled in any way. in case you didn't know, in all the ut games you can have squads of bots and give each squad different orders. yes, you heard me right, the bots do not take commands in toxik as they do in ut3, they just do whatever they want, which is ridiculous, considering they are built-in to the engine.

i continue to give this game chances to prove itself but as others have said, there isn't much point in the existence of this game and it certainly isn't worth the price they are charging for it. i guess they are trying to cash-in on the nostalgia angle but as i said, this has all been done before and been done better and the genre itself continues to fail. the new generation of gamers don't appear to be too interested in this type of shooter and the older generation is getting too slow to play this type of game competitively. if the bots were worth a damn, i'd probably play with them and maybe even a couple of my friends but since the ai isn't worth a damn, i guess i'm just not interested and i don't see any real reason for anyone else to be interested. i'm afraid toxik may be too little, too late to do anything to revive this genre, i think those days may be gone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052223743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 56510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2780, 'last_played': 1691649191}
review:
If you enjoyed Unreal Tournament 2003/4 (or any other arena styled FPS games in general) then there is no reason whatsoever why you shouldn't love this game. It looks great, runs great, sounds great, and most importantly, is very fun. 
However, there is an issue.
The multiplayer community seems to be pretty much dead right now. So, don't expect too much (if anything) from the multiplayer. 
"Why then should I buy this game if the multiplayer is as dead as you say it is?" - You may ask. Well, tbh, it's up to you to decide. For me, I love the gameplay that much that I am willing to wait it out for when this game eventually reaches content complete status. 
It is somewhat expensive for a game that doesn't have much content, or any active players, but the thought of what this game could become is worth every single cent. 
Buy it, you'll see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045056189', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1582330098}
review:
Hey! Do you like old arena shooters and think, "They just don't make them like they used to"? Then give Toxikk a try!

Still in very early access as of this review, Toxikk is a pretty damn solid arena shooter in the stylings of Unreal Tournament and Quake, and celebrates itself as one with all the polish of a next-generation game. It prioritizes the importance of a responsive, enjoyable gunplay and does it in spades, with a very fun arsenal of weapons, each with their own functions and purpose. The balancing is overall handled very solidly, and does enough to not just clone the arsenals of it's source materials and be unique in that regard.

It's also a very visually good-looking game so far. Again, very early access, but they really make some good-looking character models and environments that are not only bright and colorful, but look really fantastic amid all the havoc.

If I had to be critical about something, it'd be that the game does celebrate the late 90's/early 2000's era of arena shooters, but it makes me think more of something like Unreal Tournament 3 as opposed to the original of 1999. Maybe it's just the modern aesthetic, and in some ways this is to it's benefit, but I do feel it tries too hard the style of something like UT99, but being much closer to UT3 in terms of style and aesthetic.

Regardless of my minor nitpicks, this game is definitely worth a look if you're a shooter guru looking for something new to try. Updates come out fairly regularly, and they're definitely doing a good job so far with the game's quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981569520', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1451855582}

author: {'steamid': '76561198108658021', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1451678145}
review:
I really don't want to give Toxikk a bad review. The game itself is a ton of fun, don't get me wrong. Despite what my playtime implies, I haven't had this much fun with a multiplayer shooter in a long time. The problem is that the playerbase is super low. I thought it might have just been a dead time of day, but take a look at the game's activity charts. There's very few people playing this game, and that's a very bad thing for a game meant to be multiplayer-only. I didn't buy a multiplayer-only game just for botmatches.

Maybe this game will get popular once it leaves early access, who knows. But for now, it's not worth it...it's a whole lot of fun, but there's nobody to play with.

Asetuksia ei tarvitse paljon muokata sill√§ melkein kaikki on automaattisesti asetettu j√§rkeviin oletusarvoihin hiiren herkkyytt√§, kiihtyvyytt√§ ja liikesumennosta lukuunottamatta. author: {'steamid': '76561197968884996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1538989049}
review:
THe twitch shooter is one of my favorite genres. One that seems to be difficult to get right these days despite unreal and quake perfecting it so long ago. Toxikk however gets it right.

Beautiful and varied arenas, interesting and fun to use weapons, great pacing and a decent sound track to frag to.
There is seems to be only one thing lacking. Players.  The servers usually have a miniscual player count that tempoarily  booms when a new update is release. 
Not the fault of the devs but without a decent player base the game might not last long once it hits full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966596234', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1604437762}
review:
FRAG LIKE ITS 99! 

Best arena shooter on steam.
This game is early access!
So there are not that many players online yet.
Subscribe to the steam group so you get information when the developer announces tournaments and specials.

Every friday there is a weekly fragfest.
Make sure to be online ;)

Also the bots are very challenging too.
I hope it gets well known in future - cause TOXIKK deserves it!

Cheers m/

review: It's a great game. Technically my first arena shooter which is a style back when games were about fun and not made solely for money. Great game and I love the shift to dodge rather than double tap like older arena games because double tapping never triggers fast enough to feel reliable. Only thing this game is missing is an announcer, and a bigger player base, but that's why you should be the one to buy it to help it grow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046371069', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1472836492}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996862422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1457800353}
review:
This game would be incredible if people played it. Unfortunately I bought into the product thinking there would be some community. There is, in fact, no community. The community is dead. D-E-A-D. Dead. 

I genuinely feel this is a solid product but even I as the developer would cease supporting it (and god have mercy on the souls of the developers that do) without any current players.

Granted the game isn't ACTUALLY released yet; as is scheduled for Early Access, the fact nobody is playing the game should not stop the developers from completing the product and giving it an official release. 

The null quantity of players now should not be indicative of what the product has the potential to be - since you can't really stipulate a 'currently active playerbase' within reason to an Early Access game (because it's a game which isn't released yet). For that reason only I give TOXIKK a positive review (it's unfair to give a negative review to a product which isn't released yet based on its early access playerbase, since you shouldn't really say a game has a playerbase at all until it's released).

But god knows how long that will be, if at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990511580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1424911700}
review:
I've played a lot of sick twisted games in my day, but this is the only game where before being allowed to use online functionality I was required to sign a legal document dissavowing my faith in our lord Jesus Christ. Maybe that kind of thing is fashionable in Seattle or Spain but not in the heartland of the good old US of A. We should build a wall around the middle part of the US of A before Donald Trump's wall traps us in here with all the hippies in California.

The gunplay was well crafted and playtested extensively.

review:
Too few players, really! This game has really good potential.

This feels so much like Quake. Insta gib mutator was fun :)

I so much wish to see map tools and workshop for this.

... But for now, it really need more active players maybe some events could help? Well, if developer could throw insane sale to get lot's of active players. If devs could get more players to play this, maybe there would be more sales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021973523', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1474402363}
review:
They got me on the tag-line "frag like it's 1999!".

After 16 years of q3a, been looking for a "modern" take on fps arenas. I loved Nexuiz, but the game just died. I liked Reflex, but it felt a bit too slow. By pure chance, I've read about TOXIKK today at Nexuiz forums and it turned out to be fresh blood for me. Sticks to the roots, expands cleverly. Design is solid. Music gets you moving. Capture mod feels like Quake on a Halo map (which strangely feels good, even though I'm not a big fan of the Halo series).

The only downside is the low player count. The game is still in Early Access and I hope the player count will get better with the release, because I want this game to be my new Quake.

P.S: It's on Unreal Engine and as usual, it runs and looks smooth even on a crappy laptop.


TL;DR: if at one point of your life, you played quake and/or unreal until your eyes hurt, or fragged people on a 33.6kbps dial-up modem, you should buy this. at least for old times' sake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018885292', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1445716470}
review:
I recommend this game, hesitently for now, and for the simple reason of the servers being completely dead. Maybe once every 1-2 hours, you will find a full server but most of the time when I searched, I found only servers with 1-2 people.

Great game, but the lack of content and the lack of players makes the game hard to endorse. Still, I recommend at least watching the game as the game itself is a freaking blast and is fun as hell to play. As the trailer says, there's no bullshit. If the game had workshop support for more map and gamemode variety and the playerbase was larger, this game would consume so many hours of my life.

Now that went back to it, i can say the game is really good, and looks awesome, but the problem is, there's no players. author: {'steamid': '76561198047294457', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1473898726}
review: The closest you will get to a modern take on old school arena FPSs like Halo 1&2, Unreal Tournament, and Quake. A fantastic game that isn't bogged down in creating annoying character loadouts, cover systems, and other nonsense that comes bundled with modern military style shooters. I can't wait for this game to gain publicity as all it needs is a stronger player base.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074268229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1492525061}
review:
TO DEVELOPERS,
SHORT STORY, 4 SHITS OUT OF 8 =  FOUR TITS ON A TATE.

LONG STORY:

 please, I urge you to head my advice, never either; make pc only games, make pay to play pc games with microtransactions, make old genration remakes in a modern fps fashion with no one to play with and lastly, make a game and only use steam greenligt as an 'ad' if you can even call grrenlight an ad host.

game's solid, good for my specs and lower to quite a degree.
fun bots, only i can't tell if they are good ai or not its hektic to play
no reload, i flipping love this for no realod!

cons:
lacks developer love, yes you read this correctly fellas the devs (and im sorry to say) even with the short time i played and regardless of it being early access, there is no excuse for the lack of content in this game, the low demand for a game such as this one is detremental to the devs unless they stand out. they didn't. as soon as i got on i went it was blurry, too much contrast, too light/ dark at times the ai was choppy and just lacked generic attention to detail.

no one is playing. nuff said no ads to support you and no reason not to make one, you have the budget.

even if i could play online regularly, its boring and bots are silly if this game doesn't have a campaign hear me out M'k?
this game is not baad because the bots are not content driven, i am a player who if i can't play online, I would want some story here and there, maybe a quest of some sort or just level based stuff, MAYBE even back story for god's sake as to why this game is blue v red (TF2) and why this game is doesn't have a wave mode

I know the devs won't listen or might not even look at my comment but devs, i aint got anything against you its just the guy i am and the things i play and the way i want to play them just don't fit with another shooter based on online capabilities. if this game was f2p gr8 but you stated no plans for that as you don't want many microtransactions i get thet but there isn't a need to charge 19.99 dollars for a game not worth 5 and there is no denial

I WILL ADMIT IT IS GORGEOUS THOUGH BUT NOT ENOUGH TO SEE OR DO OTHER THAN COLLECT GUNS, KILL OR BE KILLED, RESPAWN WITH A PISTOL AND SAW, RINSE REPEAT

long story at an end devs you know what you need to do i really wanna play this game but at its current state its almost impossible for me, boring and tedious. tf2 is not that much different other than map events and jump pads thats about it. Literally.

well guys have a good one

review: This game is awesome, all it needs is more active player base. I havent played lots of quake apart from the singleplayer or UT, or other classic arena shooters. But i have played tons of halo and now i have realised that halo was a very good console adaption of arena shooting, with everything slowed down gave more time to aim with controllers. Toxikk is a litlle like halo on amphetamines, and i love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215921892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1673373088}
review:
Extremely well-made Arena Shooter with a lot of potential

If the gameplay of this game looks like UT2004 to you, that¬¥s because it¬¥s really similar. It feels quite different, though.
I believe that with enough support, the devs will find ways to differentiate it more from its competitors.

The gameplay is really solid, fast and fun and the graphics appealing.
If you have 19 disposable Euros, they are well-invested in this still growing project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044297332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1433197233}
review: A great throwback to the early FPS arena style games. Played during early access, there were certainly some hiccups with networking and multiplayer interaction, but I assume all will be ironed out come launch. If you're looking for a not-so-deep, traditional shooter that can take your mind off of things, look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996084211', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1667916247}
review:
This game is freakin' awesome. Imagine Unreal Tournament 2004 with modern graphics. 

Too bad it has no players.

And by no players I mean literally ZERO players. The servers are a ghost town.

For that reason I cannot recommend this game unless you feel like playing bots or you're going to LAN with your friends.

Honestly, the developers should pull the game off Steam in its current state and re-launch once they have more content and they're prepared for a massive marketing campaign.

I hope the full release of this game comes with a good marketing campaign because I'd love this game to do well.

I will update this review once the game comes out of early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987560471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1565205901}
review:
Excellent FPS rapide et bourrin comme du temps d'Unreal Tournament. 
La DA est plaisante avec des maps et des armes bien vari√©es (malgr√© le statut beta du jeu). 
Les missions sont, certes, classiques pour l'instant mais il est possible d'agr√©menter le tout avec pas mal de mutators bien fendarts.
Sont seul gros d√©faut reste l'absence de joueurs sur les serveurs en ligne. Ce qui fait t√¢che pour un jeu multi, reste qu'on peut coller des bots pour compenser le manque de joueurs en Deathmatch (Mais pour les autres modes qui n√©cessite de la coop les bots sont juste bon √† n'√™tre que des bots).
J'esp√®re que la sortie du stade beta ram√®nera des joueurs sur les serveurs pour plus qu'un soir!

Je le recommande tout de m√™me car √ßa reste un bon FPS avec un feeling bien pos√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036442639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1469373242}
review:
SE SIETE INTERESSATI A FAR NASCERE IL GIOCO, compratelo senza esitazione:
il gioco √® un ottimo FPS Arena, molto fluido e ben programmato, con una giusta quantit√† di armi tutto sommato diversificate (a parte il fatto che il secondary fire dello Stingray √® la tipica Railgun, che si sovrappone al cecchino, che ha come unico vantaggio la possibilit√† di mirare), poche mappe (√® sempre un gioco in sviluppo) ben disegnate, possibilit√† di doppio salto e scatto direzionabile. Fino a qui, nulla di diverso da quanto gi√† √® scritto sulle altre recensioni. 

Per quel che riguarda la community ('quale?' si potrebbe obiettare), il mio parere √® che un gioco Indie in Early Access avr√† sempre problemi iniziali di creazione della community, se nessuno se la sente di essere "il primo" a comprare il gioco ed immedesimarsi nella fondazione della Community, sar√† sempre destinato ad essere qualle che ora (quasi) √®: un gioco morto.  Detto questo, io ho comprato il gioco ben consapevole del problema sopra descritto, ma fiducioso che tramite pi√π mezzi, ovvero: gruppi di Steam, pagine Facebook (spesso indicate nei commenti della pagina Facebook ufficiale del gioco), forum ufficiale e perch√® no? un paio di amici al seguito, si possa essere in grado di creare qualcosa di buono. Il gioco gi√† con un numero di circa 4/5 players √® spettacolare (nelle modalit√† deathmatch e squad DM), mentre nella modalit√† pi√π grande (CTF) servirebbero un minimo di 6/8 player. Faccio notare che gli sviluppatori hanno indicato come giorno settimanale il venerd√¨ (in Europa all'orario delle 20.00) come orario di "appuntamento" per tutti i giocatori, per potersi trovare in un unico orario.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017971510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1500399393}
review:
Love this game. Plays homage to the classic ARENA shooters that defined the genre. If you love Arena shooters, you'll love TOXIKK. 
As much as I love the competitive feel with SC/Rankings etc - I wish it was easier to play with friends who aren't in my SC ranking, so perhaps a custom lobby of "casual" mode to play with friends?

Now.. there's a minor issue that I don't believe will be addressed any time soon, but I hope OCE Servers will come out eventually. I backed this game soon after it was first released into Early Access - there was no playerbase and I just played against bots. I still loved the game, but now that there's a playerbase I love it a ton more!
My only slight gripe is that 100% of these servers are NA/EU so I have a massive ping dis-advantage yet I've been holding my self quite well against others who have 50 to lower ping. Hopefully as the playerbase grows, so does the OCE community - I have a few friends I try to play with every now and then but it's hard as they're on the free version and I have the bought version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114468050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1447184546}

Update: Can we get a reload button please I don't think I have played a shooter that I couldn't reload on except Quake, the games speed is a bit too fast for competitive play, also I would like to see some hand grenades in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997628741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1526142414}
review:
The two biggest complaints that this game seems to have are these:
1. no one on the public servers.
2. minimal amount of content.

Both of these are accurate assessments at this juncture (release 0.89, 22 Sep 2015). However, this game has two very poignant counterarguments:

1. It's *stable*, and the content is *polished*. The game has never crashed on me, and even with the settings basically-maxxed out, it runs butter smooth on my laptop (core i7, 16GB RAM, SSD, GeForce 965M). There are only a handful of maps, but they load nicely, look great, make sense, and I've never run into a geometry issue or other annoyance.
2. LAN. This game actually works over a LAN. This is something that so few games have these days, which annoys me, because I love getting together with my friends and having a frag fest in the same room.


I'll also add a few other minor nitpicks:
1. Weapon balance could stand a bit of tweaking. The default gun is about as effective as a marshmallow launcher, while the rocket launcher will kill basically anyone in one shot, even with a whole-lot-of-health. Similarly, health power-ups are very sparsely littered around most of the maps, so death is near-constant.
2. The AI could use a bit of improvement. Playing against bots seems to go from "they'll run in highly predictable patterns, never capture the flag, and ignore your existence when you're shooting them" to "you'll never make it five steps out of the base before you get killed with a headshot from halfway across the map".
3. Vehicle maps aren't yet optimized. Most of them are extremely large, taking a long time to traverse. The land vehicles have some handling issues, and getting from one side of the map to the other takes a while on foot, due to the lack of a translocator or hoverboard kind of mechanic to help speed things along.

None of my nitpicks are actual show stoppers, if you're an Unreal Tournament fan (especially the underrated UT3, which is unsurprising given Toxikk's use of the engine), you'll feel right at home in this game that seems to take the tenets of the UT series (clearly its inspiration) and give it an overhaul in all the right places. I look forward to the forthcoming content and system optimizations, but even with its handful of maps and modifiers, it's worth the asking price - especially if you're looking for a game that supports LAN play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071029382', 'num_games_owned': 2229, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1701897307}
review:
I really like this game. I'm a  big fan of the UT series, & it may show my naivete to the genre here (I'm not sure if I'm really a 'serious' gamer, just someone who loves gaming & has been doing it since like '93-'94), but this game feels like some sweet expansion of UT3. That's not a bad thing at all. I can't wait for the game to get some more levels etc., but it's definitely on its way & I can tell the devs really care about the community (which I really hope blossoms, because the mods etc. will be wild).
If you like games like UT3, at least grab it while it's on special - I think it deserves that hand up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086883260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1635092445}
review:
PROS:

*Ragdoll physics are better than Halo's
*Mutators (Good old classic mutators, cheats if you will.)
*Bots are intelligent (Can drive vehicles, pick up weapons, capture cells etc...)
*Only four maps atm. But they are making more
*Powerups
*Guns are balanced and there is quite a variety
*Vehicles are boss
*Sound effects are pretty decent
*Music is okay
*Gamemodes (Cell Capture, Bloodlust, Squad Assault) English translation: (Capture The Flag, FFA, TDM)
*Ammo and health is not hard to come by so you can easily recover from a battle and still be able to fight.
*Character customization (Armor colors and faction)
*No lag (The only other EA game that I can match performance-wise with this is Killing Floor 2)
*Artstyle and scenery is great
*Enhanced player mobility (Double jumps, strafes, etc...)
* No pesky reload, just one giant clip
*You can fake your own death (Pressing F makes your character go ragdoll, this can be really useful for situations)
*Player has a built in active camoflauge (If ragdoll doesn't work, try this)

Cons:
* Low population (But you can fix that if you get off your ass and buy the game.)

Don't take any offense in that I was just joking around xD. Straight to the point, its a good game and it deserves more notice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014905381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1473549327}
review:
Toxikk is the game I have been waiting 8 years for.  

[h1]Pros[/h1]   
[list] 
[*]Back to the glory days
For those that weren't say...born yet, in 1999, the arena FPS might actually be a bit of an alien concept to you.  

No regenerating health, no reloading, guns floating around on the maps, no cover-based combat, no progression, no OP level-restricted guns, and none of that killstreak nonsense.

Double jumping, directional dodging, wall dodging, fast gameplay, varied weapons, and motherfucking Redeemer 2.0! 

[*] Great Optimization 

[*]Devs that actually care 

[*]Sound assets are excellent

[*]Exciting weaponry - Finally, alternate fires are back!
Also, it's about damn time FPS characters found their backpacks that can store 10 weapons at once.

[*]Mod Support! 
[/list]


[h1]Cons[/h1]
As much as I'd love to say Toxikk is a flawless game, it's not. 
It has its issues. But, it's early access, it shouldn't be a surprise (I just wish some of the negative reviewers would realise that)
[list]   

[*]Playerbase is small (for now)

[*]Bot AI can be quite silly
Especially common on CTF maps. They'll take the flying vehicles, fly them to the nearest open area, then spin around in circles until they are shot down

Thankfully, nothing gamebreaking.

[*]Few maps  

[*]No announcer
If only there were some aspiring modders willing to bring back the glorious [b]Double Kill![/b], [b]Headshot![/b], [b]GODLIKE[/b] etc. etc.  
Hinthint.
[/list]

If you are, or ever have been, a fan of arena FPS, you are doing yourself a disservice by not buying this.  
If you feel like the slower gameplay of CoD and Battlefield are getting a bit dull, you are doing yourself a disservice by not buying this. 
If you do not own Toxikk, you are doing yourself a disservice by not buying this.

Please guys, buy this game. There aren't many devs out there this deserving of your hard earned $, and any arena FPS fan will want to see this game strive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035340075', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1474208329}
review:
TOXIKK - "[...], czyli ubo≈ºszy Unreal Tournament 3." - powiedzia≈Ç piszƒÖcy tƒô recenzjƒô gracz.

    Gra o kt√≥rej m√≥wi siƒô, ≈ºe jest klonem ≈õwietnego Unreal Tournament 3, kt√≥ry swojƒÖ drogƒÖ jest troszke s≈Çabszy od UT2004 czyli swojego starszego brata, co moje sentymenty chwyta i nie daje o sobie zapomnieƒá, lecz recenzja ta nie ma na celu wychwalania kultowej serii UT ( ...kt√≥ra jest ≈õwietna ;P ), a ma za zadanie wyostrzyƒá walory tej gry aby gracz, co pakuje siƒô w tƒÖ grƒô m√≥g≈Ç wiedzieƒá czym siƒô ubrudzi.

   TOXIKK uwa≈ºam za grƒô dobrƒÖ, lecz dobrƒÖ z tego powodu, ≈ºe jest tak jakby klonem UT3, oraz dobrƒÖ dla kogo≈õ kto z seriƒÖ Unreal Tournament nie mia≈Ç jeszcze do czynienia ( Serio !? SƒÑ TACY !?!? ). Wspomniana gra zosta≈Ça oparta o silnik Unreal Engine 3, czyli ten sam co posiada UT3, oraz inne gry. Szata graficzna wzglƒôdem swojego ang. Brother from another mother - pl. Brata z innej matki, r√≥≈ºni siƒô lekko bardziej podkrƒôconymi kolorami i lekko lepszymi teksturami, oraz ≈õwietnymi odbiciom ≈õwiat≈Ça, czyli kr√≥tko m√≥wiƒÖc o grafice w TOXIKK " jest podobna do UT3 " ( lecz troche lepsza ).

   Mechanik gry i grywalno≈õƒá to praktycznie to samo co widzieli≈õmy w UT3, czyli dynamiczne starcia, ≈õwietne bronie, oraz przepiƒôkne lokacje itd. kr√≥tko m√≥wiƒÖc/piszƒÖc bomba ! Wzglƒôdem UT3 jeden z tryb√≥w r√≥≈ºni siƒô w TOXIKK i to bardzo, a mowa tu o hybrydzie Capture The Flag z Samochodami ( pamiƒôtny tryb "Assault" z UT3 ) czyli "Catch A Power Cell", jest on...no niezbyt udany...wrƒôcz g≈Çupi..., dlaczego ? no dlatego ≈ºe jak biegniemy ze wspomnianym "Power Cell'em" to szansa na to ≈ºe dobiegniesz z nim jest jak 1 - 10 000, a przy akopaniamencie koleg√≥w to ju≈º jakie≈õ 1 - 10 lub 1 - 20... manewrowanie postaciƒÖ nie zbyt pomaga aby uniknƒÖƒá kul itp. co wystrzeliwujƒÖ do ciebie oponƒôci, a pociski w tej grze raczej nie uznajƒÖ grawitacji, a ich zasiƒôg jest ogromny wiƒôc szansa trafienia czego≈õ w ciebie jest nader wysoka. Og√≥lnie tryb jest o ty≈Çek pot≈Çuc. Reszta tej gry jest dobra, gra dzia≈Ça piƒôknie, bez ≈ºadnych spadk√≥w FPS, du≈ºo opcji w tym modyfikowanie celownika, kolork√≥w na zbroi, nazwy na zbroi, markeru po trafieniu w przeciwnika itd., ≈õredni jest patent z energiƒÖ kt√≥ra daje nam mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá niewidzialno≈õci na kr√≥tki czas, oraz w trybie "C.A.P.C" zespawnowanie czego≈õ na wz√≥r latajƒÖcego motocykla bez k√≥≈Ç. Rankingi itp. wystƒôpujƒÖ w grze lecz sƒÖ "standardowe", czyli nic w nich unikatowego.

   PodsumowywujƒÖc, gra TOXIKK jest dobrƒÖ grƒÖ dla kogo≈õ kto lubi szybkie i dynamiczne rozgrywki, oraz kto cieszy siƒô z wyzwa≈Ñ jakie postawiajƒÖ mu gry i nie szybko siƒô poddajƒô.

Ocena: 8/10

Plusy:

+ Podobna do UT3
+ ≈Åadna grafika i krajobrazy
+ Dynamiczna i szybka gra
+ Fajny Soundtrack

Minusy:

- Tryb "Catch a Power Cell"
- niezbyt dobry patent z energiƒÖ
- puste serwery...

review:
C'est dommage de voir un aussi bon jeu d√©sert√© par tout le monde, les mises √† jour arrivent en temps et en heure vis √† vis du planning d√©veloppeur, le fun est l√†, tout est pr√©sent pour en faire un jeu √©normissime. Sauf les joueurs... 

 je suppose que beaucoup fuient le online parce que, il faut l'avouer, quand vous n'avez que rarement jou√© √† Unreal Tournament, les trois quarts des joueurs que vous affrontez vous bottent tellement le cul que vous vous dites imm√©diatement "je vais jouer contre des bots pour progresser".

 Mais apr√®s vous √™tre entra√Æn√©s contre des bots vous y reviendrez, et on vous bottera encore une fois tellement le cul que vous choisirez vite fait entre aller pleurer dans les jupes √† maman en mangeant des chips, et vous dire que ce n'est juste pas un jeu pour vous. C'est dommage, √† force de pleurer, j'ai plus de chips. 

C'est vraiment navrant parce que le jeu vaut vraiment le coup... Donc je vais simplement envisager que des potes finiront par l'acheter quand il sera en promotion et qu'on se fera des parties ensemble de temps en temps jusqu'√† ce qu'ils finissent par me botter le cul et que je doive racheter des chips.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961612938', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1486955775}
review:
My former positive review is below this one. Honestly, I feel robbed. I BOUGHT the game for full price and started playing the second it was inititally released in Alpha. The playerbase was pretty strong and I convinced my friends to shell out the money to buy it. Then the player base started to dwindle and the Devs said they were waiting on marketing it until everything was finished. Then, when it was finished, they made it free... so the the three of us really just burned our money on a game we hardly were able to play and then became free. I had said it was an investment and it was - a poor one.



The game is Early Access and the Devs are doing things right. 

With that being said, do I think they should not have published to STEAM yet and just sent out Alpha or Beta downloads? Yes. I'm afraid the negative reviews due only to lack of players will offset the recommendation for when the game is released. And this is a great game. The servers used to be packed. 

Are the servers empty? Yes. However, the devs are constantly active on the forum and don't want to market the game until they feel it's ready. This isn't other Early Access titles where the devs release a crappy game and vanish with your money. This game is ready to play but has limited maps. The devs are active and answer questions not only daily but HOURLY. During the last release it was a matter of minutes and seconds.

Really, in its current state, the game is an investment. Buy now at the $19USD and play it when it is finished and there is a higher playerbase. Or wait and pay what may be $50, because that's what the game is worth - that's what any other publisher would charge for this game in its completion.  Don't expect to purchase the game now and begin fraggin immediately. I know that sucks, I really do, but it is what it is.

It's up to you.
