author: {'steamid': '76561198079455287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1519462359}
review:
UPDATED REVIEW:


A lot has happened since my last review of the game. Here's a quick list of some points about the current state of the game:


What I like:

+Promising customization, with lots of options in terms of crosshairs and some interesting armor pieces. Could use more armor, but it's coming along nicely.

+Map variety is coming along nicely

+Game looks nice for unreal 3, and has some real quality work put into it.

+Gameplay is solid and fun.

+Offline with bots is an amazing feature that you don't really see in many games anymore.

What I don't like:

-P,layercount is still low. But it's rising. I think more people really owe it to themselves to play this very well polished and fun arena shooter. 

-New armor unlock tree is tedious. I don't think anyone enjoys grinding for cosmetics. If the game is good, and it is, it should automatically create replay value without the need for XP grinding. This is something games like battlefield and COD don't understand, but classic arena shooters always knew. If you want unlockable cosmetics, make them tied to contracts or achievements. 

-Game has some odd optimization on newer maps. Could use some more polishing for smoother gameplay on low-medium range hardware, as well as higher end rigs like mine. It's odd to see an unreal 3 game chug along at 40 fps at times on an expensive rig with settings turned down.

What I want to see:

*More music options. Seriously, give your musical artist a raise. You've done wonders with the soundtrack.

*More Armor sets.


Once again, a big thank you to the devs. Great job thus far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212832624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 17031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15899, 'last_played': 1625775102}
review:
Das Genre der Arena-Shooter ist leider nahezu ausgestorben, doch mit dem Titel TOXIKK m√∂chte das deutsche Studio Reakktor des Genre wieder neu aufleben lassen.

TOXIKK ist ein Arena-Shooter im Stile von Klassikern wie Unreal Tournament oder Quake. Wer der Meinung ist, dass Dinge wie Klassen, ein Levelsystem, automatische Heilen, ein Deckungssystem oder das Zielen √ºber Kimme und Korn nichts in einem Online-Shooter zu suchen haben, ist hier genau richtig! Stattdessen ballern sich hier bis zu 16 Spieler Rakten- und Laser-Geschosse um die Ohren und Eigenschaften wie Reflexe und Treffsicherheit sind hier gefragt! Wie in den Genreklassikern auch, hat TOXIKK ein hohes Tempo, wir k√∂nnen Sprungfelder benutzen und unsere Gesundheit und R√ºstung mit Items steigern. Zudem verf√ºgt jede Waffe auch √ºber zwei verschiedene Schussfunktionen.

Der Umfang der Alpha-Version l√§sst aktuell leider noch zu W√ºnschen √ºbrig, denn lediglich eine Map und zwei Spielmodi sind enthalten. Daf√ºr kann man sich immerhin einen Eindruck von den Waffen machen und sich wahlweise mit bis zu acht Spielern oder KI-Bots packende Schussgefechte liefern. Technisch l√§uft TOXIKK schon jetzt ziemlich stabil und nennenswerte Bugs sind mir noch nicht aufgefallen. Dank dem Einsatz der neuesten Unreal-Engine sieht das Spiel wirklich super aus und verspr√ºht auch einen ordentlichen UT-Charme. Zudem sind die Hardware-Anforderungen sehr fair, denn auf sogar auf meiner etwas √§lteren Kise l√§uft das Spiel in den h√∂chsten Einstellungen.

Ganz klar: Die Entwickler m√ºssen und werden in Sachen Umfang deutlich nachlegen. Die Fertiggestellung des Spiels ist f√ºr den Mai 2015 geplant und bis dahin soll TOXIKK immerhin acht verschiedene Maps, sieben Spielmodi und neun Waffen enthalten. W√ºnschenswert w√§re eine Workshop-Unterst√ºtzung, damit die Community mehr Maps nachlegen kann. Der Trailer hat auch angedeutet, dass sp√§ter sogar Fahrzeuge den Weg ins Spiel finden. Darauf bin ich sehr gespannt!


[h1]Fazit:[/h1]

Eine Anschaffung von TOXIKK lohnt sich aktuell eigentlich nur, wenn man die Entwicklung des Spiels finanziell unterst√ºtzen oder schon mal einen Eindruck von dem wirklich guten Gameplay erhalten will. Rein inhaltlich bekommt man mit nur einer Map und zwei Spielmodi aber zu wenig geboten, damit sich die knapp 20 Euro rechtfertigen. Trotzdem kann man jetzt eigentlich schon sicher sagen, dass euch ein verdammt guter Arena-Shooter erwarten wird, der bei Unreal Tournament- oder Quake-Fans f√ºr Begeisterung sorgen d√ºrfte. Hier kann man endlich wieder wie in den 90ern ballern!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136415470', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1598616520}
review:
Heres a run down of why you should love TOXIKK Updated since ginger build

1. This game is sick with Stunning visuals even on the lower settings, as well as the smooth welll though out maps. 
2. It has slick, smooth controls for mouse/keyboard aswell as for a 360 controller... what omg a pc gammer using a controller for shame...  don't judge guys maybe sometimes i like to lay on the bed or sofa and play or play away from home on my laptop where a track pad mouse dont cut it ny ways i rant
3. Its got bots with levels of difficulty so if your not the best you can practice on lower settings and ramp it up when your getting better.
4. Cheaper then main stream shooters like call of duty and battlefield. 
5. Reminds me of halo. 
6. Its still growing to be a great game cant wait to see the finished product :)
7. When it is released we wont be all grrr about bugs like BF4 as it will balanced and set up right :)
8. new game mode area domination
9. instagib settings and other mutators 
10. kustome kontent make your own maps yes finaly we can have loads of cool UE maps to make already alot of maps have been made shame a few of them are the usual same old UT and quake remakes witch is fine id just rather see more original not remakes. 
11. 2 new maps 

DEKK

Dekk Looks amazing with its scifi tech theme with is neon blue lights in the wide corridors aswell as a little arena down the bottom  where theres a watery thing that kills you dont get me wrong by the corridoors theyr big enougth there are many bridges leading to higher ground  aswell as the hell raiser wepon is back and in this map you can rack aload of kills if timed right  its also smooth flowing with areas to control
this has to be my favriot map :) of all time 

Castello 
it looks like a old medivel town that has had fututreistic expansions built around it its quit fun to play 
just feels out of place for the game 

there are other fixes and things added but thos are the best :)

Now for the only down side its got a small player base.

But i do encourage you to buy this game for all the Reasons above 
not for the negative as its a great game at heart and deserves a chance to become the next best arena shooter :)

hope this has been helpful if you wana play just add me and let me know that you wana play toxikk

review:
This geame is incredibly well done. It looks great and runs well on PC. Its a mix of UT and Halo style of maps.
Unfortunately there are not enough players right now and devs have to focus hard on getting players after EA. Players wont come by themselfs and I am not sure devs are prepared for that.
I can see this game to be great game for casuals and esport alike, but it all depends if devs can gather good and large enough community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141853940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1474079881}
review:
Nobody plays online (The game is in early access, so i'll give it some time), but the bots are very well made and deliver a good challange!

The weapons are for the most part balanced, the rocket launcher is VERY powerful, Mostly because it has so much ammo. The pistol is a joke, but other than that it seems good to me.

The overall gameplay is pretty solid as well, it reminds me of quake and UT3.

7/10. Playing with bots is fun, but I just wish more people played online in its current state. Can't wait for the full release!

author: {'steamid': '76561198125543834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1435066838}
review:
[b][i]Poor mans Unreal Tournament with little to no innovation[/i][/b]

Before writing this review I was asking myself "If I would clone a good game on the same engine, then remove most of the content and add a bit of my own similar content, would it still be a good game?" - Heall yeah it would be. But I still wouldn't recommend it, because there is the original out there with way more content.
In that regard I feel this review might be a little unfair, because objectivly TOXIKK is not a bad game and is targeted on fans of classic arena shooters, which don't need much innovation in the first place. But since here we have basically none, I don't really see the point of investing into this game.

[h1]Gorgeous graphics[/h1]
Being based on the Unreal Engine, this game looks really great. It surpasses modern standards and runs fluently on halfway decent PCs. I would definetely call this game the best looking arena shooter at this point.

[h1]Godly AI[/h1]
Another thing this game makes good use of from the Unreal Engine is the great AI, which results in very smart behavior of the bots. Even though currently there are barely any multiplayer games going on, as this game is not really popular, it is not a big deal because you can practice just fine with bots and have fun with them.

[h1]Lack of content[/h1]
At this point there are only a couple of maps with just 3 modes: Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch and some sort of Capture the "Flag" on bigger maps with vehicles. And apart from that there is really nothing you can do. That is rather poor.

[h1]Lack of innovation[/h1]
While the description of the game claims "fresh ideas", I haven't really found anything that makes this game unique compared to other arena shooters. This is the game's biggest problem. A simple arena shooter is nice, but without something that makes it stand out from the crowd, this game won't get far.

[b]All in all[/b] I don't recommend this game to anybody who is not into arena shooters, since there is nothing special to see here. Arena-FPS fans might consider it, but should wait for more content first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059476713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1497952527}
review: While I thoroughly enjoy the mechanics and the in the action feel of the game, I feel that the game is lacking in the user base. Its hard to have a multiplayer exclusive game when the is literally hours where no one is online, and I feel it is because the hype for the game isn't there for the price it is at. I honestly feel if there was a larger community and demand for the game it would be a fair price, but with no one playing the game, it should go on sale at least 50% off, untill there is a larger group of people playing it to drive interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012530909', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1424646417}
review:
As much as it is beautiful in terms of graphics (That's UE4 for you) and plays great like UT99 but in the course of 5 or so months the game still severely lacks players and available servers (See http://steamcharts.com/app/324810 ). Lack of marketing = Lack of players = lack of servers = lack of community.

If nothing is about this, this game will die a slow, painful death. Invest a little in marketing and it should help a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021906881', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1474755198}
review:
Das Spiel ist wirklich empfehlenswert. Erinnert auf jeden Fall stark an Unreal Tournament vom Gameplay her. Wer einfach nur direkt losspielen will, ohne gro√ü leveln und Waffen freischalten zu m√ºssen und auf schnelles Gameplay mag, ist hier auf jeden Fall richtig.
Die Auswahl an Maps ist zum Zeitpunkt des Reviews zwar noch nicht gro√ü, allerdings kann man dies von einem Early Access Titel auch nicht direkt erwarten. Das Spiel l√§uft allerdings absolut fl√ºssig und lagfrei und die Grafik ist wirklich gut. Auch die Maps selbst sind gut gestaltet.
Es gibt im Moment 3 Gamemodes: ein CTF Modus sowie ein Deathmatch und ein Squad Deathmath. F√ºr CTF gibt es zudem eigene Maps. Die Waffen sind zudem relativ gut ausgeglichen, gleiches gilt auch f√ºr die Fahrzeuge, welche es derzeit nur im CTF Modus gibt. Im CTF Modus machen diese aufgrund der teilweise recht gro√üen Maps allerdings auch Sinn.
Gut finde ich die schon relativ umfangreichen M√∂glichkeiten der Zielvorgaben (Kills, Spielzeit usw) sowie den LAN Modus, welchen ich bisher jedoch noch nicht testen konnte. Letzterer fehlt leider in den meisten aktuellen Titeln.

Die Voreinstellung der Steuerung ist am Anfang etwas gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig, l√§sst sich allerdings anpassen.

Im Gegensatz zu bisherigen Bewertungen, dass kaum Spieler online spielen w√ºrden, bin ich in den ersten paar Spielstunden unerwarteterweise relativ vielen Spielern begegnet, die in unser Spiel dazugekommen sind. Es gibt auch genug Server, welchen man direkt beitreten und direkt loslegen kann.
Es ist zudem auch M√∂glich, ein Spiel direkt im Spiel selbst zu hosten, hierf√ºr m√ºssen allerdings vermutlich derzeit Ports freigegeben werden oder der LAN Modus √ºber Hamachi genutzt werden.

Alles in allem bin ich von dem Early Access zu Toxikk positiv √ºberrascht, nachdem ich bei anderen Spielen hier auch schon schlechte Erfahrungen gemacht habe und es auch ein paar schlechte Bewertungen gab, welche sich allerdings als nicht zutreffend erwiesen. (zB die Sache mit dem "keiner spielt es", was f√ºr ein Early Access nichtmal allzu ungew√∂hnlich sein d√ºrfte).

Ich sehe f√ºr dieses Spiel durchaus potential. Vor allem f√ºr LAN Parties und Clans einen Blick wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065744985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1562264005}
review:
[b]DE:[/b] Toxikk ist ein grundsolider Arena-Shooter wie Unreal Tournament es seinerzeit war. Wer hier stehenbleibt oder campt, der ist schnell auf verlorenem Posten und wird von den Gegnern √ºberollt.

Optisch setzt der Titel auf die Unreal-Engine und macht einen polierten Eindruck mit sowohl abwechslungsreichen als auch von der Gr√∂√üe gut abgestimmten Arenen. Sound und Musik passen sehr gut zum schnellen Pacing des Spiels und lenken nicht unn√∂tig ab.

Derzeit noch im Early Access, soll das Spiel noch um diverse Maps und Spiel-Modi erweitert werden.

Wer schonmal Unreal Tournament gespielt und gemocht hat, der findet sich auch mit der Steuerung sehr schnell zurecht. Die Waffen haben alle einen alternativen Feuermodus und mit der "Hellfire" hat es auch einen Unreal-Redeemer im Angebot. Somit ist die Tag-Line des Spiels nicht zu unrecht "Frag like it's 1999" und wer Arena-Shooter mag, sollte sp√§testens bei einem Sale hier zuschlagen.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]EN:[/b] Toxikk is a rock-solid arena shooter, like it was Unreal Tournament back in it's days. Who stands still or camps, will quickly loose the battle and get's overrun by his opponents.

Visually, Toxikk looks well and polished in the Unreal Engine. The maps are both visually and in size diversified and well balanced. Sound and music are properly subtle and always fit the pacing of the game.

Right now, while in Early Access, the game will be extended by various maps and game-modes.

Whoever played and liked Unreal Tournament will fastly adapt the controls. All weapons have a secondary fire mode and with the "Hellfire" there is even an Unreal Redeemer. So the tag-line "Frag like it's 1999" isn't there for nothing. Everyone who like arena shooters should get this one, especially when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988755391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1691001992}
review: Toxikk ist ein Arenashooter ganz im Stil von Unreal Tournament. Ein Blick zur√ºck ins Jahr 1999 nur in sch√∂ner Grafik. Das Spiel zeichnet genau wie Unreal Tournament sehr schnelles Gameplay aus. Schnelle Reflexe und "Mapcontrol" sind der Schl√ºssel zum Sieg. Jeder der Unreal Tournament mochte sollte zumindestens einen Blick riskieren. Ich kann das Spiel auf jeden Fall guten Gewissens weiterempfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986922743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1434933345}
review:
Very smooth, fast paced, highly polished, great graphics. This game is frantic and action packed. The bots are fantastic, and if you crank them up they'll offer a really good challenge. I've played this game solo and co-op with my buddy and we had a great time. The team deathmatch is fun, and then there's a capture the flag mode on a huge map with rivers, vehicles, mountains, and bridges. We had the bots turned up one notch above the middle and it took us quite a while to finally score. It actually ended up being a bot on our team that finally brought the flag home but we helped it get back to base.

Wow, what a blast! If you're looking for a great old-school action FPS with health, armor, and weapon pickups, vehicles, and bots so you can play solo or co-op, this is a great choice.

review: Seems like a fun game, crashes immediately when trying to enter a match. None of the solutions fix the crashing issue, just another game that is unplayable that needed more QA testing before launch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961176056', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1707336778}
review:
A mix between Unreal Tournament and Quake 3, Love it!
Solid mechanics, movement,  levels, weapons and AI.

Needs more maps and players, current playerbase is very low.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998395031', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1536116022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035393318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1437274702}
review:
Had high hopes for this arena FPS. The developers talked the talk but couldn't walk the walk. It was dead on arrival and had zero chance.

Gameplay and aesthetics were great, but nothing more to look at.

3/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999172019', 'num_games_owned': 1642, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1474000978}

author: {'steamid': '76561198134303897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1434586804}
review:
If you're looking for a fast paced arena shooter, you're in the right place.

Pros: 
unique and fun to play
fast paced and action packed combat
bot battles are avaliable (and fun to play)
lazers

Cons:
not a huge player base yet
cant find many games online... yet
i'm not good at arena shooters and i die alot (but that's my problem)

all in all, when you can find a game, it's super fun. When you can't find a game take out your frustration on the bots

author: {'steamid': '76561198161243410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1477677744}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122683953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1463752756}
review:
What can I say? Best. game. ever.
No, seriously. I absolutly recommend to buy this game.
It has only one downside: The small playerbase. But even playing against bots is fun.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197992185866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1492322065}
review: This is worth the full price. This is how multiplayer FPSs should be. This is also how all Early Access Games should be. A game that should be teaching other developers what they are doing wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073801696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1475189919}
review:
Listen up you little pukes. Stop playing those bullshite candy kong hide and seek shooters and play this game.

Call of Duty has turned you into a slow baby turtle and you need to have all that bs fragged out of you.

This game is fast, fluid, and purely competitive. Old fans of Quake will enjoy thoroughly. 

We know those guys who went and had babies and wives.... PATHETIC! Buy them all copies of this game, set up a LAN and watch them slowly destroy their own lives.

If any game is going to bring arena FPS back to the forefront my money is on TOXIKK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035598838', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1436425355}
review:
The sequal to Unreal Tournament 3 that we never got.

i love it. i love the fact that i can mess with my hitmarker sounds, along with my crosshairs.
getting to put a black (any color) outline on my crosshairs really help me in game keeping a tack of where everything is. it has everything i love aboout unreal, while stilling haveing some new thing, mostly just new looks but it brings a good feel to the game.

only down side i can see right now is lack of maps, however more are planed to come.

so with all and all i would give the game an 7/10 in its current state. when more maps are added, i may rate it 8-9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198140315703', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1527319909}
review: As far as asthetics goes, its the closest it comes to Destiny on PC. However, the gameplay is can be compared better to Quake or Unreal Tournament as it is quite chaotic. not a lot of features, but thats the way its suppose to be so it isnt as gimmicky and thats fitting for it. it also has a great gamemode featuring vehicles and an extremely fun to drive star-wars like speeder that you can summon at will. bullets and projectiles take time to reach the target which is nice

author: {'steamid': '76561197972295127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1480881648}
review: I wish I would've gotten this game sooner. The gameplay is exactly like described, no bullshit ADS or CoF bloom, perfect accuracy, it all comes down to the skill of the player. Fast paced action like in the legendary Quake and Unreal Tournament games but with 2k15 graphics. The gameplay is good, graphics are good, maps are absolutely stunning, ragdoll physics are fun as balls. 10/10 game, nothing bad I can say about it. One more thing, even though it's early access, this game has fewer bugs than some "polished beta" or fully released games, take a moment to appreciate the fine work the developers have done. 11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054485168', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1454258524}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035729944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1434540831}
review: If you loved UNREAL Tournament games you will truly enjoy this title. Beautiful graphics, fast action, great selection of weapons and while anyone can play there is definitely a lot of strategy to be deployed. Very impressive game. I recommend you give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069589875', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1434422859}
review: Good game. Needs more players.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993866401', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1434590256}
review:
This is a great game. I really hope more people give it a chance. 0 learning curve for me, personally, you can just hop right in and frag. Nostalgia-fest with fantastic gameplay. Definitely one of the few Early access games worth supporting!


Heads up: There is an EXTREMELY small player base right now. I'm hoping this will change, but anyone interested in playing needs to understand this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025391808', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1530832201}
review: I've had my eyes on this game for a while now, and since it was discounted I finally bought it. I haven't put a lot of time into thsi game, but I've already enjoyed it. I reminded me of the original UT where my college buddies would play over a LAN and yell down the hallway at each other while playing. Obviously the yelling at my friends while playing isn't present, but the gameplay is, and I'm sure I'll continue to have a blast. A must purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001724694', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1575933857}
review: i HOPE THE COMMUNITY GROWS

author: {'steamid': '76561197962962568', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1439024478}
review: Great game but needs more people online to play with. I don't want to say avoid it but it needs people online, but I don't want you to buy it and no be able to play since no one is online. Classic Chicken or the Egg Conundrum

author: {'steamid': '76561198014871571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1434412538}
review:
unfortunately at this pont some major things come to mind: 

Level design is claustrophobic at best, confusing at worst
The weapons are entirely uninspired.  I have never seen a game with so many variants of the assault rifle. 
There is not enough ammo
Weapons fully obscure your vision upon selection (really, even the pistol?)
Tries to clone the unreal feel but misses some of the main philosophy. 

I was looking forward to a lot of things from this game but I don't think it will ever release, they've barely put out a couple maps in the last few months and I doubt that even if this releases it will stand up to any competition.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983252002', 'num_games_owned': 1037, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1433088344}
review:
Avoid this game by all means!

First thing- nobody's playing it.

Second thing:

They don't give one about players. (Almost) Any critique get's shut down, removed and banned. (Usually, see last post in the threads, for wisest developer answers ever, such as, why would you play an unfinished game? It's unfinished, stop saying that people don't play it!)

http://steamcommunity.com/app/324810/discussions/0/617335934143545687/

For example. So they're saying that being concerned with the developer actions has nothing to do with the game. I love it.

http://steamcommunity.com/app/324810/discussions/0/611703999965041818/

http://steamcommunity.com/app/324810/discussions/0/617335934125994144/

"So, calling Toxikk "dead" before it's fully released, before famous YouTubers have reviewed it... actually, before we have spend a SINGLE CENT on advertisement... is just ignorance or trolling. You choose. ;) " - Quote from one of the developers, Sharkster.

Yup, they even insult other developers and Early Access games there, saying, their's better. Great PR. -2nd link, last post in 3rd part of the thread.

Yeah. I also whined about the game being dead and having lots of bugs. I got banned and scared with a lawsuit.

Don't buy it. Horrible developer. There's only 1 active man from the team that you can talk to, nobody else, that's unacceptable.

Now the game:

The description lies to you:

1. No matchmaking system.

2. No skill system (it's so broken it's not even existant).

3. Most unbalanced game of the year.

4. Small maps full of corridors.

5. Does not feel like any game from 1999-2004. It's a clone of UT3, runs on same engine, uses same assets (not all of course, different people have different opinions about the usage. From opinions I got it's between 20-40%).

6. The devloper was supposed to release the game in 2014, almost no shops (checked all known shops from my country, most of them have the release date on 2014, so at least in here) besides steam were informed, even the team that actually makes, and has a major effect on the production:
http://schwiezer.com/project/toxikk/ -yup, they got the idea, release date is still 2014. -UPDATE: They have updated it to 2015 now.  OLD: http://pl.tinypic.com/r/1roz9l/8

7. Community will alienate you immediately- even if you're polite, if you don't dislike the game, get ready to be made fun of, harassed and stalked. If you made a video on it, they will downvote all your videos - with full approval from the developers of course (it seems so)- why they'd remove links from their forums to downvote and harass you in any way? No, asking to remove links and settle this won't help.

8. If you're not a super hardcore arena FPS player you won't be able to get on higher levels and grab most powerups - you will get obliterated.

9. Maps are made for controlling a particular area, usually that has a rocket launcher. Area's give alot of advantage versus any other player (RL, super armor, megahealth can be found in close proximities on some maps, to rocket launcher, which also leads to high, advatage areas on the map that usually have 1 or 2 entrances).

10. Mouse acceleration is on by default. I don't remember that in my early Arena FPS shooters.

11. Prepare for massive lags/ping.

12. You need a good PC to run it. Even then you will have framerate drops.

13. No levelling? Why I have levels in the game then?!

14. No F2P stuff?? How about skins, you know, the thing that F2P games live on? Oh yeh, we've got these!


After reading the description and playing this game for a bit, then uncovering most informations, this game seems like a scam to me. I got my money stolen, I got cheated on and scammed for non-existant features and (in my opinion) false advertising, golden hypocrisy and misleading information were applied in order to make me pay for it.

They've tried to scare me with lawsuits for defending Your wallets. That kind of behaviour from a developer is unacceptable, especially when all critique is being taken as trolling and they start to insult other players before banning them.

I've warned you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077333774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1434331029}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025010641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1497924724}
review:
READ A LOT OF REVIEWS BEFORE YOU BUY
I had to get a refund for this game. Thankfully the new Steam policy is more forgiving.

Like other reviews, this game truly is a ghost town. Going onto the forums, the devs have said they are holding off on promotion until the game is complete. Who knows how long that will be. But honestly- if you are going to make the game available, and nobody is playing an exclusively online multiplayer game, something is wrong. It shouldn't be an available product. There is very little content to speak of - one game type, small handful of maps. Getting people into the game now would still be very important I think?

I do actually like this game quite a bit. I played with bots and the visuals are amazing... but I'm worried for the future of this game. Will this ever get the player base it deserves? The early access might be damaging this game's reputation. Honestly, I would've liked to hold onto this in my Library and wait it out but if it doesn't even have enough content to hold onto a small player base then why is it available? Will people ever come back?

Other problems - the guns are severely unbalanced. The starting gun is extremely weak, the rocket launcher is a one hit kill. I can see how this would play out online.

The nostalgia wears off quickly and it would be nice for this game to have some original concepts to still move the genre forward without it feeling very outdated. Obv. there will likely be more of this in the future though, not enough content to be super harsh about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991625689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1433898273}
review:
My opinion on the game so far: FUN.

What I like:
- Gameplay is fun! A fast-paced fragfest, just as described by the devs. Simple gameplay (move, jump, dodge, primary fire, and secondary fire). No classes, and all weapons are gained by picking them up in the map.
- Weapons seem relatively balanced.
- No glitches. The game, in terms of playability, is completely hashed-out. Everything works perfectly, from what I've seen. Nothing about it is broken or unplayable, which isn't too common for early access games.

What I'd like to see:
- More maps. I know development is ongoing, but no vehicle maps exist yet, and there are only three available maps currently. All are a maximum of eight players.
- Multiple save slots for key bindings. This is due to my desire to use my Xbox 360 wireless controller with the game. Currently, it is perfectly compatible, but controls must be entered manually via the control options. This means that if you decide to play with mouse and keyboard again, you must manually enter all of the keyboard and mouse controls again, which is a bit time-consuming if you switch between them decently often (from couch gaming to actually sitting at your computer).
- More weapons. I like the ones currently in the game, but I feel there could be a bit more variety. If no future weapons are planned, however, it wouldn't be a huge letdown.
- More players online. I know this is not something the developers can correct on their own, but there have been VERY few servers with any players actively online when I've been playing. You can still play bot matches, but it would be nice to play with a larger quantity of other people.

The bottom line: I buy games in Early Access ONLY if I'm comfortable spending money on the game in its current state. TOXXIK has not disappointed! For the $19 I paid, I have gotten a fantastic experience. Sure, there are only three maps currently available, but the gameplay is fun and there are very few flaws with the current game. I absolutely recommend it for anyone who has been worn out by the current generation of military shooters, and I look forward to additional content that the developers will be rolling out for the game!

Basically, grab a copy. It is the most fun I've had playing a PC game online in a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011909948', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1490657723}
review:
Minha primeira an√°lise, durante o per√≠odo de acesso antecipado, foi positiva. Infelizmente, tive que vir aqui mudar a avalia√ß√£o. Estou levando em conta a vers√£o paga, e n√£o a gratuita, ent√£o mantenha isso em mente quanto √† minha n√£o-recomenda√ß√£o.

Se voc√™ quiser alguns detalhes extras, recomendo a minha an√°lise em v√≠deo. Do contr√°rio, vamos de texto logo abaixo e eh noiz.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KJCmC8mbJZ0

TOXIKK √© um jogo de tiro em primeira pessoa, sendo um [i]arena shooter[/i]. Pra voc√™ que n√£o sabe (fico me imaginando como que voc√™ chegou at√© aqui, na verdade), este √© um subg√™nero um tanto quanto extinto dentro do escopo dos FPSs. Resumindo, √© um tipo de game todos-contra-todos, sem mira, com armas fant√°sticas e um gameplay muito, mas muito fren√©tico. Eu n√£o cheguei a experimentar muito o √°pice dos [i]arena shooters[/i] (1999-2004), mas sempre achei interessante. Quando vi TOXIKK, sabia que era minha chance de apreciar este subg√™nero de forma decente.

S√≥ que TOXIKK prometeu muito, e n√£o apenas entregou pouco, como regrediu em tantos outros aspectos. E o problema nem reside no gameplay em si: o gameplay √© √≥timo. A movimenta√ß√£o, que √© um aspecto super importante dos [i]arena shooters[/i] √© realmente fant√°stica. Mas o jogo enquanto um todo √© menor que a soma de suas partes.

O curioso √© que o pior de seus defeitos nem √© culpa do jogo em si, mas do marketing. Sendo um jogo nichado, talvez a equipe devesse ter prestado mais aten√ß√£o em como distribuir o jogo. Mant√™-lo em acesso antecipado por tanto tempo, sem updates, e depois simplesmente lan√ß√°-lo da noite pro dia, sem uma campanha adequada, matou o potencial de trazer jogadores e manter uma comunidade. Em outras palavras: o multiplayer est√° vazio. E n√£o ajuda que o jogo passou a contar com uma vers√£o gratuita, o que em si n√£o √© um problema, mas, da forma que tudo foi feito, muitos que compraram se sentiram tra√≠dos, o que ajudou a minguar ainda mais a comunidade j√° esvaziada.

No mais, o jogo conta com um netcode porco, o que significa que al√©m do lag de jogar com players do outro lado do Atl√¢ntico, mesmo em partidas locais voc√™ vai sofrer. Resta jogar com bots, que possuem uma intelig√™ncia artificial muito boa at√©, mas que nem de longe se compara a jogar com outros humanos.

Ah, a qualidade da otimiza√ß√£o caiu. N√£o √© todo dia que se v√™ um produto final rodando pior que a sua beta.

Pegue a vers√£o gr√°tis do jogo, e voc√™ provavelmente sair√° satisfeito. Infelizmente, o jogo final √© apenas uma sombra do que poderia ter sido.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993903816', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1564844775}
review:
This game is so underrated I wanna cry.
That is the reason I haven't played this game so much, because there's almost no one to play it online with. Most of the rounds I've played in this game are so called "Boot Camp"-games with bots. It's sad. Especially when it's an awesome game like this one.

I know it's in early access and people don't wanna buy it just because of that. But hear me out: Even in early access, this is hands down one of the best FPS-games I have ever played. Now, that could be because I like Quake-ish, fast paced and not too complicated games that doesn't rely too much on intricate strategies, but rely more on direct combat strategy and good aim.

The Options-menu in this game is also very well implemented. Detailed mouse settings also include in this game, which is essential in a game like this.

The bottom line is, if you like old school shooters like Quake and UT, you have to try this game. It's still early access, I know, but you still won't regret it. Because they are constantly working on it.

UPDATE:

I was optimistic about TOXIKK. But not so much anymore. Don't get me wrong, it's still a good game. I don't have anything against the game itself. But the fact that no one ever plays this game online, except for some very few instances, made me ask Steam Support for a refund sadly. I didn't get it though, considering I've had it for too long and played it too much.

So I'm changing my mind about the review. It's a great game thus far, but I don't recommend buying this game. At least not yet. It lacks community.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979917675', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1438391062}
review:
I have to say that when I first heard about TOXIKK I was skeptical to say the least, but intrigued nonetheless. After playing this for a few hours on a friends account (not mine if my current hours are any indication), I felt like I was playing UT/UT2k4 again or any good arena shooter, which is a relief from all the copy/paste military shooters out there (COD I'm looking at you). And don't get me wrong I enjoy my Battlefields or Tactical shooters/simulators (not battlefield) most of them (minus HL been playing them since 1942), but it is getting a little long in the tooth. Yes, I am well aware of the open source Quake/Quake clones (e.g. Quake Live, Nexuiz, Alien Arena, Warsow etc.), but they werent quite the same or no one plays it seems. It seemed like arena shooters were dead until I saw Tribes: Ascend but that eventually died too. It seemed like there weren't any new TRUE arena shooters to be found console or PC-wise ( well Halo is sort of, and I want to really stress sort of...)  And now finally the UT project is started and I have this now!!!  

TL:DR If you want a fresh take on nostalgia buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980769821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1434238836}
review:
Toxikk review  version .86

First Impressions
The game has just amazing graphics, with fun gameplay that is similar to the Original UT, and is just darn fun to play.

Lets start off with the graphics, this game has very good graphics, and uses ironically the Unreal Engine. I say Ironically because in my opinion this game is better than the last few Unreal Tournament games. This game runs about 30-40fps on my R9-m290x, depending on the  map milage varies. The texture detail is nice, what you would come to expect from a AAA UT release. 

Game play is fun, it plays just like the original UT, with a few improvements that I think add a lot to the game.  Weapons feel a lot like they Did from UT, They look similar and function pretty much the same way they did. You're going to find yourself picking one up and say this is the Plasma Rifle. Some weapons vary a little, in the alternate fire modes, but they will feel familiar.

One of the little Improvements they made is after you kill an enemy they drop a health pack. What a simple reward for killing someone, it really prolongs the carnage. The health pack is available for anyone to pick up so if you are in the right spot at the right time you can grab that health pack after someone else‚Äôs kill, however the reverse is also true, wait too long and someone else will get it.


I think that the bot ai might be a have a steep learning curve, as on the easy setting (ridiculous ) they will literally walk by you and not even notice that you're there.Compared to that to higher difficulty and you see situations where Ai will mop you up pretty easily. This could just be my lack of experience with the game, but it seems that in order to get off the higher difficulty you're going to have to die a lot.   

One of the things I can‚Äôt get over is just how much fun this game is to play. I have said it before but this game just is so much like the original UT the only way to get much closer is to Remake the Original using today's Graphics. The whole game just is familiar if you have played the original UT, the game play should just come to you naturally. I have also said that I think this is a lot better than Epic‚Äôs Newer UT, and I meant it  The game just has captured the core of what a Deathmatch FPS should be and ran with  it.

Right now there are several game modes, including Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, which are blood lust, Squad assault, and Cell capture, Read Deathmatch, team deathmatch, and CTF. Nothing special to note here other than they do have some vehicles in the game.They have put in a nice scoring system, for every kill you get you get x points, for and for every double kill, killing spree or whatever you may have gotten you get additional points. In capture the cell games a cell capture gets you points, so it might be possible to win the game just on the number of points.

Final thoughts. 
More people need to buy this game and get in the online mode, just because the online play looks to be a little slow right now. That is just do to a total lack of players right now though. Buy this game and you wont regret it I promise.

review:
I'll amend this review if anything changes, but as of now there are a total of nine people playing across three matches... in the entire game. The largest match I played was 2v2. Such a waste, because this seems like an otherwise very fun, very pretty game. 

I almost don't want to give this a negative review because it'll dissuade others from playing, and if this had a solid following I'd play it every day. But as it stands, I wish I could have my money back. Only available for a few months and this is totally dead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077440276', 'num_games_owned': 1074, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1562638399}
review:
This game is so much fun. It seems like it may be just a ripoff of old arena FPS games, but it feels so new and fresh. If you like games like UT2004 and Quake III, you'll like this game.
Coming back to this after several updates I have to say that the game has improved, but it is lacking players. 99% of the time servers are completely empty and frankly, that's a damn shame. This game deserves A LOT more attention than it's getting.

UPDATE 9/25/16: 
After the game's launch there has been a surge in the playerbase and that's great. There are actually people to play with but the matchmaking can be spotty at times and lag can sometimes be an issue from what I've experienced. However, that doesn't detract from the game as a whole. It's still a solid experience and it feels very polished all around. It's a loveletter to fans of arena FPS games and it hits all the right notes. I highly recommend checking this game out at the very least.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970369012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1474144016}
review: I have put 2 hours into the game not allot of time but wanted too put it out there as I see it so far. This current build of the game puts the version number at .86 parsley not sure what all the herb references are in the build names but whatever :).If this is true that means they are saying this game is 14 percent from version 1.0. With that in mind I will say the game play is superb the movement the mouse feel and options all feel awesome graphics of course it's UT engine so they are very nice and yes the gameplay feels nearly identical too UT. I don't consider that a poor design choice as I enjoy being able too carry over what I know from other fast pace first person shooters from one game too the next without feeling that I have too relearn the game completley. Now if they add a map and a really unique mutator too the game for the remaining development up too 1.0 I will say it's worthy of a purchase price otherwise I won't be able too recomment it without more content. The reason people arent playing allot is largely due too that issue right now. This is early access so again not an issue unless never addressed. I look forward too more maps some unique mutators not UT ones. Then I will truly be able too frag like 1999. The gameplay and weaon feel/balance is very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994503917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1634606259}
review:
Exactly what it claims to be, and that is an excellent thing indeed! Unreal Tournament 2k15 :D

Honestly, if it didn't have "Early Access" written on the front page, I never would have known. It feels more polished than any game I have played in recent memory. Controls are tight, graphics are phenomenal, multiplayer connections seems good, weapons are interesting, and modes are implemented. The only thing that is lacking is that here aren't that many maps, but other than that, I would think this game was already released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138728794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1561179929}
review:
ENGLISH:

I barely played a hour and it was enough to make me fall in love with this game: great visuals and weapons, fast action, jumps, vehicles, no silly stuff like automatic health recovery, no classes/levels, no chance to hide or camp, no reloads (I admit I pressed the R key several times haha), no biased gameplay, just speed and skill like the classics Unreal Tournament and Quake. Wanna replenish health? Wanna have that bast.ard's weapon? Wanna be the best of the match? KILL; nothing more.

I've read some comments about few weapons, maps and game modes, but well, what do you expect if the game just uses 2 GB of hard drive? 

-Weapons: I don't know their names yet, but I can tell there're like 2 or 3 assault rifles (that shoot energy beams), a shotgun, a flamethrower, a sniper rifle, a rocket launcher and the default equipment (a pistol and like a circular saw), so there's a bit variety.

-Game modes: 3 for the moment: BloodLust (classic deathmatch), Squad Assault (team deathmatch) and Cell Capture (like capture the flag), up to 16 players.

-Maps: Very few at the moment I'm writting this review, but the ones already in game are pretty detailed and well designed to prevent campers and coward hiders. 

I hope developers add more stuff later.

By the way, the only con I can tell this game has got is that the online servers are pretty empty, so I had to play with bots (however, their AI is decent enough to play some funny matches). Let's wait to see if this game becomes more popular among community in the next months; if so, It'd be a great addition to everyone's games library, especially if you like shooters but wanna play something different than those kinda generic, tactical, militar-based games with a release per year (don't get me wrong, I often play Battlefield, Call of Duty and Counter-Strike). 

For me: 9/10 'cuz it can improve with time :3

---------------------------

ESPA√ëOL:

Apen√°s jugu√© una hora y fue suficiente para que me enamorara de este juego: gr√°ficos y armas geniales, acci√≥n r√°pida, saltos, veh√≠culos, nada de ridiculeces como regeneraci√≥n autom√°tica de salud, sin clases ni niveles, sin oportunidades de esconderse o campear, sin recargas (aunque admito que muchas veces presion√© R jaja), nada de parcialidades o ventajas, s√≥lo velocidad y habilidad como en los cl√°sicos Unreal Tournament y Quake. ¬øNecesitas salud? ¬øQuieres arrebatarle el arma a ese bast.ardo? ¬øQuieres ser el mejor de la partida? MATA; nada m√°s.

He le√≠do algunos comentarios acerca de pocas armas, mapas y modos de juego, pero, ¬øqu√© esperar√≠as de un juego que ocupa 2 GB en el disco duro?

-Armas: A√∫n no me aprendo sus nombres, pero puedo decir que hay como 2 √≥ 3 rifles de asalto (que disparan energ√≠a), una escopeta, un lanzallamas, un rifle de francotirador, un lanzacohetes y el equipo base (una pistola y una sierra circular), por lo que puedo decir que hay algo de variedad.

-Modos de juego: 3 por el momento: BloodLust (partida a muerte cl√°sica), Squad Assault (partida por equipos) y Cell Capture (algo as√≠ como un captura la bandera), permitiendo 16 jugadores simult√°neos.

-Mapas: Muy pocos en el momento en el que escribo esta rese√±a, pero los que ya est√°n en el juego est√°n bien detallados y dise√±ados para prevenir campers y a quienes se esconden.

Espero que los desarrolladores a√±adan m√°s cosas de √©stas despu√©s.

Por cierto, el √∫nico "pero" que puedo decir es que los servidores en l√≠nea de este juego est√°n vac√≠os en su mayor√≠a, as√≠ que jugu√© con bots (sin embargo, la IA es lo bastante decente para tener buenas partidas). Esperemos que este juego se vuelva m√°s popular entre la comunidad en unos meses; de ser as√≠, ser√≠a una gran adici√≥n a toda librer√≠a de juegos de quien sea fan√°tico de los shooters, pero a su vez quiera jugar algo diferente que esas entregas anuales gen√©ricas, t√°cticas y basadas en lo militar (no me malinterpreten, pues juego Battlefield, Call of Duty y Counter-Strike asiduamente).

Para m√≠: 9/10 porque puede mejorar con el tiempo :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198033125689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1452481274}
review: Doesn't know what era of shooter it wants to be in or how it wants to go about it. It feels like a mix of quake, unreal championship, and Halo; but done very poorly. It's not balance or robust enough to play competitively, yet not big enough or have enough content to be played for fun. It's awkwardly trying to be something it can't with content (or multiplayer community) it doesn't have and an appeal to a market that wanted it so badly, just done right. Much like Sim City (5) syndrome; It's a let down that teases you until purchase with it's promises and pretty pictures. I'm better off going back to playing the games it's trying to be, at least they play right and have a respectable amount of players online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044325629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1485917859}
review:
Excellent game. Tried out the bots mode, and it provided plenty of hectic fun.


Do I recommend this? Yes. It's probably the most underrated shooter I know of. Not only that, this is the most fun I've had with a modern FPS in years. This game NEEDS to get out there, tell your friends, tell your family, TOXXIK needs to be more popular. 

For the price, you can easily get plenty of hours out of the bots alone. The online community is picking up though, as more people are finding out about this fun, hidden gem.

-Sehr viel Spa√ü Online, wie auch Offline
-Back to the old rules 
-Gute Performance 

Con:

Ps: Wer noch nicht so viel Ehrfahrung mit Arena-Shootern hat, kann erstmal Quake-live (kostenlos) ausprobieren (f√ºr das Spielgef√ºhl)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989937454', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1586907474}
review: If you yearn for a fast-paced, simple shooter, please buy this. Not only because you owe it to yourself to play this already polished gem, but to bolster the community of an amazing game. I bought this, played a bot match, played another bot match with increased difficulty, jumped into my first live deathmatch game, got second place, and loved every second of it. An accessible game that's easy to jump into, yet rewards skillful play greatly, and allows you to pull of shots that make you feel like a marksmanship god. Fast, addictive, fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065785288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1431316360}
review: Dead game. Servers are empty apart from a few games with 8-16 players, it's a pretty fun game but unless it manages to go from 50 concurrent players to 1k+ its probably not worth getting

author: {'steamid': '76561197966826263', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1431363738}
review:
Don't get this game if you have a 32 bit OS. It fails to mention that it can't really run on it. The game wants to use more memory than 32 bit OS allows and will just crash constantly. Farthest I've gotten into the game itself is past the main menu and about 10 seconds into actual gameplay before crashing.

I can't comment on the gameplay unfortunately, just beware if you're not running 64 bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085684806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1502950649}
review:
There isn't anything to be said about this gem that hasn't been blurted out by hundreds of others, but fuck it, i'm saying it anyway.

You remember Quake? Unreal Tournament? How about good 'ole arena FPS games in general?

You like 'em?

Buy this then. The content that'll be added in the future will be well worth it.

Admittedly, there aren't a whole lot of people on the servers (though currently it's on sale, so that'll change soon), but you can play with bots that are, believe it or not, are actually smart and are about as much fun to play with as real people.

A game destined for great things.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987850236', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1609534710}
review: I can without a doubt recommend this game. The customization is pretty stellar, the weapons feel powerful and lethal, combat is fast and unforgiving, the announcer sounds great, the graphics are breathtaking for such a fast paced game. There are some drawbacks though, not in the game itself, but more-so if you are used to modern shooters, this is probably not the game for you. This is as the trailer suggests, old school. If you played Quake and Unreal and liked them, this is the game for you. Could definitely use some new maps, as there arent too many, but if the devs introduce the steam workshop that will change very quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982228865', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1431349953}
review:
Un juego impresionante, nada de casta√±as de Pay2Win. Partidas igualadas, las unicas ventajas son lo que puedas llegar a recoger en el mismo mapa. Al ver juego no dude de que iba a ser otra casta√±a del monton de Pay2Win, juegos que ni toco, ni aunque me los regalen con todos packs, DLCs... Da la sensacion que estas jugando al Unreal Tournament 2004, tiene mas similitudes que con otros juegos clasicos. De momento parece no haber vehiculos(para un jugador). Las armas parece que no hay que recargarlas. EL juego es muy configurable, las opciones graficas para nada estan capadas. Sin problemas puedes jugar con tu monitor de 200+Hz.

Probado en:

i5-3570k 4.2Ghz
z77 asrock extreme4
HDD WD green
Samsung 840 pro
4x2 8gb RAM ddr3 G.Skill ARES 1866Mhz
Creative X-FI Extreme Gamer
BeQuiet purepower 630w
Asus Strix 970 4gb (stock boost)
Benq XL2430T 24 (configurado)
Win7 64bits

El juego puesto en opcion "Ultra" y FullHd(1080p), sin Blur y sin Vsync, a veces llega a alcanzar 200fps(medido con Fraps). Pero normalmente suele rondar 120-150fps a la hora de jugar. Con lo cual no me parece que este mal optimizado y siendo un juego sin acabar en alpha/beta. El juego no tendra problemas con monitores de 120-144-200+Hz

author: {'steamid': '76561197970279423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1451623717}
review:
Feels like 1999 and it's just a fun as it was then but with better graphics.

I like the bots to play against and they feel real enough for me, so that's a win.  As I get better, I'll dial them up, and *maybe* play against people if I feel like it one day.  Having the bots recommened by a few friendly people on here sold me on the game and I'm glad I bought it.

Good game, easy in, easy out.  Fun

Looking forward to new maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995712663', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1710786006}
review:
Great Run and Gun, very much like UT, but with it's own set of nuances. The gameplay is solid, even at early access, and with very few low-latency servers, the gameply doesn't seem prone to any performance issues. I can play and not suck at 160ms ping (not great, but not a lot of choices). Just enough customization on the characters for now. Steam integration, and it doesn't take long to get an online match. 
Looking forward to vehicles later on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005327559', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1473723232}
review: I can't really say if Reakktor Studios accomplished their goal, making Toxikk a game just like the arena shooters in 1999, because I was born a year after that, my earliest games were Jet Set Radio and Halo. Anyway, the game itself is lackluster but what's there is really good. This probably won't be true after long since it's early access. They advertise "no perks" and "no regenerative health"just as the games of old played. It's really fast paced. A lot of what makes the game simple and fast paced is well done. There are two equal teams and balanced weapons with varied abilities, each of them with two fire modes. The best thing about this game is the movement system. It's not really parkour but you can still move around the map quickly if you knew how. There is a double jump and a "dodge" that can be combined with ramps and lifts in the maps to get around well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084365262', 'num_games_owned': 1079, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1490734954}
review: Je crois que TOXIKK est LE MEILLEUR JEU DE FPS MODERNE A CE JOUR, serieusement, joue a ce jeu, si tu aime UT2004, ou Quake Live, Quake III arena, ce jeu est pour toi, aucun f2p, pas de p2w, tout ce que qu'Il y'a c'est du sang, fun, et meutres ;) si tu le prends, pense a cette critique :D je sais pas si c'est la premiere recommendation francaise/quebecois (car oui je suis quebecois!) alors si tu aime jouer avec tes potes et bien prends ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133155823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1516862296}
review:
TOXIKK really is what is is marketed as. I've still been playing UT 2004 up tilll now. TOXIKK is an actual fast paced arena style FPS that is a sigh of relief in the sea of modern military shooters. The game looks great, plays smoothly, and is over all worth your time. 

See my full review [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vv-zkSF5p6s]here[/url].

review:
Ja....ich w√ºrde sagen so an sich klasse Game....doch wenn man in den Multiplayer gehen will, tja.....keine Spieler Online ^^ das m√ºsste sich definitiv noch √§ndern!

Ansonsten: Klassischer Online-Multiplayer-Shooter wie Unreal oder Quake.....keine Kampagne...nur Koop Deathmatches etc....

author: {'steamid': '76561198012845920', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1430425398}
review:
TOXIKK ist in der jetzigen Version alles andere als Schlecht.. denn es bietet Tats√§chlich alte Kost.
Darunter versteht man,unkomplizierte Action,kein dummes b√ºcken,verstecken,campen und wei√ü der Geier! Man merkt dem Spiel schnell an das die Entwickler Unreal und Quake geliebt haben :D

Es ist sau schnell,die Maps k√∂nnen unterschiedlicher nicht sein.. und es ist halt ein Spiel was man jeden Tag ne Runde Spielen kann aber nicht MUSS.

Daher w√ºnsche ich mir f√ºr die Endfassung


MEHR WAFFEN
MEHR GORE
WENIGER HALO SKINS
BESSERE MUSIK
MINIMAL LANGSAMER,denn momentan kommt mir das so vor als w√§ren die leute voll drup :D

Und vielleicht wird auch noch mein Wunsch war,das man eine Map Hinzuf√ºgt wo man sich in der Disco abknallen darf ;D
Klingt zwar irre , aber manchmal braucht man dumme Ideen um aufmerksamkeit zu bekommen.

An alle anderen kann ich nur raten dieses Spiel doch bitte zu Unterst√ºtzen damit endlich mal aus Deutschland etwas Vern√ºftiges Produziert wird!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057516469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1665857157}
review:
Gelangweilt von milit√§rischen und taktischen Shootern?
Dann solltet ihr mal einen Blick auf dieses geniale Spiel werfen! 

Ich muss dazu sagen, dass ich vorher noch nie Arena FPS gezockt habe. Mich machten bereits die Trailer zu TOXIKK ziemlich neugierig und ich stellte fest, dass sie nicht zu viel versprochen haben.

Pros: 

         Gameplay, was sofort Spa√ü macht
         
         Wundersch√∂ne Grafik

         Gute Musik & Sound

         Coole Waffen

         Sehr gute Performance (konstant 60 FPS)


Cons:

         Multiplayer-Server entweder komplett (!) leer oder nur eine Hand voll Spieler


Fazit: 

Dieses Spiel ist absolut jeden Cent wert und ich hoffe, dass sich noch mehr Leute das Game kaufen, damit auch der Multiplayer nicht zu kurz kommt. Ich bin gespannt auf weitere Updates, denn die Entwickler scheinen gro√ües Potential zu besitzen.



Mein System: AMD FX 6300 @3,5 GHz
                       Nvidia Geforce GTX 660
                       12 GB DDR3 @1333 MHz

author: {'steamid': '76561197985000657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1444607096}
review: The game is small, and still very much in development, but unlike a few other Early Access games floating around, the devs seem to be absolutely dedicated to making this game happen in full. The mechanics are tight and fun, the guns are visceral and satisfying, and the game has so far delivered on everything it's promised. I highly recommend this to anyone itching to scratch that early 90s deathmatch multiplayer itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007542983', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1474483119}
review:
Toxikk is a brilliant game, a throwback to the good old days of arena shooters, if you've played Unreal Tournament or Quake you can immediately catch a grip of this game espcially since it borrows so heavily from UT which is not really a bad thing considering how well made the game is and the lack of modern arena shooters.

Graphically Toxikk is a very pretty looking even for an early access has very few bugs and glitches, its biggest flaw is perhaps its gun play while the gun looks great the sound decent and the player feedback during firing isnt exactly on point also only 3 maps as of this posting so hopefull by release both these issues will be solved.

The biggest problem and perhaps the most biggest turnoff is the online community is literally dead you'll barely notice more than 3 servers with users playing so hopefully by launch the game will have a decent user base so you can play games online.

EDIT (21/3/2016) - devs are supporting the game but this really needs a free weekend or something similar and needs to get out early access alreay so people tha dont buy early access titles can grab it.The servers are up but the have max 6-7 players at its peak in off time there are literally 0 players playing the game and the game has been in early access for more than a year now.

EDIT (22/9/16) - game is now out of early access and now has a option where by users can play the game for free with some restrictions, the numbers of players thanks to that has surged but the main gunplay since the early access hasnt changed also i noticed mostly EU servers and never got lower than 180 ping which servered affect so i decided not to play it until a major update/new regional servers were added.I think now with the free edition you should defeinately check that out and if interested buy the full access later.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960272710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1428860296}
review: This is the new breed of arena shooter.  It has a feel very similiar to the old Unreal Tournament games, that's for sure.  Sound-wise the game is satisfying and well done - a step up from the old breeds.  Graphics-wise the game is gorgeous but there are some textures errors here and there, but nothing really noticible (you have to look to see them, and it could have been on my end).  The controls are tight, responsive and well produced.  The guns seem to be balanced and offer a good variety of strategy and tactics in order to master the elements for success in this game.  However, despite all the goodness in the deathmatch mode, the capture modes are weak and not fun - the maps are too big and feel lacking in the arena feel.  Overall the deathmatch maps at this point are great, fun, well designed, and balanced.  They are gorgeous as well and feature wonderful and engaging sounds/music.  The team play capture maps, I personally think, are lacking, not fun, and battles are too spread apart.  So far at this stage in the early release there are always good US servers to play on.  Netcode seems to be tight and responsive.  If you are an arena fan, get this game.  Also the developers are responding to the community very well, and very quickly.  Great Devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042292886', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1523316918}
review: Despite the high regards people have talked about this game in the past, I'm going to be the ultimate scum and say 'Be patient for Epic Game's newest rendition of Unreal Tournament. Unless of course, you're not willing to wait for their version. Buy this version instead and shake off all that rust.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018820777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1428600811}
review: Remember the good old days of Unreal Tournament? Where you and your buddies could just hook your computers up together and have a massive death match? Where there was no regenerating health or obnoxious constant voice chat? When an FPS was filled with silent characters that never talked, crazy guns and ridiculous speed and power? Well, if you do or if you're curious about a game like that, look no further than TOXIKK from Reakktor Studios: an indie that's a throwback to the old games of yore. The slogan in the description is ‚ÄúFrag like it's 1999,‚Äù and that's accurate statement to what the game is. [url=http://www.noobfeed.com/previews/318/toxikk]Full Preview[/url]

review: Playing this game brings me back to the joys of play the original Unreal Torunament. Everything is fast, and everything is beautiful. For years now the only arena shooters I've seen that have looked good have been all console based (can't blame them, there's gobs of money there), where the controls didn't have precision and even the fastest shooters go by at a crawl compared to the shear speed of this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034334547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1353, 'last_played': 1661447239}
review:
Fraggen macht wieder Spa√ü!
Wer in den 90igern Quake III Arena und UT mochte wird TOXXIK lieben!

Alle die sagen das Arena FPS Spiele out sind liegt v√∂llig falsch! Grund daf√ºr ist nur, dass kein Arena FPS nach Quake und CO wirklich was getaugt hat, und zu dem viele auf den Markt geworfene PayToWin sind. 
TOXXIK l√§√üt ein Genre wieder aufleben, wobei nicht nur die Grafik frischen Wind rein bringt, sondern auch die Spielgeschwindikeit nichts zu w√ºnschen √ºbrig l√§√üt.
Desweiteren wird Modding, eine Vielzahl von MAPS und Mechaniken den Spielern er√∂ffnen.

Meine pers√∂nliche Wertung zu TOXIKK in der Beta ist 10/10 und ich la√ü mich √ºberraschen was mich bei Release noch erwarten wird.

review:
Great, fast-paced shooter inspired by UT series. Skill-based gameplay, well balanced weapons, few great maps (new maps incoming, hype), good graphics and smooth movement make this game very exciting expierience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028652973', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1424146089}
review: TOXIKK is a graphically beautiful throwback to the FPS games of old, where nothing but time and skill stands between you and being the best.  Getting rid of all of the unlocks, loadouts, and perks means that you can jump in on day 1, day 100, or day 1000 and when you get stomped, you'll know it's because they were just better than you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046656442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1473722379}
review:
One of the best examples of " Early Access " so far!

Feel like your part of the development, Devs true to their word.

As for the game, amazing... Elements of many arena shooters, UT3 and Quake, HALO 1-2... Easy to play, Hard to master.
But unfortunatly despite the hype, very positive feed back and what seems to be alot of enjoyment from the current player base, There never seems to be more than 3-8 players online spread across 2 servers.

I will still give it 10/10 and the best idea is top buy the 4-Pack and share with some friends

This game has allot of potential as it's still in the early stage, a winner for sure!

THINGS I'D LIKE TO HIGHLIGHT:

-Dodging/Wall Dodging.

-Weapons(a reason good enoguh to try it out is to test the "Hell Raiser" or "Redeemer" if you know where it's from and what it does;))
+++++++

Just get it and start playing, like.. YESTERDAY!! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024579812', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1424797214}
review:
Do you like quake? Then this is your game.
Do you like unfinished games? Buy this game...
Do you like good games? Don't ever pre-purchase a game... Not even if they are in early access. 
Why?

Because even if the game is good and just some parts are disturbing or glitchy, it will make you think of the game in that way. Which will not make you especially turned on to play it the next time because of unfinished parts. I say:
Release everything or nothing!! As the good old days!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039843763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1561473867}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054670727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1455825419}
review: High quality, solid classic-style shooter with great graphics. Servers are quiet but with friends its a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973929206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1426625020}
review:
I was really hoping this would be a good arena shooter but I am really dissapointed.
- although the controls are spot on, the gameplay is kind of slow and clunky
- the servers are empty (talking ~20 players total at prime time)

+ the graphics are ok and thankully its possible to turn most of the flares and blurrs off
+ its awesome to see a server browser with dedicated servers after all those lobby p2p games

Not worth the price by a long shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981735935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1473615437}
review:
Definitely a no.

This game has been built to look upon the gods of FPS. Unreal and Quake. Yet, it fails miserably at copying those two more importantly, it fails to create anything new or unique, the game is a total rip-off with no original content and poor execution. The game is very un-balanced, and it will not be fixed very soon.

Toxikk was promising upcomer for the FPS genre but the delivery is without finesse. 

2.5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198065840128', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1433728606}
review:

I'm terrible at the game, brand new to Arena FPSs. I rarely get any kills at all, so if you've never played a game like this before prepare to die a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112958015', 'num_games_owned': 1250, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1473883910}
