author: {'steamid': '76561198001976900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1427514232}
review: Does anyone even play this game? I log in everyday and see no one online hardly?

author: {'steamid': '76561197997007518', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1434332782}
review: As stated in many of these reviews, Toxikk is UT2004 with modern graphics, Movement can be pretty fluid once you get the hang of using the strafe key, and the guns all handle like you'd imagine in an Arena shooter. Toxikk sticks to a very tried and true formula, which is great, however the biggest flaw right now isn't even with the game itself, but with the community, or lack thereof. Although this game has over 1000 reviews (at the time of this review), I sadly rarely encounter other players, many servers at least in the US are either completely empty or sparsely populated at all. There are very few maps, 3 in total I believe (Twin Peaks, Foundry and Artifact), which might be why the lack of players. Luckily the Bot A.I. is pretty well done, especially at the harder difficulties the A.I. opponents can provide more than enough challenge for those who aren't Arena Shooter vets. What I think this game needs right now is some publicity, and maybe a small sale to encourage people to adopt early.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016948043', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1691466474}
review: An awesome FPS for those who are into the Arena-styled variety. Not as popular, but after it's more developed, it should damn well be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961309167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1484943244}
review:
I don't feel like writing a long review right now so I'll keep it short:

Toxikk is freaking awesome.

This is how every early access game should be delivered in my opinion.  There's not much there content wise, but the foundation is freaking incredible, the graphics are gorgeous, and the gameplay is top notch.

They just need more maps and more players and they'll be good to go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096532785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1479399177}
review:
(This is the 1000th review for the game!)
Toxikk is an amazing arena shooter! It has a variety of weapons, beautiful maps, it's fast paced, has double jumps, and it reminds me of the good old days of Quake!
A strong 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001534970', 'num_games_owned': 1454, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1425929793}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]TOXIKK[/th]
        [th][url=http://game-guide.fr/40098-toxikk-acces-anticipe]Lien vers le test[/url][/th]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Les FPS sont l√©gions sur nos consoles et PC, c'est un fait. Chaque ann√©e, on a droit √† une nouvelle fourn√©e, du FPS pop-corn, adapt√© pour convenir √† tout type de joueurs, et √ßa se vend toujours tr√®s bien (m√™me si une baisse des ventes a pu √™tre constat√©e ces derniers mois). Pourtant, il y a une sous-cat√©gorie du genre qui a totalement disparu de nos rayons : je veux parler des Fast-FPS ! Quake, ou encore Unreal, ces deux noms parleront forc√©ment aux joueurs nostalgiques. Ces deux licences ont fait le bonheur des amateurs de FPS dans la fin des ann√©es 90 et le d√©but des ann√©es 2000. Et depuis la derni√®re version de Quake sortie en 2007, Quake Live, plus rien... Devenu trop difficile, trop exigeant, pas assez gratifiant, le Fast-FPS est peu √† peu tomb√© dans l'oubli, ne r√©unissant plus qu'une niche de joueurs, qui attend patiemment (pour un joueur aussi nerveux, c'est presque un comble) un descendant, de meilleur qualit√©, √† Quake 4 ou Unreal Tournament 3. Certains FPS r√©cent ont tent√© une approche un poil plus rapide ces derniers mois, en t√©moigne TitanFall ou le dernier √©pisode de Call of Duty - Advanced Warfare, avec du double saut, du saut contre les murs, ou encore du dash (qui consiste √† foncer dans une direction tr√®s rapidement), mais la vis√©e assist√©e, la r√©g√©n√©ration de sant√© et tout un tas de d√©tails rendent l'exp√©rience quasiment d√©plaisante pour un joueur de Fast-FPS.

Apr√®s plusieurs ann√©es de disette, plusieurs petits studios se sont rendus compte que cette branche du FPS est d√©serte, et ont d√©cid√© de se lancer dans la conception d'un descendant du genre, par passion, si l'on en croit les dires des d√©veloppeurs. Eux-m√™mes savent qu'ils ne vendront pas ces jeux par palette. La cible vis√©e est pr√©cise, on vise les nostalgiques principalement, ceux qui en ont marre d'√™tre assist√©s chaque fois qu'ils visent, ceux qui ne pr√™tent pas attention aux d√©tails cosm√©tiques d'une arme, ceux qui pestent contre la r√©g√©n√©ration de vie ind√©cente... et qui souhaitent avoir une exp√©rience d'un FPS pens√© pour le PC, et non adapt√© aux consoles (allez donc jouer √† Quake sur consoles, vous m'en direz des nouvelles !).

Aujourd'hui, on va s'int√©resser au jeu de REAKKTOR Studios, TOXIKK, qui est l'un des titres les plus prometteurs pour assurer la rel√®ve d'un Unreal Tournament !

Plus qu'un hommage aux fast-FPS des ann√©es 2000, TOXIKK souhaite rafraichir le genre en ajoutant quelques √©l√©ments pr√©sents dans les FPS contemporains, afin d'attirer les curieux. C'est tr√®s l√©ger, les puristes n'ont pas √† s'inqui√©ter, ils ont juste ajout√© une petite composante "RPG", en donnant de l'XP pour chaque joueur tu√©, et bonus de fin de manche. La progression sera affich√©e dans un classement g√©n√©ral et offrira quelques succ√®s Steam. L'autre ajout, un poil plus g√™nant, mais qui peut √™tre d√©sactiv√©, est l'arriv√©e d'effets de lumi√®re et autres options douteuses qui font tant plaisir aux joueurs. C'est tr√®s beau, clairement, et √ßa reste fluide, m√™me sur des configurations modestes, mais les habitu√©s du genre iront vite d√©sactiver ces fioritures dans les options, tant √ßa g√™ne parfois la lisibilit√© de l'action.

Comme je le disais juste au-dessus, le jeu est globalement tr√®s beau, avec ou sans effets visuels, et tourne tr√®s bien sur des machines modestes, dans la plupart des cas. Il y a en effet quelques soucis d'optimisation √ßa et l√†, en particulier sur la nouvelle carte CTF - Twin Peaks, qui peut freezer √† des endroits bien pr√©cis. Les d√©veloppeurs travaillent dessus, mais pour un jeu comme TOXIKK, o√π il faut √™tre r√©actif et avoir un jeu fluide, √ßa peut √™tre assez g√™nant. Vu que je parle de cartes, sachez qu'il n'y en a que deux actuellement. Oui, c'est tr√®s peu pour un titre vendu 18,99‚Ç¨, mais pas non plus honteux, surtout que ces deux cartes sont de tr√®s bonne qualit√©.

La premi√®re, Foundation, est une ar√®ne jouable en mode Bloodlust (Deathmatch) et Squad Assault (Team Deathmatch), elle est d'assez petite taille, mais est assez riche √† explorer, gr√¢ce √† ses nombreux couloirs, son sous-sol et son √©tage qui offre une belle verticalit√© au tout ! Pas le temps de s'ennuyer ici, √ßa frag en permanence, les manches s'encha√Ænent √† un rythme effr√©n√© pour notre plus grand plaisir.

Le mode Cell Capture (une capture de drapeau, grosso modo) est un peu plus pos√©, logique puisqu'on est sur Twin Peaks, une carte enneig√©e (l'action se d√©roule au Canada) assez vaste o√π on peut piloter des v√©hicules, tr√®s nerveux et plaisants √† piloter. Cette carte peut accueillir plus de joueurs (16 joueurs, contre 8 sur Foundation) et donne un petit c√¥t√© tactique aux affrontements, du moins si vous jouez avec des amis... sur un serveur public, la strat√©gie n'a pas lieu d'√™tre.

D'autres cartes sont √©videmment pr√©vues, on peut s'attendre √† voir d√©barquer une nouvelle ar√®ne sous peu, qui prend place dans une belle jungle... apr√®s, l'√©quipe ne cache pas qu'elle compte sur sa communaut√© pour proposer de nouvelles cartes. Si elles plaisent aux joueurs, elles seront ajout√©es via des packs communautaires. Les outils n√©cessaires √† la cr√©ation de ces cartes sont √† disposition des joueurs depuis peu.

Comme je le disais un peu plus haut, les v√©hicules sont assez nerveux et jouissifs... rassurez-vous, il en va de m√™me pour le reste. Le jeu reprend avec brio la nervosit√© d'un Unreal Tournament, les d√©placements sont rapides, les esquives sont pr√©sentes, les rebonds sur le mur se font naturellement, le double saut r√©pond √† l'appel (mais manque un peu de p√™che...) et les armes propos√©es sont pour la plupart tr√®s int√©ressantes, entre le Bullcraft, le Violator, le lance-flamme Dragoneer, le Stingray, le lance-roquette Cerberus ou encore le sniper Falcon. Chaque arme propose un tir principal (clic gauche) et un tir secondaire (clic droit), pas d'iron sight (impossible de viser en utilisant la mire donc) ici, tout se joue au skill, pour le bonheur des nostalgiques et autres puristes. Quelques probl√®mes d'√©quilibrage au niveau des armes subsistent √† l'heure actuelle, mais les d√©veloppeurs font au mieux pour arranger tout √ßa... reste √† voir comment ils pourront rendre le Raven, le pistolet de base du jeu, plus int√©ressant, car l'arme manque cruellement de punch pour le moment.

TOXIKK est bien parti pour √™tre un digne repr√©sentant du Fast-FPS. Dynamique, beau, exigeant, le jeu ravira les amateurs du genre et arrivera m√™me √† convaincre certains joueurs d√©sireux de s'essayer √† des FPS bien plus nerveux. Le seul d√©faut du jeu √† l'heure, c'est son contenu, relativement chiche, surtout quand on sait que le ticket d'entr√©e fr√¥le les 20‚Ç¨... Acheter le jeu maintenant, c'est soutenir l'√©quipe derri√®re le jeu, qui semble r√©ellement passionn√©e et ne souhaite qu'une chose, assurer la descendance d'un genre qui a malheureusement perdu en popularit√© ces derni√®res ann√©es.

(Version de test : 0.75)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991683410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1429756181}
review:
Despite the current lack of maps, this is probably one of the most polished early access games I've ever played. The game is extremely well optimized, the netcode is excelent and the controls are sharp has Nigel Farages tongue (very). 

It's current problem is the lack of players, too many are absorbed in F2P team based games to give this game a look and the $20 price tag seems unattractive with the current lack of content.
While the current pay model avoids many of the F2P pitfalls (RIP Tribes: Ascend) it's created a lack of a stable playerbase, either a price drop or going F2P with microtransactions for cosmetic enhancements only seems desirable at this point. I just want as many people playing this game as possible because it's so much fun.

If you're considering purchasing TOXIKK buy the 4pack, hell buy several. TOXIKK is too good to die early

author: {'steamid': '76561197984246130', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1509850778}
review: Fantastic oldschool shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058232715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1439236361}
review: I've spent a very little amount of time on TOXIKK. But I can already tell you that this is a promising start for an arena deathmatch game. The maps are fun to navigate, as well as visually striking. The guns are fun to use, and each gun has a right mouse button feature that is handy to use in some circumstances. I cannot tell you how excited I am for the full release. In my opinion, and I don't know if anyone (dis)agrees with me, I'd like to have a higher jump. I feel like I couldn't reallly climb up a small ledge with my double jump

author: {'steamid': '76561198052475572', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1458588327}
review: This game is fantastic. While a little lacking in content at the moment it is a blast to play alone with bots or with friends. There are currently only 3 maps but each one was brilliantly designed. The action is very fast paced and the weapons feel really nice to shoot. I am always excited for new updates that bring new content.

review: I haven't really played a game like this in a while. I can usually pick up a FPS and be pretty good at it after a few games. But here, the challenge remains. Other than only two maps so far, money well spent.

review: Very fun arena type shooter. I believe currently it is worth reccomending, as it is an enjpyable experience for any old school FPS players like myself..... Needs maps, or at least community support for mod makers to make maps...... very limited gameplay with a handful of weapons, modes and maps..... buy it if you want, just know there isnt currently much actual content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010189344', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1478004236}
review:
Vorab, es gibt in dem Spiel momentan recht wenig Karten (2). Eine ist weitl√§ufig und man kann mit Fahrzeugen die Map durchlaufen, die andere ist eine echte Arena. Also recht klein und verwinkelt (so wie es sein sollte). 

Trotz dieser geringen Anzahl an Maps macht das Spiel jede Menge Spa√ü, wenn man sich eingespielt hat. Ich musste 2 Bot Matches und 3 Online Matches bestreiten, bis ich mich an die Steuerung und das Waffen bzw. das Projektil Flugverhalten gew√∂hnt habe.

Das ist definitiv zu viel und man sollte an den Waffen etwas tun. Aber nach dieser Eingew√∂hnungsphase hat man ein wirklich spa√üiges Spiel, welches nicht k√ºnstlich durch Unlocks von Waffen oder diverse andere Freischaltungen in die L√§nge gezogen wird.

Das Geld wurde definitiv gut angelegt und ich bin mir sicher dass ich das Spiel auch weiter spielen werde. Lediglich die geringe Spieleranzahl macht mir sorgen, aber daf√ºr gibt es ja relativ gute (schwierige) Bots =)

author: {'steamid': '76561197974299682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1476069137}
review:
Si Unreal Tournament 2004 se hiciera hoy, este ser√≠a el resultado. Simplemente incre√≠ble. 
Este juego es un arena shooter hecho y derecho: las armas no se recargan (disparan hasta agotarse la munici√≥n), la energ√≠a no se regenera autom√°ticamente (hay que recolectar medkits), todos los jugadores empiezan con las mismas armas y condiciones (no hay clases, ni loadout previo). El juego es r√°pido, fren√©tico, y muy bien logrado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977812421', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1436538931}
review: played a game vs bots to get a feel on the weapons. They're perfect! the feel of the game is awesome and the only thing i dont like about it so far is the lack of maps (early access, cant be helped) and the lack of Windowed fullscreen. overall the game feels awesome and I recommend it to anyone who wants a genuine arena shooter that has the same feel as the 90's arena shooters like Unreal Tournament and Quake! 8/10 so far, will without a doubt rise when the things i addressed are implemenented! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197984621019', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1359, 'last_played': 1491137115}
review:
Derzeit gibt es viele spielbare, aber unfertige Arena FPS auf dem Markt. 
So haben wir die Wahl zwischen Reflex , der Unreal Tournament 4 Alpha , Toxikk und noch so manch kleinerem Projekt.
Nachdem ich quasi all diese Produkte nun mehr oder weniger ausgiebig gespielt habe( soweit es der aktuelle Entwicklungsstand und die Playerbase zulassen) macht Toxikk auf mich den vielversprechendsten Eindruck.
Vorweg muss ich Sagen, dass ich bisher eher Arena Shooter im Quake Style genossen habe. 
Ein gro√üer Grund war das fl√ºssige Movement durch Strafe Jumping und co.
Toxikk setzt eher auf Dodge Mechaniken und Walljumps um schnell von A nach B zu gelangen.
W√§hrend mich das bei UT 2k4 Eher gest√∂rt hat, macht es bei Toxikk wirklich Spa√ü.
Toxikk erm√∂glicht es sich durch Kombination dieser Mechaniken schnell und fl√ºssig durch die Maps zu bewegen. Ein Gutes Map Design tr√§gt nat√ºrlich bei dazu den Effekt weiter zu Unterst√ºtzen.
Die Waffen bereiten allesamt gro√üen Spa√ü. Sie sind gut durchdacht und vielf√§ltig genug, dass jede einzelne ihre Daseinsberechtigung hat.
Das Map Design ist wie bereits im Abschnitt zum Movement erw√§hnt hervorragend.

Zusammenfassend kann ich f√ºr Toxikk guten Gewissens eine Kaufempfehlung aussprechen.
Das Spiel wirkt deutlich ausgereifter als die gro√üe Konkurrenz und wird mit kommenden Updates eher noch besser als Schlechter.
Das Entwicklerteam wei√ü was es tut und die ver√∂ffentlichte entwicklungs Roadmap macht freude auf mehr.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055604085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1442694870}
review: Not what it claims to be.  all you need is a rocket launcher or a sniper rifle and you pretty much win.  The spawns are set at certain areas and people just camp them until they win the match. side-strafing is ridiculously overpowered and pretty much makes you untargetable. If you thought was going to be a decent FPS game you're completely wrong.  Its a cluster-F*ck of rocket launchers and sniper-rifles just murdering you at the spawn points.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004829815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1462571816}
review: Any fan of oldschool arena shooters will love what this game currently is; and might become. It has the fancyness of a modern game but still plays smoothly. Guns and movement feel great and the Twin Peaks map show interesting map design which is promising for future maps. Gamemodes like "Quake freeze tag" would be awesome to see in future developement. I just hope the developers stay true to their oldschool concept so we don't end up with another modern UT. In the future when theres more content, I really hope more players discover this excellent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975327788', 'num_games_owned': 1438, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1463310938}
review:
Frag like its 1999!

Yeah thats basically it. It feels like a good old arena shooter. Fast movement, fast jumping and fast shooting. No useable cover. Just you,your gun and your enemy. Well and, movement. Its fun like hell.
Sadly, at the moment its missing players. There usually is one server with a little amount of players playing. 
Thats not much, and its the reason i write this review. 
This game need more players. Come on guys, buy it!
So far there are only 2 maps in the game. One is like a deathmatch arena, the other one is with vehicles. 
Vehicles are doing very good in this game. Its very easy to control them, and from what ive seen, theyre not buggy. 

This game will become really awesome, if more maps and modes are added. Its in an early stage of development, so it lacks content. Hope the player numbers will rise soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043506328', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1424546703}
review:
Excelent game I have enjoyed it for the most part.

But I can not give it a thumbs up because of the lack of organization on their end. (let me explain)

I Pre-ordered the 4 pack with a DLC code, I recieved my 4 game codes once the game came out in an email i used the first code and have enjoyed the game from that point on, but then next day my email cleaned out all my unmarked emails. The 3 extra codes are gond, now thats not their fault my email deleted all my unmarked emails on schedule. But in good faith I susspected Reakktor Studios to have a database containing all the users who ordered the games and the keys they recieved, I contacted the support team and recieved an email telling me that they could not help me because they do not store that information.

And about that DLC code, I was sopose to recieve another email at the beginning of February with it but still have yet to recieve that email or help from the support team

All in all it is a great game just be sure you put those keys somewhere safe!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030457810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1463788921}
review: Fun game, but I am mediocre at it.This is made even more painful by the fact that the game is dominated by a handful of supreme players who make me feel like a retarded kid in a wheelchair being beaten up by Mike Tyson.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070866001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1424584365}
review: This game is worth the price if you want an action all the time FPS. I had to cut back on the graphics for my computer but they still look great. The only things is you are taken back to an older style of FPS, sort of like old counter strike. If you don't like not looking down iron sights you might enjoy this game! The other problem I see about it is it doesn't have such a big community; I know that's because it's newer and not a lot of people want to risk spending the money, but I think the game was worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993748260', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1581043336}
review:
Loved the game. Precise striking and amazing vehicle/combat system. I can't help but feel that one when you first started playing Halo on Beta... * Cough * Blood Gulgch * Cough

author: {'steamid': '76561198107581706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1433323464}
review:
Been playing this game for a while now and feel ready to write my review. This in a fast paces, action shooter that remindes me of Halo, COD: AW, and Quake: ET smashed into one game.

The multiplayer in freakin insane especially with the new map and game mode. If you cant play online then play against bots wich are some of the best bots I've seen in a long time.

What I would say to anyone even thinking about getting this game would be for them to "GET IT ALREADY!"

author: {'steamid': '76561197974798282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1441607750}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022214667', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1424680768}
review: Le renouveau du FPS est l√† ! <3 Concr√®tement, Toxikk c'est quake en HD. Un gameplay ultra nerveux, une palette d'armes, pas de rechargement, pas de classes, pas de niveaux d'XP (sauf pour la customisation du perso, qui est purement esth√©tique) Et pas de DLC. Un v√©ritable frag fest ultra fun et qui demande un certain niveau de skill. Pas de quickscope, de lance grenade et autres conneries. Un jeu que je conseille √† tous les vrai fans de FPS qui ne veulent plus de jeux arcades au possible (slt CoD). Cependant le jeu est en early access et ne vaut pas vraiment son prix pour le moment. Seulement 2 maps et 2 modes de jeux. Toutes les armes ne sont pas encore impl√©ment√©es etc. Mais Toxikk a un futur devant lui, j'ai confiance en Reaktor. Un jeu √† surveiller.

review: Qu'il est bon de retrouver les sensations d'un vrai fast-fps de nos jours. Il a jamais √©t√© aussi gratifiant de faire un frag ! Deux maps actuellement et une petite communaut√©, dont certains anciens pro-gamers de UT99 et UT2004. author: {'steamid': '76561198008511394', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1474922347}
review:
Okay, I'm usually really sceptical with Early Access titles, but this one just rocks! You liked Unreal Tournament or Quake? This one is for you!

Maybe you would like to wait until more maps are available but the existing two ones are already really great and the whole game looks very polished. Maybe more player models would be cool. But the gameplay already rocks! Really action paced and good looking graphics. The controls are perfect too.

To the developers: Keep up the good work and this game will be amazing! Thanks a lot: Long time not played such a game. Hope this one gets to retail stores too. This game deserves a big community!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998220309', 'num_games_owned': 774, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1501007945}
review: This game is fucking awesome. Real Halo/UT/Quake shit. Right now there's only 2 maps (one small FFA one and one huge CTF one), but the game isn't buggy and it's essentially fully featured. Some more vehicles would be nice (tank pls), but the core game is DONE, all the guns are there, the basic gamemodes are already made, and the game is goddamn beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963116899', 'num_games_owned': 2411, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1458091557}
review:
This game takes me back to a time when Quake, Half-Life, and Unreal Tournament owned my multiplayer fragging world. It's fast-paced, the weapons are familiar, and both the visuals and audio are excellent.

As of the time I write this, there are only two maps. I've played the crap out of the deathmatch map, and I've only started playing the capture the flag map. Both are lots of fun. I'm also very interested in the introduction of vehicles with the CTF map; they remind me a bit of Halo.

Assuming that the developer continues to add maps, modes, and mutators, I highly recommend the game's purchase when it goes gold. Until then, if you're willing to take a chance on early access and you don't mind a small subset of gameplay, I also recommend purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987843932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1473533482}
review:
2016
Toxikk toxikk.. It's not "frag like it's 1999" because the game never had that feel. Weapons are still unbalanced now that it's even out of Early Access, visibility still doesn't exist because it's very hard to spot an opponent from surrounding bells and whistle light effects and map design is just bad (aside from Deck 16 ripoff and that one bigger mayan themed map.). Other than those two maps, the maps are very horizontally designed which means they harken back more to CoD than arena shooters. Maps also are like everything else in this game, visuals > gameplay, meaning that they do look nice but do not play nice.

Toxikk is a very nice looking game but it just doesn't have that good feeling gameplay. Rocketlauncher projectile travel speed is still unbalanced, it's way too fast for an actual skillbased arena shooter.

Go for Unreal Tournament 4 instead than this.







2015
Due to this game being in an state where pretty much everything is still open and un-balanced, i just cannot recommend this at the moment. Weapons and pretty much everything is still totally open and waiting for fixing to be done. There is also only 2 maps available and no map editor for community to make maps. 

If you don't want unreal tournament but want something that is slightly like it, play wickland instead forexample since it's balanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982497018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1486338477}
review:
It's no UT2k4

I understand they wanted fast no-bs gunplay, but this is ridiculous. Seriously. Hitboxes are retarded, maps claustrophobic in a way that UT never was, and movement so ludicrously fast landing any sort of blow is 90% luck. 

Not only that. Armor and health pickups do next to nothing, since pretty much every gun does a stupid amount of damage. 

It's a shame, because the larger map really is a lot of fun. But the core combat is so dodge based, it's almost as if they forgot about the whole "Shooter" part. Vehicles are balanced really well, so there is that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978576524', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1424561875}
review:
This game, frankly put, is fucking awesome fun. I never realized up until now just how badly I missed this genre of shooters but DAMN. There is so much potential in Toxikk and I really hope to see it come into it's own. It's clear that the developers really understand what made the classic arena shooters so much fun to play in the first place. I never realized just how badly spoiled I have been by modern shooters, my twitch shooter skills are not what they once were.

As it stands right now however, I wouldn't reccomend purchasing it unless you truly want to support the game and it's developers. As of the time of writing this review there are only two (I think?) maps avaliable to play and there are still some severe balance issues in the weapons. If you're like me and you get fatigued quickly from playing the same map and/or game mode over and over again then I'd hold off for a little while.

That said; I have no regrets about supporting Toxikk as I truly want this game to succeed, we need more off the wall super fast arena shooters in the world and I believe that Reakktor could very well be the studio that is about to bring them back. Even in this early stage of development the game is well polished, everything works well and looks fantastic and it has some of the most engaging combat I've seen in an FPS for years now. Truthfully, I steer clear of Early Access games almost all the time unless I see one that I really believe in and Reakktor are well deserving of my faith.

I know a few people are concerned about the price point, but trust me. It is (or will be) absolutely worth it. Quake Live is great but I believe that Toxikk could well turn out to be even better than the Quake series was back in it's heyday. I think we're about to see the rebirth of the twitch shooter genre and it is going to be... A blurry, migraine inducing and hilarious mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015539882', 'num_games_owned': 3125, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1460286672}
review:
As of v0.75:
TOXIKK wants to be new Unreal Tournament.
And while it's still quite rough around the edges, it is definitely getting there.
The combat is quick, fun and all about learning maps, honing your reflexes and learning how to use dodge jumps.
No progression means everyone's equal at any time. And for me personally that's a very cool thing (at least I can't make an excuse that someone has higher level than me and that why I suck xD).
There are only two maps in the game, but they do show that devs know what they are doing - maps are very well designed, nicely balanced for all the game modes you can run them on, have enough space for close combat as well as for long range encounter, and of course look pretty cool.
The game code seems to be quite solid - I rarely had dips below 60 fps. And the ones that happened seemed to be related to particle emitters.
Cell capture mode (that is essentially CTF) is pretty awesome too. Mostly because of the huge map with vehicular combat and all the crazy stunts you can pull off.

So, if you like old-school arena FPS games - I'd definitely recommend TOXIKK.
And if you think that 3 game modes and two maps are not enough, then just add it to your wishlist and keep an eye on it. It is pretty damn enjoyable.

On the downsides:
- Game features only three modes and two maps at the moment
- Vehicles are behaving a bit whacky from time to time 
- Looks like weapons that emit a lot of particles (mainly flamethrower) currently crash the game
- For some reason game has mouse smoothing on by default (although it's barely noticeable)

More detailed look in the video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BY6o3eKB-HY

author: {'steamid': '76561198035610158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1473800345}
review:
Je vais essayer d'√™tre assez concis dans cette √©valuation par rapport √† la pr√©carit√© du d√©veloppement du jeu.
Comme je le disais, le jeu est tr√®s jeune, √† √† peine un mois de la sortie du jeu, on se dois de se poser la question : "Qu'est-ce que TOXIKK a √† nous proposer ?". A l'heure actuelle, je dirais un contenu assez limit√© (le jeu en est √† sont 2√®me Build, sois sa 2√®me grosse version du jeu). Qu'as t'on ma bonne dame ? Et bien, 3 modes de jeu, 2 maps, 7 armes... mais aussi de bonnes bases comme les mecaniques de d√©placements qui il faut le dire, sont difficilement criticables : on saute, on double jump, on straffe, on rocket jump et j'en passe et des meilleurs...
Que du vieux donc ? Pas que, parce que depuis le second build, un 3√®me mode de jeu vient s'ajouter au traditionnels Deathmatch (BloodLust) et au Team Deathmatch (Squad Assault) : Le Cell Capture, qui est en soit une sorte de Capture the Flag pimp√© √† la sauce des d√©veloppeur. Les d√©veloppeurs avaient promis des v√©hicules auxquels nous avons eu droit dans cette release : 5 v√©hicules (terrestres et aeriens) chacuns dot√©s, au m√™me titre que les armes d'une identit√© propre, de la m√™me mani√®re que chaque jeu contenant des v√©hicules aujourd'hui. 
Parlons en d√©tails des armes que je n'avais que survol√©es jusque l√† : 7 armes maintenant, 9 pr√©vus √† la fin du d√©veloppement. Ces armes, on les r√©cup√®re comme dans tout bon arena shooter qui se respecte, au fur et √† mesure que la partie se fait, sur des plaques o√π chacunes √† un temps particulier √† spawn (mis √† part le Raven pistolet que tout le monde poss√®de √† chaque r√©aparition). Donc ici, pas d'armes d√©bloqu√©es en ayant simplement rod√© le jeu, la seule chose d√©bloqu√©e au long de l'experience de jeu (√† par la customisation du personnage), c'est purement et simplement du skill. Les armes ne sont pas sp√©cialement originales dans leur fonctions principales, ce qui est probablement voulu par les d√©velloppeur du fait de l'argument old-school repla√ßant les joueurs de Quake en terrain connu : Un lance roquette (plut√¥t utile contre les v√©hicules en Cell-Capture), un fusil de sniper, un fusil √† pompasse, deux fusils d'assault, un lance flamme et un pistolet. Chacunes d'entre-elles poss√®dent une fonction secondaire plus moins utile (v√©rouillage de v√©hicules, lance grenade, etc...). Ces derni√®res sont plus o√π moins √©quilibr√©es m√™me si le jeu lui m√™me dit qu'elle sont volontairement gradu√©es en foncton de leur puissance. Nous n'avons donc de ce c√¥t√© rien de bien surprenant mis √† part leur game-design futuriste du plus bel effet.
Avide de customisations en tout genres ? Faites la queue, comme tout le monde ! Pour l'instant, l'aspect de personnalisation ne reste pas le point fort du jeu, mais ce n'est pas non-plus son point faible. Avec √† l'heure actuelle seulement quelques options de "Pimpage" comme la modification de votre r√©ticule de vis√©e, la couleur de votre troufion ou bien le genre d'armure qu'il porte InGame, les d√©veloppeur promettent non seulement d'am√©liorer cet aspect mais aussi de l'int√®grer au jeu (d√©blocage d'item esth√©tique gr√¢ce au level up).
Graphiquement parlant, et surtout pour une Early Access, le jeu est tr√®s bien con√ßu. Les textures des soldats et des 2 maps sont bien travaill√©es sans pour autant que les effets visuels ne vous donne l'envie de jeter votre Skyrim au toilettes.
Parlons maintenant gameplay, le truc qui fera l√¢cher 19 boulasses √† plus d'un d'entre vous ! Le jeu est un retour √† l'age d'or de l'arena shooter r√©ussi : je me suis vraiment rem√©mor√© (malgr√© le peu de temps auquel j'ai pu y jouer) mes parties d'Unreal Tournament dans lequel tout se jouer au plus rapide, agile, malin ! Bref, un r√©el retour au source de ce genre qui refais face avec des jeu comme Reflex (assez m√©connu du grand public et pourtant assez agr√©able √† jouer). C'est dynamique, fun, sans prises de t√™tes et c'est jouable. 

Si on r√©capitule : 

PROS : 
- Une r√©ele bouff√©e d'air frais avec son gameplay old-school √† la sauce moderne
- Un syst√®me assez √©quilibr√© entre chaques armes du jeu et leur spawn
- Des d√©veloppeurs impliqu√©es dans le d√©veloppement de leur jeu (des vieux de la vielle qui l√¢che un gros "NON" bien fat aux Free 2 Play) et un chemin tra√ß√© pour le jeu et son futur
- Une esth√©tique futuriste classe et des graphismes plus ou moins optimis√©s

CONS :
- Le manque de contenu √† l'heure actuelle
- Le prix (qui pourrait, en vu du contenu, en d√©tourner plus d'un)

Pour finir, je dirais que je recommande le jeu aux personnes qui appr√©cient les arena shooter et qui savent dans quoi ils s'embarquent : un jeu bon, mais en d√©but de d√©veloppement avec un contenu assez limit√© pour le moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017167209', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1493803892}
review:
For the first time in a while, I'm actually enjoying an online FPS --and this game isn't even finished. What does that say about the mainstream gaming industry? I appreciate this game because it goes back to basics. There's something about the simplicity in the combat and weapons system that is volumes more satisfying than any of the Triple-A blockbuster games in the genre today.

I've been enjoying myself. I discovered that I very rarely found myself pissed off or bored. Why?

***INCOMING RANT***

Because there is no bullshit in this game -- just as the developers have stated. There are no level 99, prestige 256, plays-this-more-than-he-goes-outside, 13-year-old, pissants, who apparently f**** everyone's mothers on a game-by-game basis, with completely decked-out gold-plated, diamond encrusted, Dorito (TM) sponsered, akimbo, rapid-fire, Panzerschrecks. There is no godforsaken, pay-to-win, microtransaction system. There are no killstreak-rewarded weapons of mass destruction. There are no premium-edition, day-zero, spend another $50 for the complete game experience, downloadable weapons/ maps. No bullshit.

This game reminded me why I originally fell in love with the FPS genre. It has brought me back to a time before a bi-annual Call of Duty release. Before Battlefield 5: Give Us Your Wallet. Before anyone gave a damn about the color you customized the laces on your soldier's boots.

It has brought me back to a time of Halo CE. A time of Counter Strike. A time of Unreal Tournament.

***END RANT***

I don't get mad when someone nails me in the head with a shot from their sniper rifle from miles away because I know that it took skill. In fact, I'm impressed by it. This game goes back to the time-honored tradition of shooting first and shooting precisely. The frag goes to the person with a truer aim. Not to the guy with better perks or a superior weapon unlocked late in the game. Everybody has an equal chance to use any weapon. You just have to find it on the battlefield first.

In short, this game is fair and fun. It is a FPS in the most traditional sense. I can only hope that Toxikk will spark a resurgeance of the traditional, competitive first-person shooter. Although, it isn't complete yet, it will be well worth the $20 and then some.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041308217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1424512912}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035029179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1501321797}
review:
I think everyone has been stung by an early access game at some in their gaming life.

TOXIKK is not like that. It runs on the tried, and tested Unreal Engine 3, and is well optimised for its early stages.

The devs are transparent, and know when they have made a mistake. For example, this is from the v0.73 patch notes: "To have it only accessible outside of a match was pretty stupid, but if you work with a game for years, you sometimes don't see the most obvious flaws."

It is good to see a dev admit a mistake so openly.

The beta roadmap is well planned out, and feature rich. - http://forum.toxikk.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=993 - So far they have kept to their release schedule.

The game plays well, and is very reminiscent of arena FPS games of old. Everything feels tight, and well balanced.

A must play from gamers who grew up with Quake, and Unreal Tournament.

It only has two maps as of now. The only good one is Foundation. Twin Peaks kind of sucks, feels like it should be in Halo or RenegadeX. However Foundation is Awesomely crafted with sick jump and Secrets. Gun play is Amazing. No BS. All based on your skill and not your Rank. Sometimes your ping though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018725684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1424297998}
review:
Its a good game, given that there aren't that many arena shooters being released .  Game runs smoothly , no hitbox issues or major latency issues either.  Guns for the most part are mostly balanced , although abit vanillaish in terms of variety versus other arena shooters .  

At the moment there aren't alot of maps or game modes or even mods / mutators, i'm sure this will change in the future. No microtransactions in this game ( as of 2/18/2015 ) and there aren't any " Pay to win" aspects that I've seen at all . 

Though they need to take the loading animation away from the character right after you respawn b/c you got fragged. Those 2-3 seconds = too much time for other people to react , esp in a DM .

author: {'steamid': '76561198054526076', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1429692497}
review:
Ok so I bought this and played it for a while and from what Im seeing, its nothing new.
I do respect what they tried to do with trying to revive the old Quake Arena/Unreal Tournament feel, but you cant have a shooter without BS.

-Game has almost no players on at anytime. (I think I saw 3 servers with people in them)
-for some reason everyone ditches the server when match is over so you get one game before having to search for another server
-Game pretty much consists of people grabbing:
A. The Rocket Launcher
B. The Sniper Rifle
C. A vehicle
-The servers I have seen people on seem to be running one boring mountain type map only. One Gamemode. No variation.
-No perks and such but you can grab +50 health right at your spawn, which everyone does so if you dont you will most certainly lose a firefight, which consists of only rockets or vehicles anyway.
-There is a jump and a double jump and everyone uses it like some kind of evasion tactic. Everyone jumps while theyre shooting for some reason, idk why.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015392731', 'num_games_owned': 1378, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1427555763}
review:
With the recent addition of vehicles, the reccomendation of this game is definately a "FUCK YES"

The vehicles are a bit weird to control at first. I think my biggest issue was thinking that i was in a flying vehicle when it was actually a hover vehicle.

The game play is almost reminescent of Halo serious in the bigger map.

The smaller maps are a closer game play to Quake, but different enough to stand on its own.

All guns have 2 firing modes beside the sniper, which is replaced with a scope. This makes for interesting mechanics, along with the ability to fake death and go invisible. These tools help you get by the noobs and show your dominance. Any veteran player will be able to quickly realise this though, and will wipe you out.

The controls are responsive and fluid. My biggest gripe was the Mouse Acceleration that is on by default, but can be disabled easily in the options.

Another down fall is the TAB button opens the console, and F1 opens the scored board. I think this is a default UE4 thing, and it should be changed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998104200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1490121381}
review:
Holy cow! This game is great!!
It's got only 2 maps and 3 (I believe) different playmodes so far but heck, I feel like back in the day when Halo 3 was out.
It's obviously just in early access but I think it's definitely worth those 18‚Ç¨. The gameplay is very addicting, fast pace and super smooth. I feel like they'll have to make a tutorial and tinker a bit with the maps (like make things that are visibly there actually "standable-on"(?)). 
There are a few neat cusomizations and the weapons all have totally different experiences to give, the vehicles are also awesome. This game is bound to become (even more) awesome (than it is already)!

If you're gonna waste some time, do it while playing this game, you won't regret it if you like fast pace shooters! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967830373', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1661192860}
review:
Wahnsinn! Endlich mal ein Spiel welches sich auf das wesentliche beschr√§nkt! Und zwar das, worauf es ankommt! Kein nerviges in Deckung gehen des Gegners mehr, der dann wieder mit voller Energie vor einem steht! Endlich wieder Power-ups auch wenn es da momentan nur Health-/R√ºstungsbooster sind. Aber allein schon wegen dem dauersprinten macht das Spiel hier mehr Spa√ü, als dieses "Ich bin Super Soldat der ganze Armeen im alleingang plattmacht, komme aber in Luftnot nach f√ºnf sekunden"-gehabe.
Dieses Spiel richtet sich eindeutig an die alte Generation von Spielern. Diejenigen die mit UT und Quake gro√ügeworden sind (oder so ziemlich jeden anderen Shooter im Deathmatch damals). Ebenso f√ºr all diejenigen welche die jetzigen Military shooter mechaniken nicht mehr sehen k√∂nnen und einfach die Schnauze voll davon haben.
Ist der Preis gerechtfertig f√ºr eine Early Access? Momentan gibt es vieleicht nicht viel, was ein Kritikpunkt ist. Aber der Entwickler hat einen netten To-do Plan im Forum, anhand dessen jeder verfolgen kann, wann ungef√§hr was kommen soll. Es ist sogar begr√ºndet, warum welches Element implementiert wird. Also f√ºr welche Testzwecke (Es ist eine Open Beta). Und ich denke mal, das der Titel mehr kosten wird, wenn er fertig ist. Hinzu kommt, das es Deutsche Entwickler sind, und wer unterst√ºzuz nicht gerne die heimische Industrie? ^^
Mit Neocron hatten sie schon Mut damals bewiesen. Ebenso wie ihre F√§higkeiten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973608826', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1473975977}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986409717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1424268395}
review:
Si eres de mi generaci√≥n y te metias en cibers para jugar lan con tus amigos o totales desconocidos a jugar a juegos como Quake 3, o Unreal tournament y lo echas de menos, este es tu juego.
Tiene el espiritu de esos juegos que tanto nos gustaban que eran muy directos y te daban exactamente lo que quer√≠as. adrenalina pura y dura. Batallas directas y r√°pidas en los que lo que contaba de verdad era MATAR Y NADA M√ÅS.
Los gr√°ficos son realmente buenos aun siendo un EA. Si eres de los que he dicho antes. no te arrepentiras. por el momento solamente hay 2 mapas y pocas armas, pero se a ciencia cierta que este juego va a ser increible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046705085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1546906740}
review:
This may be an early access game, but with the release of the .75 Curry patch, this game is really worth sinking hours into. With the addition of new vehicle gameplay, jetpacks, CTF gamemodes, and excelent quake-style strafe jumping, this is a great arena shooter I can see myself playing for many many hours to come. If you feel iffy about this being an early access title, don't be so wary. All the core gameplay elements and weapons are fleshed out, now the devs are just making content patches, such as future maps. One thing I'm not a fan of is that there is no editable FOV, viewmodel or otherwise. 

All in all, this is a great game to pick up on steam sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989778363', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1463252268}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018230286', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1563429448}
review: Exactly what the trailer promises.  Arena FPS, No bullshit.  Weapons are fun, vehicles are fun, movement mechanics freak out going up hills but are otherwise fun, game is all around a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988365551', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 4548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1490443683}
review:
If you love UT99 / 2004 (and 3 of course :-)) .... you'll love this one.

This early access version actually feels like a final game. It is highly polished, the gameplay works almost flawless.
I'm just as much hyped as I've been when UT2003 came out. Toxikk is a bomb of a game.
Today, the newest update has been released, featuring the vehicular mode capture the cell (basically vCTF but with little interesting twists!) and a new map.
So far the beta only has two maps but I've been playing them for nearly 20hours total. Roughly 15hours on just the first map..
The game is highly addicting and fun. That is not only my opinion but the opinion of dozens of players in the game chat. The players are friendly and fair (so far). I could not find any harassment yet. I could always find a server with players. Even though it's just a test version with (as of writing this) 2 maps.
Oh did I mention the graphics look gorgeous.........?

I really love what Reakktor Studios have done with this. In my opinion it sets the newest milestone for arena fps!
With more maps coming, this game will beat everything comparable out there, hands down. I don't even care about the newest UT in the making since they don't even seem to know what they're doing and Toxikk already sets the bar really high!

Skill wins here, no bullshit luck with unlocked perks and upgrades...
If you want to compete your skill. Play Toxikk.

Frag like it's 1999

author: {'steamid': '76561197967079158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1584572837}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971741691', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1426844218}
review: TOXIKK is an old-school arena style shooter with a modern facelift. In the spirit of Quake and Unreal Tournament, it very nicely scratches the itch for a twitchy, skill based shooter - in an age of cover mechanics, skill progression and unlocks, it's a pleasant supprise to find a new game focused on individual skill rather than simply rewarding whoever has been playing the longest with advantages over their competitors.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022747099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1424200027}
review: Fast paced action fps. As said before; Unreal'ish. Started with 1 map and 2 game modes (DM and TDM) it was fun. Now with the new content (Cell Capture + bigger map) it's more versatile. And even more fun. Even in its current state. I'd recommend it for sure. It's still early access, but developers seem to be consistent and live up to their promises.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014158345', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1479855912}
review:
A throwback to 90's gaming culture, TOXIKK is an arena shooter with bright, neon colors, and a puzzling level design that favors corners over open fields, and promotes fast paced gameplay with powerful weapons. Even in its early stages with only one map (this review is written as of 0.73 Wasabi), the game shows a balanced arsenal where one doesn't even feel guilty for using the rocket launcher.

Although many players may have already been introduced to the genre, TOXIKK holds its appeal for new players that freshen up the pool to add new experiences, and wage new wars. However, this comes at a price since the arena shooter genre has gone all but extinct since the 90's, with the last "popular" arena FPS being Unreal Tournament III in 2006, which was poorly recieved due to its unbalanced weapons and poor movement.

However, TOXIKK features improved movement in comparison to UT3, and again, a more balanced arsenal where a player is encouraged to utilize all weapons at their disposal. With the development team faithfully taking the opinions of the players to heart, weapon balance is still being perfected even now.

A nostalgia trip for old school gamers, and a new experience that completely abandons that of modern shooters for the new generation, TOXIKK is an amazing game that revitalizes its genre with fast paced action and impressive graphics (for an indie game especially). Reakktor Studios is putting their money where their mouth is, and indeed letting us "Frag like it's 1999"!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063364156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1685024425}
review:
Absolutely fantastic game, especially as it's in Alpha. Very quick gameplay with a variety of weapons. Just some thinks that could do with tweaking: 
1. If you pick up a gun that the game thinks is better that the one that you are using it changes it which is good due to the quick nature of the game. However the choises it makes can be a little confusing as the Violator for example is much better that the Dragoneer or the Falcon because of the grenade  but it swaps to one of the other two if you pick one up. Please could we have of editing the order of priorities in the settings.
 2. I know that this game is in Alpha but we need more game modes and maps. The concept art look amazing so please can we have what's in them. Apart from that the game shows promise and is really fun.
P.S F8 and F7 do weird things...

author: {'steamid': '76561198071619552', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1497772508}
review: Needs hit markers or a noise that tells you your actually hitting, different crosshairs, brighter character models, Better pistol/ spawn on random weapon, rocket is a little broken, bigger, more open maps, a temporary spawn sheild so you don't get spawn killed, an equipable melee weapon, and maybe later on a grappling hook for other game modes. But for an early access arena shooter, its great. Would wait for more maps before purchasing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987043233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1423886549}
review:
[h1] What I think of Toxikk [/h1]
[i] A continued update [/i]
 
This game [u]looks[/u] great. It has great visual details to it, sparks, explosions, laser pew pew pews, but I think that's where it stops being a [i]good[/i] game. 

Let's start with the pros, shall we?:

[b]Pros[/b]:
[list]
[*] Polished Beta
[*] Visually amazing
[*] Classic UT competitive feel
[*] Shows a lot of promise
[/list]

[b]Description of Pros[/b]

What a great game to first start up and get into. The color choices, graphical additions (explosions, etc), and yes, even down to what they let you set in the settings, this game has it going on. With the vehicle additions, bigger maps, and other promises, I can see this game going far. I'd love to experience all of that in the final expansions to this game's beta and final release. For now, we can expect the devs to slowly roll out what they have to add.

[b]Cons[/b]:
[list]
[*] Terrible map design on this first map
[*] The worst starting pistol ever designed
[*] Sluggish character movement and terrible shift key (It's a mix of a jump run).
[*] Starting settings are terrible
[*] Unfair weapon choices (Rocket launcher dependent)
[*] Gameplay seems sacrificed in order to maintain a sense of "hardcore". 
[*] Gun pick ups take too long?
[/list]

[b]Description of Cons[/b]

Now... Where to begin... Let's start with the horrid map design. I don't know who was in charge of this beauty, but they need to check their work again. The map design feels like a mix of Call of Duty meets Operation Metro from BF4. Extremely tight corners, tunnels leadiing to MAYBE 1 or 2 exits, and really just feels cogested. Extremely focused gameplay on the rocket leads to choke points in that area. 

The pistol deserves it's own paragraph because, I'm telling you, this thing is the shittiest invetion of all time. It's a single shot left click, triple shot right click (Think the glock in CS). The damage is unbelieveable terrible and where it fires comparative to the actual location pointing at seems off to say the least. I don't think this pistol should be in the game due to the fact that when everyone has the laser rifle or rocket launcher, you're stuck spawnin with this sack of shit and get instantly killed.

Ugh. This game feels SLOW. Against UT2004, this just doesn't feel anywhere close to as fluid, nor do I feel like the shift key helps you in any regard. You slow down to as if you were standing still after using the shift, forcing you to jump, or do something else, such as get killed. If you guys want a fast-paced (T)DM, this isn't the game for you. The mixture of tight hallways, lack of fluid movement, and unfair weapon choices kills it.

I don't know if anyone else noticed this, but the added acceleration in the mouse controls killed a whole round for me. It's WAY too fast. My G502 literally whipped around as if I was on crack trying to aim at people. I can't do it. Had to turn that shit off. Why isn't Raw acceleration in the settings?

The rocket launcher and possibly laser rifle are the only two guns worth using. Really guys? Back in UT2004, almost everything was worth using, even that fucking shield if you wanted to piss someone off. I'd rather have that shield than the shitty pistol you gave us. C'mon now.

This is the most important point, too. They want no bullshit, but have sacrificed raw gameplay in order to achieve it. You start out with a shitty weapon, have to go find the two weapons that are the best, most likely die in the interim, spawn in against some rocket launcher, and continue. That's bullshit in my eyes. UT2004 at least gave you an AR + Shield combo to start in with. You guys want to frag like 1999? This isn't the way to do it. 

Maybe this is jsut me, but the gun pick up time limit seems much, much longer than any UT/Quake game I've ever played. What do you think?

[/rant]

Thanks for reading through. I will continually add on to this as I see fit, but for now, I will continue playing when more people get on. Seems pretty dead so far. Deathmatch is just not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999550642', 'num_games_owned': 594, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1454861969}
review:
The game looks stylish and works smooth in its current state (as of 13.02.2015). Imagine a faster and more beautiful version of UT3. That's what gameplay feels like atm. Design is a mix of Halo and some hi-tech-almost-cyberpunk futuristi—Å atmosphere. There's only one map available now and it's a neon megapolis sort of map for (team) deathmatch mode. However, there'll be more features released soon, considering what we may see from the trailers. The game looks and feels pretty good right now. Even extremely good, knowing the fact that it's in early access state.
I hate early access just as many of you. I had a lot of bad experience with the games in early access. But Toxikk is a different story. 
Waiting for further updates and fragging like it's '99!

TL;DR: It's promising and pretty damn good for an early access game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088491343', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1494275719}
review:
One of the best FPS shooting games since half life / ut / quake. Movement in the game is rly good and weapons feel nice.
Its rly nice that u can also set up ur fov altought yet there are not so many players in the servers, but i hope that will change after they patch the game with new content.

I hope  weapon models will be hideable in the future and the swapping would be faster between weapons (I mean for example if u shoot with Bullcraft and swap to cerberus, it needs to load bullcraft before it swaps wpn).
Atleast they weakened cerberus instatly while it was getting negative comments from ppl as being too op weapon.

Overall: really good game with that old fps arena feeling, would give it 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030695488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1484027177}
review:
So if you want a new FPS game in your library that is loads of fun to play, this is the game. This is the game that every old school shooter fan needs. It has an old school feel with beautiful and gorgeous visuals of modern titles.

Despite being in Early Access, the graphics are very polished and gameplay is extremely well done. It has those familiar controls from arena shooters like Quake, Unreal Tournament, Turok Rage Wars, and even a few elements from the first Halo game. It's fast, it's fun, It's time to frag like it's 1999!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970294612', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1438115089}
review:
Okay, I wanna keep it really simple: THIS IS SO FREAKING AWESOME AND FUN! Really, you get set back to the glorious old school arena shooters without any hassle, no f* recoil, reload, scoping, camping. 

Just plain simple arena deathmatch and team deathmatch. Even in Early Access this games is promising and gives back the fun to the shooter genre after it got broken by so many "tactical" shooters that are overhyped like CoD and Battlefield.

Just one last sentence: BUY IT! Support the dev to make this game even better by helping them getting money for this awesome shooter!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970966763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1423374308}
review:
I will judge this game ttaking some things into consideration.  1)  This is a BETA and as such is incomplete  2)  related to Beta status, there is one map and 2 game types right now.

So, if you are a COD/BF fan looking for your next game, please keep on looking, im sure the next rehash of those games will come soon.  This is not a game based off of modern combat and using iron sights, this is a twitch game.  If you loved Q2/3 and UT99, this is the game for you.  Not saying it is perfect, and I doubt anything will fully replace UT99 or Q3 for me, but this is, FROM WHAT IS RELEASED RIGHT NOW, a game worthy of carrying the torch for those.  

The game is fast and frantic, fun weapons, starter wep blows, badly, Makes me with for the cheesey machinegun form Q3 or the Enforcer., also I think the Dragoneer blocks vision a bit too much, but overall, from what is complete I have no major complaints.

I am looking forward to more game types coming, as well as the option of starting private servers and that we can contribute content, just like the old days of UT.  Graphics are good, not the best, but good, also while SLI is stablke, it is not utilizing the other card(s), which isn't a huge deal, but I would like to see this detail added/corrected as time goes on.  There are some functions that need a bit of clarification as well, btu I think that will come with time as well.

Right now, I am looking forward to some more game time and having some old twitchy fun.

Today I give this a 7/10, and likely this will go up as the game matures and gets closer to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015500917', 'num_games_owned': 4584, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1423327629}
review:
Ill keep it short cause its easy to judge this Game.	

[h1] Low-budget Version of Unreal Tournament 3.	 .[/h1]

You can argue that UT3 is not the best one in the Unreal Series, still i compare it to Toxikk because its copying many elements of this last Unreal Version.  

Both Games grant FPS action gameplay, but Toxxic feels so sluggish, slow,boring and shallow that i cant really enjoy it.
Especially the in-Game Characters... All Robots just with different colours, how creative. 

The Music and Sounds as well as the Voiceover are kinda narcotic.  
Another disadvantage of Toxikk is the Movement. "Running", if you wanna call it like that, jumping and other moves feels like in slowmotion.


If you compare both Games (The positive Aspects)

[b] Unreal Tournament 3:	[/b]

- 8 Years old 
- Better Graphics (!!!)
- Better Physix
- Better Animations
- Better Voiceacting
- Better Leveldesign
- Better AI
- Better Gameplay
- Better Soundtrack
- Better Soundeffects
- More demanding Achievements
- More detailed Character design
- More Levels
- More Gamemodes
- Campain Mode

...

[b] TOXIKK:	[/b]

- has VAC which is good of course. 
- 1 Euro cheaper


[h1] Toxikk is not all bad, but there is no reason to prefer this over UT3. It just feels like a cheap remake of UT with no atmosphere. [/h1]


There have been other halfhearted clones of Unreal and Quake, take for example "Nexuiz".
Im pretty sure that TOXIKK will go the same way, short hype, then forgotten and removed. 

i wonder why the developers even made this game here, there is nothing original in it. 

honestly, If you like TOXIKK you should really try out Unreal Tournament 3 as well and see how much better it is.  -> http://store.steampowered.com/app/13210/



[h1]I can not recommend this, because this is just a bad imitation.[/h1]


PS,: [spoiler]  If you take a closer look at the positive Reviews, you will notice the schema that many of them oddly say that Toxikk is so great and reminds them of Quake, Unreal "and the good old days"...
Ive played Unreal and Quake since the first ones came out and i cant really follow this statement.
Quake and Unreal were fantastic, fast and demanding Games.
Toxikk's Gameplay is so slow and weird compared to that, due to the weird Movement.

That lets me question the authenticity of those Reviews. 
You could get the Idea that someone either paid for positive Reviews, or that the Authors never actually played Unreal Tournament or Quake 3 Arena.  [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198061179758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1473537615}
review:
Gameplay: 07/10 (gr√∂√üere Community fehlt)
Grafik: 9/10 (sehr sch√∂n und auch stets fl√ºssige Performance)
Gesamtkonzept: 8/10

TOXIKK bietet schnelles Gameplay auf relativ hohem Grafiknivau. Es l√§uft fl√ºssig, die Maps sind detailreich und ordentlich gestaltet. Man hat viele Optionen, Waffentypen, Fortbewegungsm√∂glichkeiten usw. Das Einzige was diesem Spiel noch fehlt um es wirklich perfekt zu machen sind die Spieler. Es gibt momentan nur eine sehr kleine Community und daher sind die meisten Server nicht wirklich voll. Was mir auch nicht so gefallen hat nach dem 1.0 Release waren die (relativ) hohen Pings, welche !!manchmal!! deutlich √ºber den spielbaren 100 lagen. Allerdings muss man dazu sagen, dass die Entwickler bald Werbung machen wollen.. Mal sehen ob das klappt... Wenn nicht, dann ist TOXIKK leider nicht zu empfehlen, da solche Spiele von einer gro√üen Community leben.
Aber Alles in Allem sei gesagt, dass ich jedem der gerne ArenaShooter spielt dieses Spiel wirklich empfehle, auch wenn man nur CS:GO oder CoD/Battlefield kennt, sollte man es nicht vers√§umen hier mal rein zu schauen :)
" Frag Like It's 1999 "

author: {'steamid': '76561198070177578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1507637401}

author: {'steamid': '76561198135093487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1561, 'last_played': 1681703021}
review:
This was a game i wasn't really sure about.
But after giving it a go i do believe i can give a positive response.
So here we go.

Toxikk is an arena first person shooter, along the lines of quake and or unreal tournament.
With that said however, I personally find this game much more enjoyable.

Pros:
       Extremely fast gameplay.
       Beautiful graphics.
       Nice variety within the weapons.
       A little customization (something i didn't think this game would have)
       
I should also mention you have the ability to fake death.
But now for the

Cons:
    
         As of now only three game modes. (more on the way)
         Lack of innovation.
         Lack of playerbase.
        
 Fixed issues: A bug with the wasabi build where i can't change my resolution.
 
(note bugs are being fixed)

This game is extremely fun, but it plays extremely similiar to other arena fps games.
As it is the game needs something to set it apart, something that makes people say hey!
This is a new experience few other games can give me! And while vehicular combat is a start, 
it still needs that extra MMPH ya know?
Would I suggest you buy this game, yes.
it may not be the most unique game you can get but it certainly is a joyride,
and besides we need more online players to form a community and help bring back
the arena fps genre.
With that said, I personally give this game an 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197988421785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1480283074}
review:
Buon FPS. Di solito diffido molto dei giochi in early access ma non mi sono pentito dell'acquisto. I developer sembrano molto attivi e escono molto spesso aggiornamenti per il bilanciamento o nuovi contenuti.

Il tipo di gioco √® facile da intuire: un fps arena puro. Niente di nuovo. Niente innovazione. Non un difetto, ma un qualcosa di ricercato dagli sviluppatori.

Al momento ho trovato solo pochi bug non importanti (una volta lo schermo mi √® rimasto sfocato) e e alcune cose da sistemare come il non poter accedere alle opzioni di gioco durante una partita. Entrambi saranno risolti con la prossima patch di questa settimana.

Non posso fare altro che consigliarlo a chi cerca un fps arena vecchio stile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027598234', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1479822900}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978146154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1423289356}
review: I'm pretty sure the rave reviews are all lies. I consider myself officially robbed after paying $20 for this. If it were free, I still wouldn't recommend it as it would be a giant waste of your time. This is really a crime to the integrity of the reviews. Steam may need to look at only allowing members with a certain level of experience and time served to post reviews. Perhaps an optional/default filter because I was fooled. It's just a really lame shooter that plays like a single developer took an old shooter engine and combined it with the recycled graphics from some previously failed game to make this. Do not spend anywhere near $20.00 for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992657802', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1623734517}
review: This is a game for anyone looking to jump into some Unreal Tournament style action early on. While the game only has one map and two game modes currently available, there is a detailed road map that has full content by May. It is very polished and the developer is talking with the community and implementing changes based on reactions there. At the very least watch a stream of it before dismissing it, it is some fast paced arena fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063604052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1664150987}
review:
Although this game is still in beta, it makes AAA title Betas look like abandoned projects. The weapon system was slightly unbalanced at first, but after they changed up weapon strengths/spawn times, it has become much more enjoyable. I prefer base loadouts for all players in a FPS; it keeps the playing field level. But when a game allows you to hoard weapons, it can be very frustrating to players trying to find a gun that will stand a chance. This game does not have that problem.
 Everything about this title so far has delivered. It is a no-nonsense fast paced old school shooter with a new age feel. There are no perks or classes. The only thing that determines the win is skill, and a little luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979825407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1429132206}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978575158', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1489337842}
review: Great game. Back to the roots FPS. Fast and fluid gameplay keeps me playing round after round. Really reminds me of quake and UT days. Highly recommend beats playing COD and Battlefield.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977554965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1442090918}
review:
This game still has a long way to go, but it does show signs of promise. While the graphics engine & gameplay is smooth there is currently very little to it.

Simply put:
- There is only 1 map.
- The game mimicks Unreal Tournament gameplay.
- Configuring the mouse sensitivity is a bit frustrating - you cannot configure options in-game.

This is an early access game... and just like many others currently on Steam I urge you to wait for the game to properly release before buying into it.

This game shows promise and you can tell that the creators have had a lot of help from the UT format of gameplay. Keep an eye on this one, it is fluid and graphically pleasing, but in no way ready for the public.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979967883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1426461096}
review:
This game is exactly what it looks like and what they say it is. if you're looking for an ultra-fast-paced, old-school shooter, get it.

Also, these devs understand Early Access better than most. Rather than release a 0.0001 and expect people to bear with them for an eternal alpha, they have a beta whose biggest changes are balance-related. There is currently only one map available not because they decided to build 10% of a product and ship it as is, but because they want to make sure the weapons are balanced with as few variables as possible before they turn on another slew of already-created, yet-to-be-100%-polished content. They currently plan to have the next massive wave of content released around February 12, following the last of the major weapon balance tweaks.

Great gameplay, great performance (!), great devs! Can't wait for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022461865', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1515662015}
review:
Overall Rating: 9.7/10

This is such a simple little arena shooter and yet, I see myself in the future, jumping on top of people's heads right before they explode into oblivion from the onslaught of powerful pellets propelled from my Bullcraft, simply by clicking Mouse 2, or I watch as someone's head is turned into a red mushy melon-like substance when I Dodge-Jump around the corner, only to do a complete Ten-Eighty and scope in with the Falcon, mere milliseconds before the trigger is pulled.

Moving on...this game runs extremely well. I'm certain hardware from 2012 and above will have no issues playing this game. Two Game Modes and One Map is fine by me. Tweak what you have now, and work your way up to bigger things, it's better than throwing it all out on the table from the get-go, only to have none of it work or be worth anything.

For an Early Access title, you'd expect there to be hundred of bugs and glitches that need fixed or tweaked. This is not the case here, as I doubt you'll find more than a few minor bugs here and there, and since you have console access, you can most likely fix your issues from there.
