author: {'steamid': '76561198122755847', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1599327806}
review:
TOXIKK may be the best Early Access game I've ever played.

Being someone who still plays arena shooters on a regualr basis, I can say that as an arena FPS, TOXIKK is pure gold. If you've played UT and are familar with the dodge and movement mechanics, you will be familar with this game. Weapons feel great and the devs are taking weapon balance as their top priority, which is more than i can say for others. [spoiler] Yes YOU Bungie.	[/spoiler]

Performance wise it runs perfectly fine on my middle-tier PC on around medium settings while still looking really damn nice. Bugs? I haven't encountered any. NONE.  Bots are included and function perfectly for those who want them.

The only con I can think of is that there is only one DM/TDM map at the time of writing. Vehicles and much bigger maps are on their way with regular updates.

In conclusion, this game is fucking awesome and kicking sand in the face of the plague that is the modern military shooter.

Highly Recommended.

review: I've played 1000s of hours of quake 3: rocket arena, cpma, etc.  This game reminds me more of unreal, but there's some quake flavor as well.  It's pretty good, but right now there is only one map.  The weapons are not yet balanced.  It could turn into something awesome, but right now it just makes me want to log into quake live.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006990591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1422745194}
review: So this is how I see it... Cliffy B and a few other guys are sitting around smokin rocks and shooting meth, playing Quake 3 and Unreal Tournament until they were so high that they just stood aside and said...... LETS MAKE THIS FASTER!!! FASTER! FAAAASTERRR!!!!  It doesn't get any more old school arena than this.  I would like to see a few additions but this is still such an early build of the game that I can't knock em for that yet.. So far, good job !  Let's see some original ideas in this. We already have Unreal Tournament and we already have Quake 3 Arena. I hope to see the talent involved add some genre bending additions to this in future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971889697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1426731719}
review: There's one map. I'm playing it over and over again shooting people. the graphics are cool, but I've turned them all the way down to get 150+ fps steady. the shotgun is stupid only because its a very confimed map.  Get rekt by really good players all day. improving is where the fun is at.  Feign death is useless in this mode but i can see how it could be interesting in large ut2k4 style ctf maps that are coming. cloak is interesting, but maybe too short and too long to reload to be relevant. NEEDS crosshair customization. This should be the number one configy thing they should add first.  FOV selector is cool (play on max ^-^). music is cool.  hit detection is nice.  people will rek you. buy alpha.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995096124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1472739752}
review:
I was quite worried about supporting another early access game, but Toxikk was worth the jump. 
It has a great ' roadmap ' for development, and the devs seem to listen to feedback. 

If you enjoy arena-first person shooters, that are similar to Unreal Tournament or games without the mumbo-jumbo like COD, then this game is for you! 

However, it only has one map, but in my opinion it is good enough to get a feel for the game. With 8 player modes and 16 players modes, normal deathmatch and team deathmatch.

review:
Bell'arena shooter!
Sono nuovo del genere e devo dire che muoio solo :)..√® uno di quei giochi dove la conoscenza della mappa, l'abilit√† di mira e la capacit√† di prevedere le mosse dell'avversario danno un enorme vantaggio sulla partita, e quindi agli inizi √® normale fare dei 0-10 per pi√π volte, ma questo deve proprio invogliare ad impegnarsi di pi√π, per fare finalmente la prima kill! In alternativa ci si pu√≤ allenare con i bot, selezionando tra molti livelli di difficolt√†.

Comparto grafico molto elevato senza impatto sulle prestazioni, √® un gioco molto leggero infatti; anche l'audio √® buono.
Grande personalizzazione delle impostazioni del mouse, personalizzazione del proprio character (colore, sottocolori, tag, clantag).

Lo consiglio in questo momento (uscito da pochi giorni) se volete giocare mentre il gioco si evolve e prende forma (con nuove modalit√† di gioco, armi, mappe, anche veicoli) nel suo sviluppo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994319342', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1475979209}
review:
This game is really fun. It REEKS of the late 90s/early 2000s arena shooters with all the modern flair of a new game. The levels are solid, the movement and  combat is smooth as butter, the visuals are incredible. This game really is the real deal.

There's a real resurgence of arena shooters and elements of arena shooters lately - the return of Unreal, Doom, Quake, and other classic franchises harken back to the LAN party frag-fests of yesteryear but with modern graphics and slick vfx. Truth be told, if you're looking for the best arena shooter out today, this probably isn't for you, but if you're looking to take a step away from Quake Champions to try out something new, this is a competent arena shooter that puts its best foot forward into a crowded genre of top not games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065158372', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1546186258}
review: This game is incredibly well optimized, fast paced and very addicting! Its a great throwback to early arena shooters and will hopefully be recognized as a classic one day. Though its early access, there are nearly no bugs or glitches, it feels like a nearly finished game (Of course missing all the maps, only one is available at the moment). Please support this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198153725149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1619236843}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965198313', 'num_games_owned': 1162, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1473962056}
review:
Toxikk feels and plays like Unreal Tournament but with new shiny graphics. The concept of bringing back arena shooters has been a great thought and this game is really well done so far. 

You can't go in thinking it's a completed game because it really is not. You have one map so far (which is well made and feels balanced) and like 5 guns that you will know well if you have played any arena shooter before. It feels pretty balanced although some guns can use a bit more tweaking.

Graphically it looks really good for how well it runs, and it feels like a futuristic battleground, but for now with only one map and a couple character models you can't really see how well it holds up under other environments, but I have high hopes. 

It's fun, that's all that matters at this point in early access, I'm hoping they can advertise this and get more people on board, because it's looking good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977663612', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1556511836}
review:
Highly recommend this game, for any FPS gamer, and esspecially for those hardcore arena FPS types who usually play Unreal or Quake, this game is awesome. 

Movement feels great, and that's one of the main things to get right for an arena FPS game like this, so good job Toxikk on that. As well as the gunplay, guns are satisfying to kill people with, especially with the sniper rifle or shotgun, but that's just me. 

Very satisfied with my purchase, and they're going to be adding a lot more content as time goes on.

Wer sich den Trailer angeschaut hat wird gesehen haben, dass bald Spielmodi hinzugef√ºgt werden die Fahrzeuge beinhalten usw. Hat also noch unglaublich viel Potential! 
Obwohl Early-Access, klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr jeden der auf Arena Shooter steht. :)

review:
TOXIKK is a unreal tournament 2004 clone with a different weaponset and devs that care about their community.
Personally love the game and I would recommend it to anyone who is either a fan of oldschool twitch/arena shooters and/or tired of the tons of 2 weapon max, ironsight, levelup-perk millitaryshooters of today

author: {'steamid': '76561198031862711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1475504501}
review:
ok this game is just awesome and i think it totally worth every penny . if u are a ut,quake arena fps fan u gonna love this game

it's built on unreal and the grafics are pretty good but i prefer to play on low settings to get a much cleaner image. it runs very smooth , 144fps constantly on both max and low settings on my i7 920 3.8ghz ,gtx 770.

i havent seen any bug yet but devs must fix some things..for example u cant change options in the middle of a match.

the gameplay is simple.... run, double jump, dodge, aim and kill  also u can use your cloak ability to engage or  avoid enemies

at current early access build the game has only one small urban map and dm tdm and one more gamemode i havent played yet... 

i think they ask too much money for that amount of content the game has now but im sure devs will not dissapoint us and add much more content soon.

UT fans reunite and get it

author: {'steamid': '76561197975942806', 'num_games_owned': 6505, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1473787423}
review:
Ok, Early Access meint hier: 2 Gamemodes, die da sind DM und TDM . . . und genau EINE Map . . .

Und dennoch bin ich total happy mit diesem Kauf. Das Spiel ist dem klassischen Arena-FPS Genre entsprechend kurzweilig, die Waffen sind allesamt interessant und effizient gegenseitig ausspielbar, das balancing l√§uft auf hochtouren, sogar was einzelne Pickups auf der Map betrifft wird hier alles geschraubt und gedreht bis es eben passt. 

Gro√üe Versprechungen stehen im Raum, Mutatoren und andere Spielmodis werden zwar "erw√§hnt" (z.b. im MP Filter) aber das kann und wird hoffentlich auch alles noch nach und nach kommen. Wenn diese Liebe zum Detail und zur perfektion dahinter beibehalten wird, kann dies nat√ºrlich auch noch etwas dauern, aber das ist es allemal wert. 

Wer jetzt sagt.. "EINE MAP??? WUCHER !" Der sei bitte an die gute alte Zeit zur√ºck erinnert, als ein Gro√üteil der Server f√ºr Unreal Tournament "Deck 16 Only" oder etwas gleichartiges im Namen f√ºhrten... 
Manchmal braucht es nur eine Map um gl√ºcklich zu sein. 

Hier jedenfalls werden Arena-FPS-Spieler eine sch√∂ne Heimat finden, 
egal ob jetzt sofort, so sie sich auf Early Access einlassen m√∂chten. ... oder eben sp√§ter ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198071145242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1424189482}
review:
I always was a huge fan of arena FPS (especially UT series). So i suddenly found this game on my Steam list and when i saw the trailer i thought my dreams were coming true. I instantly bought the game and tried it out. 

So first here are the good things about the game:
It really holds its promise of being an old school arena FPS. The combat is fast and dynamic, there are dodge jumps, wall jumps and even rocket jumps.
The weapons feel unique in their own way, Some work well on long range, some work better on short range and then there are those that combine these things with the primary and secondary fire, but they have some balance issues (I'll talk about that later).
The graphics arent really impressive but they look nice.

So here are the things that need improvement:
The only weapon thats too strong ATM is the rocket launcher, but its already been confirmed that its gonna get nerfed so that isnt really an issue anymore.
Probably the biggest issue of the game at the moment is how the weapon pick ups work. As soon as someone picks up a weapon it takes 15 seconds for it to reapawn. Thats way too long, especially considering that when you get into a 1v1 against someone when you only have the pistol and he has any other weapon youre 95% gonna lose.
Another point i really dont like is the weapon design. The weapons look way to realistic and they are all white. Take Unreal Tournament for example. Youd never see anything close to the rocket launcher or flack cannon in real life. Also you can see what weapon you are carrying only by looking at the colour.
There are no HUD customization options. Quake and Unreal Tournament had a lot of hud customization. In Quake you could even select your weapon to be on the centre of the screem wich gave a really cool old school feeling.
On the current map 8 players is too much for a deathmatch. I recommend going on a 6 or even 4 player server,

So heres my final verdict: The game may be frustating at times or feel unfair because of the weapon spawns, but the really good old school FPS gameplay makes up for all the issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052320987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1422698347}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999652637', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 2393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1598273623}
review:
W√§hrend ein Namen wie "Toxikk" das schlimmste erwarten l√§sst und der Trailer eher zeigt was das Spiel [b]nicht[/b] hat, handelt es sich dabei um ein tats√§chlich ziemlich guten Arenashooter. Ihr wisst schon: Diese schnellen Spiele mit vielen Waffen bei denen irgendwelche Leute immer meinen, dass es ja "genau so wie Halo" aussieht.

Das Movement erinnert mit Doppelspr√ºngen und dem Dodging stark an Unreal Tournament, geht aber deutlich weicher von der Hand. Jede Waffe kommt mit einer alternativ Funktion, w√§hrend die Auswahl an sich relativ konventionell bleibt.

Die Early Access Version l√§uft bisher sauber, es gibt jetzt schon Bots zum offline √ºben und es gibt nur recht wenige Bugs. Allerdings existiert im Moment nur eine einzige Map f√ºr Deathmatch/Team-Deathmatch und es gibt diverse Balancingprobleme.
Die [url=http://forum.toxikk.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=993] Beta-Roadmap[/url] im Entwicklerforum zeigt daf√ºr auf wann welche Updates kommen und was genau getestet werden soll. Sowas sollte eigentlich bei [b]JEDEM[/b] Early Access Spiel pflicht sein.

Bisher kann ich das Spiel empfehlen - auch f√ºr Leute die mit diesem Genre nicht so viele Erfahrungen haben, aber mal reinschnuppern wollen. Ob sich der Kauf im Moment schon lohnt, wei√ü ich aber nicht. Falls Interesse besteht kann man sicher noch warten bis die ein oder andere Map dazu kommt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997696521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1474041619}
review:
[b]TL;DR:[/b] TOXIKK is really fun yet has some weird design decisions and so far is pretty much bare bones. As early access as you can get but looks very promising! Conclusion only buy if you are prepared for 'early-accessness';

[u]Pros:[/u]
+ Fast paced responsive combat
+ Tight controls and movement, you can dodge and jump
+ Bunny hopping made easy by dodge + jump moves and slight wall jumping.
+ Great visual and audio feedback (except visual clutter)
+ Dedicated servers
+ Already a good variety of weapons with alternative fire and they all feel different enough
+ LAN
+~ Weapon balance is ok for ealy access except rocket launcher is completely overpowered and starting weapon(pistol) is beyond useless.
[u]Cons:[/u]
-Very barebones (below are more details see '--')
--1 small map
--Only few basic game modes
--No ranked play, 1v1 or anything other than tdm and dm for that matter.
--Terrible server browser, no filters no nothing just a list.
-Quite a bit of visual clutter, takes quite some time to adjust.
[b]-Default controls and settings in general make the game borderline unplayable (huge mouse acceleration, blur and so on are ON by default) so be prepared to spend a good hour in the settings since you cannot modify settings in game.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197997422028', 'num_games_owned': 8944, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1474077744}
review:
Update: 4 months later the game has changed a bit and there are a few more maps. However, the chart linked below continues to show that there is really no interest in this game making it a bad buy at this point.

Original Review Jan 2015: If you like UT3, you will like this game. Literally the only difference between them is the weapons and the dodge jump. Toxikk is a repackage of the UT demo contained in UDK with only minor gameplay related changes and minor modifications to several models. There is nothing wrong with this, but if you think Toxikk is a polished game you should be impressed by what you can do with almost bone stock UDK content with a very small team.

If I had to guess, most of the time working on this game was spent on the menus and the leaderboard system. None of this means that the game is bad, but the only map available right now is very cramped, the weapons are not well balanced and the rocket launcher is overpowered to all heck. You can easily dominate a match by focusing on the rockets and timing the armor. But despite all that you can actually have fun with this game and if you want some of the feeling of UT3 mixed with a small amount of UT2004 you will probably enjoy what this game has to offer.

FYI, F is feign death and Q is turn invisible (yes everyone can turn invisible)

In the end I'm voting "No" on recommending this simply because the game is incomplete. The one map gets boring fast and if you aren't used to arena FPSes, you will die more than you will kill which is frustrating. Give this a bit more time in the fryer and it will be a decent game.

P.S. Thanks trolls for down-voting an honest review. This chart http://steamcharts.com/app/324810 tells you all you need to know about whether it's worth buying this game right now.

Vecchia scuola, altamente competitivo e dannatamente divertente. Spero vivamente che venga aggiornato con contenuti adatti alle potenzialit√† di questo magnifico titolo

author: {'steamid': '76561198046478218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1422217510}
review:
Zuallererst: Ich bin absoluter Fan von Arena-Shootern und habe UT-Classic bis zum Erbrechen gespielt. Dementsprechende Erwartungen habe ich auch an Toxikk gehabt.

Ich w√ºrde das Spiel wirklich gerne m√∂gen, aber schon nach ein paar Minuten Spielzeit wurde mir einfach langweilig. Die Waffen haben nicht wirklich diesen "Punch" den ich mir f√ºr einen modernen Arena-Shooter w√ºnsche, die Grafik ist meiner Meinung nach auch nicht wirklich ein Hyper-Upgrade zu UT3 und die Waffen sind absolut unbalanciert. Der f√ºr mich ausschlaggebendste Punkt das Spiel im jetzigen Zustand negativ zu bewerten ist der "Punch" der Waffen. Die Soundeffekte sind ziemlich lahm und Spielgef√ºhl ist mir nicht fl√ºssig genug. W√§hrend man sich z.B. in Quake 3 wunderbar mit dem Rocketlauncher durch die Map katapultieren konnte und das gesamte Leveldesign sehr gut auf schnelle Bewegungen und Abfolgen ausgelegt war hat man hier nur sporadisch die M√∂glichkeit das wirklich auszunutzen. Schade, ich h√§tte dem Spiel wirklich geg√∂nnt ein neuer Top-Arena-Shooter zu werden, aber im jetzigen Zustand ist das einfach nicht so. Hinzu kommt, dass das Matchmaking zwar Old-School wie Sau ist, aber es gibt eben auch Ver√§nderungen die in moderneren Spielen durchaus positiv sind, die man auch hier h√§tte ber√ºcksichtigen k√∂nnen. Ich denke auch nicht, dass Toxikk das Potential zum E-Sport-Hit hat und dementsprechend auch nur ein kurzweiliger Zeitvertreib ist. W√ºrde der Preis bei 5‚Ç¨ liegen w√§re das alles durchaus gerechtfertigt und w√ºrde sicherlich auch mehr Spieler anziehen, aber so ist das nunmal nicht. Ich w√ºrde es nicht als absoluten Fehlkauf bezeichnen wenn man absolut vernarrt in Arena-Shooter der alten Tage ist - dennoch - f√ºr mich war es nicht lohnenswert und da setze ich mich lieber hin und spiele ein paar Runden UT-Classic, dessen Mapdesign, Soundkulisse und Spielgef√ºhl auch heute noch bei weitem das √ºbertreffen was Toxikk ausmacht.

Wenn man sich die positiven Bewertungen anschaut sieht man auch √ºberdurchschnittlich viele Leute die das Spiel auch gerade mal eine halbe Stunde gespielt haben. Ich denke man sollte dennoch etwas abwarten, vielleicht entwickelt es sich ja doch noch in die richtige Richtung.

review:

Apesar de estar em early acess, o jogo esta muito bem otimizado, n√£o senti queda de fps em nenhum instante, a gameplay esta muito fluida, n√£o percebi nenhum bug, a n√£o ser por estar jogando em servidores com +- 230 de lat√©ncia (deve ser por n√£o existir muitos brasileiros no jogo por enquanto, ent√£o tenho caido em servidores americanos/europeus).

Os unicos pontos fracos que encontrei, que provavelmente ser√£o corrigidos com o tempo, ou quando o jogo sair do ealy s√£o:

 Poucos modos de jogo (apenas 2 no early acess.)

Nota final para o jogo (LEMBRANDO, EM EARLY ACESS): 8,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034396219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1424287273}
review:
Bought the founder pack with 3 of my friends months before the beta release. 

As I can say, it's so far so good, the game runs smoothly, the frags counted flawlessly, and the noobs are started to whining! :D

Also on the PRO side is that there is a global leaderboard.

On the Contra side the Rocket Launcher is too powerful beside the other weapons and still there aren't too many maps / players. But it's just the beginning, looking forward to play several gaming mods / maps with my friends ;)

review: It¬¥s early access...just one map. Mouse controls are odd - no matter what kinds of setting I apply (not mentioning the extreme settings which do not make sense and could be cut out). Shooting lacks the good feeling I have with CS:GO (even if that¬¥s quite different) - it feels quite "paper-tiger" like and not as earthy as it should.  There are enough options that can be changed. Some character costumization. No weapon costumization (not needed in my opinion). Very seldom the game crashes when changing options. Sometimes the textures vanish (see my screenshots for that).  If they fix the mouse controls and add more content this might be an UT killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075601965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1473616196}
review:
[i]TLDR: As a long time UT gamer, I think this has wonderful potential, but has many open holes for my taste.[/i]
[b]This review is for version 0.73[/b]

This'll be my first fully polished review, so this'll be quite long:

Wonderful to finally see this genre of arena shoters coming back ^^
As an Unreal veteran, I do tell you, I see very high potential with this game.
I'm pretty sure that until next UT will be released, this will be the one we'll be playing.
As this is still at beta or early access, I wish developers would see my points in negative aspects written down below.
[h1]The positives:[/h1]
So, I hope more maps ofcourse are coming out, graphically this game is very impresssive. You could add more variations to character looks, or classes whatever, but it's actually pretty ok. The only deathmatch map available, was pretty good map really, it was easy to learn the corridors and locations of pickups.
Controls, are very good, it's perfectly polished, and I wish them to stay like this.
Things that have improved since I first wrote this review, are things like, Options menu is now accessible in-game. Also option for weapon auto-switch.
And I don't know what they did with Raven, but it feels now far better balanced than it was at first. I still suggest as soon as you spawn, to search for other weapons immidiately, but now the first weapon you have is quite bearable. The weapon balancing is being done better by each patch and that is a sign of good developers, great job:)
[h1]The negatives and things I'd like to see improved[/h1]
So, there are plenty of things which would be wonderful if they are improved, so I'll talk about each small thing separately. You may call this nitpicking, but these are things that even classic arena shooters have, but not this, when it claims to be like that. But first of all, don't get me wrong, I'm very positive about this game, and it has much potential.
[b]Music[/b]
Menu music, is horrible, and very repetitive, would be nice for it to have some variation, maybe an ambient part in the music, but the style is good though. The music in-game is way better though but decent, I won't argue about that much.
[b]Graphics[/b]
As I mentioned before about character, yeah, it could use more variation than just the two models you can choose.
[b]Left handed guns[/b]
Oh yes, I might be in extreme minority here, but this is one of my major complains. I'm a left-handed shooter, and I would like to have the option to hold my weapon on the left hand. Though no modern games give you the choice, and not that I expected that from this game either, but it would have been nice. Though working on character models specifically for this reason is kinda stupid, I know, but UT didn't change character models for those though.
[b]Menu[/b]
To change the difficulty of bots, or a map, you have to go all the way back to main menu... It's not too bad though but a quick menu could be implemented. Now that option is acceccible in-game, that is very good, but I wish there to be an "Exit to Desktop" button.
[b]Weapons[/b]
When you start a match, the first thing you have to do is to run to find any other weapon than your base weapon. Also the gameplay with these weapons, was a little bit boring, like there was no special things you could do with any weapon, not even load multiple rockets. Oh, I'm just being used to UT weapons, I was trying to sound silly.
One more thing.. how about a weapon bar? While playing I have close to no idea which weapons I'm having, and that's stupid.
[b]Other things[/b]
Well, first of all, I rarely play online. I rather play with bots all the time. Would be nice to have few things, like to change the bot difficulty automatically according to player's skills just like in UT. Speaking of difficulties, why can't I see it on scoreboard, the difficulty I'm against with? Not that it matters, but it's a nice little detail for a screenshot.
Another thing.. double kills, multi kills.. that sound that it makes, is horrible, intrusive, and they all have the same sound. Wish they had at least a robotic voice to say out loud "Double kill" "Multi kill" etc.

And I guess that's it, if I find any more of small things that bothers me, I'll be adding them to this review then. And yeah I am seeing the good changes in this game, and has thus erased some details of this review.
Happy fragging! ÔºØ(‚âß‚ñΩ‚â¶)ÔºØ

author: {'steamid': '76561197980024031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1422942698}
review:
Is this game good? Yes it is. What we have here is exactly as advertised: a skill based, fast shooter that is an ode to the days of quake and unreal. 

But if you are reading this review during the early access, you may wish to wait a while. The game in its current state as I write this is much like an early alpha purely for testing purposes. Fun? Yes. But there are the expected flaws that come with such an early build. Only one map and one gamemode is currently working/available. Weapons are not balanced, a few bugs here and there, and server connection issues abound. If you decide to buy into the e-a just know that you are getting into an incomplete game. It will probably be months before enough content is playable for this to be considered something for legitimate retail.

Beyond that the core gameplay is excellent, movement is fun, and it's been ages since we have had a shooter like this. Reakktor Studios at the very least desrves props for trying to bring twitch and skill back to a the FPS genre, which has stagnated heavily from casual pandering military shooters for the past decade. In exchange for more realism shooters lost a part of their soul, and Toxikk is trying to bring it back. Give it a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981124799', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1479878139}
review:
REVIEW WILL BE UPDATED AS GAME PROGRESSES

If you don't want to read a long review, then here's an easy choice:

If you LOVED UT2004 (or the Unreal Tournament series in general) and want to support/play a very early version of what could be a phenominal game buy it for the cheaper price now.

If you always preferred Quake over Unreal Tournament, or don't want to buy a unfinished game, don't puchase this.

It's as simple as that.


For a more IN DEPTH review, here are my thoughts so far.

-Pros

Fantastic movement system, you can set how fast your double taps dodge or even use another key entirely to dodge in the position you're moving, which is excellent for newer players (or baddies like me).

Weapons actually feel varied, and a lot actually adapt to team colors when picked up (like the stingray, instead of the traditional teal shots they will change to a darker blue for the blue team or a red for the red team) which is a nice touch.

Game looks fantastic, running on the Unreal 3 engine (sadly not 4, but I supposed it's been in development for a long time) and still looks great. Plenty of graphical settings to tweak, which is expected of a PC only game.

Is actually FUN to play, one of the most important aspects of a game period. It's entertaining and if you've loved Unreal Tournament you will most likely love this.

-Cons

It is early access. [strike]At the time of writing there is only one map, and two modes.[/strike] [i]Now has two maps and three modes, deathmatch, team deathmatch and CTF.[/i] Know what you're getting into and realize the possibility (not assuming anything, just stating it could happen) the devs abandon the game similar to other early access titles. Only buy this if you trust that the devs will deliver on their plans.

[strike]Balance is off right now, again it is early and this will most likely be sorted out, but it's worth noting that the cerberus is a one hit on fresh spawns and fires far too quickly, while the starting pistol is essentially worthless. While it's worth noting the starting pistol should be BAD, this is almost unusable.[/strike] [i]Game has been properly balanced, weapons all feel fair as of now.[/i]

Leveling system is, well, superfluous. It doesn't do anything at the moment, it's incredibly easy to level up (even bots give levels) and the numebers go rediculously high (I think I'm level 670 at the moment?). I don't understand why a system that is completely unneeded or unused is in the current build, but this is basically nitpicking since it doesn't do anything.


So overall, if you trust the devs to finish the game and want to play it now, it's definitely worth the $19 (on sale for $17 at time of writing). I'll try to keep this post updated, but honestly I'm a pretty forgetful person. Solid recommendation as of now.

EDIT: I will [strike]strike out[/strike] any outdated info and [i]add notes[/i] stating what changed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988432180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1466724821}
review:
At first glance, this game looks like another UT3 (which we all know was awful). However, i was pleasantly surprised at how good it actually is (and could be) once more updates are released. This game is much further ahead than many other early access games and is in a very playable state, even if there is only 1 map right now.

The gameplay is very similar to UT2004, while fans of Quake will find a lot to like here, it is quite different and it's not quite as 'hardcore', meaning it's a lot easier for newcomers to jump in and start fragging. Do i recommend this game right now? Yes i do, however the content is low right now so it also wouldn't be a bad idea to wait for the February updates, when a few new game modes and maps will be added.

I have a great feeling about this game, with a few balance changes and the extra content (which is due very soon), this could be one heck of a game for arena fps fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013323421', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1422316118}
review: If you see modern FPS as the bullshit that they are, buy this game no questions asked.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998632471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1552726852}
review:
You're expecting a witty Steam Review, don't look here. I'm here to tell you one thing;

This is the rebirth of 90's era FPS. The more you play, the more you're surprised you actually have to learn and work to improve. No handholding, no tutorials, just dive in and enjoy a crisp fresh (like a tin of jam) FPS experience. The other excellent reviews will tell you WHY it's good, but I'm telling you there isn't anything bad for me about the whole thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043379569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1534269562}
review: Almost quake-like fps game. Of what I've played of this game, Its extremely competative and fun. I really hope with game goes far and it should be supported. I would suggest this, the skill gap is quite large but very rewarding experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067029049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1475123331}
review:
In TOXIKK, you play as a faceless Chinese mercenary who kills other Chinese mercenaries. Why, you ask? Because they are wearing a different color. Use futuristic weaponry, only to get schooled over and over by the Cerberus. So far, this game is fantastic. It's quite possibly the single greatest fast-paced first-person shooter I have ever played. Cerberus is love, Cerberus is lifel

Hint: Press "F" to become Deadpool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030270198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1474915363}
review:
Greetings!

Grew up with UT and sadly imo since the original every game has gotten progressively worse.

The development of UT4 is stuttering alot and I already see a lack of faith in the older players/community.

I have to say this game is a breath of fresh air, the movement is brilliant and it's exactly what I was looking for. Fast and skill based.

If you're looking for  arena FPS game to play I strongly recommend purchasing this game

Nuke the RL and shotgun secondary abit and it will be perfectly balanced, well done to the developers and good to see some companies out there who do actually care about the arena genre

Thumbs up

author: {'steamid': '76561197990853822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2327, 'last_played': 1473625438}
review:
EDIT: 22.6.2015. 
Think twice before buying, go on forum and ask the devs about the release and future features. Because in current state, it is very unclear when it is comming out and how will the game look like in the end. But I still recomend it, if you like UT movement system ( this one in toxikk is even better. ) The guns are boring tho, very generic. The maps they have added are fine, nothing extra. As far as the player base is concerned, go check it out on steamcharts.

If you are deciding between Toxikk and Reflex, GET REFLEX. I'd recommend reflex over toxikk every single time. Reflex does everything better than Toxikk + the active player base is ultiple times bigger.

ORIGINAL TEXT:!!!!!
Pretty awesome game. No flaws in gameplay. It is my first Early access game i've bought. If all early access games are so excelently developed like this one, I might consider buying more or Early access.
I'm getting no lags on the server, you can create your own. Also this game will support user generated content ( maps, camos........dunno what else.)

In-game, there is some ranking based upon Experience wich you gain jsut by playing, when i bought the game i was 10 000th....... not sure if it is the real number of people taht own the game.

The game is supposed to come out in 4-6 months.

So far it is excellent.

Here is the plan of the DEVs for the Early access http://forum.toxikk.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=993

author: {'steamid': '76561197960952741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1705023525}
review: Awesome Old School FPS.  Pure FPS.  If you want a great Run-N-Gun game where you can just jump in an play then this is for you.  No leveling, no upgrades just pure FPS gaming.  Love it.  (Nothing against the current Modern FPS where leveling and upgrading and the like is the norm but this is pure FPS gaming.  Learn the level, learn the weapons and learn the timing.)  You won't be able to buy your way into a win with this game.  For some people that will be a negative.  For those of us that love Quake/Unreal/Counterstrike you will love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999111995', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1532569028}
review:
Reakktor is back again and this game shows a ton of promise for those of us who loved games such as the original unreal tournament and quake. Everyone should have a lot of fun with this game. That's the main objective in these arena FPS games is to have fun! 

I'm a bit biased towards this developer since everyday I used to play Neocron for 2 years. I've been following them ever since so I had to see what they did next with this game and I wasn't disappointed. Totally worth checking out and once it's done with everything they have planned we could be looking at game modes that are more on par with UT2k4 which I loved as well. My opinion is you can't go wrong purchasing this game and supporting an excellent developer in KK.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968605516', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1436717661}
review:
There are moments playing Toxikk in its current state where you dont feel completely in control, for example when you spawn into a match there's a pistol reload animation that cant be interrupted, even if an enemy player is coming around the corner with buth barrels blazing. Its a small thing that presents a big problem, it makes you totally vulnerable at the exact point the player should be ready to lock and load. There are two ways they could solve this, one, make the player invulnerable for a few seconds after spawn, or two, get rid of the animation altogether. Personally i'd stump for the second option and it's something I really hope the developers address considering it puts a dent in the experience.

See video for my full impressions.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CTkr1hU4Ceo

author: {'steamid': '76561197962933019', 'num_games_owned': 1340, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1486600936}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003831270', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1244, 'last_played': 1589704297}
review:
Well this took over my weekend to say the least. I'll try to keep this short; if you like Arena FPS games, then this is a safe purchase. The controlls are tight, weapons feel great and are a lot of fun to shoot, and graphics and sounds are top of the line. 

Tons of great options and customisation, but sadly not when you are in game. And for those who want the real oldschool look may have to change a few things in a config file. I have encountered one major bug, and thats the gamecrash if you click and move your mouse a lot befor the serverlist has loaded up completly. But nothing more then that. It runs at 220 fps on my GTX 980 and seems to be very well optimised, and sets a good standard for early access games.

There is only one map at the moment (luckily a very good one), and there is some weapon balancing to be made for sure. Yes the rocketlauncher is silly and way to easy to get in such a tight map. But other then that, flawless! 10/10!!! 
New maps, modes and weapons every 2-4 weeks according to the roadmap(link below), and i can't wait to see what else they have in store for this game!

Best FPS i have played in a good long while. 

Roadmap:
http://forum.toxikk.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=993

author: {'steamid': '76561198001127705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1651481066}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037834565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1473813159}
review:
Although Toxikk is early access, and doesn't have much to offer at the moment, it promises hours of good fun, and if the devs stay true to what they have promised, I can promise you that Toxikk will be a game that you can't ignore.

    Toxikk strives to stray from the other modern shooters, in fact, it seeks to bring back the Arena style gameplay from the late 90's and early 2k's by eliminating the reloading system, the health regaining, and the levelling systems. Now, being an arena shooter, it is extremely fast paced, from the movement to the short, yet brilliant encounters with your foes. forcing you to "FRAG LIKE IT'S 1999".

   Being a fast paced Arena shooter, Toxikk has quite the steep learning curve, and in it's current state, it seems near impossible without having quite the amount of hours, and at the moment, the people who play the game tend to be quite good, as a large majority of them have been playing this type of game since they were young, so don't expect to go in and be the best, cause you won't be. 

   There is also the aspect of this game not going F2P, a smart move for developers, as the want a strong community, mature community. As they say, an Arena FPS and F2P just don't work. So don't be waiting for this game to become free, as it will only rise in price, so I'd suggest getting it now.

   In it's current state, Toxikk is a load of fun, and you'll find yourself stuck to the computer screen for hours, if the developers keep their promises this game could change the FPS genre back to what it used to be, but at the games current state, that seems near impossible, as the game only has one map, a handfull of weapons, and 2 game modes, but as much as I hate to use the "P" word, this game holds much potential, and if done right, this game could change the FPS genre back to what it used to be.

Fun Factor - 9/10
Graphics - 8/10
Content - 4/10 (at the moment)
Replayability - 10/10

Early Access score - 7/10 (Final score in current state)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040385512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1479686027}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970712915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1445469987}
review:
This is a review for the Early Access version (v0.7) of the game. So far, it includes 1 map which can be played in deathmatch and team deathmatch mode. There are 7 weapons with alt fire modes, and no vehicles.

A few things to know before you buy this:

1. The balance of weapons is off. If you look through other reviews or the official forums, the rocket launcher (Cerberus) is widely believed to be highly OP.

2. The skill level of some of the players is quite high. You will get fragged, a lot.

3. There are already cheats available for it, which can alledgedly fool anti-cheat protection employed by Valve.


Still interested? OK, this game is somewhat promising. I can't claim it's worth $17 at the moment, but there's some potential here. Notable features include an activatable and rechargeable cloacking device and pretty good graphics. It's also a pretty stable release, I haven't had crashes or glitches.

It still lacks "something" to distinguish it from UT2k4, maybe one can claim the pace is even faster and more brutal than that, as most of the weapons do a lot of damage.

Overall, I can "recommend" the game to someone who is interested in getting an early look at a product that is clearly attempting to bring back UT2k4 style shooting to the PC, but it's still pretty rough around the edges. Everyone else, stay the hell away for the time being.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020035831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1528169295}
review:
I backed this a long time ago even though I'm not the best FPS player in the world. 

This is how the bar should be set for Early Acess and Greenlight.They followed through with their proof of concept and brought to the table a PROPER public test phase. Not trying to make a profit model for a game that stays in alpha/beta forever (at this point).

This is the stripper model of FPS games and I love it. It also has the same vibe we saw in classic Unreal Tournament and I'm not saying that because it runs on Unreal. It also runs amazingly smooth.

It truly is a back to basics classic arena shooter. It's a proper pickup and play as well given the streamlined menu setup. Brings back the nostalgia of my childhood after a minute of gameplay.

I'd recommend this to anyone who grew up with UT or any of the game prior to the Halo/COD-baby generation!! A MUST.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101103854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1424214755}
review:
The game tries to sell its self as a competitive arena FPS similar to those of the 90's era. However that's really where it falls short. Toxikk really has nothing in common with a proper arena fps and its really just another casual modern FPS game.

Here are the core problems.

* Over the top fog and post processing that cannot be disabled in online mode (see forum post:  http://forum.toxikk.com/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=1400&p=13556#p13556)

* Film grain / HDR / Bloom / Post Processing / Distortion / Grain effect make visibility worse than even call of duty.

* Mouse acceleration and smoothing is difficult to remove, to fully remove it you have to change a number of config settings, these config changes tend to get overwritten if you don't set them to read only.

Seeing as this is an early access game, and this is the direction the developers have decided to take the game really disappoints me. I will update this review if any of these issues change, and hopefully they do.

I would personally avoid the game and go for a proper competitive fps like Reflex.

**EDIT 1** 

I create a youtube video to demonstrate the differnces with fog on and off: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=381959609

**EDIT 2** 

The dev's released an update today that fixed the visibility issues to some degree. The fog is still there however player models are much more visible now.

That was my main gripe with the game. The best solution is to totally remove the fog, but as its currently not as game breaking as before I'm going to change my update from not recommend to recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082719213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1513646775}
review:
Fun with a few gameplay issues. It's basically Quake Live with an artpass at this point. May be good to wait for the second map in February if you want more variety, but the current map is very good.

I did notice that the game feels sort of laggy. The lowest ping server I can find is 50ms, and even on this server some players teleport when they double-jump. This may be a server-side issue, as I was using fairly low graphics settings, but I don't really know.

Some gameplay feedback:
-The Cerberus is very powerful in DM, in TDM it seems to be less of a problem
-I question the damage dropoff model on the Bullcrap shotgun
-I do not like the weapon autoswap mechanic. I'd at least like to set my own weapon priorities so that I don't switch from the shotgun to the sniper I accidently picked up while fighting in close range
-There seems to be no way of knowing which weapon I will scroll to next
-I feel like the primary fire on the flamethrower is really weak, and secondary uses too much ammo
-Visual effects for the flamethrower block too much of the screen
-The starting pistol is next to useless. I'd like to see an interesting buff to it, like giving you faster cloak regen while you have it out rather than something boring like a fire rate increase
-I like the concept of the violator but primary fire seems weak and secondary fire is very hard to hit anything with. Maybe let the grenades roll a bit?

author: {'steamid': '76561198096399922', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1484017405}
review:
To begin, I'd hope you understand the phrase "Early Access."

Toxikk is very reminescent of arena shooters in the days of old and that is where this game shines. However, because it is plagued with the disease commonly referred to medical practitioners as "EA", the game suffers from a lack of content at the moment. There is one map and two gamemodes. Gamemodes right now include Bloodlust - Free for All and something something Team Deathmatch. That is not to say it is boring, it certainly caught my eye with stunning visuals: Explosions, gun animations, fluorescent lights, reflections, etc. are all very well and pretty.

I hope that in the near future, we will see the maps and vehicles shown around E3 2014. This game is heading down a very promising road.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979720191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1707090639}
review:
[h1] TOXIKK Early Access Review (Steam Version) [/h1]

This game definately brings back some fond memories.

UT 99, Quake, Half - Life, LAN Parties, Dial-Up, The dreaded phone call.

Man, i miss games like this...

Talking about the game itself though, i can highly recommend this to anyone who used to bash the hell out of games such as Unreal Tournement.

At the moment though the game does not have everything implemented yet, the only arena that is available for playing is 'Foundation' a somewhat China Town style map, which is infact quite spacious and highly detailed.

There are a few things that make the game unbalanced at the moment, mainly the 'Cerberus', which is an automatic Rocket launcher and can be quite a pain in the arse to get past when there is a player dominating with it on a game server. But in the upcoming patches things are going to be scaled up and down so that it feels a lot more comfortable.

Anyone that is a fan for Character Customization, this game has a few bits and bobs that the player can play around with to tweak their character.

- Two selectable armor types [Factions]
- Glow Colours for lighting
- Patterns and Textures
- Armor Colours
- Clan Tag
- Name Tag

Although it may not seem like much there will hopefully be more on the way to look forward to.

Toxikk has options for 'Mutators' Just like that in Unreal, I haven't had a look into any of them, if any yet. But Player created content is going to be widely available.

There seems to be a ranking system in the game but, the XP seems to scale up infinitely so... Where that goes... I have no idea, Ranks and rewards will be most likely implemented later.

Other things that can be a little bit arsey with the game is the likes of it's optimization and support for other platforms such as MAC & Linux, but apart from that...

In a nutshell, the game is fantastic, has brilliant visuals, isn't 'pay 2 win' or 'free 2 play' and is definately a fully skill based shooter.

[b] - Windowlicker - [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198084463960', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1439574114}
review:
Toxikk...The game that you can play until your fan becomes a portable heater. This game by far took first impressions to a whole new level. You join in and a certain feeling hits as you blow your enemies up into next week. I am proud to be an early access tester for this game. May its future be bright and move modern fist person shooters aside.

Pros:
Fast-paced arena shooter
Guns are diverse
Awesome looking player models
Classic type of arena shooter
Brings fun back to first person shooters
Great developers
EXPLOSIONS EVERYWHERE

Cons:
Guns are somewhat unbalanced
Not much customization to the player

I am glad that people still care about the more classic flow of games enough to modernize them. It isn't a perfect game but I believe it has a bright future.

review: The game looks good and looks fun... It is, for a few minuts, then you realise that the easiest weapon to get kills with is the rocketlauncer, and how short the respawn timer of it is, and that everyone has seperate weapon spawns... so within a few seconds of the game starting everyone has a launcer and it turns into a rocket fest... Mby once they bring some ballance to the weapon spawns somehow, it will work.. But atleast for me, it's not working just yet. ;) save your money and wait for the release imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998457151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1425692477}
review:
First and foremost the game works, and it runs smooth about 95% of the time.
Server loads seem to be properly balanced.

I can't tell you how good it is to play an FPS the way I remember them before all the damn crafting and grinding.

There's minor work to be done on less than a handful of the features/weapons and game flow.

Having a game in it's beta function, be fun and not be bogged down by release issues does seem like a throwback to 1999.  Where people gave a damn about what they released.  When people put gameplay over everything else.

Can't wait to give you guys more of my money.

If you like arena shooters, this is the new gold standard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016559082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1484544948}
review: I definitely can recommend this game. It's got great polish for a game in early access. Once some weapon balance comes (Which is already outlined in their plan), it's going to be a very fun game. Although I already enjoy going 40-0 with rocket launcher :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197978029151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1479059077}
review:
Delivers on the "no skill-trees, no perks, no cover systems, no classes, no configurable weapons and no iron sight aiming, no bullshit" promise. 

More UT than Quake for my tastes, but still a lot of fun.  Hope to see some fun user-maps and mods in the future.  

Definitely check it out if you are sick of Hat Fortress 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993423353', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1693251219}
review:
Bought this game when it first went on EA and liked it then. Now that it's fully released I just love it. There's a nostalgia factor for me because it plays like Unreal Tournament which I sank a ton of hours into when I was a lad. 

Very fun, the adrenaline will get pumping. Everybody starts out on the same footing so you simply have to outplay everybody else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981444559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1579415743}
review:
---JAN 2015 EARLY ACCESS---

Take your best memories of old school Unreal Tournament, and then make it beautiful, load instantly(menus and startup too), with amazing performance scaling, super tight gunplay, and add another point out of ten to top it off.

Seriously, you can hold your breath, launch the game, load a match and have killed 4 people before you exhale. I honestly know of no other game where I can do that.


-----A YEAR AND A HALF LATER-----
Yeah. Game is still fantastic. Super polished. 


Just play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083881769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2081, 'last_played': 1476564426}
review:
My words are sparse,
but all in all I've found I'm actually enjoying myself when playing this game.
The one map that there is looks extremely good texture/lighting/atmosphere and I'm hoping for this kind of consistent solid work from the devs on upcoming maps. Hopefully a bright one, as I'm getting sad in the nighttime map. I'm looking for bright not bloom.
The guns details are high, and again high quality work by the devs, they all look unique and bad ***king ass. They all have very good sound as well, which is helpful with immersion, and by that I mean I feel like I'm actually shooting a futuristic sci-fi space weapon.
You can say rocket launcher OP, but I found this isn't true, it's just the easiest weapon to use, and get used to. With everything so fast paced and no ADS, just jump around choas ***king awesomeness I found I had lost my more accurate aim. Couple hours in, and it has slowly made it's way back. With it I noticed I can actually start killing bots that have obtained the rocket launcher.
Yes, bots. They are surprsingly good. I mean, every once in a while it feels like they were watching you come around a wall, but that could just be a bad perspective on my unwittingly bad skills. So far I've been playing on Adept the 5/8 skill levels. I have only won Bloodlust (FFA) a handful of times and that doesn't give me the justification to move forward quite yet. Especially since the one time I did go online, I had my ass handed to me like an infant trying to play basketball.

The menus are clean, and minimalistic, along with the HUD, no radar, no classes, no reloading, no grenades, no melee.
This is a step backwards in terms of modern shooters, but not in terms of fun. It quickens the action, creates a lot more gun on gun, like to the point of that's all there is, and allows for more movement actions. Dash and double jump adds a lot of possiblity to map design and gameplay aspects, it certainly was the right choice as it moves the matches along quicker.

Overall it's a solid FPS
and If you enjoy a solid FPS game, you'll enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965631885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1428261833}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004251131', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1519599121}
review:
Short Story: I recomment this title to everyone who liked UT2k3 / UT2k4 or other Arena Shooters! Gameplay has huge potential, and if the Devs focus on "Moddability" and Community Content this might be the Arena Shooter to play for a decade! The Game Content is limited at the moment, but it's a good Thing to start practising early to Master the Mechanics :)
--
Long Story:

Since UT2k4 i've kind of given up the hope for a worthy Arena Shooter, but i'm starting to think that Toxikk might be the saviour of the Subgenre.
The Game is still in the Beginning regarding available Game Content, but i think it has quite a huge potential. The Movement feels smooth, although a bit more "wobbly" than UT2k4, there might still be some tweeking necessary. Aiming feels fine so far altough i am surprised that Things as Mouse Accellaration is enabled by default. 
The Weapons need some balancing (currently the Cerberus Rocket Launcher is instakill for direct hits and shoots fast flying projects with a wide aoe radius) every second, but i'm sure the developers are taking care of this in time. 

The Graphics are really impressive for a "smaller title"  so far, altough it doesnt really matter for an Arena Shooter in my opinion (apart from the "better graphics == more players == bigger community == more modding stuff).

author: {'steamid': '76561198011914050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1426545691}
review:
tl;dr- buy it, find a cerbereus. Press f to fall over

Very fun for early access, I did promise myself no more due to the abundance of what I call "2 months work, 2 years off" devs but this is quite a blast and seems well made.
It's nice to see a multiplayer shooter which isn't unlockable focused *cough* CoD *splutter* battlefield *sly look* TF2 (I'm sorry I love you really Gaben).

Nice graphics, simple, very well optimised (better than most AAA titles 6 months after launch), no lag on servers.
Needs some balancing though, it's pretty much whoever has the cerbereus rocket lawnchair wins unless you get lucky/have good aim.

Also the mouse sensitivity and movement speed is crazy high, take that as you will, it won't be what you're used to though unless you played quake, unreal and so on.

Want to see more game modes, maybe workshop integration/modding, more maps inlcuding maybe a huge one (know it's meant to be frantic close quarters but still. A one hit kill mode would be so stupid it would be funny and I want to see it. 

A lot of potential, could even add co-op horde mode of some sort idk.

Just hope the devs don't get lazy

author: {'steamid': '76561198030607528', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1497450180}
review:
First off I love this game. And I wanna explain to you guys the Pros, Neutral and Cons about this game and why I wouldnt recommend it.

KEEP IN MIND THIS REVIEW IS WAY OUT OF DATE!!!!!!!!! I HOPE TO UPDATE IT JANUARY 2016. THUS I CHANGED IT MY RECOMMENDATION TO YES.


Update for V0.82:

The new Updated seem to have killed the Perfomance of the Game to me. The framerate wont go beyond 20 fps on the lowest and ultra settings!

My Setup:

i7 4790k @ 4.6 Ghz
16Gb RAM
GTX 670 4Gb GDDR5 RAM

There is absolutley no reason for the game to have such poor perfomance. 

I redownloaded the game, deleted all configs, updated nVidia Drivers, tweaked the nVidia control panel for Toxikk. Nothing helped.

If a Devs reads this and wants my dxdiag file or other Benchmark files of the rig just comment and ill get back to you :)

Pros:

Graphics are great and the options are plenty and good customizable, esp. turning off blur and that shiny stuff.

Movement is fast paced it responses perfectly and feels not floaty, like CS:GO

Weapons are great and very satisfing to use.

Models are very detailed and the customize options are enough to do at least a bit of a unique character

EXP and Skill Level has no influence on the game what so ever.

Texture Quality is more than enough for a fast paced arena shooter.

The first map is very well balanced and fun to play.

TDM and DM are very funny to play and if you win you feel like you really deserve it for playing good.

New Map looks awesome!

The Toxikk Redeemer (dont know the real name) Is beatiful!

Melee kills fell great.

The neutral:

No Diversity at the moment.

Rocketlauncher and Shotgun Camping is very common since they are the strongest weapons in the game imho.

No Option menue while in game, its annoying in the beginning to get your mouse settings right.
C) In-Game options menu was enable with V0.75(huge shoutout to Sharkster(Developer) for the correction of the cons.)

Doesn't use steamworks for private matches, i cant host matches since my ISP gave me a DSLite tunnel so noone can directly connect to my IP and the Internet speed from my friends are too crappy. If you have the same issue just use hamachi and connect to the IP of your mates through the console "open IP:Port"

No dedicated Serverhoster at the moment, at least I didnt find anyone.

B) Dedicated server hosting was supported from the very first day. There are a bunch of private dedicated servers online.(huge shoutout to Sharkster(Developer) for the correction of the cons.)

No matchmaking atm

The  negative:

Autoweaponswitch cant be disabled which is sooooooo annoying.

A) Auto Weapon Switch can be turned off since V0.73, but if you leave it on, you can now define weapon priorities (since V0.82). (huge shoutout to Sharkster(Developer) for the correction of the cons.)

Only one map and 2 modes at the moment.
D) There are 3 maps (and 3 game modes) now and two more maps coming during April.(huge shoutout to Sharkster(Developer) for the correction of the cons.)

Cerberus either does to much damage or to high rate of fire. They should nerf the firerate or the damage a bit, not that much.
E) Cerberus was re-balanced with almost every patch, taking community feedback into account.(huge shoutout to Sharkster(Developer) for the correction of the cons.)

Spawnpistol to low damage or to low rate of fire.
F) Same goes for the Rave ("spawn pistol")(huge shoutout to Sharkster(Developer) for the correction of the cons.)

Only 6 Weapons in game right now. I hope i didnt forgot one :)
G) There are 9 weapons in the game now (Ravager not yet 100% functional though)(huge shoutout to Sharkster(Developer) for the correction of the cons.)


XP/LVL/Rank gain while playing against bots. CMON! When I warmup against bots or play with friends in LAN i dont want to increase/decrease my lvl or leaderboard rank. 
I) XP vs Bots: Yup. That's still in. Will be eliminated with one of the patches to come (with an XP (huge shoutout to Sharkster(Developer) for the correction of the cons.)reset).

Offtopic RANT!:

For the people who claim that the cerberus(rocketlauncher) is an insta win totally OP weapon and therefore the game is shit I only say one think. Go back to CoD. Im sorry but I never felt that the Rocketlauncher was OP. You can easily kill the RL Guy with the Shotgun in close range, on long range with the falcon(sniper) and so on. If you have decent aim you can easily take him out. even RL vs RL is possible. And its a very sorry excuse to dont recommend the game just because you sucked and died to a rocket in your face and rage "TOO OP NO FUN ASIDKASJH DJALHSNDLAKSHJDKALSDJIO J NOT A GOOD GAME! UNBALANCED! NOT RECOMMENDED!"

Also it was announced! that there is only 1 map and 2 modes at launch. SO inform yourself before buying something and then start to complain!


Now back to topic!

Conclusiontime:

Why dont I recommend this game?

If you dont look for bugs or talk to the devs there is to few content to be worth buying it. As soon as more maps, all weps, more modes and workshop support release GO BUY IT but right now I cant recommend it if you dont want to get involved!


Thanks for reading and sorry for my bad english.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972469536', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1424992039}
review:
It is a fun game.  it is pretty much just Unreal Tournament though.  I mean the look and feel and all is the exact same.  It runs well.  Great graphics.  There are a few quarks that I am not a fan of. 

First, when you just spawn there is a few seconds where your gun has to "load" and you can't shoot.  
Second, the rocket launcher and shotgun seem to be one shot kills even if you have full life.  The number of times I have spawned only to be one shot after taking a few steps.  Its horrible.
Third, the gun balance is horrible. You start with a crappy pistol searching for a better gun.  The chances of getting one shot before finding said gun is high.  It takes a good amount of bullets to kill a person with a pistol. 

4/5.

Pros:
+Boot Camp (Local Bot Matches)
+Classic Arena Shooter Gameplay
+Stable Servers
+High amount of customizable graphical settings
+No FREE TO PLAY, FREE DEMO

Cons (More like Small Gripes)
-High ping on many servers (I'm in the Eastern US)
-No true controller support (wouldn't recommend one anyway unless you have a handicap)


TL;DR: This is one of the best early access success stories of all times. If you love arena, GET THIS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034211651', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1456184540}
review:
Here are some honest Pros and cons:

pros:

-Fast paced
-Based on skill (Unless you're using the Cerebus)
-Graphically stunning
-Good old fashioned combat
-Good dedicated servers
-Amazing port
-Very responsive movement
-Good map design (Only 1 map but Its design is excellent)

Cons:
-THE CEREBUS (I will talk about this once I finish with the cons)
-Crashes when on server screen (I doubt it's my machine the things a beast)
-AGAIN THE CEREBUS
-Really should be more than one map. I know it's early access but I still paid for the game give me at least 3 maps.
-The lens flare on the lights is distracting
-Map hitboxs are inconsistent

THE CEREBUS - Let me start by saying that this is the reason I stopped playing. The Cerebus is a rocket launcher which you can pick up near the center of the map. It's an OP weapon which almost everyone uses. People would rather not use skill and instead use this OP weapon and think they're good because they're getting loads of kills. YOU CAN NOT USE ANT OTHER WEAPON BECAUSE THE CEREBUS IS BETTER. The damage of the weapon isn't the problem It's the firing rate of it. You can't escape it and it just ruins the game and until they tweak the weapon I'm not playing online because I'd rather use a veriaty of guns. 

Overall the games great but maybe don't buy it yet... Just wait till the game has more than what it has so for

-Nostalgic Pickle

author: {'steamid': '76561198008336413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1426133991}
review:
I am beyond impressed with this gem. It is good to see actual skill based games come back into the fold. I had some trouble getting acustomed to the movement, but after I realized the mechanics of Dodge then jump+jump "Gotta go fast" I was having a blast out gunnning or hunting people down, closing the gap in .1 second for the kill. It is a good feeling of when one kill actually feels a rewarding as the next, instead of being a float in the sea of military cookie cutters. It brings life to a genre that is not only rewarding, but shows you what dedication and time put into it can do if you want to learn, you shall get better, instead of a one button beats all design. 

- The guns -
for the most part are pretty well balanced despite say the flamethrower need some graphics tweaks (Flame obstructing vision.)

The rocket launcher - I can see the backlash, but take into consideration the map size. I was engaged with a player at a farther range and I could dodge his shots with ease and outshoot him, which resulted in me getting the kill.

The Pistol - NEEDS a buff, it is near impossible to maintain any sort of survivability with it, it either needs a damage boost of maybe 30 - 35/ faster firing rate OR get rid of weapon respawns and implement an always active weapon availability like UT.

- Customization - 
This was a big problem for me seeing as how I am a aesthetic jumkie. There needs to be color customizations on Hud, beam colors, crosshair + ALSO adding crosshair customization, maybe even character LED lights.

Also the posibility of creating a character/presets available. 

 - Future - 
I hope this game is still supported and looked after like a small child to a paret after the release, possibly more maps and guns. A constant overview by the devs and interaction from them as well to he community with open ears. 

-Conclusionn - 
Needs a few tweaks, but it has impressed and can be near perfect if things are addressed/changed, but not to the point of ruining the weapons/alterations. (Balance, don't nerf to uselessness)

Thank you for all the time and work put into this, brings my heart joy knowing the gaming industry is still fighting and is much alive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032614730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1561257195}
review:
This is one of the best first person shooters I have played in years, if not the best period, which is quite surprising considering it isn't even done yet and I'm not normally a huge fan of early access games. Trust me, this game is worth it. If you like old school arena shooters at all, you will love Toxikk. Everything works exactly as it should within the parameters of the genre. The movement is extremely well-polished, the weapons feel natural (although some need balance adjustments as of the Wasabi build), and the atmostphere is perfect. 

There's no f2p pay-2-win BS-- another reason to respect the developers. They refuse to put in the nickel and diming model of most AAA studios anymore. It's a breath of fresh air when someone is actually pro-consumer anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995944207', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1631462449}
review:
Although technically still in alpha, this game doesn't do anything for the genre in its current form. It's essentially an Unreal Tournament 2004 clone with prettier graphics. The current map is also typical of an UT deathmatch map, featuring tight areas and some sense of vertical height. The map itself is well designed as are the weapon models and the sound effects have quite a bit of impact. Expect powerups such as health vials and armour to be placed strategically, the same strategies of Quake also apply here. Variety of weapons is limited; as you'd expect for a game this early in development but each handles well and are overall quite balanced with the exception of the shotgun and rocket launcher. Most of the weapons are also too similar to those found in UT 2004; to the point where they even share the exact same secondary fire modes.

I'm hopeful for the future of this game but in reality, quite worried that it will play it too safe and not deviate from the already established formula.

In my opinion, it will take some creative map design and new game modes to separate this game from UT. As an example, there are a lot of things which can be learned from Halo 4 which we've not yet seen on PC. It would be interesting to merge the exotic map design and experimental game modes of H4 with a fast paced old-school competitive shooter like Toxikk. Even the free-to-play Tribes: Ascend was built off being able to predict player movement and splash damage whilst travelling at fast speeds. It would be extremely refreshing and beneficial to this genre to introduce more platformer type mechanics into deathmatch maps.

I hope the developers don't stick to the same design philosophies for other game modes and hope they really try and craft something special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068282750', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1426361924}
review:
EDIT - No longer reccomending game: Not many people are playing anymore and there doesn't seem to be a whole lot of effort being put into the game, make sure you know what you're getting into if you buy this game.

EDIT - [No particular version]: Linux support pls. Before stuff gets too big and crazy I hope devs will make versions for other operating systems.

EDIT - CURY: The game now has a second map for CTF and has 2 vehicles. It is still lacking content enough content for me to feel confident in recommending it to my friends but that's why it's in early access. This game still shows quite some promise IMO.

This is great but ITS NOT FOR EVERYONE. If you have never played an arena FPS or like arena FPSes then you will (probably) love Toxikk. If you hate them, the experience is no different. I personally have never played an arena FPS and I love this game. I originally found this game on kickstarter a couple years ago and thought it looked amazing but unfortunately I could not support the campaign at the time, here we are now, this game is great, I am in love with the concept BUT it has only one map at the moment (I'm writing this review 2 days after it was released on early access so thats probably changed by the time you're reding this). If you like the concept I strongly recommend picking this game up for only $17 but if you're looking for an extensive FPS this is not it... yet.
