review:
This game reminds me so much of UT99. Just an excellent Arena style FPS like it's supposed to be! 
No camping to get that killstreak to get an automated drone or chopper that kills all the players for you, just pure movement and aim skill in this game.

Even in the menu you get that this is an excellent shooter just by all the different parameters you can adjust to get that exact mouse speed and acceleration you might want. 

Absolute must buy for any UT or Quake fan.

Kids, watch and learn, this is what a competitive shooter is all about. Can't wait for CTF and perhaps (*hoping*) an instagib mode? 

Absolute AWESOMENESS this is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049036335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1682368418}
review:
First of all: Toxikk is in an early state currently. The first Early Access build has been released about a day ago and the developers included one single map only - on purpose. This is because they focus on basic gameplay and weapon balancing at the moment, which will be done based on community feedback. However, new content will be released every 2-4 weeks. Reakktor have posted a detailed release plan on the official forums, which can be found here:
http://forum.toxikk.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=993

I'll try to update this review as new content gets released.

So here's my current opinion:

I knew this would be a very early release and hence I had my doubts about how playable and enjoyable it would be and how smooth it would work from a technical perspective. The download was about 800 MB only (including the dedicated server files), so I was very curious about what I would get to see.

Well, what should I say? Everything works just perfectly! I experienced no crashes at all. Graphics are smooth and beautiful despite my rather old system (Win7 64, Phenom II X4 CPU @3400 MHz, 8 GB RAM, Radeon HD 5800 graphics card with 1 GB). I play in full HD at high graphics settings and get no stuttering at all.

The game actually comes with a single player mode called "Blood Arena" where you can play against adjustable bots. If you set the number of combatants to 1, you will be alone in the map and can try out everything you want while taking your time. Once you're fed up with fragging bots, there's also the "Multiplayer" mode. Here, you can play on the internet, as well as on your own LAN. In both variants, you have the choice to create a listening server (where others can join while you're playing as well) or join another server (listening or dedicated). So playing a LAN game with your friends is really easy, for example.

The gameplay as such is very fluid. There's double jumps, dodging, dodge jumps and wall dodge jumps (exactly as in UT2004). At the moment, there are 7 weapons in the game including rocket launcher, sniper, flamethrower, shotgun, pistol and some more. The rocket laucher (called Cerberus) is somewhat overpowered in its current state, but I'm sure this will be fixed with the next release as weapon balancing is one of the main goals currently. You also can't access the options while being in a map yet, so the first setup is somewhat of a hassle. But once you're done with this, it's all ok. This will be improved as well for sure.

Apart from this, I'm really impressed how well everything works. Playing the game is great fun already - even if there's just one map (called "Foundation") right now. The menu, characters, weapons and map design is outstanding in my opinion and the sounds and music fit very well too. All players have equal chances as there's no such thing as DLCs, micro transactions and the like. To me it seems that this really could be the start of a true 1999 Arena FPS revival with up-to-date visuals.

I've been in the developer forums for some months now and I can really say that they have the right attitude towards the community, development and marketing. They have made everything as transparent as possible (as you can see with the  beta roadmap linked above, for example). Also LAN mode, free dedicated servers for everybody and the possibility to create your own clan in the game (not included yet) have been implemented as a result of community feedback - before the game even became available in Early Access.

Just 1 1/2 days after EA start, there are many active players and people trying to build up a community already. You can find Steam groups, twitch channels, clan pages/forums, TS servers, IRC channels and so on.

To conclude this lengthy review: I recommend getting this game asap and frag like it's 1999. ;) But keep in mind that EA has just started and the full content will be available in 4-6 months only.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072428271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1586660998}
review: Great game!  Fun to pick up and play, even for a casual game.  It's intense without being overbearing, as the absence of a calcified rank system removes the drive for "the next level," all while maintaining competitiveness.  The flexibility of this game means a player can be a pro-grade die hard UT fan, a casual bloke (or blokette) who just wants to blow off some steam (get it?), or anywhere in between!  The devs actually listen to their customers, and this is a product that could easily be worth 3 times as much as it is.  Get it while it's hot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047267321', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1424579900}
review:
I've never played UT or Quake.  I started playing games about the time those died out.  This is the first true arena shooter I have ever played, and while it took about an hour to get used to, I am having an absolute blast.

Just a few tips for new people:
- You can jump with space and dodge with shift.  A good way to move fast is to dodge forwards then immediatly jump (you can do this over people's heads).
- You can dodge off of walls
- All guns have a primary fire and alt fire mode (left and right click).  For example, the starting gun has a single shot as the primary and a 3 round burst as the alt fire.
- The starting gun is intentionally bad.  You'll want to look for gun pickups around the map.  They will have timers over the spawn portal, if it's under 10 seconds you may want to stick around.
- The cloak (Q) is good for waiting for guns to spawn.  It lasts 3-5 seconds but you decloak as soon as you start shooting.
- Try to anticipate where people will go and be ready to shoot there.

Overall, I find that this game is really excellent, even though I don't really have a background in these types of games.  Highly recommended.

review:
Kurz mal angezockt und erst mal voll abgekackt.


Bei dem Spiel geht es um Skillz, Skillz und noch mehr Skillz.
Zurzeit gibt es 2 Modis. Deathmatch( Bloodlust) & Team Deathmatch (hei√üt hier Assault Saquad) 
Waffen sind noch ein wenig imba und  werden hoffentlich bald ausgeglichener sein.
Es gibt auch nur eine Map, die ganz ok ist, aber das Movement ist ziemglich geil und erinnert, wen wundert's, stark an UT (double jump....)
In Zukunft wird es bestimmt mehr Inhalte geben (Maps,Waffen, Fahrzeuge,....)



Wer damals schon UT oder Quake gezockt hat wird sich schnell zurecht finden und auch seinen Spa√ü haben. 
Ich gehe dann mal weiter √ºben

author: {'steamid': '76561198033173561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1424192721}
review:
TL;DR of pros/cons in the end.

TOXIKK is an Arena FPS that brings back the excellent gameplay from older titles such as Unreal Tournament and Quake, even though it's closer to Unreal then Quake (if that's good or bad that's for you to decide). 

The controls and feels of your character is top notch, at first it kinda feel slow and sluggish but when you start getting used to the dodge mechanincs you feel like a super hero at times. The gunplay is satisfying and every weapon feels good to use, even though some of them are highly unbalanced at the current moment (looking at you Cerberus).

The graphics are great aswell as the artstyle, really fits the game.

So far there is only one map available which is a bummer but it's Alpha/Beta/Early Access/Whatever-you-want-to-call so it's not too much of a hassle. The map layout is good with some open areas and a lot of chokes and close corners that "enforces" CQC, kinda wish they would add a larger map aswell so we would have a bit more variety.

To sum it up:
Pros:
- Great and clutch controls
- Satisfying gun-play
- Good graphics
- A bit of fresh air from the current trend of modern military shooters
- Brings back memories of the good old days of Arena FPS's
- Good hitboxes and netcode (atleast what I've experienced)

Cons:
- Only one map, will be fixed eventually.
- Unbalanced guns
- Seems to be a bug that when you spawn your gun doesn't pop up immedietly meaning you are defenseless for a few seconds (might be server lag?)
- To remove mouse acceleration completely you have to edit .ini files.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113268585', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1463391742}
review: Toxikk is an incredibly fun game. Even though its early access its seems very polished i have a solid 82fps at 1440p that NEVER drops during gameplay. I enjoy how everyone starts with a pistol and you have to get to the weapon spawns before the next guy if you want a better gun. The gameplay is smooth and fairly fast paced. I'd say pick it up its worth it the devs seem to really listen and they have the development plans and goals clearly laid out for the coming months. I donated to the kickstarter so my keys were only $11 but $17 is still worth it. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014316197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1480865486}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988874712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1474638402}
review:
PROS:

*Good graphic
*Well optimized.
*Dedicatd servers.
*Old fashion hardcore game.
*No crap within the game.[ like perks and etc etc.. ]

CONS:

-Unbalanced weapons.
-One map so far,and a bad one if I may say.
-Lack of weapons,the developers should make it easier to find weapons,it's reallsy sucks to fight someone with a pistol while he has rocket launcher.
-The game crash from time to time.


-Rocket launcher is OP in my opininon.


*Does the game worth 18$?*

At the moment no, it's not really worth 18$,but we should wait and see how the developers are going to update the game.
I have high anticipations for this game,hope the developers won't fuck it up.

-Do I recommend this game?

Yes,it's full with potentional,and it reminds me UT 1999,I really do miss those times.
If you played and enjoyed UT and other arena games you should try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121341864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1425815212}
review:
Apr√®s une petite heure de jeu mon avis √† chaud sur Toxikk :

Pros:
+Le jeu est vraiment beau
+Fonctionne sur la plupart des PC
+Fluide
+Serveur nickel, pas d'attente pour rejoindre une partie
+On retrouve les sensations de Unreal Tournament ou Quake 3
+Super speed
+Du kill, du kill et encore du kill

Cons:
-Une seule map pour le moment...(Petite en plus)
-Le respawn des armes trop lentes
-Manque d'√©quilibre entre les armes
-Enlever la fonction qui change l'arme automatiquement quand on prend une nouvelle, rageant en plein combat !!

Conclusion :
Toxikk est exactement le jeu que j'attendais depuis 10 ans ! Il manque plus qu'a attendre le nouveau contenu (map, mode et autres) pour que le jeu soit complet. Un fps arena fun, speed comme √† l'√©poque qui s'annonce comme le GOTY FPS de cette ann√©e 2015 !
Bon courage √† la team pour la suite !

(Mon PC le fait tourner facile en High : I5 4400, AMD r7 240 2go, 8go ram)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044791742', 'num_games_owned': 918, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1604512620}
review:
[b]GRAFICOS:10[/b]
[b]JOGABILIDADE:10[/b]
[b]SONS/EFEITOS SONOROS:10[/b]
[b]REPLAY:10[/b]


Toxikk e um jogo para fans do genero que quake praticamente inventou de fps competitivo,quem manja um pouco sabe que olhando rapido alguem desavisado acha que e um jogo lokeira onde tudo se move na velocidade da luz e a unica coisa que vc pode fazer e girar a camera e torcer para um dos seus tiros acertar o alvo.....rsrsrsrsrsrsrsr.

Definitivamente o jogo nao e assim,se vc jogar um pouco mais vai ver que e um jogo extremamente habilidoso e com o tempo vc vai se sentir numa briga de tiro com varios The Flash mas tudo sendo controlado por vc de forma eficiente e com um controle incrivelmente preciso e ajustavel da maneira que vc achar melhor.

Nesse genero vc nao precisa ser um eximio atirador para se dar bem pois esse nao e o ponto do game,aqui vc tem que ser bom de reflexo e coordena√ßao motora(sei que praticamente todos os jogos tem que ter isso,mas aqui isso e levado muito a serio)para sair das emboscadas enquanto vc esta seco para pegar um kit de armadura(que e muito cobi√ßado)ou ta esperando aquela arma que vc e muito bom com ela ser sumonada no spot,o jogo ainda possue um sistema de HS para quem acertar a cabe√ßa em que vc ganha mais XP e pontos(isso depende do modo de jogo),mas o foco mesmo e acertar o inimigo nao importando onde for pois as armas sao extremamente forte mas nao sao nem de longe OP,vc tem total condi√ßoes de vencer quem for com a melhor arma e vc com a arma padrao e tudo so depende de vc.

Os graficos.....Haaa e que graficos,primeiramente e um jogo de tiro futurista onde vc tem o seu corpo envolvido por armaduras pesadas mas mesmo assim vc e rapido como um gato e ao mesmo tempo tem um peso muito decente que vc sente quando pula(diferente dos jogos que citei la encima que quando vc pula parece ate que vc e um balao)ou quando usa os dashs(que por sinal pode ser feito para qualquer lado....isso e a grande carta desse genero),vc pode editar o seu personagem desde o aspecto da armadura ate as cores das luzes nela,confesso que ainda tem poucas op√ßoes mas e obvio que vai ser adicionado mais coisas com o tempo pois o jogo esta no EARLY ate o momento mas vou falar das limita√ßoes do EARLY mais para frente,e incrivel como o jogo tem texturas e filtros exuberantes e ao mesmo tempo e super leve com um desempenho que me deixou de boca aberta o tempo todo enquanto eu corria pela tela de HongKong(que por sinal ate o momento e a unica existente,mas e compreensivel)que exibe graficos sensacionais tanto na sua qualidade tecnica quanto artistica,para vcs terem uma idea o jogo nao possue qualquer tipo de mapa mas com apenas 10 minutos de jogo vc ja conhece cada ponto do mapa e se sente super bem com isso,e se os personagens e a tela tem graficos lindos as armas sao melhores ainda,nao vou nem citar o designer delas pois isso vai muito do gosto de cada um(eu adorei todas ^^)entao vou falar doque vi com os meus olhos,.....sensacional cada arma tem graficos detalhadissimos do nivel em que vc nao olha nem o nome dela mas sabe extamente que arma e extamente,vc so nao lembra de cada uma como nao consegue esquecer delas(ate agora estou com uma metranca que tem como cartucho um cilindo no meio dela avermelhado)e isso e simplismente sensacional o fato de vc indentificar algo apenas olhando logo no primeiro contato com o jogo sem precisar decorar ou ler algo,bom para encerrar a parte dos graficos tudo que posso dizer e que realmente a produtora se empenhou para trazer um jogo lindo e leve de forma extrema para nos Pcgamers(para quem nao sabe este jogo foi feito exclusivamente para o pc por pessoas que amam esse genero e tbm o pc como plataforma de jogo).

Outra coisa que fica muito em destaque sao os efeitos sonoros e a trilha sonora,tenho um amigo que nao e muito ligado em jogo e na hr que eu joguei pela primeira vez ele esta aqui olhando e adivinhei qual foi a primeira coisa que chamou aten√ßao dele?......sim a musica do jogo,kra a trilha do jogo(pelo menos da unica tela ate agora disponivel)e sensacional e nao te tira a aten√ßao do jogo um so instante,os efeitos tbm corresponde perfeitamente com cada a√ßao e tudo combinca de forma excelente dentro do game que vai desde um simples barulho do seu p√© tocando o chao depois de um dash ao barulho do seu p√© tocando o chao depois de um salto,e incrivel como coisas quase iguais tem barulhos diferentes.


Ate agora eu disse coisas que consegui ver com pouco tempo de jogo e tbm so disse coisas boas mas o fato e que o jogo e tao incrivel na sua vers EARLY que todo o resto que sentimentos que falta nao faz mal algum pois e um jogo feito apenas e simplismente para o competitivo extremo sem personagens com leveis mais altos que o seu com armas melhores ou com qualquer outra coisa que tenha alguma influencia no seu desempenho.

Varias outras coisas sobre o jogo que foi prometido para vers final e nao esta aqui sao tbm de cair o queixo como os mapas com veiculos que se parece muito com um BF futuristas.

[b]Para resumir e o seguinte,se vc curte esse genero de fps entao vai fundo que e de longe o melhor jogo que vc vai encontrar no mercado pois e um jogo que esta sendo feito por fans reais desse genero e nao por uma empresa que visa "APENAS" grana,sao pessoas que realmente querem ver esse genero de volta a ativa no mercado de fps e que estao de saco cheio dos fps comuns que tem de quilo por ae[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027461341', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1638744206}
review:
**EARLY ACCESS REVIEW**

----------------------------
>EARLY ACCESS DETAILS<

Be warned that the game contains for now only one playable maps, with only DM and TDM modes and no mutators. HOWEVER, additional content should come in pretty quickly since a lot of the content shown in the trailer is not there yet, meaning it's probably almost ready to be added to the official build. On top of that, the core gameplay is 99% done I think, the 1% left being the details they MIGHT change according to user feedback, so IF I'm right and the core gameplay is mostly done, that means the focus will be on adding content to the game (even maybe additional gameplay).

>EARLY ACCESS DETAILS<
----------------------------

OMG. That's what I think of this game. I never felt such a tension since I played UT2k4. Actually the whole game is a love letter to UT2k4 with modern graphics and a whole new set of weapons (it still have classics projectile but powerful weapons, explosive-type weapons, widespread weapons and charged weapons but there is many fun and new primaryand secondary fire modes. Cause yeah, the game features two fire modes, something introduced by the Unreal serie and used almost nowhere else (unfortunately IMHO) and here it goes.

It's exactly what I excpected from UT3, an evolution of UT2k4, with better graphics, a few twist of its own, and a competitive gameplay.

In short there are now 2 main "competitors" that aren't really in competition. Reflex and Toxikk. BUt as I said they do not compete, Toxikk, is UT-like arena shooter where Reflex is a lot more akin to Quake ;) Still you should own both at some point (wait a bit for Reflex it's not that much polished as of now).

Last but not least, the game features a SDK. I didn't download it, but on the website they say that every registered player have access to it for free, so I guess it might be a Steam tool or a download on Toxikk website ! This SDK will allow players to create skins, maps and so on, so I guess this so on could possibly mean developing your own mod and mutators like in UT2k4 (hell, the match creation screen even has a category mutator with no mutator as of now, but still it exists so my prediction is 90% accurate).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998957660', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1430370728}
review:
I cant believe I spent 17$ on this trash. If you want a game where the primary win conditions are a huge ping and the ability to camp the rocket launcher spawn point, this is the game for you. That being said, I think this game has the potential to be awesome, thats primarily why im so disappointed. Beyond the two huge issues listed above, let me go through some bulletpoints

Huge maps my ass, theres one map out and its incredibly tiny

Players have, in my opinion, way too many hitpoints. It isnt uncommon at all for a gun to take 6-7 shots to kill.

Almost nothing about the trailer is true or currently implemented

UI feels like it was designed to be "futuristic" with no thought at all to functionality

Rubberbanding is rampant, and so is getting insta-spawn killed. 

The game requires extensive .ini editing to remove some annoying "features" http://www.nimbleminds.eu/forum/community-boards/community-games/toxikk/5609-toxikk-tipps/

And last but not least, its Early Access. Which means none of this will probably get fixed and we'll get one or two more maps and then the devs will probably call it done and move onto another project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019649555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1425702612}
review:
Let me preface this by saying this: I want this game to succeed. This game really does have some sweet, polished fun. But the fact of the matter is that I only was able to play one game before I had the game repeatedly crash on me. To the point that I came to make on this review: devs, please fix the crashing issues, as I can't write a good review for a game that I can't play. I cannot reccommend this game until these crashing bugs are fixed.

EDIT: 1/29/2015

After a much needed update to fix some issues with crashing I have to admit that I really like the action of the game. It's still very limited play though as there is only one map to play on and two game modes. I hope they come out with new maps and game modes soon. Also weapon and vehicles would be nice as well ;)

review: This game takes me back to old days playing whatever version of Unreal I had at the time.  The first time I played this game I was initially impressed by the gameplay which is intuitive for players of old school FPS games.  I will admit I don‚Äôt play that many games on the keyboard/mouse these days, mostly because I play in the living room.  I set this up with Xpadder & a controller and it works very smooth.  I then turned the graphics settings all the way up and then played another game.  The graphics on max were very impressive and ran smooth on my laptop, and were intense on my TV & projector.  I am looking forward to future developments for this game.

review: Another wanna be "Skill wins" FPS that is clearly not the case.  Old school feel is nice starting off with only a pistol, but as usual 1 map, small at that, put a rocket launcher in the middle and it just becomes "Winner is first to reach it" kind of gameplay.  Would be nice if these dev's that advertise their games as a "Skill wins" kind of game actually made the game that way and not "First to get to OP weapon" wins.  Unless its balanced out and they put in some bigger maps for now I wont be recommending this to people.  There are other F2P FPS's out there ATM as well as some $30+ FPS that do a better job with the "Skill outweighs Weapons" kind of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992002311', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1473801674}
review:
UPDATE 07-03-2015:
Last patch improve a little the framerate on the big map, but it's still not very good (drop to 70 on some spots of the maps with everything to low).
If you are not an addict of the > 120 fps like me, you will have no problems.

UPDATE 17-02-2015:
While the performances on the game was perfect on the first map, they are bad on the second map (big map with vehicles).
Now, I have a lot of drop at 60/70 FPS. I sadly can't recommend the game in this condition.
---------------------------
It's a long time that I haven't played to a such good FPS.

- Very nervous, totally worthy of UT/Quake.
- Movement system is fun/deep/fast.
- This is the kind of game where you make memorable frag, like in Tribes or Quake. You close the game, and you still remember of this moments.
I talk about this kind of moments when you make a mid air or a perfect reflexe snipe during a fast dodge+jump or a double/triple kill with a big anticipation for each shot and a perfect switch of weapon during the gunfight.
- On my PC (I2500k + 970), the optimisation of the game is just perfect. I locked my framerate to 125 fps, I can play with all settings maxed without a single drop of framerate !

Only one downside, the visibility is not ideal in the game. You can remove a lot of visual effects with cfg files, but it's not perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030083302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1549509144}
review: I always dine upon the reviews of my fellow steamonians but have never brought a dish of my own to the feast. This game changed all that. This game orders up a heaping portion of kick@ss with a righteous side of wanton destruction. It puts the pickle back in the bun of your arena burger... I feel like I may have lost my way a bit in this analogy. Bottom line, this game is too good not to support. It really channels the UT2004 vibe and does it even better, in some ways, by being even truer to the series than the series itself stayed. I feel like the most important point to take away here is that time travel exists... because clearly the devs have found a way to go back in time and make sweet love to UT2004 and brought back the love child for all of us to play with... and now we know why I should really stay away from writing reviews on Steam, sorry guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993661434', 'num_games_owned': 7148, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1449086723}
review:
The only negative thing I can say about this game is the Rocket Launcher is, in it's current iteration, too overpowered in narrow maps. It's the old quake rocket launcher, with quake damage and speed. For maps with small corridors and twisty turny multilevel playing fields this is just basically like handing murder-onna-stick to the capable players in the arena.

That's the bad.

The good? Where do I [i]start[/i]...

It's beautiful. All the other weapons handle perfectly, it's like someone walked back to the late 1990's, found Unreal Tournament, blew the dust off, cradled it lovingly in their embrace, and went "It's okay, you're safe now, modern game developers might have forgotten the concept of the pure deathmatch shooter, but we won't forget. We will make you shine, we will make you stand tall once more."

And they did.

Oh god, they did. Toxikk is effectively what happens when you pull Unreal Tournament out of the 1990's, put it in the hands of developers who loved, absolutely loved Unreal Tournament, and then decided to take all that was good about the game, and make it -better-. The graphics, beautiful. The sound, meaty. The gameplay, tight. The effects, lush. The core levelling concept - pitch perfect. Everything about this game save the one thing I mentioned right at the outset is wonderful, wonderful, wonderful.

What we've got here, is a beginning, and if the devs keep up the good work from this point on, we're going to see an explosion, a return of the FPS arena shooter on the PC in a big way. This is worthy of your time, and your money, and even with the one map it runs right now, it's glorious. Get it. Love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960445564', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1511565409}
review:
This game feels like Unreal Tournament moved into today, and I've played on one map.

Nostalgia is overwhelming me. Even though I'm not much of an arena FPS HARDCORE CAPS LOCK OMFG I NEED 800x600 kind of guy, I think this game Toxxik bring a very great peek back in time and drags the ideas of the past into the future with style, pizzaz and REALLY solidly running gameplay.

I have't had this much fun with a game in a while - definitely one of the few early access titles one should support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043076233', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1473508084}
review:
[h1] More polished in Beta than most recent AAA games. [/h1]

Seriously though, this game is FUN, I dont think ive had so much fun with an FPS in a while!

[b] Quick summary: [/b]

Dedicated Servers, none of the p2p shit.

If you want to stay alive, you HAVE to move, but you have to be able to hit moving targets at the same time. 

There is more to the game than just moving and shooting, press F to play dead and escape from a firefight, or lie dead and spring up like a trap to unsuspecting players. Press Q to enable a temporary cloak (Maybe 3 Seconds?) and sneak up on your prey.

This game is a prime example of the beauty of Unreal Engine. The lighting, reflections, textures, particles, etc are all gorgeous. Honestly one of the most beautiful Unreal Engine games I've seen.

The music in this game is just perfect. When I first hopped into a match I didnt spawn just so I could hear the whole intro track, that dirty bass just fits the theme so well.

This game runs as smooth as warm butter (at least on my PC), I have had NO framedrop or performance issues whatsoever.

[b] There are a few issues though: [/b]

[list]

[*]The sensitivity slider is no joke.

[*]There is no Borderless Window option, and sometimes it can take a few tries to get your settings to stick. 

[*][strike]You cannot change options/settings while in a match, you have to leave the match entirely to change settings (unless maybe you can in the console, not sure though).[/strike] FIXED

[*] The game did crash once, but started up again with no problems.

[*]Some of the weapons need a bit of rebalancing.

[olist]

[*][strike]Cerberus (Rocket Launcher) needs a damage nerf (He who owns the cerberus, owns the match)[/strike] FIXED

[*]Raven (Basic Pistol) needs a fire rate boost

[/olist]

[/list]

I can 100% reccomend this game to anyone looking for Quake/UT style fast-paced FPS arena action. Just remember that at this moment there is only 1 map and 8 guns.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993191437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1436090962}
review:
Auf so ein Game habe ich jahrelang gewartet, als gro√üer Fan von UT und Quake! ..bin begeistert! - denn Das Gameplay erweckt so manche Erinnerung an fr√ºher :)
Leider gibt es momentan nur eine Map, man darf halt nicht vergessen dass es Early Access ist, und das vergisst man hier leicht, da es sich jetzt am 2. Releasetag schon ganz sch√∂n vollwertig anf√ºhlt ;)
Macht jedenfalls irre Spa√ü und h√§lt was es verspricht! 
Die Waffen sind noch imbalanced, Item-Posis sind in Ordnung. Ich hoffe jedenfalls es kommen bald neue Maps, man k√∂nnte hier auch gut mit dem Workshop arbeiten! 
Movement find ich teilweise etwas schleppend, und Errungenschaften gibt es momentan nur nach einem Rang/Punktesystem, zumindest im Low-Bereich schnell gemacht was ich bis jetzt mitbekommen habe (Habe jetzt nicht mal 1,5 Stunden gezockt und habe schon 5/16), das k√∂nnte man z. B. noch etwas einfallsreicher/kniffliger gestalten.
An der Grafik gibt es nichts zu bem√§ngeln, wie von einer gut eingesetzten Unreal Engine zu erwarten.. Nur diesen f√ºrchterlichen Blur-Effekt aus der Voreinstellung hab ich direkt in den Grafikeinstellungen ausgestellt. ;P
Wer viel Wert auf Soundtrack legt dem kann ich leider nur empfehlen seine eigene Playlist im Hintergrund laufen zu lassen, der Soundtrack ist jetzt nicht so der Ober-Hit, aber da kann ja noch einiges kommen wenn die Map-Anzahl steigt.

~ 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198010192951', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1422051137}
review:
Hilariously bad name, surprisingly good game; iTzxxTOXIKK420xx is fast-paced and a decent amount of fun for being something in Early Access. As the game's description outlines, it plays much closer to older games like Quake or Unreal Tournament (incorporating things such as map placement of weapons as opposed to preset loadouts and non-regenerating health) and ends up being a refreshing change of pace from what you get with a lot of online shooters these days. However, considering there's only one map and the weapon balance/map placement is still being worked out I'd probably recommend people to wait for a couple updates just to have a bit of variety and not get burned out on playing it before the game's at its full potential. Regardless though, the core gameplay is entertaining and it seems like there's a lot of promise in this for anyone that just wants an Unreal Tournament-style game to get into so it may still be worth checking out if only to see the solid foundation the developers have laid.

And who knows, maybe they'll call it something else by the time it officially releases; otherwise you might want to boot up some eroge like Sakura Angels or a valley girl simulator - such as the critically acclaimed Barbie Dreamhouse Party - before jumping on here and save yourself the embarrassment of your friends seeing you playing something that sounds and looks like a bad Xbox Live gamertag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121020425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1431707754}
review: This game looks like halo and its damn aswome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198101180386', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1423424886}
review: This game isn't worth buying right now, the movement mechanics and physics sdont seem really ballanced and the projectile speed of certain guns aren't perfect, this could be a good game in the future, but i'll probably wait another year before comming back to it. feedback isn't very well worked out so far in my opinion, but the game is very early in developpement. Also the biggest problem i'm finding right now other than general game balanced is that there is no minimap and the maps themselves dont seem very creative, this game honestly seems like a new attempt at quake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107298618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1422102834}
review:
This game surprised me, it is a good and I mean really good early access Title.

It is not a buggy pile of ''Revolutionary concept'', No no no It is a simple an well executed Master piece.

It is fast and fun to play, and good lord am I happy that this is not one of thoose Free2Play games that are totally awesome but ask you bucks for everything.

You just buy the game custom your Badass soldier (You can put your name on it well nobody cares about that but I find it really cool so yeah be happy to know that) and join a server and play no Account required or some poop like that.

Every body is equal every Body has the same chance to win, it is just beautifull.

You might say that it is pretty expensive well this game is worth every god damn penny it asks you don't need to wait or pray for it to become playable it is already believe me people it is a gift from the gods.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031276356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1490317222}
review:
I will have to update this as development goes on, but so far I'm having fun.

The aesthetic reminds me a little bit of Halo, but the mechanics feel like Unreal Tournament. The one map that we're able to play on right now (Foundation) is a fairly small map, but has well-placed weapons, health packs and so on. The map is also well made to allow for quick movements and clever tactics.

I'm looking forward to the bigger maps with vehicles as they come. I really think this is going to be my next shooter. I've gotten bored of military shooters. Advanced Warfare did a little good with the exosuits, but this game just brings me back to the Halo days a little bit which is what I grew up with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024515670', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1432424263}
review:
This game is pretty shiny! Being a lover of shiny things and arenas of death, this game was pretty magnetic to my eyes when it was shown to me. so now a early on review that WILL change at a later date. Oh and heres a summary of everything im about to say. This game is fabulous. It has really good core gameplay. It has what id expect from an arena shooter and adds more sugar to the amazing cup of tea that it is. There are some weapon balancing things I would do such as buffing the spawn pistol and reducing the default ammo count on the rocket launcher. The visuals need to be a bit less blurry for a pc game. Id recommend this game simply because it plays very well and it doesnt require a top of the line pc to play it.

And now on to what I love about this game in detail. 

*The weapons! They look amazing and feel right when its in the hands of my character who really looks like a spartan from halo 4/5. Being a long term halo fan, I actually really like this. Anywho, the weapons are nice! The rocket launcher is a strong power weapon as it should be buut compaired with the other weapons, I feel it needs less rockets upon pick up. Maybe a longer respawn time too because out of the matches I have played thus far, it basically will give you victory if used right. You will never run out of rockets if you and run the map just right. Maybe the rocket launcher simply doesnt belong on the one map we have right now. I also feel the pistol can use a slight buff. Its the only weapon that seems to struggle to hold its own among all the other weapons from my experiance. I dont have much of an issue with the other weapons cause they seem perfect. They arent op and they all hold their own against eachother pretty nicely. 

*The map! The layout of it is nice. Pretty generic and what id expect from an arena shooter. It runs smoothly and theres combat basically everywhere. I cant wait to see more. The one map we have right now consists of 3 or 4 floors which dont really have a direct line of sight on eachother. Around the center, theres a lift and a jump pad so you can go from basement to roof really fast. Mobility is no issue on this map to say the very least. 

*Player movement. Its really really smooth. Its way beyond my expectations. I don't actually have much to say about it other than its gonna take me some time to get use to the dodging mechanics.

*The audio. 90% of the time, I mute my games audio cause I hate the way things sound in most games. A lot of times, its just the bgm cause I hate the bgm games use. The sfx I turn down but not off most of the time simply cause I like hearing my guns shoot or my swords swing. This game is one of the few that I play that has audio that i actually like to listen to! 

*The bullet holes! Yes really, this minor detail! SOOO many games dont even bother with this detail. While they arent perfect or even the best looking ones, they are there so I know my gun is actually shooting and missing vs me thinking I am shooting and not knowing that I am missing then assuming my game lagged or glitched causing me to rage quit then never playing the game again. Bullet holes and scorch marks are highly important for any shooter game. I only wish they stuck around a while longer for simple asthetics added over time sense there's nothing destructable. 

More will be added im sure as more is put into the game.
Now for the things that bug me or what id consider to be bad.

*The textures. You have this glowy tv screen sign thingy that looks absolutly amazing on a wall that is so blurry, it would probably look like a solid color from 50m away. The floors are okay but still pretty blurry. 

*Gibs arent juicy enough. They look like rocks too. 

yep. those are my only two dislikes about this game. Two minor details. The gameplay is solid.

review: If you like Unreal Tournament, you'll love this. There are some balancing issues currently and there's only one map to play on, so I'd wait a few weeks to get it if you can't stomach playing on the same map over and over again. Otherwise, it's pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046755458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7769, 'last_played': 1459764054}
review:
Ok So 
Toxikk is a fun and fast paced game.
With the comeback of arena fps games coming this game is probely one of the best ones to start you off. Unlike UT4 this game has alot more freedom in the movement very sumular to Ut2004
The gameplay feels great and the community is friendly i havent met anyone who is disrespeckt full in any manner. But I beg you do not buy the game while it is in early access. It is dead for the time being manly because reakktor doesn't want people to play the game while they are still fixing bugs. 
I kid you not if you like the idea of the game and like the way it looks buy it when it comes out. You will have your moneys worth but until then there is no point for getting this game in early access unless you
want to help with the dev of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096691719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1423060854}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970685915', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1422332404}
review:
Wonderful game. Achieves 144 fps easily. Good friendly community. Really solid gameplay. Mechanically brilliant, fluid movement, the game provides a lot of 'wow' moments. Post death there's a swift return to action which helps maintain momentum, and if you're having a really good run it is very possible to stay alive for a while. 
In the community discussions you can read where the game is up to. At my time of playing there is only one level - however the game is going to grow, for now I'm already extremely satisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989736237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1423429064}
review:
Was always going to buy this game because it's cheap, but genuinely didn't expect myself to enjoy it.

Was blown away by how much fun i was having, it's intense and incredibly well optimised. From watching the vids before the game release it's the movement that put me off the game, but it feels smooth and works great.

Well worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044303388', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1431, 'last_played': 1634953161}
review:
Unlike the few early access games I've bought, Toxikk is extremely polished, runs well, looks good, and has a clear road map for final release, which should be in May.  Because the developers are using early access as a time to test specific features there is a lack of content in game as of the first release (only one map). This is completely fine when you consider that by May, there will be 8 official maps and with the Community SDK launching in March, there will be plenty of community maps, many of which can be ports of popular UT3 maps. 

Don't buy this game if you are some how under the illusion that you are getting a full game; you are not.  You are paying a slightly lower price now in return for helping the developers tweak all the in game settings.  The devs are active on the forum and are great at listening to and responding to community feedback. 

With that out of the way, the game is fun, the weapons and movement feel good to me, and I've really enjoyed the time I've gotten out of it. I don't have much experience with UT, Quake, or any of the other popular arena shooters.  The closest thing I have experience with is Halo, and honestly the game really isn't that similar, but it is more so than Call Of Duty.  

The game is without a doubt worth the asking price now if you're excited by what this game brings. If you're still on the fence about it, wait a little while and see what new content comes out in the coming weeks. I'm gonna go get some frags now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970790284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1422640922}
review: I wasn't sure quite what to expect with this however my friends told me this was like Unreal Tournament.. They were right! The feel of this game is great, the movement is excellent and the graphics are spectacular. If I had to compare this movement to anything it would be UT3, double jump and dodge are here. My few complaints will (hopefully) be addressed as this is an early access game. Spec mode is pretty bare bones, I can't figure out how (if you can) talk while in game or find out who exactly I'm spectating unless I follow the kill messages. One map is disappointing esecially when you are basically paying for a beta BUT the devs said the will be adding more before playtest is over. Hopefully us playtesters will get a huge discount on final game *wink wink*

author: {'steamid': '76561197988382352', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2151, 'last_played': 1473991047}
review: I absolutely love it ;). This game has a great deal of potential and is pretty well done for an early release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061336044', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1435173960}
review:
first thing people thinking of getting into this game day 1 is that at launch there is just 1 playable map,
this out of the way, everything currently implimented works perfect from my expericance so far.
its  absolutly awsome, they nailed the arena shooter feel to the letter.
havnt had this rush in a while.
they seem to polish the implemanted mechanics very well befor going into early access.
what is in at the moment doesnt feel buggy at all, and flows like a charm.
contant is a little thin at the moment with only one map (if you look at the trailers, its the china town map), but its so fun.so i dont really care that much at the moment,
we'll see how often they release new maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991628562', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1486896230}
review:
Here's a short survey to find out if you want this game.

Do you like:
1. Unreal Tournament and/or Quake 3 Arena?
2. Freakingly fast paced shooting?
3. Fancy graphics?
4. Great controls?
5. Skill based games? (Can be quite hard as a beginner but crazy rewarding as you get better)
6. LAN play?
7. Great optimization?
8. Early access which is only missing some maps, weapons and such? (Only found one bug as of yet)

If you could answer yes to any of these questions (mostly 1, 2 and 5) then yes. I totally recommend getting this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017777870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1488490196}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026417638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1479594844}
review:
This is probably the greatest Early Access game I've ever played. I miss these kind of shooters! Guys, well freakin' done! The one map I get to play is pretty awesome. It's well built. The game sounds great. Takes me back to my Unreal Tournament days. 

I can't wait for the final version and I'm happy to be part of the building process!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985999539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1424201287}
review:
Lo ten√≠a reservado desde que Reakktor Studios lo anunci√≥ el a√±o pasado y ahora que ha llegado a Steam por medio de Steam Early Access puedo decir que la espera ha merecido la pena.

A√∫n tengo que echarle m√°s partidas, pero vamos, que las primeras impresiones para alguien que tiene en un pedestal t√≠tulos como Quake III: Arena o Unreal Tournament, no pod√≠an ser mejores.

Como reza su eslogan, "Frag like it's 1999". Un FPS como los de anta√±o, fren√©tico y directo.

#Actualizado

Si bien mis impresiones siguen siendo positivas, por ahora esta versi√≥n, a√∫n en desarrollo, es parca en contenidos, al tener tan solo dos modos de juego (Bloodlust y Squad Assault), que vienen a ser el Deathmatch y Team Deathmatch de toda la vida, dentro de un solo mapa, Foundation. Al menos, eso s√≠, se puede jugar tambi√©n offline contra bots (con varios aspectos a modificar) o en LAN contra otros jugadores (esto √∫ltimo ya no lo he probado, que conste).

author: {'steamid': '76561198039403329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1473943792}
review: good game but..............still a long way to go and yet reach standard of Quake3 or Unreal Tournament yet. however because it cheap price you may try to buy it. but do not expect many people play it cause still only death match available for now. and balance between weapon still not good yet. let say you still need luck about where and when you respawn. wrong place wrong time only mean get killed right at you spawn point by rocket and beam weapon. thanks to the extremely weak pistol you spawn with. it may have unlimit ammo but too weak like that only mean inevitable get spawn kill. hope they gonna do something about its balance soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972854065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1472310287}
review:
Attention: C'est une v√©ritable Early Access, si vous esp√©rez jouer √† un jeu complet attendez.

Prometteur, un bon retour aux sources comme les vieux de la vieille l'attendaient. Il est encore en phase de peaufinage, mais si vous n'avez pas peur d'√™tre confront√© √† une version encore non finalis√©e, foncez et supportez Reakktor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985417009', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1585226839}
review:
Toxikk... Hammer... Mehr brauch ich eigentlich nicht dazu sagen.. 
Nach der UT3 Entt√§uschung vor einigen Jahren, habe ich lange auf ein neuen schnellen Shooter gewartet. Und Toxikk ist obwohl es erst in einem Fr√ºhstadium ist jetzt schon sogut wie Perfekt. Das Movement ist finde ich haargenau wie Ut2k4 , die Waffen sind ein Misch-Masch aus UT und Quake. Bis jetzt gibt es zwar nur eine Map (Die ich Pers√∂nlich nicht sogut finde) und einen Modus (Deathmatch) allerdings reicht das f√ºr eine fr√ºhe Beta (Early Acces-Phase) vollkommen aus. Ich kann das Game jedem UT und Quake Fan nur ans Herz legen, und wenn jemand der bis heute keins von beiden gespielt hat in den Genuss eines sch√∂n alten Shooters kommen m√∂chte ist er bei Toxikk genau richtig! Ich hoffe Das Game verkauft sich gut damit auch die Entwickler dran bleiben, allerdings habe ich da garkeine Sorge, da viele auch so ein Game gewartet haben.. Jetzt k√∂nnen wir nur noch Abwarten das das neue UT was kommen soll √ºberhaupt noch mithalten kann mit Toxikk.. Es wir schwer!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014851791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1478022274}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003842408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1473725518}
review:
Its a surprise how polished this game is. Depsite its day 1 flaws (1 map, imbalanced rocket launcher) the overall game is extremely solid, and I reccomend this game to anyone and everyone interested in playing a real game.

Think UT with some Quake influence. Yes, that means there is a skill curve, git gud.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058846554', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1431297794}
review:
Not a bad game at all. Quake players will definately like the game. Graphics are beautiful, havent noticed any major bugs or lag when playing any server.

plenty of mouse customization, but not a lot of fine tunning for it. Would be nice if I could set it to a decimal if needed.

Hopefully in the next early febuary update when vehicles come in, I can edit the review and say that the game is a good mixture of halo and quake.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992338529', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1695094486}
review:
This game has all the making of a great game from the era of twitch and arena shooters. It presents it in a way that is simple to understand and is almost addictive.

This game will get better with time and more content.

At this time, I would give it a 7/10. Let's see if they can make it a 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998098415', 'num_games_owned': 892, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1425867090}
review: Movimenta√ß√£o igual a UT, velocidade de Quake, gr√°ficos modernos. O jogo √© caprichado, design excelente em tudo. No atual est√°gio, com apenas 1 mapa e 2 modos, o jogo funcionou redondo, bots e online. Muito promissor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013636176', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1442072830}
review:
Although the game only went into beta, it's pretty clear it will be one of the best arena shooters ever made.

If you liked UT2004 you like TOXIKK. It basically uses the same movement model, so you won't have a hard time to adapt. The weapons are somewhat similar to the Quake Weaponset, so no surprises on this.

About the tech stuff:
The Game is built with the Unreal Development Kit, so it uses UE3. I run it w√≠th ~150 FPS on a i5-4570 & GTX770, no OC. Ofcourse such stuff is map dependant, and there is only one map so far. But it should give you a clue about the performance.

The game will evolve over the next few months, so make sure you check in from time to time. That is, if you're not fully into it already! See you ingame!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985986008', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1588188881}
review: I did think this would be a copy of unreal tournament and quake (etc). I was hoping it would be a good copy but as of now I don't think so. Gameplay is very generic. Visuals are not good enough to draw you in despite unoriginal gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992703739', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1422352361}
review: Just WOW, I know it's early to speak on it but so far I can say that I have not had so much fun in a game where I'm like "WOO!!!" or "YEH MUTHAFUCKA!" with this extreme competitive drive lol! I enjoyed it and looking forward to seeing more of the game. The engine and feel of the game is PERFECT. Once you get your sensitivity set the way you like it... its like arming yourself to get some really bad ass frags. Definitely give this game a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009631201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1421976433}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032831831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1532917154}
review:
waited for release.
its finally here
there is only one map. but 2nd map is to release is a few weeks.

first impression is...
first 3 rounds DM and TDM
OMFG this game play is so fast i can't even grasp what is going on "Dead"

a few hours in..,
OMG you got me... respawn. shotgun to the face... pay backs are great
and as you get away someone else gets you...

to take away from this whole review is.
the game play is EXTREMELY FAST.
the current map is small but more are coming.
we already seen some of the other content..
this release is scaled for testing and still VERY PLAYABLE.
i put nearly 5 hours in on day one.. and i love it......

author: {'steamid': '76561197971676818', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1424366799}
review:
1 Map, 2 Game Modes, 7 Weapons... That is current early access state of game.

Weapons (in short): 
You start with single/3fire pistol. Then you have one LMG which is reasonably strong. One weird Flamethrower which is very strong at very short range.
And now the 4 killers: Bullcraft Shotgun/Falcon Sniper/Stingray Plasma/Cerberus Rocket Launcher.
 - if you know how to use them... 1 shot one kill.
Weapons are plenty on currently only map available and easy to access.

Movement (in shorter):
 - Jump, Double Jump, Dodge+Jump, Wall Jump/Dodge
 - If you can, you are twice as fast than those who can't

Game Modes (in shortest): DM/TDM

To wrap it all:
 - game is unforgiving, you are either capable to frag or bottom feeder (No Skill, no Kill. I call it fair play!)
  (I saw it in many matches, people ranging from K:D of 0:8 to 10:1)

Should you get into this fast train?
 - If you like how randomly weapons shoot in modern games, which makes great players miss and give bad random hits, then this is not for you.
But if you gun in CS1.6 with AK three people across entire map before they can even aim at you, then you have skill required to be competitive here. Welcome to Frag Fest.

Here you have feature list tracker (roadmap):
http://forum.toxikk.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=993

author: {'steamid': '76561198093728107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1449825644}
review: This game is chaotic. CHA...OTIC!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975676099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 2055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1971, 'last_played': 1473957535}
review:
Finally done, after all this time. I bought this game since it first appeared in early access and never regretted it.

What a great game. Gunplay is fun. Movement is fun. Vehicles are fun.

Everything in this game just screams FUN while shooting at you with a rocket launcher.

Were you let down by the Doom 2016 multiplayer? Here's your answer. Kinda missing those UT times? Well, the new UT doesn't have vehicles yet, this game does. Just simply want to shoot your friend with a shotgun? This is one of the better games to do that in.

Graphics are absolutely gorgeous. I'm used to the simple Quakelive etc. "arena-fps" graphics but this game is like "yo it's 2016 we gotta update our graphics a little bit." Still, you can tone those down a lot if needed.

One of the best qualities in this game is the robust crosshair and hitmarker customization. You can tweak your crosshair size, add layers and put two crosshairs together, making one ultimate crosshair, color them, rotate them.. Pretty much anything. You can also choose hitmarker visuals, it's colors and sounds.. It's awesome and more games need stuff like this.

There are tools for those who love to make maps, and the soundtrack kicks ass!

There's also a demo that let's you play with anyone who owns the game on the official servers, so feel free to give the game a try and join us. But for 20‚Ç¨, you would get amazing amount of fun.

The only con I find is the lack of players, but since the demo let's you play with anyone on the official servers, I don't see any point to not give it a try. I'm sure the playerbase will now pick up since it's out of early access.

Anyway this must be one of the better FPS games I've played for long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052647315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1586882644}
review: If Halo 3 and Counter Strike had a baby and you added extremely fast player movement that would be Toxikk. After only 15 minutes of the game I was already having a blast and knew this game was something special. It is very well balanced and I believe this is an extremely important FPS game in todays version of the genre. This game is pure fun and it is the best Early Access game I have played so far. I got it the minute it came out and I could not be happier with my purchase. It is extremely addictive and a ton of fun. I hope you guys enjoy playing Toxikk as well. Best $17.09 I have spent on an FPS game so far :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065622806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1422047757}
review: true oldschool arena shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025166909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1471327448}
review:
Takes us back to the amazing world of Arena-FPS games, but with a surprising refresher on how to do it.

Early Access means the game is still in its infancy, which means we have a few things to bear, (such as weapon balance issues, a single map, and connectivity issues,) but I'm sure those will be ironed out in no time.

This is an excellent FPS with a LOT of potential. If you are a fan of older Arena-Style shooters, such as UT or Quake, this is definitely worth your money!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046963497', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1473830833}
review:
This is a tough one. What I played, I really loved. However, that's at around 18-20 fps. I know it's not me, as I just got done playing Crysis 3 at a steady 60 fps with everything on 'high.' It may be because I have an AMD Radeon card. I'm not going to fault the game for this as it is Early Access and it just came out. I'm also getting a bug where the options menu hangs everytime I apply the option. I can keep selecting ''apply,' but it won't go away, forcing me to manually close the game. 

The game plays fantastic. Currently only one map, but the game feels fantastic. I'll give it a cautious recommendation and hope that it gets updated very soon.

EDIT: The game seems to be locked at 17 fps for me. This is...odd. I get 30fps at the splash screens. Then, in the menu AND gameplay, it just stays at 17. Neither up or down. Huh.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971516978', 'num_games_owned': 8386, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1421997691}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999712762', 'num_games_owned': 1949, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1473994002}
review:
I'm impressed. This is probably the most polished Early Access game I've ever played, and also one of the best-looking ones as well. Especially for an indie developer. The game is perfectly stable, crash-free, and runs smooth as silk on my PC. Was able to set my options and join an online match within seconds, no problems whatsoever. The game runs on Unreal Engine 4.

It has all of the settings you would expect from a proper PC game. World detail, shadow detail, light shafts, AF level, multiple forms of anti-aliasing, different framerate caps, V-sync, and FOV slider that can go well over 100. I'm playing it on the "Very High" preset with a few extra tweaks. I'm sure I can run it on "Ultra" just fine, but I haven't bothered trying yet. It's such a fast-moving game that there isn't much point in stopping to admire the pretty graphics (but it's a very pretty game anyway).

The menus are laid out well, the server browser is slick and functional, and - as I said - the whole game feels extremely polished.

Fans of Quake and Unreal Tournament will feel right at home here. The devs have been pretty straightforward about their resentment toward F2P games and microtransactions. There's no leveling, loadouts, XP, or any other "modern" FPS features. No sprinting, no ADS. Bunnyhopping is alive and well. The rocket launcher is the most devastating weapon in the game (as it should be), but it's not fast enough or explosive enough that it doesn't require skill.

The weapon spawn points actually have a timer floating above them to show when they will respawn. A clever feature that I have never seen in an arena shooter before.

The one little gripe I had is that I couldn't modify my settings during a match. Had to back out to the main menu to change my mouse sensitivity. A bit frustrating but something you'll only have to deal with once.

The other thing I should point out, is that there is, literally, only one map right now. But it's a very fun, polished, and well-designed map. Lots of branching paths without feeling too cramped. My understanding is that the developers are working on balance right now, and will release maps over time; the next map probably being sometime in early February.

Really glad I took the risk on this game. The people making it are obviously pretty passionate. If you're looking for classic deathmatch-style gameplay with a modern coat of paint, it's a must-have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028662817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1424325362}
review:
An appetizer for now, delicious supper later! 

It has been sometime, I would say, since there has been a good FPS that is worth looking at for more then a glance. Toxikk seems to want to be a small niche shooter for those gamers who want to enjoy a arcade/arena shooter, it runs on the Unreal Engine 3 and plays quite well. The speed seems to feel faster and more intended compared to UT3 which is a blessing but as you can tell by any screenshot it feels very much alike in terms of design. Toxikk seems to copy the atmosphere of UT3 which can feel kinda wierd with how simple and clean arena shooters are meant to look, more of an opinion, but they certainly could have picked a more vibrant map to showcase the game with then the one in Hong Kong, which can feel very much like Shangri La off UT3.

Now the movement and fluidity of the game feels overall very good as it should be. I spend a few matches alone just dodging in and out of areas. And the guns used in our single map seem to work really damn well. The guns so far implemented are the...
Raven (Handgun with an alternate fire burst of 3-4 rounds EXTREAMLY like UT3), 
Bullcraft (Shotgun with a great alternate fire with a pretty beefy blast radius somewhat feels like a flack cannon), Violator (Assult machine gun with a canon style launch alternate fire kinda like flack guns alternate),
Falcon (Simple sniper rifle with nice looks but wish it was a lightning gun),
Stingray (Acts like a much quicker link gun with a shock rifle type alternate fire),
Dragoneer (Flame through that does quite good in close quarters usually I would think these would suck in arena fps),
Cerberus (Rocket launcher, unfortunately doesn't fire more then one rocket with alternate).

Weapons seem pretty good so far and there alternate fire is very well done.

The developers might have a pretty good flushed out game on their hands that really has released at a good time. A lot of arena shooters are in development and the only big one thats open source is far from completion on the new UE4. If players continue to recieve weekly or biweekly updates on maps and they are flushed out and don't feel sammy there will be great success. Keep doin what you're doin devs. I hope to see that one map in the preview with snow and a mountain/lake soon! Show us players other gametypes that we could put those weapons to use with, looks good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039802992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1531262606}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970607272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1422163932}
review:
Played on release day, its pretty good especially for release. Great framerate (way above 60) and only takes up about 15-20% of my CPU on ultra settings. Very smooth even with higher ping.

There seems to me mouse accel issues when you cap your framerate too high, so just cap your FPS at your monitors refresh rate for now to fix it.

Olny 1 map at the momeny (day of release), but more are coming obviously.

Also the weapons arent too balanced, Rocket takes literally no skill (i went 15-0 without trying), but you just need some fine tuning here and there, and the game has great potential. Id definitely recommend it!

Also forgot to mention: Dedicated servers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068487764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1435263717}
review: Early Access Review (Wasabi Build): Arena FPS is a dying genre now amongst the casualized modern shooters of today. The genre definitely deserves to be revived and Reakktor Studios seems to have put forth much effort to help the cause. The game lends itself to the Unreal Tournament community more so than that of Quake with its double jumps, wall dodges, and weapons that each have a secondary fire mode. It's definitely a well polished game for Early Access and I can't wait to see what it has to offer in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129593114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1587909190}
review:
As a QuakeLive veteran which has for over 1400 hours in game and as Quake2 veteran which had for over 3000 hours in multiplayer games from 1998 until 2002 and as a UT'99 veteran which had for over 700 hours of multiplayer games from 1999 until 2001 - believe me, TOXIKK is A.W.E.S.O.M.E - because, game has mixed style of Quake3 CPMA and UT 2004. It's perfect to me. If you're fan of classic multiplayer quake-unreal style of shooters (which were famous during middle of 90ties) - THEN BUY THAT GAME, BECAUSE YOU'RE GONNA ENJOY IT. 
And if you're real call of duty/battlefield fan then you're gonna have some troubles adjusting your skills to this game, because this game has strong and big learning curve (as many Quake/Unreal based shooters) - it's skill demanding game.
And still for early access price, game isn't even expensive, it's bargain and it has lots of qualities even it's still early access and in the future we're gonna to see new maps, new veichles - I mean a lot of things.
I recommend this strongly this game, because I have STRONG feeling that 90ties fps games are gonna be back soon, very soon because of TOXIKK.

BUY IT - YOU WON'T REGRET IT

author: {'steamid': '76561198010896582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1422228935}
review:
What an AMAZING PIECE OF GAMING RIGHT HERE FOLKS! Miss UT? Good strong FPS matches? Want very well balanced gameplay? Want to have fun with your buddys? Or just have a casual match with constantly something to do and battles to be won!?

WELL LOOK NO FURTHER!! TOXIKK IS THE ANSWER YOU'VE BEEN WAITING FOR!!

I can't put in words how much fun this game is! Scaling walls, rockets flying over head, the bass of explosions and sniper rifles whizzing by as you fight on either solo or co-op, the fun does not stop and it's only just begun! You're only 1 min into a match!!! 

I can't stress enough that you need to buy this game, register on the forums and become an active member! Enjoy the bullets!

If there was a hell yesssss i recommend this game option, i'd click it for the rest of my life.

review: First Impression: This game is most definitely a throwback to the classic arena shooters. I suck as much now as I did then and I love it! I'm running this game on high settings on a 4 year old ASUS ROG G73JH and it's smooth as butter with the framerate. This is going to be a great way to relieve some stress in-between other games and just unwind, but most of all, for early access, it's functional on launch day. Albeit, it's one map, but 3 game modes currently and much more to come. Worth the purchase and worth the wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018986597', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1473740464}
review: Toxikk is a great predecessor to Unreal Tournament. Not saying thats what they were doing for. lol Game is great. Fast paced and full of action. Set up a dedicated server and play with anyone you want or open it up for everyone. Play vs. bots or people it can be a challenge doing both. Playing bots on GODLIKE is insane x10. Can't wait for more maps and the following that will come with a great game like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067357839', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1431229272}
review: when the original toxikk came out in 2003 everyone thought it was vaporware because the marketing was so stupid like "remember 1999" omglolrite, but then they actually made it and it crushed ut2k3 it was just 2real and all the haters were silenced, but then the scene just got too big you know what im saying with MTV and GOTY HDDVD box set and the korean samsung toxikk team with 50 million seed funding. And then shooters died. and we all just went our separate ways... some people went into rehab for all the special K they were doing in those days (everyone remembers that toxikk2k4 clan, the K-Holez), and we just sorta grew up you know what I'm saying. So thats why this reboot is so special, it's something I can play with the kid and remember the good times and they totally went back to their roots with just the 1 classic map and mode, no silly vehicles, even put the alpha tag back on. Long live arena shooters!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972324850', 'num_games_owned': 875, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1481164660}
review:
Sweet game!
Honestly it feels a lot like Unreal Tournament 3. Maybe thats because its running on the Unreal Engine but its also just the fast paces run and gun fragathon that was UT3. As of right now there is one level which you can play deathmatch or team deathmatch on. Its loads of fun. The weapons are cool. I can only assume there is more to come being an early access game so as long as the developers stick to it, im sure this will be a very fun little game that will provide many hours of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055476604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1445476500}
review:
Toxikk is everything I want in a arena shooter and the way Steam Earlyer Access SHOULD be done. They've used this model not as a way to pay for their game to be made, but for beta testing and polishing for full release. 

The game currently only has one map availible but according to their roadmap they should be coming out with a new one twice a month. Reason for this seems to be for testing and balencing, instead of the maps just plain not being finished. 

I honestly think that Toxikk might be the game to finally give the arena shooter that shove to come back from the grave.

EDIT: THE DREAM IS DEAD. RIP VIDEOGAMES
