author: {'steamid': '76561198015621793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1473820896}
review: What UT3 SHOULD have been! Excellent gameplay! A true spiritual succesor to a timeless classic ~ Unreal Tournament 2004. It makes me very happy to say that the arena shooter is back in action! So what are you waiting for? Get back to fraggin!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109878630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1446668319}
review:
Before I begin, Id like to preface this by saying that this is a first impression of Alpha gameplay, and subject to change.

I'm very excited for this game, and the potential it holds. Its a very pretty, pretty game: the lighting and colors are beautiful. The audio is on point, the music just loud enough to hear, but not loud enough to cover whats going on. I enjoy the design style, and i personally quite like the double jump and dodge maneuvers implemented in the gameplay.

I have two issues with the game.

Firstly, I expected more. The trailer had multiple maps, while the release on has one, and a small one at that. As well, I got turned around quite a bit, and I still have trouble locating one of the weapons consistently. The trailer also promised vehicles, of which there are none, and 9 weapons, of which I can count 5 or 6. I understand that this is an Alpha release, but Im just somewhat dissapointed.

My other issue is with one of the weapons, the Cerberus launcher. To me, it seems like it is too overpowered, or at least, overused. I personally prefer the Violator, especially its grenade launcher. While playing with bots, all of them use the Cerberus to the point of ridiculousness, and the actual servers provided me with too much lag to get a proper approximation of what they were like.

All of these issues can, and I hope will be, fixed by later patches of the game, and I am excited to see what the future holds for this game.

UPDATE:
I must say, after playing another match or two, my opinion of the game has vastly improved, on top of my already high opinion. My new favorite weapon, the Stingray, is immensly satisfying to kill with, especially with its secondary fire. I would also like to amend my previous statement about the Cerberus, as now that Ive figured out how to dodge, I can avoid the rockets for the most part and retaliate with the Stingray before they can get off a second shot.

Im a little dissapointed that this map doesnt allow us to use the Falcon very much, as its scoped zoom is almost useless in this close quarters map. As well, i would still have liked to see a couple more weapons, but perhaps on a larger map, as another weapon would make this one feel too cluttered.

While playing Squad mode, I quite enjoyed the little markers that would tell you where your teamates recently died, as it made it easier to find the nests of enemies the bots inevitably formed.

I still have some concerns.
Firstly, the fact that you cannot change settings or options while in game is incredibly frustrating, and lead to me having to quit matches to change my graphics settings far too many times. As well, the framrerate can tank, which is annoying to say the least.

Also, the lack of weapon names in the controls while changing keybindings frustrated me. Perhaps because of my years playing Quake, I expected to be able to see which weapon is which, so I could map them to keys accordingly, but sadly, this was not the case.

I shall update this review as my experience continues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004059162', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1424358323}
review:
This game is already rockin' the hell out ! It is really " Frag like it's 1999 " ! Very smooth and fun to play, dedicated servers, good netcode, gameplay mechanics of UT2k4 but with a boost !

Toxikk have great potentials for both parts : fun and competitive with a nice Netcode !

First map is cool, but need some adjustments and more space / zones to frag people in DM, while TDM works fine !

For Unreal Tournament fans, this game is the one for you !

The rest of the Negative Reviews are just from people that don't know how to play Arena FPS, while they comparing it to classic shooters like Battlefield, Call of Duty and such crap games.

Reviews like those ruins the feedbacks / spread false sentences about the game ( and they have not understood what an Arena FPS is ) : 

" Only filthy casuals would praise a game with no reloading , hopping around like a brain dead rabbit, spraying and praying to get any kill. Nubs who can't aim, can't handle running out of ammo and have zero ability to use strategy "

Arena FPS are pure Skill and NEED Aim, Pre-Fires, Map / Spawn / Pickups control, etc etc. to be played. Without the basic movements ( dodge, double jump, walljump, strafe / feints ) you will be an easy kill. Don't blame the game when the fault is ONLY yours.

Otherwise, cod and the rest of crap shooters with bad netcode, balances, and stuff ( sold as complete games when they're not ) is the way for easy wins. Go for them.

Review zur ersten spielbaren Version von TOXIKK

Ein paar Runden angespielt und ich bin begeistert!
Es spielt sich sehr √§hnlich wie die alten Unreal Tournament Teile aber hat auch jetzt schon ein paar Neuerungen wie den kurzen Tarnmodus. 
Die Waffen f√ºhlen sich sehr gut an und wirken jetzt schon recht gut balanciert. 
Movement f√ºhlt sich auch sehr nach UT an, kommt wohl davon das es auch die Unreal Engine 3 ist. 
F√ºr Solisten gibt es auch computer gesteuerte "Bots" die man von "total einfach" bis "omg der cheatet doch" einstellen kann. 
Bis jetzt gibt es nur eine Map die recht klein und eng ist, aber sich schon sehr gut spielt. 

Endlich mal wieder ein richtiger Arena shooter! 

Also wie gesagt, wer fr√ºher gerne Quake oder UT gespielt hat UNBEDINGT zugreifen und den Entwickler zeigen das es noch Spieler gibt die auf skill (Nein nicht dieser M√ºll F2P shooter) setzen und nicht auf "Wer hat das bessere Equip und h√∂heres Level.  

Immernoch hier am lesen... los los kaufen!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119585996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1454365303}
review:
These are first impressions from playing the game for a few minutes in the bot match on a potato with 4gb of ram and a $40 gpu.

pros:
[list]
[*]game looks amazing. even on low, it's pretty freaking sweet how great everything looks.
[*]headshots count for extra damage. I like this, you might not.
[*]surprisingly polished. I encountered a total of 0 bugs, which is good for an early access.
[/list]

meh, but acceptable:
[list]
[*]runs poorly on low-power machines.
[*]frame rate tanks sometimes
[/list]

cons:
[list]
[*]mouse acceleration is ON by default. (seriously, I thought this was an fps game)
[*]WHY CAN'T I CHANGE SETTINGS WITHOUT EXITING THE BLOODY GAME?
[*]starting mouse sensitivity is 3 orders of magnitude too high. (again, wtf devs)
[*]turning the quick settings slider to low doesn't actually turn everything off (if i'm on low, im trying to wring frames out of the thing, and there's no way I'm going to be able to appreciate that there's 2x msaa turned on when it looks like a powerpoint presentation)
[*]ummm, where's the tutorial? was i just supposed to figure out that there is no sprint, and that instead shift is mapped to dodge?
[/list]

basically sums up the first few minutes. solid game, needs some tweaks, 8/8 gr8 m8 would recommend buying WHEN THE GAME IS OUT OF BETA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032415501', 'num_games_owned': 9681, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1489893927}
review:
[h1] ***Currently working on updating and re-vising this review for the offical release of the game*** [/h1]

Review Version 0.98 GINGER BUILD


Should just re-name this to "Unreal Tournament 3.5"

If you have played Unreal Tournament in your life and you enjoyed it, then you will feel right at home, as it is basically the same thing, which is OK! After hearing about a new Combat Arena FPS coming into the works, I was really looking forward to it. Normally, I would never look into Early Access games, but for once in my life, I was actually EXITED to back this up... Hell I bought the $90 Godlike Package >_>

So lets start with the PROS:

This game plays and feels exactly how a combat arena shooter should. You have your quick side jumps, double jump, elevator jumps, rocket jumps, various weapons to pick up in combat, health pick ups, armor pick ups, power ups like Mega Health/Shield, Quad Damage, Jetpack (or Jump boots), and so on and so on. In addition to this, you have a temporary cloak ability that lasts a whole 3 seconds, but it's great to use when walking around corners that you are unsure about. And yes, Mutators are back baby!

The assortment of levels is also great. Some being brand spanking new, and some being re-vamped of classic maps, such as the good ol Deck 13 from UT making a triumphant return, or CUBE (AKA Level 7 from DOOM 2.) The addition of Steam Workshop mod support and built in map editor is also great to have, as this resulted in modders making even more classic or new maps. Having played all of them, they are ALL fun to play! ... Well expect for ONE.

The gamemodes are your standard modes, Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Domination, Capture the Flag, plus vehicle versions of such. I should not have to explain what those gamemodes are.

Weapon selection is as follows:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Weapon[/th]
        [th]Description[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Ravagen[/td]
        [td]CQC Saw with short ranged lazer[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Raven[/td]
        [td]Pistol with single shot and burst shot (can only have 1)[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Bullcraft[/td]
        [td]Shotgun with single and double shot[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Violator[/td]
        [td]Assault Rifle with Grenade shot[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Falcon[/td]
        [td]Sniper Rifle with Scope (Zoom)[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Stingray[/td]
        [td]Lazer Assault Rifle with full auto and beam single shot[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Dragoneer[/td]
        [td]Flamethrower with spray and charged fireball (Yes, a f***ing fireball)[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Cerberus[/td]
        [td]Rocket Launcher with a locking on function for vehicles[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Hellraiser[/td]
        [td]Aka Redeemer. Fires 1 nuke and "fly by wire" mode (can be shot down)[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

And now for the CONS.

My BIGGEST complaint about the game is the one map, EHRGEIZ. This is by far the WORST map I've ever played in any video game. Not only is it a small cell capture map with some vehicles, but combine basically no health/armor pickups at all and no cover to hide behind, the AI will spawn camp you hardcore to where it's aggravating to compete it. Most maps you can deal with the cheat/aim bot style AI but this one you simply can't. This being a "Contract" mission you will want to rip your hair out.

The AI is nice and can prove to be a good challenge... But they are VERY cheaty/aim bot at times. A good example is going onto huge maps, such as the mountain one. You can be standing on one side at the very top looking around, then the AI could be on the very bottom on the other side of the map, and be shooting AND HITTING you with the pistol. Even if you took a sniper rifle and zoom in you can just make out the bot as a tiny dot. Just like I said in the worst map ever, when the AI gets into the mech. You can spawn (behind cover,) go up the elevator to your powercell, and you would die instantly cause he would start shooting you through the one open side, while he was still sitting at his spawn, like he was following you after you spawned in.

A minor complaint, the weapons do not have a "combo" as UT did with some of their weapons, ex. The Shock Rifle from UT, or the alt fires for the rocket launcher.



Pros:
- Great graphics/gameplay/sound/music.
- Maps are a blast to play.
- Weapons feel good.
- Vehicles are fun.
- Good amount of customizations.
- MOD SUPPORT
- Achievements

Cons:
- Currently very few people playing online. (EARLY ACCESS problem I would assume.)
- Has one of the Worst f***ing maps ever, EHRGEIZ
- AI can be cheaty/aim bots.
- No Steam Cards. (As of yet)


Playing TOXIKK makes me feel like I'm playing UT... Which is why I brought up the joke about changing the name to UT 3.5, it's the next UT game!

Keep in mind that I am no professional reviewer, professional game critic, or Pro FPS player, I'm just a guy that loves to play video games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969842980', 'num_games_owned': 987, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1430155664}
review:
Ok.

First impression time!

Reakktor dead on deliver what they promissed. "Frag like it's 1999." 

But with some nice nouanced twists and additions to the old formula. 

Movement feels just like the classics (UT, Q3A). Some tweaking to the mouse settings and veterans feel at home within a handful of botmatches. 

The first map might be a bit small, although I feel for 8 people its just right. In my view it can absolutely compete with the old classic standarts. Actually I absolutely love how contorted it is and how fighting places are spread both horizontally and vertically across the map. Very good design.

What's toally new to the classic formula is the cloaking. By a press of Q you become transparent, which can help you get away from hairy situations. But it has a well balanced reload time and limit of uses. It's a nice tactical element.

Last but not least, this is actually a beta status early access release in the good old way, not a prototypic alpha that's gonna crash every 5 seconds. What is there is rock solid and by todays standarts absolutely release worthy as far as stability goes.

Best 15‚Ç¨ (that was the pre-order price) I have ever invested into a game. I will have loads of fun in Toxikk!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045582850', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1493356129}
review:
An excellent shooter with a lot of potential. I just hope it maintains an active player base.

This game is the arena FPS I've been waiting for. UT2004, while great, is showing it's age a bit and doesn't have enough players to really get into it. It's like HALO, but better.

Right now there is only one map, but I would still consider it to be worth buying at this point.

I haven't been this excited about a shooter in a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977246791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1479650301}

Definetly worth buying for everyone who loved  the old titles like Quake or UT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964258555', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1575249987}
review:
Toxikk reminds me of all the good things about playing Quake 3 or Unreal Tournament back in the late 90s.  

Imagine that gameplay, but with today's graphics.  The developers have got amazing results using the Unreal Engine.  The game looks gorgeous on Ultra settings with a solid 60FPS.  You really feel like you're fighting in the alleys of a futuristic city.   Weapons are well varied and tight and the mix of them make fighting in the city map quite frenetic.

The netcode seems to be working alright, I didn't notice any bad lag when playing multiplayer.  There are also single player missions to help ease you back into your happy fragging place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053109976', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 10518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1647927559}
review:
Well, here we are. Toxikk has come out and guys. I can't believe I'm saying this, but maybe certian Early Access titles have tainted my viewpoint of EA games. But, Toxikk is incredible in the state that it's in. It feels pretty much like a finished product. Despite obvious content issues. 

So far the game is fast paced, furious and relentless. I really like the XP element which unlocks cosmetics, but also encourages a competitive element to your personal self. It feels good, the options menu is great, the FOV slider goes up to 120 from 90. Which is nice but I'd like to see it go up to 150, the sound track is excellent and it's really killer.

It's really promising especially at this early access launch state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008281986', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1481652918}
review:
Run, jump and gun. This game brings back the classic FPS style of the late 90s that you know and love. Your character has the ability to double, rocket and sprint jump. Your character can carry all the weapons at once. He also runs at the speed of a cheetah. This game will make you feel like a real badass like you used to in Quake! This game brings back the fun in online shooters that went missing in action long ago.

RIght now there is only one map though. The devs will be releasing more in the coming months. If you are okay with that then gets this game.

Seriously get the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008654281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1426400110}
review:
This is BY FAR the most polished game I have ever seen on Steam Early Access. There are so many heap of shit games being churned out right now, this is just a breath of fresh air. Very glad I bought into the game. 9/10. 

The Good
- The game has very smooth controls and fun movement.
- Lots of guns that are really satisfying to use. 
- FOV Slider.
- Really visually appealing.
- Easy to use dedicated server tools

The Bad
- XP System easily exploited
- Rocket is insanely overpowered. (You need to reduce the splash radius (or the damage) and maybe    even reduce the fire rate by a margin because it is a bit too easy to kill people).
- Head hitboxes are way too big, you can hit people with the outside of your crosshair on their head. 
- The pistol is a joke, so when you spawn you really have to avoid people.
- Play will be very limited until the new maps come out, but I am happy to wait.

The Ugly
- Me
